atID8DrVx2KRP9vcNAZv2w.text: Went here after the Country Music Awards last week. My wife and I always eat at Battista's when visiting Vegas. Fun atmosphere, good food and free wine.   Well done.

bCBVzUjPOaDqVcb5mgxleg.text: Fun place. A must if you are staying in the strip. The food is decent and the accordion player is the best touch! Enjoy!

7CoCSBVqY-ZJaRqQorjyPw.text: Very loud, many drunk people and long wait times (don't know why as it seemed somewhat empty inside). The food is horrible, how can you mess up pasta. I can see why the wine is "all you can drink" as being drunk helps with masking the horrible food.  I have no idea on how people can describe this place as a "hidden gem" or "[you] won't be disappointed". I'm sad for them as they may not have had better Italian food or are comparing this place to Olive Garden (BTW... also horrible).   Like anything else YMMV and their claim of being the "finest Italian Food & Atmosphere  in all of Las Vegas!"... LOL, I think not!   Yes I know I have "2 check-ins" for here but I was forced to come a second time because of a friend who "had to check it out". Fortunately, they also had the same verdict as I did. Rest assured, we won't be here again.

qRGZDl-yIaHWRalG0lXz6Q.text: We didn't have a reservation but were able to eat in the bar area.  Dinner there is a la carte, which was fine for us.  Saved around $12 if you don't want soup, salad, or unlimited house wine.  My Chicken Rio was lukewarm, but very good & a generous portion.  My friend's Chicken Parmigiana was HUGE, but no side of pasta was a little unusual.  Very good also.  Waitress was busy but friendly & efficient.

rFNhgQI2PiKjEJqHDjT6QQ.text: Driving into town and realized we could walk here from The Flamingo do we made a quick open table reservation and got right in.  Family style restaurant with cool decorations and nice vibe. Great food and great service.  Too much food for just us 2, and we should have paid the minimum charge each and split! But great overall experience

EAMdDo7-zqca4FZucAZdtA.text: Tonight was my first visit to the hole in the wall. I ordered the cannelloni and my wife the chicken rio. Both dishes were tasty nothing over the top. We enjoyed the complementary wine and cappacino. The ambiance was unique and we had a good time. I feel like we got what we paid for and can check one more iconic vegas eatery from the must do list.

4CRHrDsWHsrkkAaVo2EOsQ.text: Old school Italian restaurant that you can find one block off the strip.   Menu is located on the wall. Dishes come with soup or salad and an amazing cappuccino after dinner that taste like an amazing chocolate chip cookie. All you can drink house wine?? Yes please. Meals come with white or red and all you can drink.   Food is better than Olive Garden but it isn't the best high end either. I will say you will love it and the atmosphere.   Many popular athletes and celebrities eat here so be ready to run into someone.   On a date with the one you love?? Make sure the little old guy who has to be close to 90 comes by and plays a song on the accordion for you!! Tip him a few bucks and you will make his day.  Love coming here when I stop in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu inside on the wall!

OSDDhkp8pcsSi4IvxY58HA.text: Delicious. Interesting ambiance. Low-lighting is nice. Leafy green house salad is very good, garlic bread is fantastic. I had spaghetti with meat sauce, Hubby had manicotti with a side of meatballs. All were delicious. Generous servings and red or White House wine includes. We will definitely be back. Hubby says "it's the beat meal I've ever had."

pw9CbK9tOLSL8KkFK40-wA.text: I was so disappointed with Battista's Italian restaurant.  Yes, you get free wine with your dinner but it is nothing special.   You get your choice or soup or salad, main course of your choice and hey cappuccino at the end.  The Decour is from the 1950s old outdated all I could think of is this place is a fire trap waiting to happen.  The food was so-so more on the bland side definitely nothing to write home about.   I would not recommend this place. Needs a major overhaul.

Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mhEu3iA2Kr2bEQwkNxBaag.text: Very good homestyle Italian restaurant. As a New Yorker the past 35 years, very pleasantly surprised to find such a good homestyle Italian restaurant in the middle of Las Vegas. Prices were very reasonable, free wine included, plus cappuccino, garlic bread and a very good salad. Highly recommend.

Eehg1CwTwtGc77GL0pNGFw.text: Overall we found the place economical but the food and service were lacking.  And the accordian guy who comes around we first thought was charming until he harassed us repeatedly for a tip (even tough we didn't ask him to play)

FGhSiJFs2f9i4W4Jm8tjTg.text: I've tried for two years, to get to this place. When we come to Vegas, it's on my list, but something always happens. Not today! I wasn't going to let anything get in my way of going to this place. I've heard about it and wanted to try it, so today was finally the day.  When we walked in, it was exactly how I thought it would be. Old school Italy. We were finally seated and pleasantly surprised to see the red and white wine, already sitting on the table. I wish that was where my story ended, but alas, no. We were given soup or salad choice and the salad was a basic salad. Nothing to write home about. The garlic bread, while plentiful tasted like that frozen bread you get in the grocery store, with too much seasoning. Still not that big of a deal. I ordered lasagna, my husband spaghetti and meatballs and my daughter chicken parm. Well, I guess we drew the short straws, because my daughters was above average and our was not great. My husbands spaghetti was equivalent to junior high cafeteria food. And for $25, it should be a heck of a lot better. The cappuccino that comes with the meal, tastes like hot chocolate, which is weird because I hate coffee and wasn't looking forward  to this, but it tasted like hot chocolate, so I drank it up!  If I was forced to go back, I'd get the chicken parm, avoid the salad and bring a light bulb with me, because it's so dark in there, it's hard to even read the menu. You get the old school Italy vibe, but the food doesn't do this place justice. I didn't take pictures. You wouldn't be able to see them if I had, because it's so ridiculously dark in there.

Fg5zcHH5-m56w6ALIUUo5A.text: i love this place the food is average and the wine is good but they are always on top of their game when it comes to service. went there for my birthday and they did not disappoint. Make sure you see Gordy make the whole experience worth  it.

XSUgfI6RkAPkAdaaXIJx_Q.text: I'm a fan of most places on the Vegas strip....I'm also a fan of the places and hidden gems off the strip.  This is one of them.    Coming from Chicago with numerous decent Italian restaurants and restaurant chains I can be picky with my Italian meals and this place really gave the biggest bang for my buck hands down...when it comes to Italian food.  This isn't exactly the place to go after downing cheap drinks next door at the Stage Door Casino, but it is what it is...and well I dined here after, my friends half in the bag.  I wish they could have enjoyed this meal as much as I did along with the wine that came with it.  We arrived there a bit later than dinner time, there was about a 15 minute wait so we grabbed a glass of wine at the bar.  The place was still pretty hopping.  The  memorabilia is worth checking out while waiting as well.  The menu is straight forward and on the wall...all meals come with house wine - red & white, delicious garlic bread, soup or salad.  Two of us got salads, one got soup - we raved about both.  I ordered ziti with meatballs for my meal - I honestly have no idea what the others had.  I enjoyed the white wine with my meal and just tasted the red, that was good as well.  I read complaints about the wine... they don't advertise it being high end wine, thus why it's HOUSE wine...and if that meal was al a carte anywhere else, you'd be paying more.  If you're looking for a decent Italian meal...off the strip and not in a hotel, this is a great place to go.  I would definitely opt to eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House wine, white &amp; red...
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qSOM8Mq_T51S4mhibzSbOw.text: This place has been around since the beginning of time. Food and service continue to excel. Wonderful ambience. This is authentic Italian. Short walk from the back of the Flamingo. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LWXuVDgT59z-jfTz8N8h5g.text: A must do when in Las Vegas.  The food was good, the free wine was awesome, and the ambiance was intimate and entertaining.  We will definitely go again when in Las Vegas, and highly recommend it as a must do.

ZFRToSGOV9evvitdfGRFRw.text: Wasn't sure what time we would be arriving so took a chance and just walked in around 7 pm on a Friday night.  Staff handled waiting customers  professionally and while we were told it would be a 45 minute wait we (party of 4) were okay with it because again, it was Friday night at a normal dinner hour.  Ended up sitting at large bar table and had phenomenal service from an already busy server.  Can't remember her name but to me customer service and attitude will normally make up for any food issue.  In this case there was no issue with either.  Awesome wait staff and food.  Portions will fill up an empty stomach and not priced bad at all.  Old school Italian atmosphere with an awesome smell as you approach.  Highly recommend!

Zl3WEU62PaQ0J1TedOurmA.text: Great place to spend my birthday dinner. The food was tasty and so plentiful they had roll us out.

AwQZxWI8hfnsMtH9zp-lvA.text: I've driven past Battista's a million times.  I am a frequent patron at Stage Door, but have never gone to Battista's until my bachelorette party on Wednesday night.  We had a reservation, and they do not seat until your entire party has arrived...which is pretty standard practice.   We really enjoyed ourselves.  Service was fast and polite.   I ordered the Veal Marsala, which comes with (as all entrees do):  unlimited red or white house wine, a side of pasta, garlic bread, soup or salad, and a cappucino.    The veal was to die for.  Tender, light, flavorful.  The minestrone soup was great too, and the garlic bread...well...thankfully someone moved it away from me, or I would have eaten the whole basket.   I stole a bite of tortellini from a friend, along with a bite of shrimp scampi, and manacoti (what, it was my night, I can eat all the things if I want to!!) and all of them were great.  The shrimp was absolutely perfect.   For the price point, I thought that everything was very good.  I'll definitely be back again.

5fkKgxHO18Uj7XNc-trhJQ.text: I love this place so much! The interior is unique and old school and funky with fairly dim lighting. You should make a reservation cuz this place is very popular. The food was outstanding and free wine with your meal!

wtXYnqtNRdjveZfMunT9RQ.text: Hole in the wall all around fun dinner with friends that is very different from the Vegas norm.

aiMLp5wFpwvEyYDzYsLkaw.text: All the stars. Add another star to it.   Simple Italian perfection.  The prices looked high on the menu. By the time you drink the wine, eat the bread, and have an excellent meal? I have no problem with the prices. Worth every dime.   I had the Lasagna. My buddy had the linguini with clams.   Both well fed. We are not small guys. Excellent!

B4E6mN3p3VLUv6nLuDwwWQ.text: My best friend and I also went here to eat in Vegas this was our first meal and we got there and I have to say the service was first rate I'm it's really kitschy it's a really nice laid-back godfather type of garlic bread gave my friends fiance goosebumps the wind was perfect and free so you can't beat that I have the eggplant Parmesan and it was the best I've ever had

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hFAofvuJv2Csf0o2F8FpQw.text: Located behind flamingo hotel. You get white wine and red wine house salad or soup with cappuccino after your meal. Garlic bread was so good I was full before my large portion of chicken rio came.   The food is not salty! Which is greats the soup you can tell is fresh. I will come back.

s5WcsPFei2Ze8ojibuXHDA.text: I had the server order for me.  He ordered the lasagna.  It was unbelievable.  I loved all the cheese. The sauce had just the sweetness but not too much.  The meal came with soup (minestrone) or an Italian salad (my choice), the garlic bread was nummy, and a cappuccino (which I declined but was made to try).  To top that off, you can have all the wine you can drink.  What did I like the most?  Being serenaded by an 80 something year old accordion player.  I'll definitely come here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the lasagna.

QYCSYSE4Cy2q6bj5AFsa5Q.text: LOVED IT! How can you beat unlimited wine at your table? Food was really good, old school, heavy sauce.... dark lighting, funny old guy with accordion that plays all of a minute, odd decorations.  I'm sorry if it isn't your style, but we will be back, WITH RESERVATIONS MADE, and our friends!

4WFE6xCk-2sFBIeTd7R0lQ.text: What a waste of $60. Seriously, I rarely pay that much for a meal out per person and this was spent on the blandest most subpar Italian experience of my life.  Let me break it down list style.  1. Menu is limited. Think In-N-Style. You select an item and it comes with: unlimited red/white wine, soup or salad, garlic bread, and a dessert cappuccino (aka a hot chocolate). $24.95 - $49.95 per person, based on meal option.  2. Since a friend and I arrived an hour early, we waited at the bar, I ordered a diet coke and she a beer, and two apps: fried mozzarella & fried zucchini. Total: $34 The fried cheese and zucchini weren't anything special and we're $9.95 a piece and we're just average.  3. Once our full party arrived, I learned I couldn't transfer my diet coke to the table, which was annoying. Our orders placed, soup, salad, garlic bread, and wine came to the table quickly.  4. Since it was late (9:45 PM & they close at 10:30 PM), our table was seated in the only room with other patrons. It was packed and loud and we all felt squishy.  5. My friend and her sister split the Veal Marsala ($31.95). It cost them an extra $13 for splitting a plate (because you get those included extras) The veal was overcooked and rubbery. I ordered the Steak Pizzaiola, which is basically a large piece of meat with marinara served with a side of garlic cream spinach. The steak was the blandest, least flavorful slab of meat, ever. The tomato sauce (calling it marinara would be a grave misjustice  to Italians everywhere) was also lackluster. Price point for this disaster $28.95. These two entrees came with a side of ziti and more of that tomato sauce.  6. Lastly, the check came and so did the post meal cappuccino which tasted like a hot chocolate. This stuff was delicious. Rich, chocolatey and creamy. Nothing reminiscent of a cappuccino, not a hint of frothy milk.  The service was weak, the food was tasteless, and prices were gauged. Don't eat here. You'll be full, but you'll feel like you were just ripped off.   Butt-istas Hole in the Wall is what it shall be named henceforth.

klpV4Rw9SlVBi7IW6P26ZA.text: The prices may seem high at a glance but it's really a good deal with the included wine, amazing garlic bread, generous portions, soup or salad, and fantastic ambiance!  We got a reservation for two and were seated on time after a short wait (we arrived early)... The ambiance is great... Kind of like what some chains emulate, but True to the name reminded me of some of the authentic hole in the wall spots back in Chicago... Anything feeling authentic in Vegas is a welcome treat.  Wine and garlic bread were brought to the table right away and we ordered shortly after. I got the special - a grilled swordfish over pasta and my wife got the cioppino. We enjoyed the as accordion player (who's been wandering table to table for 33 years!) while eating our soup and salad.  Salad was a petty basic house salad with salami and a hunk of cheese in it. The ministoni soup was really great.  Both our dishes were large and quite good.  The after dinner "cappuccino" was nice but not really deserving the name... More like a hot cocoa with a splash of espresso in there. Wasn't bad though.  I would definitely go back and recommend it to anyone visiting Las Vegas that wants a nice Italian meal (with plenty of wine) near the strip.

4Op_2JmjFlTHN6xBe4YN1Q.text: My husband and I come here constantly for the amazing food! Hands down the best Italian   My issue is with our HORRIBLE server Anthony.. we asked him what he he special was and he lied and they said they were out.. that was a lie.. I called him out on it after hearing another server telling his table about it and how good it was.. after that he completely ignored us, never checked if we needed anything.. you would think out table didn't exist .. WORST SERVER IN LAS VEGAS!  Our busser was amazing and attentive and we tipped him our sever was an A$$hole

PkUKt6wjTq2_NqzVehzVcg.text: Definitely worth checking out. The food was good, but didn't especially impress.  The atmosphere was a nice change from the strip.

bUVJdtCxwq_xiyLOkIOdjw.text: Here's the thing.  You don't go for the food.  You go because it comes with.  Comes with soup.  Comes with garlic bread.  Comes with what is apparently Ovaltine dissolved in coffee.    You go because there is a ton of fun crap to look at on the wall.  And because you can be loud and obnoxious.    You go because Dobby the house elf from Harry Potter, who your grandma would find disturbing yet oddly charming, will come by and play you a 10 second song made up on the spot and demand immediate payment  But mostly, you go because it comes with UNLIMITED TABLE WINE.  Not good wine.  But drinkable wine with presumably some alcohol in it.  The food was not bad.  It just wasn't good.  The portions are large.  I won't go into detail because you will probably go anyway and find out for yourself.   Maybe go when you need to absorb fifteen martinis?  There is a TV or several in the bar area where you can stand with beers and yell "GO [MY FAVORITE SPORTS TEAM]."

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu.

kmFrjtpe3TmBH-7bd97lRA.text: I just love this place. The location is perfect because it's just a few steps off the Strip but you don't have to pay the kind of prices Strip hotels charge.   I thought the food was great from start to finish and I really appreciated the simplicity of the menu and the "all-inclusive" pricing. The cappuccino they include, I'm almost positive, is actually one of those General Foods International Coffees. Who cares, it's tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmegiana, so good! The creamed spinach was a perfect bonus!

bKGVfuFCR2-pll805Ltacw.text: I've always notice this little hole in the whole spot every time my friend talks about stage door and was craving Italian food so I chose Battisa's. It's very old school Italian you feel like home. The decor looked fun first think I spotted out was the wall of tiny liquor bottles from all over the world. It was pretty cool. Then when they seat you it's not one big open restaurant it's kinda sectional stations kind interesting but seems not private. They give you free house red or white wine which was decent I mean come on its free. The over all experience was nice I'd recommend it to anyone.

XxSQwgdmMXSm_gXT2IzxKA.text: So this was an interesting experience. Pros: very fast service, no wait, friendly staff. Cons: very fast service (like was this food even made today?), no wait (is that because no one wants to eat here?), friendly staff (when you can't understand what your guests are saying, just smile!).   Overall, we had fun and I guess that's what counts. Rather than get into everything little thing that went wrong, I'd say...just go with it.

mAN9-yUOyL7Iea85zODZpw.text: Must try if your in Vegas. Great Italian food and free wine. You may have to wait so make a reservation

U2NC4mnS-FY-eMPpyDR89g.text: OMG it upsets me that there's not a chain of these restaurants. And unfortunately, I live in the opposite side of the country.  An hour wait on a Wednesday night at 8pm. That shows you how hoppin it is. I had Chicken Parmesan with spaghetti - $28.00 (That came with a side of spinach). The chicken was HUGE!  And for me to carry food home, it must have been big. Before your meal, they serve you you get a choice of soup or salad (I got the salad, yes it was amazing), including the most delicious garlic bread ever (puts olive garden to SHAME), and for dessert included a cappuccino. I'm not a fan of cappuccino's but it tasted just like chocolate milk, I couldn't even taste the coffee-ness.  Like I said, it's unfortunate I live a 5-hour plane ride away. But when I'm back.. I'll be sure to spend money there, again! Next time I'll be smart enough to call in for a reservation.  I guess I should tell you about my service as well, GREAT.

Jy5lr95RFN-GK8yYOjOaDQ.text: Dirty restaurant. Expensive price. They force me to pay 5$ tipp we just had 2 bowls soup and some bread paid 35$  They creat own policy to force you pay tip Created a dark design to not see what you eat  Dont waist your time

IiggledEY0Qa3xstLEsNYQ.text: The ribeye had the smell of  burnt salmon skin, i asked for a rare medium rare, it was medium & dense like a New York steak. Judi ordered the steak pizzaiola, it was more tender and rarer than my ribeye! Judi liked the sauce , I didn't. Cheesecake with strawberries , good.

XTOAhtpu1lqR7--6PifOjQ.text: Maybe not the most fabulous Italian food I have ever had but the entire experience is excellent.  They make the dinner easy: soup or salad, bread, and wine come automatically, there is a broad selection of choices, large portions, the ambiance is wonderful, excellent wait staff, and the (tiny) accordion player is a great touch.  It's well worth a visit if you are after something a bit lower key and not RIGHT on the Strip.

uXZDoL-Q8FjwbtewLQMszg.text: I really tip my hat to this place. From first bite to last my meal there was what one dreams about when they are eating Italian food anywhere outside of NY. No shortcuts here this place puts out Classic Italian comparable with the best in New York hands down. Thank you i will be back again and Again. If you don't like this place you don't like Italian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was the eggplant parm. It was AMAZING!!!

_qoPNFQvDIQpeZFUIcYkAA.text: This was a trip down memory lane - a sad one. Brought my wife here while we were in Vegas for the New Year's holiday. Back in the day - and we're talking mid to late 1980s, I remember Battista's as offering pretty good dishes. Maybe this has to do with the changes elsewhere. Used to be that Vegas wasn't a foodie's delight - just the opposite, in fact. Nowadays, though, you can get top cuisine with hardly any effort. We were able to get into Olives, for instance, on a day's notice.  But back to Battista. The minestrone was lukewarm and my pasta dish was tasteless & overcooked.  My wife ordered the scampi and it was similarly a horror show. True, the garlic bread was delish but that's little consolation for what was an utterly forgettable meal.  Too bad. I pine for the old Battista's. Then again, maybe it only existed in my imagination.  In any case, if you want Italian, go elsewhere. This place survives on its (fast-fading) reputation

z1fy5Taw0CZ78Sn9yIOJyQ.text: What's not to love?   The food is classic American-Style Italian.. great little guy running around playing his music on an accordion..and most of the staff has been there a very long time.. 20-40 years in some cases. it is very inexpensive, filling, and always a good time. Please check it out and ask fr Luigi! He will take care of you and has been there almost as long as the restaurant itself!

kMPaTyYjpliQ6AByWEWcEA.text: Went here last Friday night for dinner before hitting the strip.  We had made reservations and I'd highly recommend. Only had to wait 10 minutes just long enough to order drinks.  The menu is short  like 10 items to chose from and it's posted all over the walls.  Everyone in my party enjoyed their meals - lots of food as all dishes come with salad, bread and unlimited wine! :)  I got the meatballs. They were definetly good pry not the best italian food ever, but this isn't italy.  The cost is reasonable between $20-30, but I feel everything costs that much in Vegas.  They didn't mind running a couple credit cards which is always nice.  I'd definetly come back next time we are in Vegas.

8xs0W7unqBxuRJnr7TmPnw.text: Complementary Wine with dinner...Sold! Meals include salad and garlic bread as well as a cappucino after your meal. Prices are between 18 to 36 dollars...for all that you are getting the prices are decent. The food is amazing..I have been here a few times and have always left satisfied and happy! The place screams old Hollywood with pictures of actors from back in the day. Lots of charm and the service is excellent. If you are in Vegas and are tired of all the usual buffets and such..check this place out ...you will be glad you did,

9wVwSMiJSwmNJdGg6gBbyQ.text: A hidden gem that looks like a hole in the wall, unlimited wine, need I say more?? Ok ok the meals are a little pricey but they are very good, the chicken parm is a favorite!

P2qoJKdIx0eNTW9osviQsg.text: Synopsis: Want a respite from the Strip? Here's a cozy place that serves up generous portions of Italian food. Menu is all inclusive and the prices are just as hearty as the dishes you're eating.  Unabridged:"Hole in the Plaza" would be a more appropriate title, but who cares when their front door is made from a huge wine barrel? There are several signs advising reservations but our party of two was seated within five minutes on a weekday night.   Pick your entree from the many menus posted on the walls. Just because you went a block off the strip doesn't mean prices are cheaper, but they do include their well-known bottomless wine. One sip of the red (or white) wine will tell you that it is not choice but you can drink copious amounts of it. Get into the Vegas spirit and try to finish your carafe, you could even pour it over your head for a wine shower. It's bottomless so they'll bring you another.   Garlic bread - our first basket was a bit stale but the second one was fresh, warm, and delicious. I went with the minestrone as my appy, my companion went for the salad. The salad was a bit of a let-down, iceberg lettuce and a bit of sliced veggies on top. The soup was hot and while it wasn't astounding, it was a nice starter. My eggplant parm was a huge slab of eggplant/cheesy goodness on a plate. Perhaps it's because I had skipped lunch that day but I was satisfied with my meal. My dining partner got about 2/3 through her lasagna, then threw in the towel.   I don't care for coffee, but I passed my cappuccino to my companion who happily polished off two. She said they were very good.    Taste-wise Battista's is like a hybrid of Olive Garden and Bucca. Decor-wise it's a bit like a time capsule: signed pics framed on the walls, memorabilia, and the friendly booths that are comfortably broken in from patrons over the years. Our server was cordial and down-to-earth which was refreshing after dealing with aspiring showgirl/gold-digger waitresses earlier in the day. There was an accordion player who we found slightly annoying but the regulars kept requesting him to play bits of songs sprinkled with corny jokes. (I know, I know, I'm heartless cause I didn't find this elderly man's vocation engaging, but I'm trying to chat with my fam while stuffing my face. Accordion's gotta go.)  For a memorable experience and laid back surroundings, this is it. For mind-blowing Italian cuisine, you may want to look elsewhere. Vegetarians - you're limited to several pasta choices and the eggplant parm. Vegans - pasta pomodoro: that's it.

MK_zlLHopiHYQ5vT_yrcJA.text: We went here for our last dinner in Vegas and throughly enjoyed the experience.  Comparable in atmosphere to the Rendezvous in Memphis, Battista's had all sorts of celebrity photos adorning the walls, along with a basketed ceiling and a waiting area filled with mini bottles of liquor.  Completing the interior decor is the dinner menu, printed in large print on each wall.  Traditionally, I choose chicken Parmesan whenever I eat at an Italian restaurant for the first time; tonight was no different.  The dish came with a side of penne with red sauce and spinach.  It wasn't the best ever but it wasn't the Olive Garden.  Next trip to Vegas, I will pop in this place again.

vj9z7IL7M0FRLJNllRLJMQ.text: I liked it Free unlimited wine with dinner, great garlic bread,salad was very good,entree (chicken parm) was good not the best but not bad. Dark inside,comfortable atmosphere.Decent price.Will go back.

jNW_h60M6LeGCVY2gApekg.text: Food was average. Service was bad. Glasses and plates dropped on to the table. Waiter and busboy were almost rude. weird, aweful place for dinner.  spend the $$ elsewhere.

JQr36_-YRnpKiSFOpaAW6Q.text: It was not at all what I had hoped for - I was expecting a more relaxed restaurant with a wide variety of food. The serving staff was distracted and disinterested. The food was average, and the atmosphere was dull, except for an old geezer who was going around all the tables playing a few chords of the same melody - quite annoying after the first couple of renditions. This is adequate but not at all great. Far better options for good Italian food in Vegas. Not going to be returning.

7MSmuX-5VKocX56bfOKTig.text: The first time we went here, it was one of my favorite stops to eat at in Sin City. But after our last visit, the novelty has kind of wore off. Battista's is located about a block off of the strip behind the Flamingo. Plenty of parking right by the door. Expect a little wait, but it's worth it. We usually pass the time by stopping at the dive bar in the same parking lot for a couple cheap PBRs.  Like other reviewers have noted, it is a bit overpriced. You can expect to pay in the neighborhood of $60 with tip for two adults. But hey, it's Las Vegas, who cares!? You wont leave hungry or without being at least mildly buzzed. My wife usually gets fettucini and I'll order Spaghetti and Meatballs. As soon as your wait-staff approaches your table you are offered a craft of house wine. Its good enough, you wont be disappointed. The garlic bread is very very good and i'm usually not that generous with garlic bread. My wife gave the salad a thumbs up and you can sub applesauce for the picky eater in your crowd. The entree portions are large and we have no complaints with the food at all. The complimentary desert Cappuccino is AWESOME. I don't drink coffee or cappuccino and I love it.  I think its closer to hot chocolate than any kind of coffee/cappuccino. But seriously, it's a tasty way to round out the meal.  The biggest bummer is the increasingly creepy accordion player. The first time we went to Battista's we were entertained and thought it was a neat touch, the rest of my family loved him as well. He'll ask you where you're from, pretend to play a song associated with that place and mumble out-of-tune some lyrics for 20-30 seconds and then stand there uncomfortably until he sees some money. I didn't really have a problem until our last visit. Being that we were on vacation, I didn't have any bills smaller than a $50. We hoped to avoid him, but he was unavoidable. Once he was done singing his 20 second off-key rendition of "Back home again in Indiana", we thanked him as he tapped on the money clip on his Accordion. I explained that we appreciated it and we would catch him later in the night once we paid our bill. We got a snide, "Well I guess we'll just see about that" back at us. Super awkward and embarrassing moment in front of my wife and others seated near by. Really!? We're here eating $30 plates of spaghetti, do you really think i'm trying to cheat you out of a couple bucks for a tip? We're on vacation and only have large bills/credit cards. Once we paid our bill my wife tracked him down and gave him a tip, but made sure to tell him how disappointing he made our stop.  It wasn't until I read a few reviews on here that I found out I was not alone. We decided we're just going to decline as soon as he steps up to our table if we go back in the future. Though it would be fun to try out some new places and see if he has a song for Madagascar, Bokoro, or somewhere else equally obscure.  I'm not saying I wouldn't recommend this place to someone else, but the accordion guy can suck one. If you try somewhere exotic, post and let me know what he plays.

RJlnfhN10HwV-qCH_vsjsg.text: Literally a hole in the wall. You enter and expect a little place and walk through the waiting area, and the restaurant opens up to a pretty big space. We were seated on a two seater tabel in the corner. It was of course crowded because it was a holiday. The tables were a little too close for my comfort, but the food was awesome. Dinner came with your choice of complimentary house red or white wine. I had the clam linguini with white wine sauce and my partner had the chicken alfredo. Both were delicious and I was full, but stuffed my face to finish it, I HAD TO! It was too good to take home for later....... plus we wer on our way to a concert that day. We finished up with a complimentary cappuccino and went on our way. Good value for quality of food and service.

LFTQgJwc2eRSdeDWDlaN8Q.text: When I was 21, a group of my more straight-edge college friends decided they wanted to go to Las Vegas.    A week before the trip, my dentist told me I absolutely had to go to Battista's.  Sure thing.  Then-boyfriend and I checked it out.  We thought it was great.  Fast forward four years... my brother is now living in Vegas, and my immediate family decided to meet there for Christmas.  Having remembered my wonderful experience at this restaurant, I decided we should all go.  BIG mistake.  The wine tasted like 2-buck Chuck that had been opened five days before.  The salad was comprised of iceberg lettuce and topped off with a hunk of salami.  I'm pretty sure the sauce was Ragu.  My brother, an erstwhile captain in the Army, said he'd rather have an MRE (meal ready to eat) than dine at Battista's again.  The little man playing the accordion knew the Ohio State fight song.  Battista's better hang onto that guy - it's the only reason they even get a star.

xbjubZY5xnUM7xQ4SjE_9w.text: Everything we ordered was delicious!  I had the cheese manicotti and my husband had the lasagna (which he described as "amazing").  The garlic bread melts in your mouth and even the house wine was good!  Kinda pricey, but you get what you pay for in great service, atmosphere, and quality food.  Would definitely return if I were in the area again.

y1eT8Yrar10gN3PziTtWvg.text: Loved the unique atmosphere! Sausage dish was excellent as was the salad and garlic bread. Servers were attentive and who couldn't enjoy the accordion player. Old Vegas at its finest best.

CpEAf-duhniLJMePKYBc4Q.text: Located right behind the Flamingo.  Ambiance is great.  1950's old Vegas style complete with OLD pictures of dead celebrities who have eaten there.    Dinner was $38 with tax and tip.  Included all you can drink red and white wine. (As E40 would say, "I think it was that top of the line wine, Carlo Rossi").  Veal parm was great. Included antipasta salad, garlic bread, and capachino (which tasted like Swiss Miss hot chocolate).

FIref_4qO_9ocPUSax3Xzg.text: Pros: * all the wine you can drink *"cappuccino" chocolate, hazelnut flavored coffee  with whipped cream is yummy. *meatballs were tender and tasty * cannolis were super sweet but yummy  * garlic bread was actual garlic bread  Cons: * salad was drowning in italian dressing * spaghetti tasted like noodles in tomato catsup.

ymV6L8ziRAplNuZ2KA8OPA.text: Go for the atmosphere and to hang with friends to chat over the endless house wine.  For whatever reason my friends get a kick out of eating here, so every once in a while we stop by.  During my last trip in the middle of last month, a bunch of us stopped in for dinner.    The food here is just really average.  The decor is cool and the location is really popular.  If you go, make a reservation and be ready for crowds.    I ordered the Veal Marsala and my veal wasn't the tender cuts of meat that you might expect.  Instead it was chewy.  Chewy veal?!?  Come on...    I do like drinking the endless house red wine out of the Godfather glasses, but that shouldn't be the only reason to go here.

rcxBR1qddPQPTwiRqdqdDQ.text: What great atmosphere.  So nice to get off 'The Strip' and go to a 'real' restaurant.  The service is great, the food is decent, the portions are huge, and the unlimited table wine and garlic bread will shut you down!

fP0c4BBDabJsppkw7jqpRA.text: Battista's is great. Simply great. And there it is... simple.  It's often said of restaurants by restauranteurs is that simple is best, and we've found it here. And right in the middle of the strip no less! What a find!  Old Las Vegas adorns the walls, wine casks abound, a dark, busy and welcoming interior, matched by a staff that's used to managing and shepherding packed packed crowds day in and day out.  You can eat in the bar area, wait for a table with drinks, or stand around and read the short menu until your reservation comes around. Either way, there's lots to see and take in.  The menu is simple, and contains simple Italian food. And yes, everything comes with bread, wine, and soup or salad. What a treat!  For $30, Sarah and I stuffed ourselves by splitting the Lasagna, the salad, basket of bread, and three carafes of wine. Including tip! What a steal, as I said, in the middle of the strip! All the menu says is that there's a $10 minimum per person, so why not split all that yummy simple Italian food!  This was one of our favorite meals from our last trip. The energy, the location. It was a truly old school Vegas experience. Imagine what it was like when Battista's was just one of a few options along the strip of smaller hotel/gambling outlets.... oh yeah, it was just like this, busy, dark, and simple.

giSvbtdCjYCn92jOe9oSGQ.text: First time eating here we were referred by some friends who are here on a trip, not disappointed!  It's a cool break from all the cookie cutter joints on the strip.  I would have given the food  on taste a 3.5 but the fact that all meals come with red wine or white a soup and a salad it's a no brained.  Service was great !  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone for a little taste of Italian with some history!

SnmZjRuxpcC5QS3zGXBIUg.text: Food was great, delicious salad and the meatballs were flavorful and tender which is what you hope for. I'm not a wine drinker but I was able to enjoy the included wine, it Wasn't bitter.  Only complaint is hostess staff we walked in and to the hostess stand and the girl just looked at us so I did the same back. My husband finally said 2 please but there job is to make you feel welcome. I'd suggest getting that only issue addressed.

yEMQsezSw33a8Jn2dZIJtw.text: The food is still as good as I remember. This restaurant has been around for quite some time. The walls are covered with everything you could imagine. Pictures, memorabilia, license plates, street signs, etc. Even the menus are on the walls.   You get unlimited house wine, soup or salad, bread and a cappuccino with every meal. Please, keep in mind that the wine will not be the best you have ever had. In fact, I think they changed it? Or maybe my taste in wine has evolved since the last time I drank it. The garlic bread is so good! I could have eaten that all night. The salad is large and the dressing is flavorful.  I had the eggplant parmesan and LOVED every part of it. My roommate had the lasagna and ate every bite. The cappuccino at the end taste more like hot chocolate but it's a perfect end cap to a great dinner.  Everything is always fast here. Even the food. For food that is so fresh and delicious, I can't believe how quickly it comes out. The service was great from the host to the waiter. I'm glad I brought my roommate here. It was a great start to our Vegas trip.

3fRaRz_1QjN11--7AzTKsQ.text: i would give my left kidney for this place. soooooo amazing. literally the. best. place. in. vegas.

J8AaA3Lr_fN9oHEvRC-VrA.text: We got a groupon for here, so we decided to try it out. The servers have excellent customer service and the restaurant is beautiful! All the meals come with a soup or salad (I got the soup), red & white wine, bread, and a cappuccino at the end! It was all very delicious. I got a Shirley Temple since I'm underage and it was great! My entree was the chicken Alfredo and it was one of the best Iv ever had. My parents said the wine was good too. It was a great experience and the next time we're in Vegas we will definitely be back!!

o2iguq9h_NDWwD3BAAAjuw.text: Ned C.'s review pretty much sums up what our experience was about 2 weeks before his review was posted. Our first night in Vegas couldn't be better having this as our first dinner spot. I think this was our favorite of the week. Our shuttle driver from the airport recommended it. I've seen the restaurant on previous trips but the exterior wasn't anything to write home about.   If you like the atmosphere of "dark bars" you'll love this place. Easy to get a table for two on a Monday night. My GF appreciated the carafe of house wine brought to the table (I don't drink but she enjoyed a few glasses with dinner.   Menus are brought to the table but everything is posted on boards on the wall. Simple, but tasty. We had eggplant parm, and like Ned C. stated, the sauce could have used a little kick, but I do understand that you have to compromise for your guests.   Service was very good. I would have like to see the server at the table more, but his assistant was charming and made up for it so we never had to look for staff when we needed something.  Our bill for two people was reasonable, and if we had had the time would have stopped in again.  Later in the week a couple locals recommended this place to us. I imagine that it has a good local following.

FXcriJRAmVK7aGy0qEA2_g.text: More quantity here than quality but knew that going in. Sauce is bland and spaghetti and meatballs was average. Should have gotten chicken parm.

gjaMQ0M0xLMGxkbyG2kVdw.text: Fun restaurant.  This is what defines "Old School". Dark and cavernnous...full of booths and tables, old photos and Italiano decor. The place appears to usually be buzzing with activity. We were there on an evening in June 2018. Our large group of 7 enjoyed our visit very much. Our meals included chicken, pasta and steak dishes,  house red wine, salads and bread. All were good. Our other restaurant options were to go to Buca di Beppo or Casa di Amore which we have already been to and we're were glad we came to Batistas. The price was fair and food good. Service was just ok.

4ilezhSwZx4fo1O_3L8ntA.text: Cool spot to visit while in Vegas. It is a much cooler bucca di beppo. Meals run about $25/person and comes with house wine. Friendly service. Very dark inside. The area itself is kinda shady but nothing a yelper can't handle.   I enjoyed my meal. Cheese ravioli with white sauce was easy to handle and not too heavy for the night of drinking that followed. Also, you may need to wait a bit for your table. While you're waiting go next door to the Stage Door Casino where it is cash only at the bar and the drinks are dirt cheap.   Have a great time!

hdgzCVtt0z39vd6G87nW_w.text: Battista's is a kitschy Italian restaurant right behind the strip. My friend and I were drawn in by "hole in the wall" being in the restaurant name. We came in for dinner and the place was absolutely packed. The 2 girls working the front desk could not have been any more nonchalant or rude. They couldn't care less if we left or stayed when they quoted us a 1.5 hour wait.   Luckily, they managed to inform us that the bar area was open seating, and there were 2 seats available at a high top. The only drawback to this area is that the menu is a lot smaller. We both just wanted Spaghetti and Meatballs, so we went for it. Our server in the bar was awesome. I wish I remembered her name because she was friendly and quick to get us our food.   The meal was average, but just right after a day of drinking. If I wanted something quick to coat my belly, I would come back and sit at the bar. But the food isn't good enough to warrant a 1.5 hour wait for the main dining room, and putting up with the attitudes of people who clearly don't want to be working there.

WATPMvHBHNjgY9PJxsOqmA.text: Great! Classic Italian. I recommend making reservations because the wait can be long!
