Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PBGClpVuSxrAhdJzf5MkTQ.text: Great group dinner place. Roughly $40 a person for a soup /salad and entree with unlimited bread and wine. Great for large groups but call ahead. We've been here many times and will be back again!

1GlO_IzVUcG_u9kkkjWmfQ.text: Love this place, awesome food excellent atmosphere super romantic  A must do if you are in Las Vegas  Very well priced all in. I recommend leaving room for the coffee

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fODy8wqrC_8ngZnxtO8sdw.text: The bread and soup were great! The lasagna not the best but I loved the atmosphere and Gordy!!

UL3k8NckZLzgXf6s9XdyEA.text: Great food, great "old Vegas" atmosphere. Service was awesome. Have been several times over the last 25 years - mostly business, but last trip was with family (on the way to Grand Canyon). All visits were great!

v9lMMo1Umhqoxgve5JZAyA.text: Kitschy restaurant that I surprisingly like and will come back! Great deal for their meals. It's a bit dingy but part of the appeal. The lineup is a long one during dinner, even on a weekday (in the middle of January too!!, but waited it out anyway!  I had the spaghetti and meatball. Enjoyed the atmosphere, and the roaming accordion player (tip them!).

yXVXiRpRjO_FZc5Vrbc_hQ.text: Suuuuuper dark restaurant, which bothers some people but not our party. Had reservations and were seated right away. They don't provide menus, as they are located on the walls. House wine is served to start, both white and red. Mediocre quality, but good enough for free. Salad served before dinner was great! Fresh and had an amazing house dressing. Garlic bread was flavorful as well. I ordered the spaghetti with meat sauce, very good. Healthy portion. Meal was finished with a cappuccino, also good.

iq_4HMNoaY4XXoWxgoNegA.text: don't be fooled by the name. it may not be upscale but this place is dope. i love all the eclectic decor. the space is tight, seeing that it is a hole in the wall, but let's get this straight, their food is better than any basic a** olive garden. and the portion sizes are huge. i do think they do use the hole in the wall aesthetic as a crutch, for average service. in the end it still was delicious and you'll have loads of food leftover for a good late night snack

PrU6kshYplJzGcuSerl0rA.text: Gross gross gross! Didn't have a chance to tell the waiter how I was not happy with my meal cuz he never showed his face again till he was ready to bring the check! Well that reflected in the less than 10 percent tip. Soup tasted like the canned soup and worse was the sauce omg dark sweet sauce with no flavor. What does it take to whip up a simple marinara!!!! Not much olive oil garlic and some fresh tomatoes. For the price this place sucked. I could have bought a can of chef boyardee that tasted better for 1.25. What a disappointment. Worst off I tried to tell the manager on the way out and he could care less. Please don't waste your time and money on this place there are a million other places in Vegas to eat at that price.

yyDVZNaoq8kQF5PqD8GzZA.text: If you're looking for a gourmet dinner, this might not be the place for you. However, if you want a relaxed atmosphere, Italian food that feels like you're eating a home cooked meal with unlimited wine and reasonable prices (being so close to the strip), then this is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AuKWNcNEEdgqPRLhMH70Pg.text: Such a great ambiance and fun experience. I love the Italian food here and my favorite part is the cappuccino at the end. Always enjoyed being greeted by the elderly man playing the accordian. He made our family's dinners special. As a local, I always recommend this restaurant to visitors and friends.

J9EQ0sEEASt8bmsZ6VmIWQ.text: OK, where to start.....  I appreciate independent family restaurants, and in most cases they cook with recipes passed down through generations.   This IS NOT that place. The kitschy decor with old memorabilia gives the air of a certain authenticity and non commercialized feel unlike the rest of the strip. The food however is a completely different story.   I am shocked by the amount of 5 star reviews! I have come to the following conclusion, either these reviewers are:  1. Friends and family 2. Have never eaten in a restaurant better than a McDonalds  3. Don't know how to cook from scratch 4. Exclusively eat Stouffer's freezer lasagna and "make" pasta by boiling dry noodles and pouring Ragu jar sauce over top.  5. Have recently taken part in Las Vegas' new legal marijuana laws before going out for dinner  6. Are completely sloshed from the cheap "house wine" they serve BEFORE they serve you precooked low quality and mass produced food.   I am still in awe that the place was full and kept turning over tables. I can't imagine that any of the diners, (us included) could have ever been repeat customers.   There is excellent food in Las Vegas. If a celebrity chef restaurant is too pricey, do yourself a favour and go to something like Maggianos where although it's a chain, the food is actually good.

m2ZgNEInIUrHs__oCCgv4g.text: Food is not that good.. one of the employee is rude asf.. hes a young filipino guy.. not going back here.. waste of money..

clthv-_WW4FaNI2nNOuC5g.text: Just had dinner here again! We visit every time we are in Las Vegas. The chicken Alfredo is by far the best! We recommend to share the Alfredo and get a side of meatballs on the side because they are delicious! (Keep in mind, to share there will be a $13 additional charge). Also, the cappuccino as always is AMAZING! Thanks Battista's for always being dependable for a great meal. We will continue to come back again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A9TQoxNsDYdgHaoVLQrolQ.text: I'm giving this establishment a solid three stars. I have been told about this restaurant by others who really seemed to enjoy the food and the ambience. This is not a chain restaurant and it is off strip so I did not know what to expect. However, I have eaten at places such as Olive Garden and Maggianos enough to have a certain expectation. Unfortunately our expectations were not met.  When we first entered, we noticed that the lighting was low and it became very evident once we were seated. Not only was it dim but the lights themselves are orange in color casting that orange lowly light over everything.  The menus are on the wall and most of your meals include soup or salad, the entree, a side of pasta and a cappuccino.  We decided to split the chicken Parmesan for $30. When you split a meal they will tack on the additional charge. For our trip it was an extra $13 to cover the second person. My wife had the salad with Italian dressing and I tried the minestrone soup. Both were fairly plain. They tasted OK but nothing to write home about. Garlic bread also was decent but I would've traded for some OG breadsticks.  The entree portion was nice and large. We expected a good size portion that we could split. They say the chicken comes out at 10 ounces which is fine because we each are comfortable having about five or 6 ounces of meat separately. It tasted pretty good but seemed a little thick and heavy. The side of pasta seem like something my eight-year-old would give me at home. The pasta itself was cooked al dente but had no flavor. The sauce on top was probably homemade and tasted good but not good enough to finish the small side portion.  During your dinner you have your choice of white or red house wine. We tried the red wine first and our impression was that we were drinking communion wine at church. So we decided to try the white which was lighter in tone and had a little more fruit on the nose. Both wines could have been third crush. I would not have paid separately for these wines but they were included as part of the meal.  My wife and I both agree that the best part of the entire meal were the cappuccinos at the end. My wife doesn't drink coffee but she really enjoyed these drinks. They tasted more like hot chocolate then True cappuccino.  About four hours after the meal my wife wasn't feeling so good. She had an upset stomach which could've been a result of not being used to acidic red sauces.  I'm glad we visited just so that we can say we been there.

LeswrA5eL3Sm6Vgo0uBJGw.text: Shocked this place has such good reviews...  Table of 4 and 4 out of 4 meals were terrible.  Pasta over cooked (penne and spaghetti) the lasagna tasted like it was days old and pasta in it very over cooked and pasty the veal was also over cooked and lacked flavor.  The red sauce was bland and terrible.  I suggest taking your money elsewhere.  Or perhaps even buying some Prego or Newman's Own sauce would be far better than this place.  I thought it was good when I went prior to this about 5 years ago but was really drunk and it probably wasn't as good as I thought previously.  Bad food and overpriced as a result.

UqEhNxclI6CWGcakeLShkQ.text: Reasonably priced quality food is becoming a rarity in Vegas. Hole in the Wall gives you good Italian food at a nice price, including unlimited red and white wine during your meal. We had the veal with a side of sausages in marinara - and it was fantastic. We walked there and walked out, which was good - because we need the exercise afterward.  Service is good but not quick, just enjoy the wine and your company.

Yp4fHYEXLvl8FYtoy8LJrQ.text: I don't even know where to start with this one.... The location of this restaurant isn't bad at all. Easy to find, Uber and Taxi knew where it was. One problem we encountered on the way out was that Uber does not let drivers pick up from this parking lot... That was odd. So we had to walk over to the Linq and order a taxi there. Battista's really wants to live up to their name Hole In The Wall! haha Inside the restaurant is loud and dark! The menus are posted on the walls, so if you have trouble seeing in the dark good luck ordering. The night my friends and I visited this establishment there were a couple of large parties and other normal sized tables. The service here was slower than molasses. With that being said our waitress was actually very helpful and prompt. (I really wish I remembered her name... She is the reason I'm not giving lower than a 3 star on my review) The "salad" that is servered before your entree isn't really "Italian".... It was just a bunch of vegetables and stuff thrown into a bowl. I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. That wasn't bad, but my friends got some other items and their food wasn't good. For food it was alright, but for what the advertised Italian food was, was terrible... Also during the meal they offer free white or red wine if you are over the age of 21. Nice gesture, but no thanks. The white was watered down and the red was freezing cold! (Freezing cold as in the serving temp of white wines cold) At the end of the meal you get a nice cup of cappuccino...... I wish that was the case. It's really more like a cup of really chocolaty hot cocoa. (Which was actually really good though!) But after my first experience coming here I don't think I will be joining the staff at Battista's for dinner anytime in the foreseeable future. After all Vegas has plenty of food spots to try every new trip out for me.

OktHut2n7MQ5K1Hc2sjLJg.text: This is a very reasonably priced Italian dinner, especially for Vegas! It's authentic in the sense that it tastes like the Italian you get from someone who is a decent cook, but not originally from Italy. I had the chicken parm and my hubby had the lasagna. They were both very large portions with a deep maroon red sauce. The chicken was tender with tons of cheese and the lasagna wasn't overly heavy. It comes with a very nice salad with salami! And all the free wine you can drink. The wine was sweet and maybe a little watered down, but I still left with a buzz despite the amount of food I ate. Service was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend&#39;s cannelloni

THIATF_VMmYsKdeUmRKOzg.text: Fast service, great atmosphere, staff is friendly. Bottomless wine. Honestly the food isn't phenomenal or anything but you get salad, garlic bread, pasta, wine, and a cappuccino for like $25 so it is definitely worth the money!! Shout out Giovanni who was a great server always on top of everything and super friendly. Make sure to have cash for the accordion player or tell them you don't have cash before he approaches. I didn't get his name but he's an old man and he will start playing for you and demand a tip. We witnessed him get upset with many people for not telling him they didn't have cash for a tip before he started playing but he definitely sneaks up on you and will start serenading without being asked. Anyways, if you're looking for a place to get alcohol with a lot of food for a good price, this is it!

xiu4thPEkiZEfn9ZC-B1lQ.text: Amazing food, good value.. you get 2 large carafes of red and white wine, pasta, salad, and cappuccino for $20

m8_S2hW1zEjkq3RyTt9jNQ.text: Wow,  I have been to Las Vegas at least 10 times and my biggest regret is not all the money l lost in the slot machines, it is having not discovered this place sooner.  They start by giving you a large carafe of house wine on the house.  Then they bring you a large basket of amazing garlic bread.  They then offer you a choice of Minestrone soup or a house salad.  Lots of great entrees.   I chose the spaghetti and meatballs.  They were amazing.  My wife chose the eggplant parmigiana and it was among the best she has had.  The atmosphere is super cool and very old school Vegas.  Lots of pictures on the wall.  The waiters actually have names like Luigi.   Then as you are enjoying this amazing food, you are surprised to see an old Italian man that is like 90 years old come by your table with an accordian and play you song requests. Then as this is not enough to amaze you, they bring you an awesome cappuccino to finish off you experience.  My new favorite restaurant.

vagQ30mfCyN_gJZ_FXt8lg.text: Was expecting something spectacular because it smelled so good when we walked in. Maybe I was just starving. Food was ok. But it is massed produced and I get why they were crazy busy on a Tuesday evening so fresh would be impossible. Had plain old spaghetti and meatballs (I said the place smelled like yummy marinara) but the sauce was almost burnt (it was a dark color even) like at the bottom of a pot that had been cooking for a bit. Garlic bread was cold and greasy.  Our server was decent. Nice guy but had 2 huge parties (including ours) so we didn't see him much. I was underwhelmed.

drvHnCSQSnqHzysI7kuEOg.text: Battista's reminds me of how old Italian restaurants used to be. Great food a decanter of Chianti. The little man playing the accordion annoys me. I tipped him $5 to play somewhere else.

at5PsfzMrsiUzVMzebLSfQ.text: This review is four months late! But the experience was so good here I couldn't let it go.  Food: Everything was great. Most authentic Italian we have had, probably ever.  Atmosphere: Quirky, dark, intimate. Except a big group of jocks that rolled in hot and loud af.  Staff: Friendly, knowledgeable. They sat and fed those jocks so fast in order to get them the hell out so that everyone else in the restaurant could re-commence their own conversations, which was impossible during the invasion.  I wont go to Vegas again without coming here.

_nhG5lxuhIZBEV5Ry1OyXw.text: I have wanted to eat here for years. I figured a place that could survive the reconstruction in the area without selling must be doing something right. That is mostly True.  The good parts of Battistas are good and the bad parts are expected.  First off the decor is totally dated -- and this is a plus!  When  you walk through the door you are transported to New Jersey circa 1978.   Secondly, this has to be the best order and dine system in Vegas. All entrees come with either soup or salad, side pasta and an after dinner sweetened cappuccino. In addition carafes of house wine are yours to drink for no additional charge.  This also makes reading the bill easier. Another win for Battistas.  Third up is the food. This one is not so good. My party tried spaghetti with meat sauce, lasagna and a steak dish.  All were edible but ho-hum. I really thought that they would be special due to the longevity of the operation. Oh well.  Overall I *would* eat here again but I wouldn't recommend it. There are better options.

5AXetrK6G0EpAuGcFlZQ6A.text: A fine place to take say, an 18 year old nephew. Not a good place to take your friends from milan. The food was mediocre at best. Very very very covered in sauce. Like whoa. Service was fine. Nothing amazing nothing horrific, a solid B-  The decor is amazing and the vibe is fun. The food is painfully missing the mark.

Lvu5tg8_nU-TqEcF8frFTA.text: This place was fantastic.  The staff was great, and the atmosphere was fantastic.  The place was packed, and you are right next to adjacent diners, but in our case it was clear everyone in the entire room was out celebrating or to have a good time, so it was extremely fun.  The whole room sang happy birthday to two different patrons while we were there!   The food was awesome, I had the shrimp scampi with garlic butter on fettuccine - probably the best meal on the table. The portions are huge, and you get bread, salad, dessert cappuccino, plus unlimited wine!    Highly recommended for going out for a fun time.  Probably not great for an intimate date.

H8qObsT2kF6mDt2JtCMDkQ.text: EXCELLENT! The sweet man playing accordion is just the cherry on top. Everything was fantastic. Food, service, and atmosphere.

Ogz85ZHrxQFzDE6KgMUSGQ.text: 4 Stars for the Ambiance, Garlic bread, Salad and wine. 3 Stars for the Spaghetti ...was good but not Great. Gravy could be more acidic and meatballs were ok as well. Wine was ok and got drunk...hey its free wine. Great place and get away for overpriced strip ...good family restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful sign

uct8znIicBEKbRnv_HUCxg.text: A great break from Casino joints.  Always good and consistent but occasionally a little slow on service.

ZcTxR2fhmemlEyy_iVgDGQ.text: This place was a decent meal.  I think you should come to place with low expectations so you wont be disappointed.  The decor and atmosphere is what makes it OK for them to charge $20+ per plate.  The menu is simple and your table wine, soup or salad, entree and after dinner coffee is included.    Like I mentioned above, the atmosphere is very old school Italian and has a great atmosphere.  The service was really good and the food was decent.  If you're expecting a high end meal here you're in the wrong place.  The food is "OK" to "decent" but to call it "really good" is stretching it.    Would I come back?  I think so!

o9UVjxkTmSbLyL2NaPJC0A.text: All you can drink wine and accordian, so good your wife will kiss your friends husband!  Seriously, the food is your average Italian fare and the atmosphere isn't really classy. But this place is fun!

2B-x2gvGi8eJYXeH-4Q1KQ.text: we went here on a sunday evening. it wasn't crowded at all. everyone recommended this place to me so i had to give it a try! with every meal you get unlimited/complimentary red and white wine, a salad, garlic bread, and cappuccino (soooooooo delicious)! the portions were huge and we didn't want to carry left overs with us so we shared the ziti with meatballs and an order of sausage. it was more than enough for both of us but they do charge you a $12 fee for sharing. we liked everything about it, even the cute old man that comes around and sings for you! we also got pretty drunk very fast with all of the wine!

9_wMWR6hhvlVLZN9VT81GQ.text: Don't get me wrong, the food was super delicious, but I think what really made this dining night out into a rich experience was the ambience&decor. This place is essentially the palace of hole-in-the-wall restaurants. Such a wonderful eclectic mix of stuff as I have never seen outside of Midwestern Cracker Barrel-esque restaurants. It practically carries you off to another place! But let's talk food for a minute. The garlic bread. Best I've ever had, hands down, anywhere. The antipasto salad? Very delicious. Red or white wine with your meal? The wine is okay, but the presentation gives you that authentic experience which goes above and beyond flavor. And the pasta itself? A classic testament to Italian cuisine, with perfectly complimentary flavors. The cappuccino at the end of our meal was the perfect touch, though I wish it had come with a cannoli. My only critique? Don't eat here if you are cutting back on sodium. Holy meatballs batman, I loved the flavor, but was it ever salty. Make no mistake though, we'll be back!

_7S7Tbky05ePb6MOlWo36Q.text: WOW!  Eating here was an absolute waste of time and money.  How in the hell has this place survived for so long serving below average food?  Such a shame...is it that hard to make decent food?

VYy_hl9DZ11nc4ex-71T8Q.text: This is NOT the old Battista's!!!   It is now owned by Cesar's.  I always looked forward to eating there when the NFR was in town.  Now it is overpriced pasta.  I could not get a pizza or any of the old good stuff.  :(     Vastly disappointed.    With out the "shoved down your throat menu",  the place still has kept it's ambience, memorabilia and the elder accordion player.  Please change back to the old menu (even a trimmed down one, put back the pizza and appetizers) and you will be the old, familiar, cozy, eclectic and special "hole in the wall" place people will come back to.

oVKpkNDWnwscZQsPOMSxVA.text: Overpriced ... Rude service... Bad food... Cappuccino? I know it was international coffee from a tin

OyX59LaITC7j0nBo7CenoA.text: Seriously, awesome find. If you ride the monorail at all, you've probably passed the huge Battista's sign next to the Westin Casuarina. Follow the sign and find your way into a charming and romantic side of old Vegas.   The food is decent. I've had better. I've had worse. The wine is what you would expect unlimited house wine to taste like. Having said that, for twenty something dollars, you can have garlic bread, salad (or Minestrone if you're not into the greens), a heaping bowl of pasta, and cappuccino that sort of tastes like maple syrup infused with chocolate (in an absolutely incredible way). Did I mention the unlimited wine part? You can drink loads and loads of wine here - it's light, and refreshing, and though it's not the best tasting, you get used to it. This place is about an incredible experience. It's about taking a breath of fresh air and enjoying a slow and luxurious dinner, filled with wine and a musician who will come to your table and play you a song (he did a rendition of California - like the older song, not the one from the O.C.). It's not just a dinner - it's an experience - one you'll come away loving. And as a bonus, you may not need to pay for food for another 24 hours because you will be stuffed!  Bonus - two separate people told us we were a cute couple. That's right, people went out of there way to be very nice for absolutely no reason other than to be nice. People are warm, the place is warm, with a decorated ceiling that makes you feel like you're in a real Italian home.

XRjfudMqxQXAJ1GAh0lpKQ.text: This place is only one block off the strip, behind the Flamingo.  Mr Man and I love this place for their unlimited house wine with your meal.  I love their Seafood pasta, Eggplant Parmigiana, and their Linguine with Clam.  Mr Man recently tried their Special of the Day - a huge 16oz steak with mashed potatoes.  All the guys' jaws dropped when that big ol' hunk of meat came out.  All the guys tried it and instantly regretted not ordering the steak. hahahah Regardless, we all loved the food and had such good service from our waiter.  1 star taken due to being a bit pricey.  But hey, it's only 1 block away from the strip so you can't expect it to be cheap!

ND7kgsvSxMYiiOFLYhtyUA.text: Beware humans the food served at this place is not meant to be digested! The wine is rubbing alcohol w food colorant.  The pasta tasted like something canned and mass produced in order to exterminate the human race.  I dont think they even dust and sweep!  Save the $27 and ur intestines!!

ETCXDk0iBqR1We4OyaD5rQ.text: Awesome old-school style & good food. Usually busy, but the wait isn't generally long. Great staff and you can expect to pay from about $30. to 50.00 / person, depending on what you want. The salad, bread, table wine & a cappuccino to top things off are included in the main course price. Worth the walk.

R6ae-mnH1fBBzJBOxJXVsg.text: Loved it! Felt like I was in the movie Swingers! I would definitely recommend this place, even though the food and wine were not very good. The food is rather simple more than bad, kind of like the food you would have cooked in junior high school. But, the restaurant is very cute, and it is nice to get out of the casinos for a bit. Although simple, I thought the food was better than the food served at the casinos, which was often time just plain bad. And while the wine is not of the highest quality, it is drinkable.

XhevCsANyUxlMXDJ30Ct9g.text: love this place, no trip to Vegas is complete without visiting here.  Go with  a big group and be loud and fun, or go with an intimate date.

MSvCFXdWLqmyOU5S2g2VbA.text: We have been here for two years in a row as a post carb-up meal for the Las Vegas Rock n' Roll Half Marathon in December.  The food is fine, and the atmosphere is awesome, cheesey yes, but fun.   Wine is included, and you can order from a variety of dishes off giant menus on the wall - and the best Accordian player makes his rounds and sings songs to you!  We love throwing bucks his way to hear him sing state-specific songs to us like "California Here I Come", and "New York, New York".  I think next time I am going to be from Oklahoma. Its perfect for a big group - make sure you have a reservation because its been packed when we have been there. You can either park in the lot or walk from the strip (its back behind Flamingo/etc.)

f23nzEifg7QH0OD10ijP4Q.text: Just had a business meeting here, and boy was it embarrassing.   Its started out alright with the salad, but then it went down hill from there.    We all ordered our food I had the shrimp scampi and it was horrible.  Very bland.  When i asked for fresh grated cheese they said that they grate it everynight and put it in these dispensers.  You can tell the just buy it from Walmart.  Then when the cappuccino came out it just tasted like hot chocolate what a joke.  Everyone else I was with was embarrassed too.  It would be nice if the service was good but they were all angry and didnt want to help us at all.  When I went to the bathroom our server was sitting at the bar talking.  They couldnt pay me to go back to this place.  Good Luck to all who dare try this over priced hole in the wall.

8K8OI2qq36Sqv29fAZ1D5A.text: I don not understand how people can rate the food here as anything better than mediocre.  Perhaps they have never eaten good Italian food before?  The prices are fairly low for the strip area, but I prefer paying more for quality.  I will never return here unless they were paying me to eat there!!  My food was flavorless and just plain bland. Not worth my time.

UWLI4iBTOHqosJp00-5AJA.text: this place, is straight up the jam.   if you're hungry, and like getting drunk. wow. jam.   all you can drink white and/or red wine!?!?! included?!?!?!! whaaat?????...jam.  complimentary cappuccino offered at meal end, nice. jam.   old timey accordion guy?!?!?!!?!? whaaaat???   i'm sleepy now, naps.   five stars.

f7N1Rfj8eH8AEUpP7bsD_w.text: The food is absolutely amazing. The environment is charming. Service was great. I recommend making reservations!

IRxxCoSp4vd2IGNTibX82Q.text: The ambience and the decor are good.  Classic and relaxing.  The complimentary bread and cappuccino are great.  The flavor are a little bit light.  With the complimentary red and White House wine is still a place worth to come for family and date.

1cJgxPMeEXzeLVJPZp9LSA.text: First time Vegas goer. Very nice place to get out of the rat race on the strip.  So good that we went back for a second time later in the week.  Relaxing and eat your own pace with bottomless wine with your meal.  Yes the garlic bread is awesome.  The salad and dressing were very tasty.  Egg Plant, Linguini and Clams, Seafood linguini. All were good.   These folks like garlic.  So do I.    Good food Good service Good location.  Get a Vegas to Go coupon book and use the $10 off coupon.    We will be back next trip to Vegas.

vaLqVz-xYyowuLvWDwvUiA.text: Went here on a recommendation of a friend,didn't know what to expect and was pleasantly surprised .Very old school looking in the inside ,was greeted by a very friendly waiter.He was very professional , informative,and attentive.As well as the the bus person.Nice menu with lots of options,I opted for the veal picatta my guest had the eggplant.Dinners included soup or salad ,garlic bread ,side of pasta and cappuccino .As well as all the house wine you can drink either white or red.Very satisfied as far as everything went and a nice bonus was the gentleman that played the accordian.He was personable as well entertaining.I can see why both locals and tourists flock to this place .Guess that how you stay open for 35 +years with all that competition.Would go back and will recommend it to my friend when they visit Vegas

Z6MAZDFmlNyYMByqP-QQhQ.text: I love Battista's and have been coming here for about 8 years.   Can't beat the excellent prices for a salad or soup, entree, garlic bread, all you can drink wine and cappuccino (which is really hot chocolate,but who cares) ALL YOU CAN DRINK WINE!  Old Vegas charm, a home cooked style dinner, an amazing accordion player and did I mention all you can drink wine! What could be better!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XfZb6Xlcgy62jb6qduOh7A.text: I love this place and eat here every time I come to Vegas.  The Chicken Parmesan is so good.   The first time I ate here, we had to wait an hour to get a table.  Now I make a reservation through Yelp and I don't have to wait.  The food is very good and there is a lot of it!  .   And Gordy the accordion player!  He is a gem, so fun to hear him him play and people singing along.

D0Sk9PBDsT21Gvpgge7SnA.text: This place has a great hole in the wall old school Vegas ambience and that's where it ends. The service was good but the food was barely edible. There was nothing good or fresh about the food. I had high hopes for this place and sincerely would never go back.

GLGgASxWRJiaztgKr1BvQg.text: Highlight of my Vegas trip! I've been trying to get here for a long time! Sorry it took so long! This place was amazingly! The atmosphere was incredible! Loved the service and the menu and the food was delicious! Portions are huge and wine and cappuccino served with all meals (even though I don't drink either) fun place to go! And there was an accordion player who played for us at our table who has been there for over 35 years! He was great!!!!

vEEn2vs4ZA82hJj8tWRKQw.text: Two stars because the food was edible, but I greatly prefer Olive Garden. I actually found the free wine to be such a joke, because it tasted so watered down! No wonder it's free! But it does have a pretty low key, hole in the wall atmosphere so if you are looking for something like that you would probably enjoy it here. The food is pretty pricey for sub standard Italian fare. Service was good though.

VnIyLyLVZtQXNMC_yU-EVw.text: This place is worth a visit for two reasons: the atmosphere is very old-school Chicago Italian, and it is within walking distance from the Westin. The 30 minute wait on a weeknight was not surprising. The little accordion dude was entertaining, but would have been much better off focusing on the large, jovial, lubricated groups of people and not on my colleague and I who were trying to have a work-related conversation. Can't blame him for trying though. Our server was rather non-attentive, and we had to actually request him to come over and take our orders which was strange. The food: I had veal parm (you almost feel obligated to order an old-school dish like this in this type of atmosphere). The veal was ok--but the sauce tasted a little on the undercooked and bland side. The salad was nothing special, but the free wine was nice. All in all--worth the experience and the large portions--but nothing I would go out of my way for again.

L8pfzAo0gPkticHkPaOsfQ.text: Went for dinner last Friday night and it was well worth going to.  Definitely make reservations and come hungry.    Would have been 5 stars, but apparently you don't get to take your leftovers home.  Lesson learned there.

3iL0oGExL91tt1xcXVXOTg.text: Why have I not been here before???? This place is awesome!  The decor takes you back to the old Vegas mob days. Amazing food and great staff, priced just right.  And free wine!!!!! Can't go wrong with the amazing lasagna. The cappuccino at the end was the icing on the cake.  We 100% will be back.

ANUR7eXG2Gc8iJpwaAyAgA.text: Rude accordion player ruined experience.  The food was good.  Meat lasagna was a large portion, good table wines, nice cappucino (though a bit sweet for me).  Our waiters were excellent.  The accordion player, was EXCEPTIONALLY RUDE.  You should be ashamed to have someone like that interacting with the public.  My colleagues and I were visiting from out of town and discussing some medical technologies when the accordion player forced himself onto our table, disrupted our conversation, berated us for using our phones to perform our jobs (we are medical IT), and then yelled at us when we didn't tip him for a 15 second melody when we didn't want him to impose himself upon us in the first place.  We didn't ASK you to join or conversation nor did we desire you to corner us at our table and shove your accordion in our faces.  He was disruptive and loud to the point that neighboring tables asked what his problem was.    He is no different than the street window washers that try to hold you hostage after washing your windows when you didn't ask for it.  The situation could have been avoided if he had some social awareness or led with, "May I interest you in a tune?"  The food was good, but not so good as to be worth the wildly disrespectful service we encountered.  We will never go back, we are advising our colleagues to avoid this place, and I advise the public to avoid this place.

XegyP11WpUV3QNrwq8XkyA.text: Great Italian food. Nothing fancy but just good Italian food. Looks like this place has been in business since Frank Sinatra ruled VEGAS. If you are looking for casual dining this is the place for you.

86vJMDGxg7Zj0tl7A5cCfw.text: Your expectations going in will be important. Name of restaurant is the key. It is a hole in the wall so don't expect "four seasons" service. It's a crowded lil place and the servers do the best they can. Food is better than average and you get salad, bread, and wine with your meal. Bread was Awesome!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu is on the wall.

7hUK7PCnCgcyq-XOf7wZ3Q.text: Honestly, the food itself is a 3/5. But the service, atmosphere, and wine/garlic bread/ cappuccino that is included with each dinner is what will keep me coming back. This was, hands down, the best service I experienced while staying in Vegas over Labor Day weekend (2014). This includes a premier steak house and night club we visited.   Overall, best service and best value.

4lcUzfXlQ8QiQjVjIoQCkA.text: Celebrated my friends birthday on Saturday.  Battista's is a favorite of hers and rightfully so.   We had reservations and they were ready for us and seated us as soon as our party was there.  All I can say is the wine was flowin (free btw-coplimentary with your dinner) the bread kept comin and service was great!  The bread is drenched in butter...not good for the cholesterol but pretty darn good.  My bf and I ordered ziti with meatballs and pink sauce.  Pink sauce isn't on the menu but they said they would do it for us.  It was pretty average.  I've definitely had better.  We also ordered sausage and peppers and the bf loved that.  From the looks of everyone elses orders it was a wide variety of selections and I didnt hear any complaints and there were alot of clean plates.  I've been here several times and we definitely don't come for the food...it is pretty average...mainly for the the ambiance and the one of a kind experience.  Gordie, the accordion player, is such a pleasant addition to the experience as he gifts us with his music and witty songs.  It is a good place to celebrate special days with a group or even for date night.  The place is a Las Vegas staple amongst the locals and vacationers. It is all about the simple things:  Gordie, the decor/ambiance, the menu on the wall, the complimentary wine, even the door to the restaurant that looks kinda like a barrel when you come through the front door.  Sometime simple is best. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Who doesnt want complimentary wine???
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ceiling.  Cool decor!

KMWia_PbhWVqgobaaM9Zyw.text: This is our second time at this restaurant and it did not disappoint. If you are looking for an inexpensive and good Italian meal this is it!  Plus you get an accordion serenade by the owner!  This place is full of character but you better have a reservation!

Wpr9NMSbJidWm4eRjt-xtA.text: Love this place! It was perfect for our large group of 12. The service was friendly and fast, and they kept our wine full. The food was delicious. I would highly recommend this place for a different off-strip kind of feel!

HjBFZxIrfscOyJqo6WRG3w.text: Just.... not great. Tired classics. The food tasted like it had been sitting out for awhile- the bread/soup/salad. White wine- Warm. Just.... nothing I'd come back again for. So disappointed. :(   Casa di amore is way better.

jELA7fKGf3jKSZuxRZP-3A.text: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G-! The price is fair enough... All dinners include: garlic bread (deliciouuuuus *-*), soup or salad and all wine u can drink... Plus the coffee (that we couldnt drink, since we were too satisfied). The minestrone soup is perfect (as the garlic bread). And also the whole dinner... The place is beautiful, the decoration rocks!!! And the people who works there also!!! I wish we could stay more in Vegas to eat there again. *-*

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cSTfQ42BRYfvbwRmSoHMxg.text: How disappointing this place turned out to be.  We arrived a bit early for our reservation, so we went to the bar to grab a drink.  The drink was nice and strong, but I suspect they do that so you don't complain about anything else.  I ordered a cake to be delivered, which it did.  I had to ask the host if it had arrived, even though days earlier, they said they would make a note of it in our reservation.  The wait staff barely said 5 words to us.  Seemed like they were being forced to work under sweat shop conditions or had no grasp of the English language.  No idea, they never communicated to us.  The accordion player was a 90 year old man who did the same "act" to everyone.  I felt bad for him.  Being as that I had ordered a cake for a birthday, you would have expected him to sing happy birthday.  So sad. So much potential, but it fell flat on its face.   The garlic bread was soggy and old.  The salad was drenched in so much vinegar and oil.  The lasagne and other dish we ordered was very bland and lacked flavor.  You could tell they just made a bunch of food ahead of time and just reheated it.  I had to track down someone to find out when the cake was going to come, since we had finished our dinner.  It finally came, after we were about to leave.  As the wait staff, who still has not spoken more than a few words to us, cleared our table, the waiter dumped a full glass of water into my crotch.  He handed me towels.  No apology whatsoever.    I thought this would be a fun, quirky place to celebrate a birthday.  BIG MISTAKE!  Oh, they let you take your wine from your table in Styrofoam glasses...classy...  This truly is a HOLE IN THE WALL...    So much potential... it failed.. failed big time.  I walked out of there full, but not satisfied.  Oh, and with a wet crotch.    This is not a fake post... it had better not be removed by management... they should take note, and fix the issues.

qFwIuQBHTT8X-cDun1C-_Q.text: Well tonight thanks to weather to cold to wonder in i discovered a Las Vegas legend. Wine, Salad, A loaf of garlic bread, pasta and an entree plus a cream covered cappuccino all for $31.95! What? The eclectic atmosphere is fun and kinda charming, takes you back to less pretentious restaurant days. Service was straightforward and the menus is literally on the wall. Im writing this while still sitting here cause i am to full to move.  Andiammo, Gratzi Battista's Hole in the Wall!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quite an experience! So good, and i mean Old school, main street Italian American good too.

KWrDIdnnczgZmcGIFwMpSg.text: Fun place for dinner. It is all inclusive the price includes either soup or salad.  I went with the salad which was a decent salad. The house red or white wine is included I got the red and it was a nice red, nothing fabulous but a good smooth table wine. Then your meal which is I got the chicken Parmesan. It was plenty of food half of which I needed up taking home. The pasta was cooked well and the sauce had good flavor.  The cappuccino at the end reminded me a little of the over sweet gas station cappuccino I used to stop and get in high school and college. The wait staff was very nice. The atmosphere of the place is pretty cool too, very old school family Italian restaurant style.  It is not a place to go if you want to be blown away by homemade fresh Italian pasta but it's a fun spot to share a meal with friends and the price for what you get is really good as well.

u0s3n4gL1CzieVvs6PqiRw.text: Top notch old school Italian. Atmosphere-great. Food - decent. Unlimited wine - too good.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited wine.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguini with clams.

SCWM4wxOOTLJkhL80sCpxw.text: This was a interesting experience. I liked the concept but to be honest it's a little messy inside, and too much food. This felt like a fast food experience instead of a nice restaurant. The wine is fun since it come with your meal but really wish they would give this place a good cleaning and upgrade the food. The lasagna was pretty good but the Alfredo a little slimy.

OqF7_S739iDGGXTAs9UkPg.text: It makes me sad to have to post this regarding our experience from Wednesday, 9/11/2019. One Star is too many. We will NEVER dine here again. I made reservations nearly a month ago so I would make sure we could have dinner here. My mother, sisters and I were in Las Vegas to honor our Father, our mother's husband of 62 years, on the one year anniversary of his passing (9/11/2018). Being an awesome Italian man, Daddy loved this restaurant, he and my mom dined here every time they went to Vegas, so we thought, that with over 2300 restaurants in Las Vegas, there was no better place to go to celebrate his amazing life and allow us to remember him. I noted in my reservation why we chose this place and why it was so important for us to go here.  We are heartbroken over our experience. We felt rushed (5 of us were in and out in a little over an hour), (my sister made a joke that it was like speed eating), we were treated like we were an imposition to our server, and like no one cared that we were even there. When we told our server about our Daddy's passing and why we were there, she said "Sorry" and walked away. I didn't expect much, but I did expect to be treated with compassion. We are crushed, we will never be back. You are not like home style Italian...at least not like the Italian Family we are from. We will never get another chance to have dinner as a family on the one year anniversary of my Daddy's passing. Your team took that away from us. Our experience made a very sad day, that much more sad.   Signed, Heartbroken Orlando Family.

666Rjx1vFQAXqgI4ewcFHw.text: Service, price, and atmosphere are 5 stars. I really do love this spot and it is fun for group meals and definitely will leave your stomach and your wallet full. However the food is incredibly "meh" and is to the quality of any average home cooked Italian food.  But it is decent and edible and not bad by any means. It just isn't fancy or elegantly prepared and the dishes are heavy. But we come here for the atmosphere and to eat out so we accept that it is what it is and I for one hope this stays a Vegas institution!

o8u_mql142CyDF9_ZgWzGg.text: Came here with a buddy for the first time a few months back.  Holy crap what a place!!! I've driven by it a million times but didn't even know the place was here. Now it's a must stop and eat every time I'm in town!!  Can't go wrong here with free wine and ambiance is cool!!

X5wEELxhYhgLnqoqpRd9ow.text: Always a solid go-to spot if you are looking off of the Strip. Bottomless wine is a nice touch as well!

Q0GNaYM9sJzZ5PmnpVgORA.text: So good! I would return for sure. So much food, took half back to hotel. Unlimited wine, pretty good. Salad was great. Bread and meal full of flavor. Atmosphere was fun.

tOnj3EVjGO-2TNWbPBluMw.text: We easily made reservations the day of for two. It is slightly off the strip which is nice. We arrived on time however we were sat about 15 minutes past our reservation time.  Unfortunately they sat three tables all at the same time in the same section, our waitress did a great job though and didn't seem too stressed.  Included with your meal is endless red or white wine, salad or soup, your entree, and a delicious cup of cappuccino. Lots of fun decorations on the interior which make the place inviting.  The lasagna was fantastic with a sweet flavored sauce. I enjoyed the salad and of course the wine. I would be back as the amount of food you get for your dollar is fantastic. And the food isn't too shabby!

m1HrKvVk-pzH-8kr_crfFA.text: Just horrible Italian food.  I come from the NYC Northern NJ area Sopranos country and we know what real Italian food should be. I went to Battista's because it was recommended from the hotel that we were staying at and that it had a long history on the Vegas area. So I figured let's give it a shot, how bad can it be. Very disappointed to say the least.

TBJvvdR5sSz6CFUbxO-RkQ.text: I freaking love this place. The food is so good and the prices are reasonable. In case you didn't know, it comes with unlimited house wine. It's not weak stuff either. It'll get you there. Every time I'm in Vegas I hit this place up. Every time. I love it there.

Zm3RHiFS3Evdb3TAWC6H8w.text: Let's just put it out there:  Battista's is food for the masses.  It's like a cafeteria disguised as a restaurant and it's serving mass-produced, perfectly edible fare.  The food is fine (but crazy overpriced).  Our service was excellent.  The accordion guy is amusing.  The decor is kitschy and colorful.  The gals at the hostess stand were standoffish and definitely need personality transplants.  Look, I love great service and the service was really friendly and attentive.  So, they get points for that.  The food was perfectly edible.  It's not great and it's not bad.  But with a million great restaurants in LV, I'm not sure you need to be eating average food anywhere.  The lasagna was about as good as you can buy in the frozen food section of your local supermarket.  It was fine but nothing special.  The chicken parmigiana was a much, much better dish and, if you must eat here, I would go for that plate.  You get two pitchers of wine (white and red) on your table and you pour it yourself and drink as much as you want.  It's all included with the overpriced food.  It's drinkable stuff but nothing special.  You do realize there are bottles of wine out there for sale that are $2 and $3 a bottle right?  This is probably that stuff.  So, don't get too excited about the "free" wine.  You also get a "homemade" cappuccino included with your meal.  It's an absolute sugar bomb and unlike any other cappuccino I've ever had.  For me, this WAS the dessert (and honestly, even though the sugar levels were off the charts, it was pretty darn good).  Not a bad experience at all but really, no strong reason to return.

OLS5s2US-B6Wm4e9KHnDgg.text: We LOVE Battistas! This was our second visit and we loved it as much as the first! Great food! Great atmosphere! Old Vegas Style and Class! Love it!

jOKRDsqU3iZtj7b3FVQaaw.text: This place is awesome recommended by our taxi driver. It has that old time feel and the food are basic but super delicious.  They have set menu. I think the best part was the red and white wine! I love the garlic bread as well. Seriously you have to try this place at least one time and go from there. Do make a reservation!

oOkg348GPokTWZfOkVywww.text: Good food, quiet, and dim, there's no better combo in Vegas! The price point is a little high, but not by Vegas' standards, and you'll leave well fed with a to-go cup of table wine.

M7T5PHf1SM1IfuC9f6uzzQ.text: You have to experience it...Old school Italian dishes like Mama used to make. Old school Las Vegas, you just cant find this kinda place anymore..Eclectic decor and truly Italian food, great garlic bread, the red n white table wine is well, table wine....all you can drink... Bon apetit.... Give it a shot, recommendation: uber to it, parking is tough, also get reservations, they are always busy...

9Z0uUF6hqORMQ9f18uc3Rw.text: Absolutely awesome place.  Great history and they haven't changed a thing.  You cant go in hoping for some upscale experience.  This place throws you right back to the days of old blue eyes himself.  The food was wonderful and so was the staff.  Plus you can't beat free wine!

no9ZpM8oQXDAg3xt6iUEdQ.text: A gem that is walking distance from the strip, but full of flavor and personality. The decor is kitschy and wonderful. The amount of food and the quality is outstanding for Vegas. Each meal comes with a carafe of red and white wine, soup or salad, garlic bread, and a sweet cappuccino with whip cream.  I was pleasantly surprised by the salad...mixed greens with no ice berg lettuce in sight! A warning for vegetarians, ask for no salami! I had the eggplant parmigiana. Wonderful and filling. Next time, my husband and I will split a meal. It was too much food, so good and refreshing.

inUFDBLnlSPUBF1wTp3TEw.text: Food was amazing! You get complementary wine, soup or salad, cappuccino at the end of this your meal, AND garlic bread ! Can't beat that anywhere... Literally !!!! I ordered chicken parm which the chicken was a huge portion and you get a little side of pasta which I didn't mind because I'm not a pasta fan. My boyfriend ordered the chicken Marsala which isn't on the menu but they made it for him and he ate the whole thing. I ate most of mine but couldn't take it back to the hotel because we don't have a fridge or microwave. The service was great only issue we had was waiting for more bread but it was busy so I'm not going to complain.   The only issue I had was the stupid old ladies behind us who honestly complained the whole time for no reason !!!! They were so rude about it I almost got up to tell them to shut up. They even said something to a couple that just sat down about how they couldn't get a wine glass for the free wine, they give you a little shot glass to drink from but that's fine ! Not something to complain about. They were being so long about how they were never coming back which is fine but keep it down and to yourself!!! We had a great experience thank you !

KTlEgnMLBDg7HhgejTcE4w.text: I have been wanting to try this place for years.  Each time we visit Vegas. It did not disappoint.  The food was amazing.  You will not leave hungry at all.  One the wine is included and is completely unlimited.  The salad was a really nice salad. Not the lettuce tomato cucumber you get in most places.  This thing was loaded. We were full from that and wine.  Luckily this is not a place that rushes you.  They encourage you to relax and enjoy your meal. I had the veal picante and he had the lasagna.  Boy was it authentic and amazing! And the cappuccino at the end was just what I needed! I highly recommend this place for any Italian food lovers. We will be back.

Dr6DSPZu0Let_gm-NXvxJQ.text: It was a VERY slow Tuesday night at the restaurant. I made a reservation for 6:30 p.m.. The hostess who took the reservation was apathetic at best. She didn't repeat back the information on the telephone to ensure that the time and name were correct, she just said, "Yup."  Upon arrival to the restaurant the hostess who showed us to her seat just motioned for us to go to our seat  and did not specify which seat. She should have just walked us to  a row, containing six different tables to show which table specifically, but instead she rudely pointed and had us guess which table she referenced. Seriously? !    We waited 15 minutes for anyone to acknowledge us, and when I asked whether or not a worker who walked by was our server, he simply replied, "NOPE! " in the most apathetic fashion possible.  At this point in time, my better half went to speak to the manager regarding the atrocious service we'd received thusly. The manager simply stated, "Well, I've never had any complaints about him before, all I don't know what to tell you."   I continued to wait for water/acknowledgement from our server who had already walked by me 3 times without so much as a "hello, I'll be right with you."   At that time I requested to speak with the manager "Doug" myself. I explained the situation that no one at the restaurant seemed to have any interest in providing any level of satisfactory service, and he simply shrugged it off and said, "Well, I hope it gets better." Instead of taking ownership of the problem and asking how he could MAKE things better, he apathetically walked away and did nothing.  At this point in time we had lost our appetites and our desire to dine at a restaurant who simply didn't care about the quality of service they provide. This is level of laziness is  usually reflected in the food as well.  "Doug" watched us walk out without any concern for losing our business, and I guarantee that I will NOT be back. As a professionally trained chef, I do not go out for the great food as much as the service, as I can create any dish I desire in my own gourmet kitchen.  This place is completely unacceptable any longer. This was my 6th and final visit to this restaurant. I used to recommend this place time and again to all of my friends who visit this fine city. I am flabbergasted that a city built on hospitality could have an entire restaurant full of staff who just simply doesn't care about their customers. Obviously they learned it from their manager Doug. These things always start at the top.   NEVER AGAIN

7W4IjhauapcKV2t64EqJUw.text: Let's start off with the good:  Ambiance and service was good.  The bad:  We had the linguini chopped clams, sausage cacciatore and meat lasagna   Linguini chopped clams: Bland bland bland. You can barely taste the clam and it's also very soggy. The serving bowl was also unappealing. It was placed on a stainless steel bowl  Sausage cacciatore: The sauce itself was ok. A little on the bland side. The sausage was a different story. It has a weird taste. It tasted like they tossed a whole bunch or herbs and hoped for the best.   Meat lasagna: Pretty average. Nothing special. Taste like lasagna from other Italian restaurant  The "free" wine is a NO for me.  It taste like red wine as if it was bought from the dollar store.  Cappuccino was ok I guess. A little on the sweet side.  The price didnt reflect the quality of the food.  $30 + for overpriced cafeteria tasting Italian food.  I suggest going to bucca di beppo instead. Where the price justifies the quality of the food.

idLDGWJwlfTLUJ2Ma7ghRA.text: Battista's may not be considered "fine dining," but it earns a 5-star rating from me! I love bringing visitors here, and here's why:    * Ambiance: This is old-school Vegas. There aren't many places like this anymore, with big red booths, dark secluded rooms, and celebrity photos on the walls.    * Service: From the hostess to our waitress and busser, everyone was friendly and professional. Too bad we missed the accordion player on the night we visited.   * Price: Meals range from $23 to $41 per person. A steal, when you consider they offer tons of food and all-you-can-drink wine!  And, most of all ...   * Food: Great cheesy garlic bread. Great salad (more like an antipasto than a traditional house salad). A tasty cappuccino after dinner. And Italian classics like chicken parm ($31) and veal marsala ($34), plus faves like spaghetti and meatballs, linguine and clams, lasagna, and ravioli. Although the underseasoned entrees are the weak links in the lineup, they are still pretty tasty. And did I mention ALL-YOU-CAN-DRINK WINE?! And they aren't stingy with it, either. Ask for red, white, or both, and they will bring you a carafe or two--or more. (Just don't be a lush and spoil it for the rest of us!)  This may be just a "hole in the wall," but as the landscape around it changes, I wholly hope Battista's is here to stay!

DIK2-MnpJhQmBKHPQFq_qg.text: Best ever, truly authentic Italian food.  Wish they would allow take out, other than that perfection!

9wBi9jBw2gT0I-1xFeXYGA.text: Ick.  Walking in it smelled so bad - almost gag reflex bad. Gets and holds your attention bad.  My guess...combination of kitchen, mildew and the same air that has been in there since opening day. Service is indifferent at best. Ambiance... if a collection of airplane booze bottles counts, it's ... still nothing. Ah..the food.  Give me Olive Garden any day. Did not risk trying the carafes of wine that comes with the meal.  And only $110 for 2 people!

If you are ever In Las Vegas come check out battista's hole in the wall, great Italian food. Can't lose out. Thanks for the warm welcome.

Bs21VGW_y44uU-rGGfF4HQ.text: Have been wanting to try this place for years, since we typically stay at the Flamingo which is just steps away, and I am so happy we did. Old school, dark and reminiscent of the "good ol days" of Vegas, Battista's was a perfect place to unwind after a day of gambling and shopping. Very reasonably priced, all dinners included a full carafe of wine, both white and red, and a after dinner cappuccino. The lasagna was delicious and was a generous size. We are in Vegas several times a year and will definitely be back here.

uG55XvrB3usRIuF7NGZ3ng.text: I really really really REALLY like this place......and it's not the all you can drink wine talking =)  Well, maybe it's the wine.just.a.little!   I had heard about this place for a while now as couple friends had their first dates here.  AND it's one of those vintage hole in the wall joints. I am super down with that!   Came here on a random night before hitting up The Linq next door.  There was a 30 minute wait so we just had a couple drinks at the bar.   Prior to coming here, I mentioned to the BF that it was all you can drink wine and he's all "nah, maybe a glass!"  Welp, as soon as we sat at our table, we were greeted with a cradle of white AND red wine. YES, TWO ALL YOU CAN DRINK WINES!!!! Our waitress didn't want us to make a choice on which wine to drink. **boom**   Our salad was bomb. The pasta we ordered was "eh." I wasn't blown away by the pasta nor did it make an impression. The cappuccino was EXTRA bomb tho!   Ambiance was exactly what I pictured. Dimly lit, old school resto. Vintage photos and quotes on the wall. This would be great for first dates :)  I'll def be back again. For the wine and cappuccino! And good company, of course :)!

CkoQbouC8iMEhb530egO5w.text: Unlimited wine? I'm in 100%. I'm aggrieved that I wasn't informed about this enticing deal sooner. Located off Flamingo and the Linq, Battista's Hole in the Wall has all the character of an old school Italian restaurant. The entryway makes you feel like you're in a giant wine barrel, and the area by the host stand is a feast for the eyes. From floor to ceiling, Battista's is lined with interesting tid bits and knick-knacks (like an extensive collection of mini liquor bottles!). Lighting is dim and like any good Italian joint, patrons are greeted with the sound of raucous laughter and conversation. Reservations are a must - we arrived on a Tuesday evening with reservations at 8PM. We were lucky to find parking in the crowded lot. Amid the hustle and bustle, we ended up being seated at 8:15PM.   CHEESE MANICOTTI ($25.95): Like all meals on the menu, this entree comes with a salad or minestrone soup, garlic bread, unlimited house red and white wine, and a cappuccino at meal's end. I opted for the salad as my starter, which was heavily dressed in Italian and had sparse toppings (1 olive, 1 slice of mozzarella, 1 sweet pepper, etc.). Though lacking creativity, the salad was fine. The accompanying garlic bread was warm, fresh, and delicious. The manicotti was served with a side of creamed spinach, which helped to break up the overwhelming amount of cheese on the manicotti. Instead of being served in wine glasses, guests are provided with small shot-like glasses to use for the wine. Kind of odd, but after a few glasses I cared not. The cappuccino was a sweet treat that I enjoyed every second of. 4/5  CHICKEN RIO ($29.95): "Superb" according to my husband. He said the sauce was quite similar to jagerschnitzel sauce. Served with a side of shredded zucchini. He'd order the same thing again! He didn't leave a speck of food left on the plate and was so full he couldn't drink any more wine. 5/5  SERVICE: Food came out quickly and in order. The waitress was a bit over flirtatious but she took care of us overall.       Worth a Return Visit? On the whole, I rather enjoyed my meal. I wouldn't order the manicotti again, but will definitely come back to order another menu item at Battista's. For an Italian meal with Vegas panache, you can't beat the deal Battista's offers. Dinner for two cost $60 pre-tip, a bargain for Strip prices.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2016: #13

wIk57oru020iIH4fywMx9A.text: I went here 03/12/16 I really liked he decor I liked the location which was close to the strip. The menu was really creative which included re and white wine. The food wasn't amazing I had the chicken Alfredo and the sauce wasn't the best. The wine was regular but it went well it's the food. ayMRjwPXKWSzDfQSlvVovw.text: This past week, several colleagues and I made a last minute reservation at Hole in the Wall looking for a decent Italian meal and a little fun. We got it in spades!  We were seated within 5 minutes of our reservation time and were greeted by a very friendly and competent server. The free wine wasn't at the 100 pt. level, but, was definitely decent and together, most of us enjoyed more than one carafe. Garlic bread was great and pastas were better than average. One of our party ordered a steak which was undercooked, but, was reluctant to send it back. I asked gently if there was something she could do and she immediately apologized and grabbed the dish to cook further. It came back quickly and was turned out to be very good. Cappacino was ok, but, overall service, atmosphere and food was great, especially for the amount we spent. I would visit over again and recommend to everyone.

i5-alAzsRKEDzZXBC48oMw.text: Great. great, great food! Service was friendly and attentive. Salad and bread was to die for. Cappuccino for dessert was delicious omg. If you love Italian food you have to stop by. PS. there's a cheap bar right next door. :)

jbDb8chMi8Z0K_UVFwhMqA.text: I wish we lived closer to this hole in the wall but it's OK, we'll drive here and not complain! This restaurant is so unique and the ambiance cannot be compared to no other establishment in Vegas.  The menu is very limited but it has such a variation that you can definitely choose something to eat. The menu is also placed on the wall. Did I mention free house wine all night? Red and white? Does it taste great? Not really. Could a vineyard survive with this vino product? Hell no. But it's free! Drink up!!  I ate the cannelloni the other night. It has pork in it and it was so good. The waitress set my plate down and red, white, and green were screaming back at me. My food looked like the frickin Italian flag. It was the goddamn Olympics on my plate with that flag waving in my face. I ate an Italian burrito and I loved it!

fJHyvR_y2QdacDgUuKBRUQ.text: The server was fantastic, with that said...the food tasted like it was canned sauce. The pasta was poorly cooked , the wine is poor quality. I have no idea how they justify the prices.   On a positive note the atmosphere is wonderful. Again, our server was great. She was very polite and helpful. If you're looking for a fun night you can come here, if you want any kind of quality food go somewhere else.

lpgA1fo6u8KHooMFYPibXA.text: Had the chopped clams over linguine white. Very good, lots of clans and very tasty.  Would go back.

QQ_ymhN-ARVqCmB_9dZFvQ.text: Huh. Don't get caught by this tourist trap.  Long wait on a Monday evening. No problem. I didn't think we would need a reservation. We have an overpriced beer at the bar - great bartender, though.  Soup is fine. Garlic bread, tasty. Red wine, drinkable-ish.  The service was fine.  The food was sub-par!  Lasagna with no flavor, no seasoning.  "Veal" marsala...maybe beef, maybe. I have never had tough veal, ick.  And the "Marsala"? Like tough meat in packaged brown gravy.  And the "pasta side", unseasoned tomato sauce on overcooked ziti.  This place is banking on "free" soup, bread and wine.  And huge portions of flavorless food.  Even Buca di Beppo is miles above this place. Save your money, at least Buca seasons the food and is not so terribly overpriced.

4wy-Ea0aJRy4WmeMNIBuVg.text: Good food, good price, complimentary bread, soup/salad and cappuccino what more can you ask for on vacation.  Great for groups as well.  They cut and lit our b day cake with no hesitation.

iPMHJ7UhAhV8JcNYUnKPkQ.text: What a rude waiters . nasty and uncooked food . i had italian food before and it's just waste of money. They also has gratuity as hostage policy . expensive food and no quality

4VUV_8GIUi5CLSXE2JCxLg.text: Hubby and I had such a poor experience here. The whole "cover charge" if you are sharing is ridiculous. We weren't hungry enough to eat two meals, so we wanted to share the chicken parm. We were told it was a $13 cover charge for the free wine- but we weren't drinking! We politely declined at the beginning of the meal (to which the waiter acted like we were aliens for saying we didnt drink) and still had to pay for it? Really dumb. Salad was just awful, bread sticks were really tasty though (the best part), and the pasta side dish was super bland. Chicken parm was good, but not $30 (plus $13 cover charge) good. Eat elsewhere.

BR9ZJI3EcbyxOhpbrIv8_g.text: Great place especially to take clients. One of the coolest hidden locations in Vegas.

_52iZIHY8hH2AIYT61ruQA.text: A step back in time to the days of Elvis and the Rat Pack in Vegas. Authentic family style Italian dining. Reasonably priced favorites, with all you can eat bread and wine! You can't go wrong. I have never had a bad meal here, never had bad service and never failed to have a great time! We stop a few times a year when in town. Make reservations early as they are extremely popular!

eYRpy6vY6-8kaY7CwQIOEg.text: This place has good food and it is a good deal considering you get all the house wine you can drink, a great salad, garlic bread, and a cappuccino after dinner.  And the dinner portions are huge.  I always get the manicotti and it is big enough for two meals.  However, be prepared to wait, most times 30 minutes or more.  The ambiance is outdated and could use a face lift.  And it is VERY LOUD.  And I've never had great service.  A couple of the waiters are very curt and a little rude.  But the food is good and worth going for and worth the wait.

Mps7wH7kjLYw6B7PmvlW2A.text: Awesome experience. First time there. Thank goodness they supply wine with dinner to soak up the great food. The left overs the next day were still good. This will be a must do on future visits.

FVJl9-wqyOw_1aC5ImEZHg.text: Thankfully a co-worker clued me in on this little gem.  What a great find!  Our cab driver even said it's the best place near the strip, the best bang for your buck.  The food is basic Italian, but in a good way, nothing fancy but full of flavor.  Faves from the table were the sausage cacciatore and shrimp with a tasty alfredo sauce.  But the real draw is the all you can drink house wine (both red and white) that they provide for the table.  There's a little man that goes around playing the accordion and the environment is lively and friendly.  The wait staff was fabulous as well.

dkDl9NJyhnU-9qSZxWuwNw.text: Made a reservation and got in right on time. Classic Italian restaurant with good food, quick ticket times, and all you can drink house wine. Spaghetti and meatballs were very tasty. Don't forget to tip your accordion player!

wQJapSRaeSMqFdh9HG8V1A.text: In many ways the uniqueness of this restaurant merits a visit, "endless" wine with quaint nostalgia on the walls. But for some this can be a trip to one of Dante's levels; to start, by sitting at the table you become part of a factory-style service with explanations coming at you like an auctioneer, the food is served with efficient repetition and the quality is on par with chain Italian restaurants. That is you can understand and taste the concept of the dish made long ago, but the shortcuts have eviscerated the essence. If you are lactose intolerant--sucks for you. The included wine, garlic bread and cappuccino while nice for some make it too expensive to buy a nice bottle of wine or other sides. Love the pics of the famous on the wall.

BXD4qf41yhotQZTkrBxUeA.text: Just took our son with a big group of friends and family to celebrate his 21st birthday on our visit to Vegas.  Been here many times....no it's not 5 start dining, but the food is good, portions are big, the place is fun for a group, and service is good....gotta see/hear Gordie and his accordian.  Just go, drink the 'free' wine and have a blast...

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordie and his squeezebox - a classic a Battista&#39;s

mC4kmXyqMbBwdkfRv1HjLA.text: At first bar like entrance...If your looking for Italian food, you found it! Right to the point (hence the writing is on the wall), food is cookie cutter right to order, no personalization of anything in there, have all the house white and red wine you want....It actually makes the food taste better...Choose #'s 1-18 and the last 6 are $32 and higher...You sit right on top of others next too you, however, there conversations are very interesting...

MIpxzBQM5qDBwpNLXbvvOA.text: I would really like to know what the people giving this place more than one star consume on a daily basis. I've never had a meal as repulsive as the one I had at this restaurant on Saturday. Between the service (hostesses & server) to the food, I was waiting for a hidden camera to come out & tell my party we were being Punk'd. YUCK!

MXQwSxju-UUZsCUwMdM9wg.text: Great food! It's cute and fun. Bottomless wine, too! The only complaint I had was that you couldn't just get something a la carte. You had to get a ton of food in order to get an entree. Otherwise, we had a wonderful time!

3wtZ46mF24Lsox7em8SaBA.text: Best kept secret in Vegas dining right here. We happened upon the amazing restaurant walking down from the Linq. We enjoyed the food immensely, hot and authentic. The atmosphere was romantic and unique. My boyfriend and I were blown away by what was hiding behind this "hole in the wall" door. Everyone must try this!

NhXW_tCXJbqYyk39UVS1Fw.text: No.  We went here, since we had a group of 8 and it was late on our first night in Vegas, and it was close.  What a mistake.  This place is so overpriced it is laughable.  Paid $23 for cheese tortellini with "meat sauce".  With that you get a salad, garlic bread, and their house wine (red wine vinegar, perhaps?).  My pasta had clearly been sitting in a vat too long, and there was no meat to be found in the sauce.  I could have done better with a bag of frozen pasta and a jar of Ragu, and I hate Ragu.  Seriously, I don't know why anyone who reads these reviews would come here.  Dining in Vegas can be pricey and it can be bad, but at Battista's you get both in one visit.

qobdTAlpBy1IHlKwhmKRvA.text: Great place to visit, delicious food. There is always a wait but worth it. Traditional type Italian menu and presentation that includes wine with your meal. Very family friendly. Definitely would return.

c5jKtZUuMMbUu8qig6aZ7Q.text: The menu is really limited. The prices are literally insane. Yes, there is free house wine, but that is not free when you have to pay $25 for a plate of spaghetti. Most of the meals were in the $35 range. Not an elegant place, but the atmosphere is a rustic place steeped in history.

SHqZ8gXT2DnLh1Ja_tsLVg.text: Went there on a recommendation.  Was told it was the best chicken parm ever. Booked reservations through Open Table although Sunday night at 7:00 was not very crowded. We were able to walk there from the Flamingo. One block up past the pool.  At first glance you would probably just drive by as it doesn't look appealing. Inside the place is very old school lots of celeb pics on the wall.   When we were seated at our table 2 carafes of wine were included (1 red, 1 white) all you can drink house. The menu seems a little pricey $28 for chick parm but with wine,salad,garlic bread and a cappuccino following your meal its not that bad.  The salad was dressed with a House Italian dressing which was tasty and also came with a few pieces of salami and a nice hunk of cheese. Garlic Bread was very good.  Plenty of garlic and butter and seemed to be very fresh. The Chicken parm was tender and juicy and thick.  Now the sauce - It was a little sweet and bland which is why only 4 stars.  We had them bring a little garlic powder to the table to give it a little more flavor.  The cappuccino was a nice touch for after the meal. Topped high with whipped cream.  We would go back again although I would probably order the Alfredo sauce.

G4Go6qnKSo5eiw-jwOwIMw.text: If you don't have a reservation don't show up. They tell ya 45 mins and it turns into 2 hours. Not worth the wait when hunger.

B2gSePXCjiabgIk4OK34NQ.text: I ordered the ziti with meat sauce. I had to ask them to take the dish back. No flavor whatsoever. The sauce tasted as if it came from a can and the meat had no flavor. Not worth $20+ on its best day. My minestrone soup was cold when it was brought to the table. I had to ask the manager to remove my $12 cover charge for the soup that I had and a taste of the wine. The service was awful and the food not worth a second try.

yegncED90TID9lW3GwBE2Q.text: I really recommend this place as something completely different to do on your visit to Sin City.  I love Battista's.  It only gets three stars because the food is only okay.    In spite of my 3-star rating, you should go here because: 1) The little guy with the accordian singing "When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie, That's Amore" is PRICELESS.  And followed by the Chicken Dance song. 2) The wine flows, and doesn't suck.  In fact, I liked it!  The red anyway, didn't try the white. 3) The several course meal in the dark rooms, walls covered with photos of icons of the past who used to hang out here... it's great for chillin' with your friends, drinking, relaxing and stepping back from the standard Las Vegas vibe. 4) Elvis used to come here.

qy6KMHUiq43dRv2Tbk0_hA.text: Lots of yummy stuff included with your meal, Italian salad or soup, garlic bread, red and white wine and cappuccino.  Food was good but the drinks were just ok and our waitress never even took a drink order. The waitstaff helpers were fast and efficient. We eat there every time we go to Vegas.

38P3t5Bvr2IMl3Rqdcxvcw.text: Carbs galore and the full dining experience, everything included with meal including all the wine you can drink. Italian setting is perfect and good music, come to table.

bhCrub0PJeUj4cpWAZRvPA.text: I'm really not one to give crappy reviews.  If you check my yelp ratings, you'll see that I usually only review things that i LOVE or HATE.    Battista's Hole in the Wall...i HATE this restaurant.  It's SOO over-priced -- yes you get free wine, but it tastes like vinegar; yes you get a "set" menu, but it sucks.  everything just  tasted SOOO bad.  I can't believe the waiters don't feel bad serving you this food.    Also, that little accordion man...he's sooo creepy.  shamelessly panders by playing a BAD song to get a tip at your table.     BEWARE.  DON'T GET TRICKED BY THE 4 STAR REVIEWS LIKE I DID.  DO NOT COME HERE.

1Xm29kLvutdjVoyRf81iFw.text: We were recommended this hotel by a local.  Walking in, I was delighted. Fun to look around (as we waited an hour to be seated).  While waiting we were approached and asked if we'd like a drink. When we asked what they had, we were told 'there's a long list on the table behind you' - the table with people sitting at it.  FYI - they have a full bar, but nothing on tap.  So, the food. Great salad and a yummy hot chocolate they call cappuccino.  The garlic bread and wine that also come with the meal were mediocre. The food was...just ok. I guess when I pay $30 for a bowl of spaghetti I am expecting to get wowed!  Not the case here - and the portion is not a family style portion which would have helped explain the cost.  We were entertained by the accordian player - sweet, little old man who made us smile and enjoyed the overall ambience of the restaurant. Not sure I would return, or even suggest to it a friend though.

VQsVKQ4ZKyCBiZ8nKqLVGQ.text: I've been going here since I was a kid. Every time I would come to Vegas to visit I would go. Now I live here, and can go whenever I want. Great food, great atmosphere! 25-30 dollars for a good Italian dinner with wine, and cappuccino included. Gordy the accordion player adds a nice touch. This is a must if your visiting Vegas, or for locals.
