rLlPUZsd8H8E3Fa4abZfMQ.text: Brought my girl here and we were impressed. It is a hole in the wall and it has a good vibe. Food was delicious. They don't make pretty on your plate. They make flavorful food and figure you can go to a casino if you want presentation. House wine was good and all you can drink. Nice!

tyHP8qMKCEKjv6CQkRN8hQ.text: We waited nearly an hour to be seated only to wait longer for extremely slow service and mediocre food and terrible house wine. We had good memories of this place from a decade ago. Apparently it's gotten much worse. Overpriced for what we had to eat. There are many other, better choices for Italian food elsewhere in Vegas. We won't be back.

Xwu0ruL0GDcW1oLEkjSZfQ.text: Stumbled into here after a long day of drinking at Wet Republic. Really. Somehow we wandered out of the MGM Grand and walked our way over to here while trying to find a cab.   The garlic bread is delicious and I filled up on it before our main courses even arrived! We ordered the calamari and fried raviolis as our appetizers, which were pretty good. Unfortunately, our main dishes fell short and were at best, mediocre. My least favorite was the baked cannelloni...too meaty and just lacking in flavor. The shrimp scampi came with a generous amount of shrimp. And the chicken parmigiana was just so-so. On the plus side, everything comes in a huge portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. too much food leftover

XBTFnVWltAId2tBzHwwmyQ.text: Not the best Italian food, but pretty decent and the cost covers everything. So even though $20 is a bit high for some spaghetti, it comes with house wine, salad/soup and after dinner coffee/cappaccino/hot chocolate.  Food size is quite large and filling. Flavors have a lot of garlic, which I like, but is not to everyone's taste. Everything tastes good and was cooked well. I think it's better than an Olive Garden and actually has better quality.  Ambiance dark and cozy with a ton of random stuff on the walls. Definitely book reservations if you can. There is not a lot of room to stretch out and the tables are tightly packed in.  We came here the night before the Las Vegas Rock N Roll Marathon for some carb loading. Reservations were key; there was a 3 hour wait when we left at 8 pm.

CEL4wjp9nVrMGimLhY42lg.text: For $25-$30 you get red and white wine, your choice of soup or salad, bread, an entree and a cappuccino at the end. Overall it was an awesome meal for a great value. Would definitely recommend this place to friends and visit again next time I'm in Vegas.

0zltxyrel1K4P5HBsUe-Rw.text: We ate there last night. We ate their last year also. Food and atmosphere was great. But our waiter this time could not have been less interested. It made for a less enjoyable evening this time due to his lack of interest.

UDNKB5EGwTLXCefnHKaKuw.text: i came here a couple of years back and the truth was i wasnt to impressed with the food but what stood out to me was the capuccino. when i came back to vegas on this trip with my bro i made it a point to go back just for the capuccino and it was as good as the first time we also tried there tiramusu which was also very good. so for those 2 items i give them 5 stars but the food brought down the rating alittle bit

YT_rBeyTlwKjI4WxQHTw7A.text: I can't even give this place one star. But need to in order to post. Their Italian salad consist of one tomato, one olive, one slice of salami it only filled the bowl 1/2 way. The garlic bread was soggy. The manicotti was so so and the red sauce was like opening a jar of Prego   And their cappuccino tasted like hot chocolate with a little bit of coffee. Don't waste your time and money on this place.

9NNdRnRvVRKmgZ-DegeG5w.text: Came here for dinner yesterday and I was very impressed! My boss suggested the place- and also suggested we get there right when they open because the place packs up quick. He was definitely right. It was on the dot 5pm and there was a crowd. Menu is simple, prices are fair and the food is so good (especially after food court food from the casinos!). We will definitely be back here on our next trip to Las Vegas. (For dessert I highly suggest the Spumoni ice cream cake!)

EuYHWMrCGHI6snh4WkoEmA.text: Fantastic place to eat! Highly recommend not buying the wine, but drinking the complimentary wine given with every meal. The manicotti is TOP NOTCH and made from scratch there. The clams and linguini is fabulous and generous. The menu is simple and on the wall. There is a little guy who plays an accordion who has been there for decades, you must have him playa a song for you. This place is a guaranteed stop every time my wife and I visit. This is also a celebrity frequented establishment. Very consistent service!

lRocY1vIjAGixBekmqe1QA.text: This place is old-world from everything to it's food, service, entertainment and decor. It's like a mom and pop restaurant with old world cooking and casual dining. And it has a unique menu that has a lot of sides that come with your entree. Every table gets a carafe of red or white wine, I'm told it's unlimited. Then you get a choice of minestrone soup or salad. Each order comes with garlic bread, your choice of a side and cappuccino! That's a lot of stuff!!   I don't remember the prices since I came here over a year ago maybe 2, but even if they were high you get so many other items with your meal. The wine isn't the greatest but it comes bundled with your meal so why not.   They do have an old old man that goes around playing the accordion, it's actually very sweet and comedic at the same time. But I prefer people not to go around soliciting for money and entertainment while I eat.  I ordered the Chicken Parmesan and I believe it was a huge piece of meat. The pasta was just okay, slathered on sauce onto spaghetti noodles. The garlic bread was more just buttered french loaf. Not really a fan of the food. But the cappuccino was yummy and a nice ending to the meal.   This place is definitely a dive but it's kitschy and nice that they try so hard.

64LaHqaTBE8C6f_ORIqOGA.text: old Vegas dining experience, love this place for Italian. had the chicken par and creamed spinach, great as usual. great service, complimentary wine and garlic bread. flying fingers comes by and takes request, played The Tango.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary house wine

PS2pwSaqgzg_zrsCIfw4Qw.text: How can you go wrong with a bottomless carafe of wine and sides of pasta with your pasta?  The service was fantastic, and it wasn't overly crowded: I was able to grab a table immediately.

HmqFkY-lBsRIuVD8eAEBWw.text: Not for vegans or anyone with basic dietary restrictions. All salads pre-plated, and are topped with meat and cheese. Not great food, but my kids were happy and my husband was filled up by his enormous lasagna. I couldn't see ordering a $20 plate of plain spaghetti, so I paid the $15 cover charge and ate off my kids' huge spaghetti plates. My charge included the salad and garlic bread & the capuccino. I was able to request a black coffee instead. The kids ice cream was not tasty. We didn't drink the wine. Decor is super fun and wacky. So old-school. Super crowded.

SxuJM9Juw7Ej2I5gqG-4Hg.text: Dinner here is a must every time I'm in Vegas.  Wine, salad, bread and cappuccino included with dinner? Can't beat it.  I've never had a bad meal or or bad service; it's a great way to spend an evening with friends away from the usual Strip chaos.  The atmosphere is nice and cozy, and the food is just great.  One warning:  the appetizer platter is amazing but about $50 bucks, so don't get too carried away.

U53tfxMvf3uhiWcGm9A_RQ.text: I should have read the yelp reviews first...  I'm surprised at the people who believe this is an authentic Italian restaurant.  I admit, I was pulled in by the sign...I was given the impression that this was an old school italian joint so I thought maybe the food had a chance.  I'd rather go to Olive Garden and that's pretty sad.  Beware of any restaurant that has a bunch of bullshit on their walls and some dancing monkey doing tricks.  It's usually a sure sign that they're trying to distract you from their mediocre food.  This is pretty much standard SYSCO food supply.  I ordered the cioppino, my girlfriend got the veal parm.  The cioppino was acceptable, but still a bit bland.  Not much seafood and like 5 strings of pasta at the bottom.  My girlfriend's veal was very bad.  Had a strange aftertaste that for me, made it fairly inedible.  Everyone mentions the garlic bread.  Sure, it's good, but it's garlic bread.  If you go to an Italian restaurant and your lasting impression was the garlic bread, the restaurant has failed.  I didn't need the accordion guy.  Again with the gimmicks.  I know people think that guy is cute and funny, etc, but personally, I found him very uncomfortable.  He bets on that uncomfortable to you pass him some money so he'll go away.  I felt kind of bad for him.  In a town where selling your soul for the hustle is standard practice, I didn't need it in my face while I'm trying to have a good meal.  I've been eying this place for a while, so I'm glad I got it out of the way but with all the great restaurants in this city, I felt like I wasted an opportunity.

8vl0N0L9Ey89pxXWEexB0Q.text: We have been coming to BHIW for years. Love the portion size, unlimited wine, and especially the atmosphere. Just a great place to experience, especially as a family.

kZsuI_6voN5VzQn8R4WwDw.text: I think the food deserves three stars, but really... unlimited wine?  How could I give it any less than 4 stars? (Disclaimer: Since they do offer unlimited wine here, please keep this in mind as you read this review.  Due to certain reasons, I may have somewhat of a selective memory.)  I've gone here with big groups on trips to Vegas before we go out.  Always make reservations if you have large groups!  The place is huge, but usually pretty crowded.    They have their food menus written on the walls, and they have these meal combinations that include an entree, salad or soup, bread, a hot chocolate type drink, and of course... as much red and white wine as you want!  I believe they range $20-30.  But again I repeat... unlimited wine.  I usually go with the eggplant parmesan, which is delicious.  Cheesy goodness.  Probably a 3.5 star, but gets the job done for a dinner before a night of dancing and drinking.  Other things that friends have ordered just looked okay.  So I know I keep talking about the wine, but what really stands out to me about this place.... is the first time I went here, they gave us two giant to-go cups of wine!  I'm talking Big Gulp size!  That's the Vegas spirit!

FSHEIQB3aXEAsw4AzzPGAw.text: I have been going to Battista's for over 30 years when the owners would come out and see how everything was . They used to serve more food than they do now believe it our not. it used to be soup and salad and a cannelloni before dinner, service was impeccable and the mother made every guest feel special. Now it is a assembly line, I have eaten at Battista's for the last time, the eggplant was tough, cold and not cooked properly and the soup was cold, the last three times I have had dinner their the soup was cold. The music is the same with the accordion player, I remember his first day.  Unfortunately my wife and myself will pass on this restaurant the next time we come to town.

HmWnovBiXwVVIw2G7yKnKg.text: last night i went to dinner at this restaurant...it was one of the worst places i have ever eaten....very overpriced and the portions were very small...i had my little nephew with me and he is only 21 months old and he ate my bothers portion of pasta and my sisterinlaws portion of pasta....these 2 portions that a 21 month old kid ate were supposed to be for 2 adults.....for the prices they charged they should put at least a pound of pasta on the table.....you can by a box of pasta for $1.00....i understand that a restaurant is in business to make money....but come on...give me a break...one pound or box of pasta is not going to effect there bottom line.....needless to say i would never return to this restaurant again or recommend it.....there are so many better places to go to than this hole in the wall.....

Sf_Y1ChGpBBqxiGzK5U8Ww.text: Love! Love! Love! This place. Ambiance is fun with a funky old school feel. Free all you can drink wine, garlic bread, salad and side of pasta included with your meal. Followed by free cappuccino. Gordy the accordion artist tips off the evening. Wish I could give this place 100 stars instead if 5.

Gk2dVk7z3Oj9SBWR0WvrFw.text: I don't understand why anyone would eat here. it's not Italian food. it's American crap that's one step below chef boyardee. if you ate here and like the food you need to come out from the rock you've been living under and try a real restaurant.  to be fair, the garlic bread is yummy

TE62iPw4w_r2l-Hwx7lLvA.text: We've been to Battista's before but it's been a while.  As last night was our friends birthday and she wanted to go there, we figured it would be great to go back. "Aye Carumba", what the heck happened to this place. The place was jam packed with people and took forever to be seated because, unless your whole party is present, they won't seat you even with a reservation.  Once we got seated, it was a quick explanation of the menu and if we needed any time to order.  We ordered our food and "Wham-O", our food was there immediately.  We had Chicken Cacciatore and Veal Parmigiana as our main course.  The chicken was dry and the veal was thin & fatty.  The sauces were thin and seemed watered down.  At the end of our meals, the server, who had the personality of a wet mop, immediately threw down the check without asking if we needed anything else or if we wanted dessert.  It would have been a shame because the Cannoli, which wasn't the best, was the best part of this meal.  We also ordered a side of sausage, which were thin sliced pieces covered in a pasty tomato sauce for $8.50!   Parking sucked!! It was a nightmare to get there, the parking lot is small and they park limos right in front of the entry making it impossible to get by.  We had to park at a nearby hotel and walk to the restaurant. I don't know if the original owners are involved or even care about the place anymore but it SUCKED!!  Obviously, they are only catering to tourists and their past history.  I can't see how locals would keep going there with so many other good Italian restaurants in town. Unfortunately, we will never be back there again.  I'd rather remember the past good times there than the feeling like I just ate at a Furr's Cafeteria!

Kz3pdgQxuTuuKLYjF8Vnfw.text: Bread, and cappuccino were the only good part of this place. Don't go unless you want too squint all night in the dim light, and be served below sub par food. It was extremely over priced for the trash that we were served. Pass

-KBOlzMsZwn40GlZA14CCA.text: The food was pretty good. I ordered the eggplant parm which was good but I like my eggplant done a little bit more but the dish was still very good. My husband ordered the lasagna and it was very good. The dinner comes with your choice of Italian salad or minestrone. The salad was very basic, just lettuce mix, one grape tomato, a piece of salami and a pepperoni. The dressing tasted like just oil and vinegar. The minestrone was good but nothing extraordinary about it. The garlic bread that comes with the meal is wonderful! The waiter brings out a carafe of white and red wine that is included with the meal. The cappuccino was very good as well.   Over all the experience was very good. Great atmosphere, lots of things to look at. Our waiter was so so but he had a assistant that was totally on point with everything.

FU0VcFwg9Z2vphH5ld_M8Q.text: Good price. But everything taste like candy. Way too sweet wine, marinara sauce, and the cappuccino tastes like hot cocoa.

k7XErzE7yW1r9NxwHsIDCw.text: Okay - it's not meant to be fine dining.  It's a Las Vegas landmark and experience. It's fun, it's loud, it's dark and dirty!! What's not to love?  Fresh salad, garlic bread, okay food, free wine and cappuccino for dessert.  Don't count this place out - you may find that you go back every year like we do.  Hint: the cannelloni with a side of creamed spinach is the best thing on the menu.  Every time we go, a little old man plays the accordion. Always loved him!!

h9CjGo3V4XHo3maCYmCglQ.text: Great fun, great atmosphere, free wine. We make a stop here every time we are in Vegas. Never had a bad time. Worried the land was going to be sold for a casino, but everything seems to be ok. Bring extra money for the accordion player. He's priceless. If you are vacationing in Las Vegas make sure your place has a refrigerator, portions are big!

Cy_9gpYGCU6nxUjOhDAG5w.text: So good! My husband and I went Sunday night after a friend of ours who is a frequent traveler to Vegas, recommended it. The service was great! The house wine that comes with the meal was excellent, and the garlic bread that they give you is hands down my favorite bread ever now!! The food was yummy! I got lasagna and my husband got manacotti! Our meal was around $60 which was great for us because it's what we pay at home average, and not Vegas strip price. If we come back to Vegas, that will be definite stop!

OZmgRJx1jV3gPkDPFTdszA.text: We've been in Vegas for a week and this by far was our best meal, the food was amazing. Service was also excellent

Tv87VbmTrCVlGukNUvdAsQ.text: Battista's Hole In the Wall is awesome! Went here for the first time when I was in Vegas for my kickball tourney (WAKApalooza) early October. My teammate is a huge fan and suggested this place to the rest of the team for a big team dinner Saturday night.  It's located right next to the Flamingo Hotel where we were staying, so we were able to walk over. The restaurant is pretty big itself, but the tables are sort of cramped together in small rooms. The decor is awesome. Definitely a friendly, local vibe. Since our party was pretty big (about 14 of us), we had to wait a bit before getting a table. Not a big deal, since we started pre-drinking at the bar. The price range for the meals depends, but all range from $23-40. You get unlimited red or white wine with your meal though, plus all the meals come with Minestrone soup or Italian salad, garlic bread, pasta side & homemade Cappuccino. I ordered the lasagna and it was huge. I probably ate a quarter of it before I got full. I probably wouldn't have been as full if I hadn't filled up on garlic bread, but I couldn't help it - the garlic bread was ah-mazing. The cappuccino was really good too! More of a hot chocolate than coffee to be honest.  Service was good. They were kind enough to split our party in two, to help make the check easier. We even had a gentleman come serenade us with his accordian! I would definitely come back again.

CBRhac9BV5uB-RUgBbUkCQ.text: We loved it here. The meatballs were so good. The garlic bread was delish and the cappuccino was to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uDox1tkRs1S6aKNkDZ2aSw.text: Went here again recently and this place is just awesome. It's like being in Vegas when Vegas was awesome, in the 1950s-60s. Our friends who take us here (who live in Vegas) have a standing Friday night reservation there and they treat them like royalty - the valet saves them a parking spot and they get "their" table every Friday. Awesome staff. "Their" server is a great guy named "Papa".   They got amazingly yummy salmon and we got the special of the night which was steak and shrimp. So good. Comes with garlic bread and amazing salad, and as I mentioned in my previous review, all-you-can-drink wine. Mmm hmm. Yeah.  Just go here. It's so fun.

Xr1FGILuoutf3bvSmcFHpA.text: The dimly-lit, vintage Vegas ambiance lends to the charm of this place. I'd only recommend that you check this place out one time, just to say that you've been there. The casual, kitschy comfortable vibe is really the only saving grace for this place. The food is so sub-par, it makes Olive Garden seem like it was prepared by Chef Mario Batali. I've been here a couple of times and the food is consistently bland and pricey. Bottom line, come if you're looking to grab a couple of drinks (unlimited house white or red wine comes with your meal, along with a generic flavored cappuccino after dinner) and you have really low expectations for cuisine.

dDydxKyUiZgzK9UBWO6bzA.text: One of our favorite spots in Vegas. The basic dishes arent amazing, but the steak Caruso, garlic shrimp scampi, and chicken rio are awesome. And you can't go wrong with unlimited wine and garlic bread. Plus I love the atmosphere - not fake like a lot of vegas.

N_hbGKGYEnR5w6KilBL1tQ.text: Awesome food!  Awesome atmosphere. U get tons of food garlic bread and not to mention unlimited wine for the $30 meal. U also get a dessert Cappuccino at the end. Which is yum! We went here twice on our trip to Vegas because it was So good. No where on the strip Can u get wine and a meal For $30!

isarOo2_kIHFvgO6H3aujQ.text: We recently got married in Las Vegas and we were looking all over for the perfect place to bring our guests.  My fiance saw Bautista's and I told her that I had eaten there before. and it was amazing. Well they did not disappoint.  I believe Kerry was the head server there and the staff was absolutely spectacular!  I couldn't believe how  together they kept everything in spite of the fact that the restaurant was completely packed beyond belief.    Kudos to Bautista's and their professionalism, quality food and environment! Thank you for the wonderful wedding dinner!  Highly recommend Battista's for big parties.  A side note:  The man who played the Italian wedding song on accordion for us at our table, made our experience so lovely.

3rR2GJaNNv5BRqFsNANePg.text: With the infinite nightlife and snazzy restaurants that line the Strip of Las Vegas, Battista's Hole In the Wall may be overlooked at first glance. However, this gem provides a unique, fun atmosphere with a flavor of Italia.  The menu is posted on the walls in large font and contains simple dishes that remain unchanged. Each meal comes with soup or salad, garlic bread, and free wine that is sure to loosen up the group. The meals are fairly priced and the portions will leave you with a satisfied stomach. Every meal also comes with a free cappuccino. From my travels in Italy, their cappuccinos taste more like hot chocolate. But then again, how can you complain when it is included for free?  Along with the generous portions, Battista's charismatic atmosphere really shines through when the accordion player graces you with his charming presence. The experience of Battista's makes any occasion feel special, from date night, to family night, to a night out on the town!

HjNFMkMSG9vGczN--uQTRQ.text: This place is everything if you know what's good for you. The food is good, absolutely, but you really come here for the old Vegas vibe. I would only hope there was a place like this back home. A 20-40 dollar meal gets you a soup or salad, crazy good garlic bread, an Italian entree, unlimited wine throughout your meal, and a cappuccino to finish it off. I LOVE EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE. Thank you to the returning visitors that told us about this place.

_Iup6KNHMvaQ989Q-zqJTQ.text: This is hands down by far the best Italian food I've ever had. I've eaten at many Italian places in my life and nothing can compare to this. I had the chicken Parm and it was delicious!

f4h21XEswWmnahyDmr532g.text: This place was recommended to me by a friend who comes to Vegas frequently, and I was not disappointed. It looks a little shady at first, right next door to a liquor store in a strip mall. But the staff were all very nice, and we were seated right away (at 7 pm on Friday night).   You can't beat the value- there are tiers to the menu, depending on your entree. I got the ziti with pomodoro sauce, which was the lowest tier at $21.95. The pricier options include steak and veal and can go as high as $38.95. Whatever entree you choose, it comes with house wine, garlic bread, soup or salad, and cappuccino.  The garlic bread was delicious and plentiful (we went through two baskets...there were two of us). The salad was great, surprisingly large and had great leafy greens, not just a bag of iceberg dumped into a bowl. My pomodoro sauce wasn't amazing, but it wasn't bad either. The cappuccino WAS amazing. So, so good. My mom who doesn't ever drink coffee/espresso tried a sip and we ended up splitting it.  The real attraction is the ambience and the adorable accordion player, Gordy. He found out we were from Missouri and played the Missouri waltz for us! Very sweet and he gives the place a lot of character.  The food is nothing earth-shattering but it's all tasty and you get SO much for the money. Definitely check it out, if only to be serenaded by Gordy.

zcUOmrDBkQd1azD7aNrzOw.text: Everytime I come to Vegas, I have to go to Battista's Hole in the Wall.    Never disappointed with the meal and the atmosphere.

XWMvta7a7sIhY1k8nmXHdg.text: Solid old-school red-sauce Italian. With a straightforward menu, great service, and an absolutely delightful accordion player, it's definitely worth heading off the Strip. I had the cannelloni. Nice tender meat, good pasta texture and simple but flavorful sauces...tasty. The after-dinner cappuccino was fantastic. No clue what they put in it, but it was deliciously creamy.   Did I mention endless wine? It wasn't the best wine I've ever had, but it certainly wasn't the worst, either.

nNODi7P2bIoKJWWziCI0Jg.text: I would go again, but I wouldn't go out of my way. Everyone should try HITW at least once if you are in Vegas. A bit expensive for what you get, but that's the modern Vegas strategy.  Salad - spring mix salad in a bag, like you get at the grocery, with a little added mozzarella cheese, 1 olive, and 1 tomato, with Italian dressing. It was okay.  Wine - I'm not sure you can call the house wine real wine, more of a win-like-fluid. The best I can say is that it's drinkable, and forgettable. It tastes like it's been watered down but I don't know if that's the case or not.  Garlic bread - The accompanying garlic bread was like that you would get in your grocer's freezer section. Meh.  Entree - We had the mussels in red sauce and enjoyed it. The pasta was perfectly al dente. The tomato sauce is a little spicy and I liked that. It tasted somewhat fresh with whole basil leaves. The mussels were a tad over cooked, but not so much that I didn't enjoy them.   Cappuccino - I don't know what was in my plastic mug, but it sure as hell wasn't cappuccino. Took one sip and it was awful. Very sugary sweet and tasted of chocolate. I'm guessing this is some powder mix in a mug. Yuk.  Service - our waiter existed, but we hardly ever saw him. I would actually say it was poor service. He hardly even spoke and wouldn't even look you in the face. We waited over 20 minutes for him to pick up our payment I gave up and went to the host desk.  Atmosphere - this was the fun part; there is so much to see and read on the walls and ceiling you could be there for years. One small downside was that our tablecloth was freshly stained with the wine-like-fluid.  I would come back again, but set my expectations a little lower. If you come here once, that's probably enough.

DeiEabvpqwI6PK_L3mzdZg.text: Every. Single. Time. I am in Vegas, I go to Battista's.  It is absolutely some of the best food in town.  Recently went with a group of 14 and left even more impressed with Battista's than I already was. Not one mistake, not one complaint. Every single dish was on point.  (Nearly a month later and we're still talking about the garlic bread.) We wanted for absolutely nothing. Anytime anyone needed something, bam! It was already on the table.  It's not a fancy spot, and it isn't going to cost you enough to impress a shallow date, but you'll be treated and fed really well.  Battista's should not be passed up. Ever.

c4OEfZPOYBw6scj7ltoUnA.text: Where do I begin with this review.  First off, I would like to state that the reviews that talk about the portions being small are not True, the wine tasting like grape juice or that it is has been watered down not True and that the food does not taste authentic this is also not True.  When you step into this building you immediately travel to Old Vegas, yes the price is not cheap but it's not over the top either for the overall experience.  Please keep in mind when you dine here, you are truly having an experience, it is such a treat.  You can be serenaded by an older gentleman with an accordion, he played a Disney tune for my children.  Food: Now the food.  We did not have the wine but have on previous visits, it is just your typical cheap wine not bad for all you can drink red and white built into the price.  We had the spaghetti and meatballs, the lasagna, Hubby had the chicken picante and a rather large portion of ravioli off the kids menu.  Hands down the red sauce is authentic and very addicting!  The portions are large, we took food home.  Every meal comes with all you can drink wine or non alcoholic beverage, soup or salad, delicious garlic bread, the main entree and cappuccino to finish.  My kids absolutely love this place, it makes them feel fancy!  Service: Needs a little work, not that they aren't efficient but could definitely be more warm to what they are trying to accomplish.  The Manager was seen walking around helping seat, table touching and greeting guests, this is a plus in my book and very much appreciated.  Now the hostess needs to be addressed.  When I called to make reservations she was a bit rough as well as hard to understand.  Seeing her in person I now see why because she talks with the phone away from her face and is quite gruff, wouldn't hurt for her to smile and thank the patrons.  Really it just seems like she hates her job.  Overall, a must go to in Vegas.  We are locals and will keep going back.  For a Strip Property it is appropriately priced.  We had a Groupon this time around that saved us $30 made the experience even better!  Keep Yelpin Y'All!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After dinner cup of hot goodness...cappuccino.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and Meatballs....the sauce is very authentic reminds me of my time in Italy!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good portion of Lasagna and so full of flavor.

dDJodWY5k4Hqm1d6ae-SHA.text: Honestly I would have never gone to this place had it not been recommended to me by a friend! I had never seen it and I've been to Vegas many times but I'm so glad we tried it out! It's a very different atmosphere than all the restaurants in Vegas (and home). The service was quick and the food was really tasty! They do give you "free" wine which is pretty good too! The salad was so yummy, as well as the ravioli's and meatballs. Also, the cappuccino at the end was a perfect little dessert. As we ate, this older man came and played a love song for us, it was sweet! Great place when you're in the mood for something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the Monorail

pw-cOQePStKKYd1bR45itQ.text: Not sure what kind of restaurant we're walking into. Yes you do you need reservations it fills up fast. The house wine is free. Very good, you can either have red or white or if you cannot decide they let you have both. We had clams and white sauce that was to die for spaghetti and meatballs and I can't member the other one but they were all great comes with salad, bread and when you're all done and you think you're ready to leave they bring out cappuccinos. These were the best I have ever had. It is well worth the time and effort to make it to this restaurant enjoy yourself.

aMASS1jdDDD_EKt5XzPl_Q.text: Wow what a place, sooo much history, we go here usually on birthday events  Wine comes with your meal, the sauce (gravy) is delicious  Had the lasagna and no regrets  It's a definitely a bucket list item

EA5bY8gn4PmpXKXzT8rCeA.text: My girlfriend and i come here frequently and i definitely would recommend this place to anyone. They have the best Italian food in town. We always get great customer service. Free wine and a cappuccino with your order.   Update: Everything had been great as I mentioned in my review five months ago. However, this most recent time was a complete turn of events. Ever since I ate here for the first time, I've spoken highly of this place to dozens of people and have often times brought friends/family to dine with me. Last week, for my birthday, I came with a party of six. I ordered the spaghetti I usually order. To my surprise, they came ridiculously thin. Battista's noodles always had the thick noodles. My parents and I weren't satisfied with the customer service provided by our waitress. At one point, my mom asked a question about her lasagna and the waitress responded with "that's just the way it is" and very abruptly turned the corner without making eye contact to answer a simple question.   Have you ever spoken highly about a significant other just to have them do you dirty and break your heart? Well, I personally haven't BUT if you answered yes to that question, that is how embarrassed I felt when I constantly spoke highly about the restaurant just to be disappointed when I brought my family.   Ps: my girlfriend is reading over my shoulder and she said "don't forgot to mention that my spaghetti was spicy which it never is".

V-QzOPEU95FhKW__Ztxmlw.text: The price is great. Th accordion player is adorable.  Food is good.  I would definitely come back should I be in Vegas!

_Sn6pavxsBP0eaDbHJYruA.text: I honestly don't get the good reviews. I'm a Vegas local and heard some good things about this place so I went to check it out. We ordered some basic things and EVERYTHING tasted like it had been frozen, got freezer burn, and then was reheated in a microwave. Even the desert. Luckily there was wine. Service was okay.

Tn2cav9EBppfZhV0X2zP1Q.text: Wonderful old school, family style Italian restaurant! Amazing ambiance and all you can drink house wine. Reasonably priced and attentive staff. Food was amazing. Definitely a Las Vegas Gem.

TbHbJmAvdps6KbhtAQgCnw.text: To start off I sat at the bar to grab a drink before my table was ready. The bartender did not listen when I ordered because she brought me moscato when I order Tito's and tonic. When seated we got free wine, neither of which was great, which is fine it's free. Then we were given free garlic bread which was amazing. Then we were given salad which was also amazing. I ordered a grilled chicken breasts because I'm not an Italian food fan, but it was also very good with steamed and grilled veggies under it. Then we were given "cappuccinos" after our meals, it was basically hot chocolate and it had no flavor or caffeine. The service was pretty slow and the entire hotel is extremely dark. The real reason I'm rating it so low is because of the bartender and service. As a hospitality student customer service is extremely important to me and we did not have great service.

Ziu4Z26ksHHs4M5C2ky3QA.text: I would never recommend anyone going here for any reason.  Everything is very choreographed and cheaply premeditated here.  The menu is pure trickery.  The waiters talk very firmly and fast because everything is pre-made (cheap) so that you can't ask for substitutions or changes.  The menu is pre-done and very small and you must stick to their script.  This isn't a real restaurant, it's expensive fast food in a restaurant setting.  Pre-made meal comes with choice of pre-made salad or minestrone but we were basically forced to get the salad via peer pressure from the waiter, and a very limited amount of garlic bread.  The house wine is cheap boxed wine that isn't even drinkable, but if you want to drink cheap wine and get an horrific headache the next day be my guest!  They serve the red wine cold if that tells you anything lol.  The website says they have other wine/champagne options but nothing was ever offered or asked of us since that isn't part of their fast talking choreographed routine apparently.  I asked and was reluctantly given their drink menu which is available only by asking, and told the waiter I wanted to order a glass of champagne but needed to look at the menu first.  We tried flagging him down the entire time just to order this 1 simple thing, but he never came and I was finished with my small plate of pasta and then didn't want the drink anymore, so never bothered ordering it.  My friends complained to someone else, but I was over it.  Didn't matter, he never came back.  We also asked for more garlic bread that never arrived.  He remembered to come bring us the check though (with gratuity already included) but never bothered doing his actual job.  They brought us out pre-made (cheap) 'cappuccino' after the meal and anyone who actually knows what cappuccino is would be grossly offended by this sweet cheap pre-made whatever it was with whipped cream on top.  It was so sweet it wasn't even drinkable.  This place is cheap cheap cheap and they charge a hefty amount for what you're actually getting.  They are lucky I was with a large group and the check was given to someone else, because I would have happily deducted the tip the waiter gave himself on our check.  This place is a cheap scam.

fSI9j86I7rfTvTNn-vjk8Q.text: This place is by far one of the best Italian restaurants in the country. It's a must if you are in Vegas. The lasagna was amazing. Meatballs were homemade not frozen. Lots of food for a moderate price. Best part was the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zaVPIjaKPrOKCdB82aPmCw.text: Cost way too much and quantity isn't that big. They charge an extra $13 a person if sharing a meal. Would not recommend!

pGjXDHfTfTLNGSrwl93q7w.text: I like to give out 5 stars when I review a place one because if it's it not a 5 I can just go anywhere else and it's bad I will let you know.  This place deserves the five star for 5 reasons  1) originality  2) great tasting food  3) incredible service my waiter Gerson 4) modest price 5) plenty of food This place is for the whole family, friends, strangers, and any being who wants to feel real nostalgic! Thank you Gerson, Battista's for a great time and leaving a great taste in my mouth!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. There very entertaining entrance! Wait till you see inside!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A complementary craft of wine white or red with your dinner entrée!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3OQ8W7t_waKZvIxYv1qYdw.text: I came here with my long time girlfriend who raved about this place because here parents had been coming here for over 20 years. Naturally I was very excited to eat some spectacular Italian cuisine in the city of sins. Our waiter was extremely rude and told us multiple times to wait when we asked him for help. That is absolutely unacceptable for the price of the food. On top of that, our soup came out cold and our garlic bread was soggy. For our main course we shared linguini and clams which was subpar. The wine sauce had an odd flavor and had what seemed like an endless amount of shell pieces in it. As well as that the noodles were over cooked and mushy. This was one of the worst experiences I've ever had at an "upscale" restaurant. If you want overpriced mediocre Italian food, you're better off with Olive Garden.

R1HT8Jhs9dgxB8x2UcsUxQ.text: Every trip it's a must go. The food is simple but good. If you don't care about going to a "chefs" place- it's simple,casual, reasonable, and good.

_OVFBa0dBnhM0Z805AFrrg.text: This "hole in the wall" is amazing!!!!  We went here on a recommendation of a friend and couldn't have had a better time!! The food was amazing, the atmosphere took you away from the Las Vegas strip.  Prices were amazing for everything you got. Delicious garlic bread, choice of soup or salad (we opted for salad in the 90 degree weather), each table was given a caraff of white and red wine included with your meal, and the most delicious cappuccino for dessert!  Portions were slightly large so I suggest going there hungry because you want to eat everything!!  Would definitely go back again and we passed on the recommendation to everyone we met looking for a great meal at a great price!

cKBJ-4w0OjHOZM8VAT5ojA.text: I'll make this review short and sweet, since there are so many conflicting ones.  For about $35 per person you will be fed well (food quality is ok; like a 3/5 for me), have unlimited wine (the wine tastes crappy but it's alcohol), and warm ambiance (waiters and staff again are just ok).  I'm giving it four stars because all things combined, I think I got what I paid for.  I'd come here with a group of fun/funny and easy going friends that like to drink, but aren't picky about their food and alcohol.

55Zx0aG_hSIv2-LphWudZQ.text: Over rated and ridiculously expensive for what you get. Was hoping the no frills atmosphere would translate into great food. It just matched it and delivered a no frills meal.

NF0y5PkE_KRl5iMgrUmc6A.text: 2nd time I've been here.  Not impressive.   The 'house wine' is a little suspect, the Italian food was pedestrian, and the "cappuccino" at the end was more like hot chocolate.

4fo52Srz2K6408WY73HXwg.text: I have been coming to Las Vegas since the 70's. Last night I finally tried the legendary Battista's! I was very excited to try this long standing icon that has stayed through the years!   I am sad to report that this report is not about the food, which was nothing more than average, but, in the way I was treated!   I brought my two adult sons who are here with me on vacation.  I am a gastric bypass patient who has successfully kept off 185 pounds. When I saw that their menu was all set pricing I politely explained to my boring waitress that I did not drink wine and that I only eat a few mouthfuls late at night, I was rudely told that it was 13.00 to share, no matter what! I literally ate three mouthfuls of the cold soup and one mouthful of my sons lasagna! Now I am far from cheap and was not going to cause a scene, but, Battista's you failed me! I send hundreds of guests to Las Vegas annually. You will not be on my recommendation list. I am disgusted to know your lack of compassion in a persons health battle!!

8ReKhQxE_4KCzEIR3GlRQQ.text: Visit here once just for the experience! Located directly behind the Linq hotel on Linq lane it is one of the oldest and most darling Italian restaurants on the strip!   When you walk in you step right back into time... If you like those kind of places you'll love this, if you prefer newer more modern places you probably won't dig it as much as I did!  The walls are filled with pictures of famous people dining at Battista's over the years. We enjoyed sitting by photos of a young Wayne Newton. The menu is so simple - they have different price points with 5 or 6 entree options in each category and a flat price that includes bread, house wine, soup or salad and cappuccinos.   The service here was the same you would get at a 5 star restaurant I feel. The waitor had helpers who brought out the food and a water boy that kept up with everyone's water and bread.   The house wine was okay nothing great but I did enjoy the red better... for unlimited house wine being included in your meal it's hard to complain about! Plus they were served in the tiny Italian wine glasses that they drink out of from the movies!  The bread was super good! Tons of garlic and just had a lot of flavor I felt like.   Our salads were really good they didn't use too much dressing on the salad which I feel like is the case at most places... nothing was dry and everything was fresh!   I got the lasagna this is one of the largest entree's on the menu, I highly recommend you split this if you do, one person would be charged only $13. Which it's worth it I promise! Tons of ooey gooey cheese but you could still taste the meat sauce within. Just authentic and delicious.  Husband got the spaghetti and meatballs again the serving was huge we both could have had left overs to take back easy. He enjoyed his and said it was flavorful. The meatballs were homemade and not frozen like most places.  My favorite part of the entire thing was probably the cappuccino after reading reviews I thought i'd take one sip and be done nope this was warm and something about the whipped cream it had a pumpkin spice almost taste about it that was to die for!!  This place is a great experience and it's heart warming in my opinion to know these type places still exist even! Tons of history and just pure charming!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad perfect and light

b9Px11p3tnFN8YVFR3evrA.text: Seated on time. Service was excellent and fast. I ordered the clams and linguini. Abundance of clams. Taste excellent. The salad was fresh and chilled the garlic bread we fresh and the wine was good

3Uetv4cmPr0AE-lSwHlImg.text: Love this place and try to get there every time we go to Las Vegas. With a name like Ferrari, i know good Italian when i have it!

5uwcd5nklOKF7Tc5mOBX9g.text: The first thing you need to know about Battista's is that it's not authentic Italian. This place is authentically Vegas Italian. You have waiters that have been working there since before work permits for 6 year olds existed. You don't get to choose a sauce for your starter salad, but you do get to choose your color of wine. That's it. You get accordion music in person. You get cappuccinos after dinner. You do as Battista says. You get fake brick walls and cool chandeliers and a dimly lit thunderdome of Vegas Italian wonderland. You come back and do it all over again because you will.

tCRHgIiwvXIr3UmmDnyeZA.text: Hidden gem in Vegas. The service was great, the atmosphere was amazing. You get red and white wine for dinner, salad or soup, garlic bread, your entree, and a cappuccino at the end. You definitely don't leave hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5tOoIIM41Fc2Q8UixhfMBA.text: Best Italian food in town.  Generous portions.  All dinners include red and White House wine, garlic bread, soup or salad, cappuccino, and amazing Italian food.  If you spilt a plate there in a a charge, but the portions as so big, it's worth it.   Classic atmosphere, great food, good service and just plain fun.  A must!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LCD5wBOy7UUrMbf9S5xMOg.text: My only compliant is they don't do take out!  I was under the weather, craving their spaghetti with meat sauce so my husband dined in and ordered mine - had a few bites and took it back to me.  In other words - u have to eat whatever u want THERE and then take the rest.    I would recommend making reservations.  This place really is amazing, we always go there when we travel to vegas.

Ri6qNytY68X2tNomvsxJbQ.text: Back for another FANTASTIC visit!! Carrie was a SUPER STAR once again-be sure & ask for her as your server Just to show how accommodating they are there, by accident we showed a day early for my B-Day celebration but they still seated us! AMAZING! We will go there every time we are in Vegas!

6SrxcM90chCAuC1OiBhOYQ.text: I was so disappointed with my experience here after seeing so many positive reviews and picking this place for a birthday dinner, I was expecting a great time, but unfortunately for me, Battista's fell short.  To start with, we were a large party and most were there on time for the reservation, but despite that, we were unable to be seated for a further half an hour. It was a little unclear as to whether the tables weren't ready or whether they needed every guest there, but safe to say we were hungry and eager to start ordering when we finally sat.  The restaurant itself is cute with memorabilia and photos on the walls, but very dimly lit and a little cramped. As I'd never been here before, I had no idea that the only menu's offered were the ones on the walls and that you didn't mix and match. Not only that, but we all waited a further 10mins at the table before any server came over to order drinks or explain how things worked!  So the concept is, you order an entree from one of the 3 set prices on the walls ($23/$27/$33) and you get unlimited house wine, soup/salad, pasta side, garlic bread and a cappuccino at the end.   UNLIMITED?! Hmmmm...That's all well and good, however you DON'T really get unlimited wine because you have to call them over and keep asking for refills, you DON'T really get much of the soup/salad, pasta or garlic bread because they never refill or ask if you want anymore, so you have to feel like you're bugging the server to ask for more, and then it's forgotten about until you ask a third time!  The entrees themselves are probably $10-$12 more than what you would pay in a normal restaurant setting to make up for the so-called unlimited sides and drinks, but when you consider how much you are given the chance to consume, it's not value for money in my opinion.  Don't get me wrong, the server was friendly enough when he was at the table, but he seemed a little disorganised and out of his depth with a larger party and as such, we felt a little neglected.  For entree, I went for the meat cannelloni and my partner went for the chicken parmigiana, so I can only comment on those. The cannelloni was a let down as the meat was a mushy bland mess. Thankfully it came with cheese and sauce to add flavour. The parmigiana was nothing special and not worth the money unfortunately.  The one great thing was the cappuccino, which was so delicious and moreish. I happily took my partner's as he couldn't finish it.  At the end, we were told we couldn't split the check, despite other albeit slightly smaller parties near us were splitting theirs. This seemed a bit strange to me seeing as unlike other restaurants, there were only 3 set prices to have to ring up, but despite this inconvenience we got there in the end!  Is this place anything special? No. Is the food great? No. Is it value for money? I don't think so. But maybe see for yourself, meanwhile there are other great Italian restaurants in the valley.

AQhRKGdfOxDhRyjEKIE2Jw.text: Visited Vegas last week for a business trip and my team and I visited Battistas for a dinner together. The decor is completely eccentric and cool and is complete with a very petite man named Gordy playing the accordion if you're lucky. He came right up to our table and played for us while we waited for our food. First came out hot garlic bread and soup or salad (I did the salad). You also get house red & white wine for the table. I did the chicken parm for my entree which was served with creamed spinach. So warm and filling after a long day of traveling.   If you go to Battistas west your stretchy pants!

wbmsEjvJi5y_hrkirYh5LQ.text: Italian Restaurant located on Flamingo & Linq Blvd..... walking distance to Flamingo Hotel and Hilton Grand Vacations.. I heard the food was delicious... can't wait to visit....

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battista&#39;s | Las Vegas Strip
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battista&#39;s | Las Vegas Strip

LsFAhpUKiZ09LGOePXvgNg.text: The absolute best spot for an Italian dinner in Vegas. Battista's is the quintessential dimly lit and very traditional old school restaurant. It's the type of place that used to define Vegas- before celebrity chef eateries took over.   The menu is short and easy to navigate. Your meal comes with either soup or salad, garlic bread and two large carafes of wine, one red and one white. These carafes will be refilled as long as you're up for the task.  I had the veal piccante (piccata) and it was excellent. Came with steamed squash on the side and the sauce was perfectly lemony and laden with capers. The portions were large- and most meals except the pasta dishes come with a full boat of penne with marinara. We didn't leave hungry.  This was my first time here- but it will be the spot I go to anytime I'm in Vegas.

zhZMwVz2mK9sNoTDb2v52Q.text: My wife and I just love this place!  We first visited Battista's on the recommendation of some friends who live in Las Vegas part of the year.  Monday night was only our third visit.  The staff was very attentive to our needs without being interruptive.  The rooms were decorated with items (many of them hanging from the ceiling) which reminded me of household items found on the set of the movie, "The Godfather."  As soon as we entered, our senses were greeted by the aromas coming out of the kitchen.  It was heavenly. My wife ordered lasagna on this trip, but for all three of our visits, I ordered linguini with chopped clams and white sauce.  For our fourth visit I intend to order it again. It's delicious and I can't get it back home. The decor, the atmosphere, the attentive staff, and the outstanding food made my visit to Battista's a 5-star experience.

PTGGjtyUB9r2LWWanp8MFg.text: This place is a family tradition for special events and birthdays-- it has been since the '90's. Last night we celebrated my daughter's 34th birthday and introduced her boyfriend to all that is Batista's. We were especially thrilled to be entertained by Gordy --may he live forever! The food, as anticipated, was super yummy. The service was impeccable. The environment is fun and kitchy. The only thing I can ask for is a better Moscato option in the bar. That's it. Everything else is exactly as it should be.

ZVv_R0PCX2vGijA5gyjj3g.text: 2nd time Visiting this amazing place. It sits just next to The Flamingo, don't let the outside worry you! What's waiting inside is a treat!   This is a True full course meal from Wine on the table-appetizers, soup or salad, entree drinks and a warm rich cup of cappuccino to cap it off!  The Appetizer platter is awesome and they aren't joking when they say it will feed 8-10 people! Cheese sticks, ravioli, even great cooked Italian sausage that will melt in your mouth!   The fettuccine was great! Noodles were perfect and the sauce awesome!   The fella that ventures around playing the accordion for guest is a perfect touch! Great experience that will be on the list for next time back in Sun City!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Appetizer Platter!

3gmRLoUmOjhdRw6KVwnZww.text: VERY GOOD food!!!! Have a limited menu but all really good. Are a bit pricey but worth it. You get a choice of soup or salad , entree and garlic bread. Then at the end they give you a cappuccino for desert. Also they give you a full thing of red and white wine with your meal ( very dry wine). A local spot. Suggest make reservations and it is off the strip, but in walking distance. My favorite was their Shrimp with garlic and butter sauce ( see picture)- very garlicy and GREAT. We went 2 time while in Vegas on vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp with Garlic and Butter Sauce.

V-4VnsAB3AExES6gXD5Sfg.text: Horrible. Sauce is extremely sweet unlike the very rude staff. I ate here before & it was good   This time....yelk.  Busboy was absolutely rude. We barely saw the server  but the food was just awful. Better off at a chain restaurant.

KZv_HUn5MW2mAHrui8QXkQ.text: Please don't make a mistake and miss out on the delectable Italian fare offerred at this classic Italian restaurant near the Strip! Upon walking in, there is a dimly lit classic ambiance with that old school Vegas feeling. There are photographs along the wall of celebrities from back in the day with autographs and the menu of what is offerred on the wall too. I was not used to this and one was given to me by request. Our meals consisted of an appetizing meat lasagna, steak cascara, and ribeye. The entrees included pasta, house red and white wine, and the best cappuccino ever ar the end. We came here to celebrate our grandma's birthday and this dining experience did not disappoint. Next time you are craving Italian, this is the spot to go to!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red and white vino included! OH YEAH!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Cascara nom nom!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic Vegas ambiance!

9YD1kDp72F_XvRLr4UI7Dw.text: Amazing old school Italian! Baristas has a great vibe & makes you feel like you're in a scene out of a gangster movie. Just awesome! Everything was included with dinner, including a red & white wine. Definitely not the best wine I've ever had, but overall an amazing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the menus on the walls. I didn&#39;t even need my glasses to order!;)

uBspDTQQ5o_Qzk8xpVXkJQ.text: I grew up in Las Vegas and have heard about this place for many years. My brother is a huge fan. We had so much hope and expectations. There was an hour wait but it was Saturday so that's expected and we anticipated the food being great so we stuck it out. We were really really disappointed.  Pros: Old school style, big portions, very cool (but busy/tacky) decor, real mob family type motif which was cool. Menu was on the wall and very simple, which is convenient.  Cons: Food. We didn't have a single good dish. Mozz sticks were not hot, and the outside crust was "homemade" but tasted like stale cardboard. The salads were Hurricane Katrina flooded with dressing, I like dressing, but dang the lettuce was floating! The free wine was very watered down, but what do you expect for free? We had Lasagna, one of my favorite dishes at every Italian restaurant, and Ravioli. The sauce is absolutely gross; It tasted like canned tomato paste, and not even the good kind. The sauce was so bad, I only ate about 1/4 of the Lasagna and that was a struggle. The raviolis weren't bad if you scraped off all the tomato paste. A good sauce is like one of the main guarantees you can expect at a good Italian place. For the sauce to be THAT bad, it was just utterly shocking.  We will not be eating here again or giving them another chance. Unless they come out with some sort of press release saying they've completely overhauled their sauce recipe.

um7_UnWehxSixZ67bL4h8g.text: This is one of those real hole in the wall places where you see it and think I wonder if it is any good. Well we have gone here for years! Even when on vacation, not far off the strip just behind flamingo or right across the street from Bally's side of their casino just off flamingo.  I bet back in the day this place was the place to go, you will see  old pictures on the walls.   When seated you will see The menu is posted up on the wall and is pretty straightforward and  easy to understand. Now how neat is that? You get unlimited red or white wine. Plus a house salad or minestrone soup and garlic bread. When you choose your entree there are about 5 different price levels ranging from $22 to $40 ~  example spaghetti and meatballs to a steak.One thing nice if you don't order a pasta dish you get a side of penne with marinara sauce.  You also will get a cup of cappuccino. For the amount of food and drink involved and the quality, it's a pretty good deal for your money. Especially unlimited wine!  Funny story took a friend there and he loves Italian food. Well he also loves wine and loves good Italian bread. He kept drinking and eating tons of bread(The bread is so good!). By the time we were done eating he was so full could barely walk, I think the bread expanded with the wine making him even fuller! He went back to the room and had to lay down for hours!   Over all this place has been here for years that tells you something! If you like Italian food try this place out. Or if you want to see a piece of old classic Vegas which is disappearing go here  And as a added plus a elderly man walks around with the accordion and serenades the tables. He plays some things by request.  Its a nice added touch ~ if you see him make sure to tip.. Overall its a old favorite of ours ~ One of the first restaurants we ate at when we first came to Vegas! Check it out we highly recommend it!  And before going  make reservations just to guarantee to get a seat they get pretty busy sometimes.  I hope this restaurant is here for many more years!!

g7YSeAik7r_b9G1CGXsxPQ.text: This place is really cute. The atmosphere was really cozy and had records and old framed photos everywhere. It's really dark inside though.   I went there for dinner with my friend, his mom, and sister. We're seated almost immediately and greeted by what I think was the busboy?  One thing I thought was strange was that the waiter touched our table a total of maybe two or three times? The busboy or back up waiter consistently came over to check our table to see how we were doing.   When we sat down white and red wine was dropped off.. Bottomless wine? Why not? But it's obviously not the best stuff. I barely touched it. The menus are posted on the wall, and at first glance I thought the prices were a bit high.. Then when the good came the portions were MASSIVE. The food was just okay, nothing outstanding.   For the price you're getting a soup or salad an entree and a dessert drink and bottomless wine while you dine. I guess it's not so bad.

1Kl1Y6f7ryqCPcR_GlgWJg.text: My friends and I got lost on a Thursday night and literally stumbled into this "hole in the wall" at 10pm (they close at 10:30) but everyone from the hostess to waiter was so accommodating, letting us know we weren't rushed.   Even though I'm not a big wine person, I still thought I got my moneys worth from the experience alone. For $25 you get all you can drink red and white wine, a salad, pasta, garlic bread, and a dessert  cappuccino (amazing by the way). Anywhere else on the strip you can spend that on a burger, and a glass of water.  I recommend the fettuccine Alfredo, their sauce is amazing and they even give a bowl of it on the side.  I love this place.

tkQbAZg_myDj-AlhDrViNQ.text: I came here with my girlfriend who grew up in Vegas and told me how much she liked coming here as a child, I live not too far from the restaurant so we made it a date night. I am very picky when it comes to Italian and Mexican food as I am both and was raised on authentic Mexican and Italian food and also lived in Italy and Mexico but I always give new places a shot. So here it goes,   I was very disappointed in the food as well as the lay out of the seating, when they seat you you are basically sitting with the table next to you in like a small room, I didn't get to witness the little hi who goes around playing music but I doubt that would of change my opinion about the place, the food was ok, nothing impressive, I had a steak that I honestly felt like I could of cooked it in my back yard and thrown some sauce on it. You get complimentary house wine but trust me no one is going there for the wine, my girlfriend who loves wine had to have her wine with water after every drink she took ( never seen anyone do that before ) so yeah the wine, not good. The coffee at the end was ok but again no one is going there just for that, I also felt everything was over priced but it makes sense because they really are charging you for their " complimentary " wine and coffee, at the end of the night I was disappointed but was happy I tried it because it's one of those Las Vegas things you have to do, I wouldn't go back or recommend it but if you are one those people who just has to cross it off your things to do in Las Vegas list then go for it.

xOuu7buqtFGTH4JiTZTLrg.text: Not sure what the hype is about $26 for lasagna and $36 for shrimp scampi.. Granted it came with a soup or salad .. But we don't drink so the wine gimmick was wasted on us .. Cute place but I've had better Italian .. At least I tried it

MSJPaHcm8AwztAdY_i-xdw.text: We had dinner here last night. Everything was excellent. Best Italian restaurant I have been to.

uR_U4GuLXLxvr_42HV17XQ.text: I recently had my destination wedding in Las Vegas at the end of May and had about 40 guests fly in from Chicago with my husband and me. Of course we wanted to do something nice as a thank you for everyone, so we decided food would be the best thank you. We also didn't want to go into debt by having dinner at some place on the Strip with 40 people because let's be honest, we could spend a small fortune on drinks alone. Enter Battista's!  On a previous trip to Vegas, I convinced my now husband and another friend to try out Battista's Hole in the Wall. I had heard about this place for years, but never made it there and finally wanted to try it. Yes, it looks a bit sketchy from the outside (I think one of our guests who could see the building from their room in Bally's said, "it looks like a place where the prostitutes hang out"), but it is truly a fine, upstanding business. Live a little people!  Anyway, since we had been to Battista's and really enjoyed the food previously AND you get all the wine INCLUDED with the meal, we decided to have our wedding dinner here. And I will always be happy we did.  There was already a large(er?) group that had reservations at 7pm on that Saturday, but since we were only going to have 40 people they were able to get us in at the same time. We were not all at one table, but in a room with other diners where we basically were sitting in an L-shaped table configuration. I thought it was fun to have other diners in there as well, and I hope they enjoyed some of our speeches/toasts.   Now, the important part - the food. We had one couple that is pretty much on the pulse of everything chic and cool tell us they were so happy that the dinner is at Battista's since it had been recommended several time to them. And for good reason - I thought the food was excellent. I had Eggplant Parm and wish we I could have taken the large portion I had leftover with me. Everyone I spoke to gushed about their food and especially the cappuccino. I don't drink coffee, so I opted out, but those who do said it was the best they ever had.   In addition to the dinners and all the extras that come with them, we asked the servers to bring out dessert plates with assortments of what they had. Sadly, there was no cannoli, but they had tiramisu and spumoni. As mentioned, I'm not a coffee girl so I didn't try to tiramisu, but the spumoni was excellent! And they knew how much to bring out so there was nothing left!  For those of you looking to have a large dinner at Battista's, I believe our total bill was about $1400 all in. That's not bad for 40 people who were somewhat sober when they came and left full and tipsy! We let everyone order whatever they wanted off the menu, so it wasn't like there was a condensed menu to keep the prices down. I highly recommend Battista's Hole in the wall for large and small groups!  PS - the accordion player visited us several times and was such a cute man! It's too bad our group didn't know more of the words to That's Amore!

7EsyzVSNwK1P6FFKuXd7Og.text: Authentic Italian family restaurant making our group from Chicago feel right at home. Really friendly staff, great food and atmosphere. One of the best Eggplant Parmigiana in Vegas.

3H8NAU-VwLbR2nV-wa4U4Q.text: Overrated. Everything was decent except for the main! Soup, salad and wine were pretty  standard, but appreciated as complimentary touches. The garlic bread was probably our favorite part of the whole meal but that may have just been because we were starving. I went for the lasagna whilst hubby opted for the linguine chopped clam. Lasagna was rather tasteless and way too tomato-ey, whist the linguine was extremely salty and just too overpowering on the fish side. Cappuccino - delicious but basically a cup of sugar. Cannot complain about the service. However, I do feel let down after having looked forward to trying the place out following recommendations from friends. Shall not be returning here but glad I tried it.

cx0-liME1tKNpJ2qwMqqdQ.text: Over the years I have easily been here dozens of times. When friends come from out of town, it is frequently a suggestion of mine, and my local friends enjoy it as well.   Four stars? Yes, for the Rigatoni with white clams (on menu as linguine, but I enjoy when the chopped bivalves get inside a tubular pasta, at home I use cavatelli). But yes, the dish is THAT good. Huge portion, well executed with both clams in the shell & chopped. Some pepper flakes & grated cheese = mangia! Also, I leave with a to go box with at least two snacks worth of leftovers.   The atmosphere is loud and lively and every inch the eye can see is covered in some tchotckes. Gordy the adorable accordion player is charming and is as much a fixture as the unlimited red and white carafes of wine and accompanying soup, salad, sides & cappuccino.   Others have enjoyed chicken, veal, steak and various menu options and the fun vibe you can't help but find infectious once you open the wine barrel door into this unassuming strip mall spot (no curb appeal) behind the Flamingo.   No, you're certainly not going for Chateau Margeaux or artisan plated food. Instead, go with a date or a fun group (make reservations because you will wait otherwise)  eat, drink and be merry in this Las Vegas institution.   For birthdays/anniversaries, they bring spumoni with a candle  Trust me on the white clam sauce! Cin don :)

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food, not so much the dude...

eoBC9nqHl4c6uTZ-vL3i1Q.text: So I came here on high recommendation. Food was about right for the atmosphere and reputation. Service was not.  Very impersonal and rushed. I was handed the check before service was even complete.  It wasn't overly busy on my visit.  I will rate the two stars because of the atmosphere and food charm.  But the place needs a reset on focus on experience and less focus on how fast they can turn tables.  Unfortunate, but I won't be back. $30 a person for dinner is a small ask for experience.  Not asking for much, just some decency.

0C8lljSe-_6hhW-Akm0r5g.text: I go here about once a year, and it's great that this place is centrally located on the strip.  It's just a pain in the ass to find parking, but this place never disapoints.  It's a bit pricey, but you get complimentary house wines (white and red), your meal, and after dinner capuccino is included.  Their capuccino is amazing if you like your coffees sweet and filled with cream and sugar.  They top off your capuccino with some whip cream.  You'll see a few accordian players while you there.  Great atmosphere and a great place to take a big group.   Tip: If you can't find parking on their private lot, there is a bunch of parking spaces at Linq's open lot.

uz47joth9_kgmuWBJSzY8A.text: I went to this restaurant based on the yelp reviews here and was disappointed.  Possibly my expectations were too high.. but our experience was not a great as some of the reviews listed.  So overall good service and good food.. Decent old school Italian food. The only service exception was a bus person taking items off the table without asking us if we wanted to take them to go.. and gave us a cappuccino without asking if we wanted it.. we didn't.. so they went to waste.. As for the food, the minestrone soup, pasta and garlic bread were all  just Ok.. I have certainly had better.  The entrees we had were pretty good (Veal Parmesan and Masala) However, the linguine and clams was tasteless.  The worst part is this included "wine" they serve you.. Take my advice and either bring a good bottle or order one.. That was the biggest mistake we made.. the wine is horrible and made us all a bit sick afterwards..

UfFwqZgJFSugNwHZoc3jtA.text: This Italian Restaurant is perfect! If you are in the mood for Italian, this is the place to go.  We had a party of 16 and they seated us all together.  The menus are on the walls so it makes for easy ordering.  The food was good and it fills you up!  The hit of the whole show is that a little old man goes around playing his accordion and you can tell him songs to play.  He knows a lot of songs and is very skilled. I recommended eating here if staying in Vegas it's right behind the Flamingo.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign in the restaurant.

WVgJRj3fDOltjyZwyKPWlQ.text: After hearing about this place for years, we finally gave it a try.  All six of us raved about our food.  The service was outstanding and the wine and after dinner coffee were a great perk.  This will definitely become a Vegas tradition for us.

4hKpWU2BEAcOZXP3_ttqNA.text: If you've been to Olive Garden, you've been here and you probably paid less for the same food and better service.   The only reason I can see people hyping this place up is because they're drunk off the all you can drink red/white wine. I personally am not big on wine so I ate sober...   Salad: It had a rectangular shaped peice of cheese on it and I think a cold cut slice of meat, which i was surprised by as I was asking about vegetarian items just 2 minutes before the salad came out... my mistake, I thought the salad was safe!  Bread: nothing special. Wasn't gross but it wasn't super offensive.   Eggplant Parmigiana: I just have had better. The red sauce was bland and the eggplant was covered in cheese which was overwhelming. There was soooooooo much cheese.  Side of pasta: literally,  a side dish of penne pasta with more bland red sauce on it.   Cappuccino: you know that machine at, like, all gas stations? Then you already know what this tastes like.  Service: not terrible,  but not super friendly or welcoming. Would it hurt to show some personality or ask some nom-invasive questions? Is this your first time here? Would you like to hear some customer favorites? Etc... no one explained the menu or asked us if we wanted anything other than the wine. We had to ask for a drink menu.   Ambiance: really dark version of Buca did Beppo. Really. Dark. Inside.   Overall, the word to describe this place is: meh.

ElLb1oTqYzw2EMd6UWW79A.text: If you have never ate pasta or Italian food on the east coast, you may not know the difference between good Italian and just another restaurant serving pasta.   This place looks like it may have had potential or even may have been good at some point in history. The fact is they over cooked the pasta! In a restaurant thats supposed to be authentic Italian.   The service is good and its reasonable but I dont recommend it. Go Across the street to the Italian place at Bally's. Its actually better.

3HIrWzOu3MY_vHU9QgjJkg.text: Man this place was awesome. It's cliche but sometimes you want to get away from the facade of the strip and enjoy a good family meal and Battista's nailed it. They made substitutions without a hesitation, they were quick and attentive with their service and the food was great. I could come here every week if I didn't live 2000 miles away, I'd weigh a metric ton from all the food but I'd be happy and well taken care of. Bravo! Battista's, BRAVO!

F_BCTdxG25kW30uuuMOv6A.text: Such a wonderful place, with wholesome Italian family values etched in stone or shall I say on the walls.  When I saw the cute menu's and pricing displayed on the walls, I couldn't believe what a wonderful idea was created by saving paper.  When I recieved my complimentry authentic garlic bread and was greeted by an older man by the name of "Gordy" I think he played the accordian and smiled and I felt SO happy and couldn't wait for the next up coming adventure this restaurant had to offer.  I took the first bite into heaven aslo known as the meatballs made with love.  And that was it I was in love. This is were I will eat Italian everytime I go to Vegas.  This is all I need to fill the Italian craving I feel when I visit.

CkmR8YwVZFjvYl8iM48Ing.text: Went here with a couple friends for dinner a little over a week ago.  We were looking to have a filling meal and this night we were willing to splurge on the $$ a little. Long story short, we walked out of there stuffed.  Unlimited house wine and garlic bread was the ticket to walking out fat and happy.   Overall, a great experience.  This place is a must on any trip to Vegas.  It's also nice that it is not on the strip so you avoid the annoying crowds.   The musician making the rounds was a nice touch.

3-VSUPXMZNYeS3FMRWRZ1g.text: Really funky place to have dinner. Fun but totally gaudy. Went here for the first time a few years ago with a big group and had a tremendous time. Went here yesterday with a group and had an average time. I ordered the cannelloni and was not overly impressed. Minestrone and after dinner drinks were great.   Table wine is free, and it tastes that way. But that's part of the fun.   I'd go there again, perhaps they had an off night. Love the accordion player. I think iT was his first day on the job. He was at least 100 years old. Totally a fun tourist evening.

2avyib1U8N4vUpRUpX_PCQ.text: They get three stars for ambiance and service. We have been there four or five times and we just went and the food was awful, the cheese on my veal tasted liked it belonged on something else and no cheese I have EVER tasted. So enjoy the experience, the bread and the cheap wine, but eat before you go.

pJ7HM8_I014FsPWUHCYgxw.text: fun, fun, fun! And tasty food. It's a really great experience for locals and tourists.

Mw2i9vNq7FHZfz20LJHJ4Q.text: Recently went to Battista's what a Great Italian Restaurant... Cool, Dark atmosphere with a whole Romantic Feel... Always served with a Craft of Wine Both Red and White... Great Food Italian Salad to Start with Garlic Bread. For my Entree I got the Cheese Ravioli Very Good Choice and Finish you off with a Cappicino. Will Definitely go back again.

pfnnVgpKz2AvJR7LpASWgw.text: Impossible to find overlooked and tasteless pasta in Las Vegas. Look no further they have it mastered. That plus a 45 minute wait with reservations. Pass on this place.

kYKDoHo7dFa8qS2X76OnFA.text: Terrible.   My spaghetti was overcooked and flavorless, the free wine was like vinegar (but what do u expect of free wine), the cappucino tasted like it came from a vending machine, the service was slow, and the old frail man on the accordian was kind of entertaining and cute until he asked for money.

5_rlU_-VIdiu17as2doR1Q.text: I have been eating since 1984 and i have always loved this place. This place has slipped to posibly the worst restaurant in Vegas. Atmosphere is great service is great however the food is absolutely horribly. Took my whole family here for dinner tonight and now they are all mad at me.

MKPfBstQm47MhiWmN7T7QQ.text: Blandest tasting seafood fettucine I have ever had.  Portions were large but what's the point... Burgundy wine was fine as was salad and garlic bread.
