kLwwcbkxY90xqmMCWWjwig.text: We came here for dinner a few nights ago with family. The decor is fun, and the staff is friendly.  Red and White wine is included with dinner, I can't drink because i'm pregnant, but the family enjoyed it. The man says that the free red wine was good. :)  Also included with dinner is soup or salad, and garlic bread. The garlic bread was good, nice and warm. I really liked the dinner salad, but I had to pick some of the stuff out before I could eat it (no lunch meat or unpasteurized cheese), it was perfectly dressed though. The soup was run of the mill, nothing memorable.  I had spaghetti with meat sauce and a side of italian sausage. It tasted good, not great, but there was barely any sauce on it, and i'm the kind of girl that likes a lot of sauce with her pasta so I can dip bread in it. There was always a different person waiting on the table, never the same person twice, and they didn't come around that often, so I didn't get a chance to ask for more sauce. However, besides that, the staff was very friendly when they did come around, and the guy playing the accordion was adorable.  After dinner everyone gets free cappucino, ( yet another thing i can't have, WTF man, it's a conspiracy!) the family all enjoyed it.  When we go back to Vegas I don't think we'll head back here, overall it was just ok.

PJM3UeqUr_dQUMZ1AaG1Eg.text: Good for the ambiance and experience.  Food just fine, but certainly not great.  Not a wine guy, so the included wine carafes were irrelevant.

OV7VkvBZ_eof37dwtoYuxQ.text: Yes, it's "all-you-can drink."  But $28 for pasta?  Really?  The food is decent at best, atmosphere is cool though.  Personally I'd rather buy a $2 bottle of wine and head to Fazoli's before eating here again.

B0tjZ42D6ovAkH1hn3C-fw.text: Food very good. Service very good. Feels like old Vegas and like you are waiting for a gangster to walk in. Hint: make reservations.

feqF7rGsu5o8WcBFSKx-VQ.text: We love Italian food and we were here 8 years and loved the food so we were coming back for seconds. What happened?!? The place was sold to Ceasar's.  Food was bland and dry. The free wine was obviously cheap. 5 dinners cost $155 with no extras. The help was nice but a little unpolished. The old guy playing accordion will wait after he's done playing at your table until you feel uncomfortable so you give him a tip. We noticed we were the only people in there at 6pm. I wonder why. I do not recommend.

-986F2Jn8MpUSOtAodDVUw.text: To my chagrin I went here for my wedding dinner.   This is cafeteria food. Way overpriced cafeteria food. I wouldn't be so critical but the price warrants any and all criticism.  The free wine is garbage... Though some folks (the folks drinking to get drunk) may not mind. If you buy your vino in a box disregard that last statement.  They had a hack accordian player wandering the room for tips.

2RjaGvWnymiiqyrpq0BlrQ.text: I've been here several times and you can't beat the ambiance. True old school Italian restaurant. Simple menu and good value and fun atmosphere. I love this place and go back as often as possible.  That being said, the food is simple and the taste is also. This is not high dining. Odds are you can make food just as good at home, but then, no atmosphere.  The "free" wine is questionable, but by the third glass what the hell do you care! ;-)  At the end of the meal the deserts are really good but the "cappuccino" really taste like hot chocolate. I must say really good hot chocolate, but not cappuccino.   Great place for a big party dinner.

dHMur1gN0Wjtycq9EpdtGQ.text: Very old school setting, which is nice. Entrees are pricey for the quality and quantity of the dinners. I like this place because it is an easy stroll to and from the flamingo which has very limited dining options. One star for the odd entertainment.

pu90Kyb6SJGhj--zZB3yiw.text: This place treats the patrons as if they're a product in a production line. The food is already prepared and plated (think airline food) and is brought out seconds after ordering. All the food is moved from table to table on carts, and when you order they pull a plate off the cart and serve you. They're simply trying to move as many people through as possible. We thought we'd have a nice, relaxing, long Italian meal with family and friends but after less than 45 minutes the waiter asked if we could leave because they needed the table for another party. Unreal. Half of our party wasn't even finished with their meal. For a bill in excess of $300 we should've at least been afforded the opportunity to order dessert or finish our wine.  It's super expensive. No dish cheaper than $23...and that was for simple spaghetti. The better dishes are $35 and up.  It's designed to push as many patrons through as they can. Unfriendly. Unwelcoming. Expensive. Not Italian. Don't go.

JeZ4Wq7TahBTAI5NrC61bQ.text: HID-DEN GEM!  HID-DEN GEM!  Well, maybe not so hidden since we had to wait about 15 minutes for a table even with a reservation, but this place really does look like a "hole in the wall".  I've been to Vegas several times and had never heard of this place even though it was steps from the strip.  The decor is kind of cheesy, but the service was impeccable and the food was absolutely delicious.  And seriously, all you can drink wine, garlic bread, soup/salad and side of pasta with every entree for under $30??   That's one of the best deals anywhere, let alone Vegas.  I got the sauteed salmon... the fish was really fresh and the sauce on it was delicious.  Tried bites of a lot of my friends pasta dishes.  Absolutely everything I tried was outstanding.  I really wasn't expecting much of the food... I kind of thought this was going to be more of a cool experience than anything else.  I was very pleasantly surprised.  The accordion player was absolutely adorable also.

r0eaQVIjHEM-l0sclY8BTA.text: Eggplant parmigiana was truly 5 stars. Brought my whole east coast Italian family and they all gave it 4.5-5 stars.  Pass on the garlic bread.  ziti side was so so but everything else was wonderful !

v0o-PsOP9hSU-Vst6gmH0g.text: The wine is gross, the food overpowered with Tomatos. Nothing is made from scratch. The only benefit is the dekoration what is adding character of the resturant.

EiHiNA6vcOAbleqL6B2xQw.text: A must stop in Vegas.  The food is very good and comes with a salad and unlimited house wine.  Gordy the according player is entertaining.

ihYAZTUU50dDvLacdonxuQ.text: This place does not disappoint! You get salad or soup with your meal, and an entire kraft of wine! You also get a cappuccino that's amazing!!! The food portions are large! This was recommended by the cab driver and he did not disappoint. Pricing starts around $22

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cm6LwNFhsQltvnV527IW3g.text: It has been at least 8 years since I've been here.  The waiter was pleasant but slow in service and should be more attentive. To get refills on wine or bread, etc, the waiter had to be reminded over and over. Food was just okay, I remember it been much better the last time we were here. Then what was most disappointing was the busboy actually asked us to leave while I was signing the bill. He said there was a time limit on the tables and he could pour the wine in to some cups and we could finish up in the bar area????  Because the restaurant is nostalgic, I like to bring visiting company to the restaurant. Unfortunately I'm crossing this one off the list now. Quality of food has changed and most of all customer service is most disappointing.

uIB895LpNhvY8DAHMJzlUg.text: This is a little "hole in the wall" which makes you feel you are in Italy.  A must place to get good italian food in Vegas.  They even have an accordian player that travels from table to table while you are dining and his is very entertaining.  The price includes salad/soup, entree and cappucino.  And best of all....all the wine you can drink!  Love this place.  Took friends there for first time and they wanted to go back every nite.  Good is plentiful and good.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battistas Hole In The Wall....what a find!

wbsvHN5-Ppm1A7zydM9BvQ.text: Battista's Hole In the Wall, was recommended to me for Italian meal. And I am very glad it was, this place is a throwback to the old Days building, decor and food. This is how Great Italian food is done, I will be coming here for a meal every time I'm in Las Vegas from now on. Excellent time, service was great as well as the food & drinks.

zXOgxcSdmgDO-sqLKDa-rA.text: Pretty cool old school place but I DONT RECOMMEND! We got food poisoning bad from here and couldn't believe the prices. It's pretty cool how wine, bread, soup or salad and a cappuccino is included with your meal but the food was VERY heavy, and the cheapest dinner is $27.  The kids meals are $14 each and your only choices are spaghetti or raviolis. If you go just don't eat the salad, pretty sure that's how we got sick.

GncqopnKDx0N6pUpoBNqOw.text: Another couple, my wife, and I flew into Las Vegas on a Sunday afternoon. We were hungry by dinner time but not excited by the hotel offerings. As a group we decided we wanted Italian food so we did a little online research and Battista's popped up. As we read reviews it looked interesting as something unique with good food. We called for a reservation and they were able to accommodate us. We snaked our way to the restaurant as it is a little off the beaten path plus you just can't walk across some of the streets in Las Vegas.   The restaurant was definitely old school. I saw a Tarzan poster signed by Johnny Weissmuller (the original Tarzan) along with lots of celebrity photos. We arrived at the restaurant and grabbed a drink at the bar while we waited for our table. They made good drinks or we just needed one.   We were then led back to a table and some garlic bread and carafes of red and white wine were set on the table. The waitress informed us the menu was the sign on the wall. There are six different priced sections on it with multiple entrees in each. I ordered Chicken Rio and it was delicious. My wife had Chicken Parmesan which she enjoyed, and our friends had lasagna which they liked. The food was good, not great. The atmosphere was loud and vibrant. This is not an intimate restaurant. There was a gentleman celebrating his birthday at the center table. He kept getting up making toasts to the staff and his family (I'm guessing the wine had taken hold).  He was fun, not obnoxious. The included salads, garlic bread, and cappuccino's at the end were all tasty.   Go have an old time Vegas experience. We did and we had a good time.

jusJgxeO7pzj1AhCq-AMCg.text: The wait for this was incredibly ridiculous, BUT the food it's great, like it was worth the wait, the only they need to work on is the hostess;they need more soft skills.

6EGGbEvrdURhHzWEdO7_Ww.text: Great value for the price--wine included.  Have not seen that many places.  Large portions, average quality Italian fare, but well worth it.  We made our reservations directly and were seated promptly.

EAf8YU651F3xwHhxy25drw.text: Come prepared to eat hearty food and drink cheap wine. This place is authentic. So much so that my mother said the accordion player looked "like he came with the place" and my Aunt Sheila said the red "tasted like communion wine."  Speaking of the accordion player, he looks like a shorter version of Sid Caesar and runs fast as hell when you tip him. He played literally one verse of a song, collected the tips we passed forward, and then bowed out and left. I doubt he knows more than one verse of anything.  "The menu's on the wall" threw off quite a few of us. After some of the older folks got their glasses on we figured out what we were eating. Everything comes with house wine, a salad or minestrone soup, the entree, plus cappuccino at the end. The salad was surprisingly delicious and I ate the entire thing. Entrees were pretty quick and I ate as much of the spaghetti and meat sauce that I could stomach. Boxes were plentiful, plus apparently refrigerators were not and I was the only one staying at Paris and got to take everything back to my room. Hopefully it will be equally delicious tomorrow,

DaY69q3DUkoS4QqXKLOr-A.text: Absolutely phenomenal!! Couldn't say anything better about this place. It's quick, it's easy, it's worth the money and the experience is nothing like I've ever had. You get so much food for the price and the food was honestly so creamy and the best pasta I've ever had. I ate every last bit of it. The ambiance is great and the waiter was fast and friendly. Will definitely come here again.

ao5fWnTXuKF2FBhuHiQcMQ.text: We ate at Battista's after reading all the great reviews. The garlic bread and salad were the only things good about that restaurant. The eggplant parmigiana and lasagna were terrible. The service was great but could not compensate for the horrible food. Take it off your places to eat in Vegas!

AJGtiVkGTBti0tLxVzq5WQ.text: Battista's is always a favorite when we have friends come to town. The atmosphere is unmatched in Las Vegas. With all the little cubby hole seating areas and all the pictures and memorabilia on the walls and ceilings gives the place a feeling like it's a place the mob would have dinner back in the day. We've been to Battista's many times and everything is always delicious. All the house wine you can drink is included as is soup or salad, garlic bread and the most amazing cappuccino. And can't write a review about Battista's without taking about Gordy, his great smile and his accordian! He is amazing and makes an Italian meal at Battista's complete.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordy playing for our table.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EDRSvf759a4RmP0w8GKDqw.text: Phenomenal Experience!  The hubby and I split the lasagna, which is the best we have ever had. The garlic bread was amazing.  Another perk was the complimentary wine and you finish with a cappuccino.   Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4EUpX5bDz4GeFIkjh3l0Mg.text: Wife and I showed up without a reservation @ 8:15 p.m. Battistas's was very busy on this Wednesday night. Signed in prepared to wait (1 hr) , sat @ table in the bar.  "Super"cocktail waitress Kayla took our drink order and served us from the bar menu, our request. Which consisted of Chianti (me), Moscato (wife). She had the Calamari frit appetizer, I had lasagna (best ever). This was as much food as we could handle Along with some garlic bread and salad, we were very full & happy campers. We've gotta get back soon to listen to the roving accordion player, as we dine Italian style.  Battistas food is very good, and reasonable. We also loved the old school vibe.  Viva la Italia & Battista's, molto grazie!

UfWCj6T5LK-d9X4FhkAKQQ.text: In one word.  Fantastic. From start to finish.  I made a reservation for Sunday but thought it was for Saturday.  Hostesses could not have been more accommodating even though they had a 45 minute wait.  They honored our reservation. Food was super fresh, salad perfectly dressed and that garlic bread.  Tasted freshly made, light airy warm Italian bread with butter and garlic.  Extremely reasonable.  Better than a lot of places in Boston's north end which is known for their Italian food.  Will be returning before we leave

KLMvbrNAfFCOpezYSuVRhw.text: Wanting to carbo load before the night on the strip ? Stop here, you will definitely get your carbs for the weekend! The bread was amazing and the portions are massive! The wine was just bad, you get unlimited wine so maybe that's why its so awful? I would just recommend staying away from that.   It was great not having to make a reservation and getting seated fairly quickly. The atmosphere is cool, the staff was all very friendly and the food came out quickly. Don't come here for very authentic 5 star food but if your just looking for decent pasta and great service, you'll enjoy it.

-WRhrO1mbDA-S814_W3URg.text: I have been coming here since 1979. The best italian food ever. The sauce is so good. I usually get the spaghetti with pomodoro sauce or the Ziti. I live in Arizona and they dont have one good italian restaurant. The atmosphere and service is amazing. If i lived in Vegas i would eat here twice a week. The homemade cappuccinos are the best.

csURhuS7qZ8fERb-o5Tkeg.text: The food was pretty good, and the prices seemed decent for Vegas.  I had the soup and the seafood pasta.  The best part was the never ending wine and the to-go cups at the end :)

0U9Lt5y4LWmBQj2gYcNzIA.text: I'm in Vegas for a conference... One of the folks that is here with me recommended Battista's, so we decided to check it out.   The decor is quite something... Lots of history in the place, that's obvious! Supposedly it was a hangout for The Rat Pack, back in the day.   Service was friendly and responsive. Interesting the way they price groups of things together... Enjoyed the free flowing house wine and garlic bread.   I opted for the lasagna w/ meat sauce for my entree... It was very good! I think the meat sauce was a little extra, but well worth it.   The meal was finished off with a cappuccino that was of convenience store machine quality, but not bad.   Far from fine dining... but then again, what do you expect with the name Battista's Hole in the Wall, right?   If ever I'm in Vegas again (on business, no doubt) I'll be back to Battista's.

0RWhZ5b7IjNJ1Zq1Ah1Rzw.text: Definitely a one-of-a-kind place -- atmosphere is campy but fun (lots of autographed pictures), space is unique with tables tucked in all around, table-service staff is authentically friendly and attentive, but the food. . . .  Very much below average.  Pastas were heavy, loaded with meat and cheese, flavors were indistinct.  The complimentary wine is vinegar-y, but the corkage is very reasonable -- we brought 2 bottles and the restaurant charged us $15 total.

yRZ0PgnT22KuPWwEd3fMhQ.text: My family and I ventured in to Battistas last week for dinner, and as with all my other visits to the restaurant over the last 20 years, had a pleasant dining experience.  The food is good and the atmosphere is unique with its days-gone-by feel.  Gordo (I think that's his name), the accordion player, has been there on every visit.  It's probably not the best Italian food in the area, but it's a good break from all the over-the-top casino restaurants that churn the $ around the strip.

dTH9NjFqqLNMHWFF5UbASQ.text: This is a great out of the way place, prices are right and you will have leftovers! Plenty of others have left more detail reviews, so I won't go into much more than to say, you simply have to get there and have a little slice of the "non tourist" Vegas life.

3KnA1OzhjvIdITR2NxvJ0A.text: Told i HAVE to try this place from my cousin, I just wish he had suggested reservations.  Got there Sunday night at 7:00 pm and was told by the hostess 25 minutes, my boyfriend, Rick and I both looked at the time and figured 7:25 wont be bad, so we went into the bar for a cocktail.  The hostess said it might even be sooner so when we were called 15 minutes later we were impressed.   Only to find it wasnt our name and the guy who seats people said "Oh your wayyyyyy down the list"  we went back to the bar area and sipped our cocktails, after 30 minutes they called a party of 3 that came in AFTER us so my boyfriend went up and asked "whats up with that?"  he was told the tables for 3 are different then the tables for 2 so they got to take cuts. REALLY ???    AND she said, you were told it would be 45 minutes for dinner, we both had that deer in the headlights look and said NO we werent, we were told 25 minutes, she said no you werent... I wrote it down,  Let me guess, she is someones daughter or wife that works there because she would not have her job if she wasnt.     We went back to the bar and attempted to order another drink and after sitting there 10 to 15 minutes, we had to get up to get another one.    Paid the bar tab ($45.00 for 2 drinks each) and was finally called to our table (after 55 minutes)  We were seated at a table the size for  6 (what happened to the party of 3? I didnt ask)   Ordered spaghetti and my boyfriend had veal,   Comeone folks - $50 dinner tab for that?   Save your money - we didnt need the attitude, wait nor food at this place, we wont go there again , nor suggest it ...

ukeAMFKEXBj2qcHD3K6G0A.text: The food is pretty average italian, but good.  The all you can drink wine is what makes it worth the price, so I'd pass if you're not planning on drinking.  The old accordian player is pretty sweet as well.

l2KJcVrugJA3GhmoXDQG9Q.text: This wasn't the best Italian food I've ever eaten, but it certainly wasn't the worst.   I had a group of 18 people I had to feed and Battista's was very accommodating. Salad and hot chocolate for dessert was included with our meal. Not to mention the free red and white table wine. For the price, the wine was great. The service was excellent.  My scampi was under seasoned, but the portion was large. I couldn't finish.  Considering that the Rat Pack used to hang there, it was worth going. At least once.

X7j585QYB2YVNfFivXasjw.text: I liked this place a lot. Decent Italian food and for the price, a pretty good deal. The group I was with has the chicken parmesan, spaghetti and meatballs off the kids menu and beef cannelloni. All were good. The inclusive dinner menu includes various pasta and meat dishes, salad or soup, good bread, after dinner coffee and even all you can drink wine. The ambiance was kitchy, casual and fun - looks like this place has a lot of history. This would be a good spot for families and groups. If you're ready for a break from the high prices of the Strip's restaurants (remember when casino eateries tried NOT to be expensive?!), try Battista's out.

ThFTfXzXHI2pfZmDri6LDg.text: I've been to Vegas more than a few times and I've passed this place about the same number of times, never giving it more than a glance. Who knew I would have love everything about this place. The place has been around forever. We were seated quickly and offered drinks just as fast. There are signs through out the restaurant that tell you your meal comes with either a red or white wine, soup or salad and to finish off your meal, a cappuccino. That's all included with the price of your meal. The entrees are also posted on the walls and the selection is plentiful. If your into pasta, they have it. Steak, no problem. It was just a great place to stop and eat. Oh, I forgot to mention the entertainment. There's a little guy. I'm guessing in his 70's who comes by your table and plays an accordion. Great stuff. If your in the area of Bally's, this is one for the bucket list.  I have pictures of the place and the little guy.  When I upload them, I'll post them for all to see.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battista&#39;s Menu ~  7/21/2009.

izLDodmJtzjIz99CTE296Q.text: Sad to report that I was disappointed when going back.  We brought some friends over here after raving about how great of a deal it was and were sadly disappointed.  I didn't remember how expensive it was!  For some reason, I thought it was a lot cheaper... :(  Everyone's food was alright.  Nothing great or out of this world.  But one of our friends got the ziti w/ meatsauce and it tasted like soap!  The server took it back and brought out a new one, but it tasted the same.  We realized it was just a LOT of herbs that they used, but still... majority of the people at the table thought it tasted soapy.  Boo.

sCl6A4WozhDrSvrdVLTTXg.text: This one is for Johnny Vegas! We went here last week for his birthday after I have always wanted to try out. Dark cozy atmosphere with clutter on the walls like Buca. The price along with the food is great especially since any meal come with unlimited wine, a salad/soup, bread and coffee. Might go back next week for my birthday actually!

Kuqt0r8zN5bK7g06ldgVCA.text: My brother in law had his wedding dinner here last weekend and it was a great success. I cannot speak for all the plates of food, but the Lasagna that I had was very very good and very large. It was about $25 for the meal, which included the Lasagna, salad or soup, beverage, hot chocolate drink, and unlimited wine. Not too bad. The food was great. The atmosphere is very quaint and cozy. LOTS of trinkets hanging around the place from the many years it has been there. Lots of famous people pictures on the wall with the original owner. Very nice. The servers were amazingly professional and friendly. Fast service for 30ppl was shocking. Everyone had a great time and the overall experience was perfect.   The only couple of things I can say in a negative light about this joint are as follows,  1. Food was a little expensive even with the unlimited (cheap) wine. 2. We had to wait a litte longer than expected for our table, however we did have 30 ppl, but we did have a reservation so we were expected.  Even with those little issues, I still think the place is a Woohoo! As good as it gets! Place. Enjoy.

Fev7S4cKojT8nazaachfQw.text: We waited almost 2 hours for a table of 6 and it was not worth the wait. Food is overpriced for the quality. (entrees are at least $22) We saw our busser/food runner more often than our waiter who only came to take our order, bring our food and bring the check. He didn't even introduce himself or ask us how the food was.   The bad: You're entire group has to be present and then your wait time starts. It would have been a lot better if the hostess told me that crucial fact when I put my name on the wait list. She quoted us 45 min, that passed, then she said another 20 min, that passed, another 20 min, that passed, 15 min, finally a table. Get a reservation if you really want to try it. Got the pomodoro and the sauce was runny and watered down. My friends got the lasagna which is massive and the eggplant parm which was ok. The white wine tasted watered down, and didn't even smell like wine.  The good: unlimited wine. The red wine was actually ok, it's more sweet than dry. The salad and garlic bread was bomb. The "cappuccino" (it's hot chocolate with a shot of caffeine and whip cream) was good. The portions are big. It's a fun atmosphere (the accordian guy can't really play well but bless his heart he's adorable!) Food service is fast.   Don't think I'm coming back, or recommending this place to friends or guests unless they want the unlimited wine.

qdnQKh6_ejecTBR5vJR75g.text: Oh snap!  This place was fan-freakin'-tastic.    Barely a block off the Strip...but priced like it was out by the airport!  You picked the entree off their extremely small but still varied menu...and it comes with all the red and / or white wine you care to drink...as well as a post-meal cappucino.  It was a tremendous find, and with prices being somewhere in the neighborhood of $20 for most everything on the menu, given all that's included...well, it's a must visit for anyone heading to Vegas who really enjoys good Italian Food, in a real "hole-in-the-wall" feel.  Unfortunately "Gordy" the accordion player was off on the night we went...but I would imagine that he only ads to the awesomeness of Battista's.  Have the Chicken Parmigiana...it was a great deal on a great deal of food.  Enjoy!

tIUvM0bVdHhpPs0RQ-yD8g.text: Food is not good! I am glad that I did not pay for it. I order a linguini with clam. When they bring the salad. I knew that it is not gonna be good. The linguini was dried and fishy. Anybody's home made spaghetti is better than that. Very disappointed. Although it comes with wine and garlic bread. But I  think it should be at the same level of Olive garden.( If that ! ) It is really " A Hole In The Wall ".

MU5uEchZVLCTj7_TpapRYA.text: Despite showing up on Valentine's Day without a reservation, we were seated promptly.  Very cheerful staff and always excellent food!  One of my favorite places to eat in Vegas!!!!   Pricey, but worth it!

VAJSwldfbsx0iWADYNbuzg.text: the best place to go.  I know it's easy and boring but I always get the fettucine alfredo with chicken but it's the best I've had and it's $27 for that, garlic bread, soup or salad and a cappuchino.  oh and you can't forget the bottomless red and white wine that they keep bringing, get the guy that plays the accordion, he's hilarious.  just tip him a few bucks.

yzo6MUCU-RRhSSz0BMbGiA.text: I'm on the fence with this place. I think it's a little overpriced but the idea is pretty cool. All inclusive meals with salad, bread and unlimited wine. They have a limited menu, such as they only have one salad dressing, though. It's not family style either, which you kind of assume it will be, so if you want to split add $10. The service is just fine and if you have a reservation you can be in and out quickly. I would go back at some point but I'd rather try several new places before then.

2aol0TgFNWCxyk1BuAlC3Q.text: The food is just adequate, at least that was the case with my linguini and clams and my partner's veal parm.  The "sauce" with my linguini and clams tasted bland and odd (a little like I imagine dishwater might taste), but the pasta was cooked perfectly and there were tons of chopped clams.  Yes, the cheap wine is free, and if you don't mind it and intend on draining several carafes, go for it.  Gordy the accordian player popped by our table and sang a few bars of something and then was off to work the rest of the patrons.  He is cute as a button, but didn't make up for the merely adequate food.  The cappacino at the end was delicious, but as others have mentioned, tasted like hot chocolate, NOT even a hint of coffee flavor in there.    Soooooo .... Go for the free wine, the friendly service, and all of the eye candy on the walls, but don't expect a stellar meal.

S1uTY-NqAPGMe4K2iGHVcQ.text: Huge portions. Unlimited wine with dinner. Everything was really good with the exception of the spaghetti sauce which was a little too acidity.   Diane in the bar was awesome. Made my wife an orange tic tac.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-XaTE1d6YjOe6bb7LqhLTQ.text: Personally, I loved the food and wine. My son and I got lasagna and ravioli then shared it. There is so much lasagna, it could be shared among 3-4 people. Had an accordion solo by an adorable little man.  All in all, food was good and ambience was so fun. I recommend wholeheartedly.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8i4RNYvYjwLU6anXCOu33g.text: I love to visitor here when I am in town. The only old Vegas left on the strip. Pretty good food. Fun time.

9mfmk6HwnH5HN5fxE166aw.text: Love this place and some of the best Italian food I've ever had and so affordable. Makes me feel like I'm back in Brooklyn... lots of choices and the atmosphere is perfect. See you again soon! Jim and Jazzy

w_vrE3rlQ_Ry5pYJHs2tVw.text: Love  this place, I always back when I in Vegas, the food it's delicious and no to expensive! For less $30 you can it's a salad or soup, plate your choice  and for dessert  delicious cappuccino but the most important the wine  it's included in the price

Dal1ZBTBmTr-p1hKQlLtSA.text: Best place for old school Grandma's Italian food! The wait is worth it. The wine is great! The food is amazing! Simple menu covering the basics of Italian food. Place is really popular so plan to wait when u get there. Belly up to the bar and have a couple drinks and chill! The wait staff knows what they are doing! Leave a big tip because you will be impressed and FULL when you leave.

QPuEaMSPrXR9LFG6d1hvpA.text: Great place to eat large quantities of good food. A unique experience at a reasonable price.

ouMTiqY8nsesBp9PeHYyWA.text: In 2006 we stopped by for a nice dinner while in Las Vegas. I must say it was a different Italian cuisine that we're use to back east. It really wasn't our style. Also a tad dark inside to say the least. When traveling back to Las Vegas in the future we'll check out various other Italian restaurants.

aaq-3UlHf55UfKS3qVf5Ag.text: Atmosphere here is very kitschy. Dark and lots of Italian decor with photos on the walls of those who have visited in the past. Menu divided into a few sections and grouped by price making it easy to decipher. Our waiter was outstanding and very energetic. The free flowing wine was average and the pasta was much like something you could put together with a jar of sauce and box of pasta from the grocery for $3 instead of the $27 or so there. However this is Vegas and you are vacationing in an expensive city. If you are looking for a romantic atmosphere or a place that clearly has a little history, you got it. However, great tasting food can be found elsewhere. (Sorry no photos. It was pretty dark in there.)

4GtAOlgRCEGSo6FDdmKmgg.text: This is a very cool place worth checking out.  It's located behind Linq casino on the corner of Flamingo and Linq road, right beside the Stage Door bar. It's easy to miss this hole in the wall.  I've been several times before yelling and overall pretty happy. Service can be real hit or miss, usually just okay so have to lower my rating. The server today left mid meal and never came back, needed water, didn't put dressing on the side of the salad like asked or come back to check in. Even with that I was still happy because of the decent value and fun atmosphere.  You get lots of tasty bread that comes with butter and garlic. Entrees include either salad or soup but I like to get both. Entrees include wine and also a cappuccino at the end.   The lasagna is just right portion of meat, cheese, noodle ratio and good flavors. Nothings really super amazing but I've been happy overall and like this place a lot.   Service needs work though. It's decent sometimes but the last guy went home without saying anything. Haha  Refills were lacking. The cappuccinos are made bunch at a time and get luke warm.   I'll be back though and hope to update with improvements.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna insides. Ate it all. Just right portion.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Low yellow lighting is relaxing
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor

2CuRsJDfUQpc3Cqhiy6tHg.text: It's nice to know that places like this still exist. It's really a throwback experience and an original one at that. Set aside the food and the menu for a second and you still have a terrific vibe. I haven't seen a live polka with accordion since hector was a pup! I could walk around this place for hours just admiring the photos and history. I imagine that this place has stories that would make the Vegas Stories Hall Of Fame!    We came in with a party of 8 and I think this is THE place for a group. The menu is all inclusive. The price on the board includes a main course, an appetizer, a side salad or soup, dessert and red or white wine. You're not going to leave with an empty stomach! Once your seated and comfortable, I suggest you start looking around. There's local memorabilia from floor to ceiling. It's worth walking around the halls, just to catch a couple "oohs" and "aahs"!    We eventually put in our order and the meal started to unfold course by course. The carafe of wine and garlic bread came first and the table got instantly happy. The bread was warm and delicious and with the red wine flowing, the mood started to really lighten up. The salad came out and we started to nosh even more and talk less. It was a standard Italian salad with big chunks of salami. It tasted great and to have garlic bread with Italian salad is an amazing start to a meal. The bread, salad and wine and company were all part of a joyful experience. This polka guy came by and gave us a happy medley to lift our spirits even higher.    I order the chicken parm and when it arrived it was cooked through with the texture remaining crisply while the cheese and sauce was still sizzling from the oven. The side of pasta was standard with a simple red sauce. I'm really happy with my choice and even happier with the location and the experience we had. I was treated like family by all the wonderful people at Battista's. If you want an original or non cookie cutter meal, this is it! It's truly one of a kind!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More ambiance pics
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passing the wine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot coco

ZUTZweu6I0shgrc4ki3TSQ.text: You have not experienced Las Vegas without going to Battista's Hole In the Wall! Awesome food, warm atmosphere, gracious and friendly staff, and of course....Gordy! Please take time and see our detailed review here: youtu.be/YDiJxmZr7Fg

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Living In Sin crew reviews Battista&#39;s Hole in the Wall Italian Restaurant.

4o93VRgNzvXD9BFjcTd5ig.text: With each and every visit to Las Vegas, my wife and I must go here for dinner great food great price and unlimited Wine!

KVUZJoLoxkL2pLjsrbaE8A.text: It was ok, I had the clams in white sauce which others raved about, needed garlic, my husband had the veal Parmesan it was good, not great, the sauce needed more flavor, again missing garlic for our taste.  The dinner comes with wine, the waiter Derek, left two carafes-one white and one red, drinkable but not good; being from CA wine country we're a bit picky, but we drank it, we have had worse.  The cappuccino was a sweet machine job with whipped cream on top.  Cool place but we will not return.

mjU3nXbtHh1Z9M-ESTJYXQ.text: This little place has been here forever and big-concrete-vegas grew around it, so it's behind the strip under the Linq in a not great area, but whatever. We've all been to little low-ceiling-dark-lit-supposed-to-be-intimate restaurants, right? This place takes it to an extreme. It is SO DARK you need a phone or flashlight to read the menu. It hurt my eyes it was so dark. And then when you're done, you go walk back out and are blinded! I think they keep it dark so you don't see how dirty it is. They do the kitsch-gaudy-stuff-all-over-the-walls-cluttered thing and its all very dusty...which I could only tell by touching it. What's the point of stuff all over the walls and hanging from the ceiling if its so dark you cant even see it?! Now on to the food. It was ok. I'd say one step above olive garden? Here's the problem: your meal 'comes with free' wine and cappuccino. "Free" of course meaning included in the price of your meal...which is exorbitant. Almost $40 for a steak? $30 for a pasta dish? You'd expect it to be huge but no, its average sized. Plus, there's no salad options. The ONLY salad they have is a little cereal bowl sized side salad but there is a $13 minimum per person. So if you're not that hungry or just want a salad, that tiny bowl of lettuce is $13! Because 'it comes with free wine and cappuchino' no its not free! Its bundled! We didn't even drink the wine OR the cappuccino but we're still paying for it because they're included in the price. If you want ok food AND wine (that you dont get to pick out) AND cappuccino AND you have night vision goggles? Then sure, check this place out. Otherwise? Go to a more modern, updated, and well lit restaurant. You'll get more for your money and won't get a headache from eye strain.

UIwatKBSuw8tn7BjSrPX8w.text: This place was okay, we stopped by for dinner. It's a short walk from the flamingo. The meals rang from $22-$40, the price depends on the entree you select. If you are going to try this place out I recommend making a reservation. For the price you get a choice of a salad or Soup, garlic bread, an entree, and a cappuccino. The Italian salad is amazing, I ordered a spaghetti with meatballs and my husband ordered lasagna. Both entrees were okay, the cappuccino served for dessert was pretty good.

1hQhEunVogoAnKyllkq8Zg.text: It's a family tradition to come here! I love Gordy the accordionist!  He can take me out to the ball game and sing me amore! He's awesome!  The cappuccino is another thing that's awesome!  I just wish I could have 10 of those.  It sucks that you have to have a dinner if you don't they charge you $13 on top of what you order so you might as well get the dinner.  Dinner great for me, but my teens that eat like birds are such a waste.  Lasagna has a lot of cheese and meat.. it's great.  Spaghetti is a little dry.. fettuccine a little pasty but great chicken, cacciatore was great (has a bell pepper flavor), soup was good, salad has the spinach/weeds mixture lettuce, bread has lots of Parmesan cheese.  I love it.  Gosh I'm a pig.. yes I had everything cause those damn kids are a waste.

RwC_S6FPwe0RQsrmBer72Q.text: I've been to vegas so many times and have always seen this place and thought it looked not so good. I was so wrong!  Included in your dinner is a carafe of wine, breadsticks, soup/salad, an entree and cappuccino. It was really busy when we came in but the service was still great. We told the server we were in a little bit of a time crunch because of a show and he made sure everything came out to us on time.  The soup and garlic bread were amazing and my favorite part. The red wine was a little sweet for me, but alright. Wish I knew we could have gotten 2 smaller carafes of each wine.   My entree was alright. I had the meatballs and ziti. The pasta was a LITTLE hard, not too bad. The meatballs were pretty good. My boyfriend had the eggplant and loved it.   We will definitely be coming back for the price and service.

w_hmUymcLC9DelTtKeYnhA.text: A throwback in time to an unforgettable era in early LV days when the brat pack ruled.  Charming atmosphere with original decor and entertainment.  The food was delicious and fresh. Exceptional meal at exceptional price!!! Wait staff superb.

D7VLh2RPMG5oX27UeSnHtQ.text: We were going to go here for dinner but decided not to. It is a bit pricey but does come with unlimited wine. Great for me, but my friends don't drink wine. We did get a tiramisu to go and it was delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

DVOz119pz5t26xdaguLTsA.text: This place used to be THE Hole in a wall great find.  Total old school Italian atmosphere.  Food is inexpensive.  The last time I went it was awful. Food, salad, everything was bad.  The place looked dirty as well.  Very disappointed as I used to  go here for years

5lZVfjcWQNeoBEwGr5brfg.text: Battista's Hole is a tourist trap of the highest order: kitschy and overpriced.   Prepare to be accosted by an accordion-wielding septuagenarian -- whose limited oeuvre means you'll suffer through the same tunes several times -- while feasting on mediocre food served by a less-than-attentive waiter.

YKHrRpl_2LBXSOJIX9pX8Q.text: Cool place. Food below average for price. Garlic bread and cappuccinos are the best part. Gordy, the accordion player, makes the place.

tzLfaXW-LogDRXrmN1WUDQ.text: I love this place! Old world Italian food. Try the fettuccini Alfredo. It's one of the best. All you can eat homemade garlic bread, soup or salad, house wine abs cappuccino included with every meal. Plus the cute accordion player is a hoot!

VrEhX814hwXO0XFyeGff-g.text: The food and service was out standing!! I'm a local and will definitely be going back..

OlvZ8yWRB4Et1CYn3Ef2xw.text: Battista's really feels like a hole in the wall since it is a smaller place that feels dingy, with a really nice ambiance and history behind it. All of the entrees come with unlimited wine. I wanted red wine and my boyfriend wanted white wine, so they brought us a carafe of each! They are not stingy with their alcohol or portions. Each entree also comes with salad, bread, and a cappuccino dessert.  Ended up ordering the chicken parmagenia, which came with the creamed spinach, and ended up taking half of it to go due to the generous portions. We have made this place part of our anniversary tradition.

M2_kq_wv9hdTsOH_7RWwxw.text: Great food and great service  you need to go check it out. Free wine too great pictures  on the walk great talking moment

RugzxUP0hd7FgSNGh58NfQ.text: Hole in the wall?  Basically there was a hole in the wall. I went in. They put me in a booth. Ordered lasagna. Not bad expensive. Not Italy lasagna but worth the price. All you can drink red or white wine l, Salad, garlic bread and Lasagna for $25.95. Not bad. Heck I would do it again.

7rEbJgJ1oDem5g5yJFTKkw.text: Honestly- just came here cuz the hubby wanted to. Disappointed Iike I thought I would be. I got the veal piccante. It was rubbery and flavorless. I honestly think they subbed chicken. The nature of veal is that its tender. That's why you order it. Like rubber. The wine is free if you don't care that it's muscadine. I happen to have a great distaste for muscadine. I like the ambiance. That's why they got two stars. Period. Food bad. Wine bad. Ambiance ok.

piC5qwmABpGJuNM8Oj08NQ.text: I went here after I saw a show and it was recommended. Service was alright but the food was extremely bland! So much so that I only ate about half of it, paid and left. I ordered the eggplant parm because I usually like it. While the serving size was good and hot it lacked flavor. I paid around $45 for dinner but didn't even like it. I went somewhere else to eat dinner after that.#disappointed

HZdgov2_JC8rSE4C3LI1vA.text: I'm not one to write a bad review, I usually just don't go back. But I've lived in vegas for 5 years, being from New Jersey I've eaten the best in Jersey and All the 5 boroughs in New York. And believe me between Vegas and Henderson there are some really excellent italian restaurants....I'm 100% italian and in the food business. So I know what food should taste, look, smell like....First off I've passed this joint 100 times...always said one day I'll give it a shot...so the other night I did....my foodie partner and I walk in...first I think wow this joint is gonna be great...just by the ambiance of kinda vintage ol' school Vegas...so I give it and 8 for appearance....not clean or organized at all but that doesn't mean it's gonna be a bad joint...now we sit down and we are given Red wine on the house with little tasting glasses which I loved...thought man this joint is going on my list...ok skip ahead to the menu on the wall...yeah u read that right....there's a huge ass menu on the wall with the normal shit on it...MEATBALLS, SPAGHETTI, CHICKEN PARM, EGGPLANT PARM, u get the idea....ok no big deal this is what this guy offers, ok so be it. Now for the prices? And I ain't cheap by any means, this place is a joke...but we order anyway thinking small menu, high prices he has to use top of the line products...yeah not so much...I order eggplant Parm with a side of Meatballs...my buddy ordered chicken rio, ok so now the garlic bread comes along with my complimentary salad and his soup, he said the soup was average and my salad was good, crispy romaine sliced Mozzarella not fresh but restaurant depot or Sysco crap...ok no big deal...now 7 min after ordering our food comes out...yes i time the order to the time I'm served....RED Flag...right away...no way that's cooked to order...it came out my gravy tasted like pure sugar and dark...which means he uses a shit tomato and that gravy has been cooking all day down to a thick transmission fluid like state...and full of oil..the Meatballs were hard as rocks, means he only uses a shit beef in them and then bakes them off which is ok if u use the right mix...they where dead to me not soft and firm like a good Meatball should be and tasteless no garlic or fresh Grated Parm Regg in them just BLAH...my eggplant itself was ok...but the gravy ruined the taste for me...my buddies chicken rio was dry and bland and fell apart which means it was made earlier in the day and sat in a cold drawer and just put in a pan with that cream sauce over rottini macaroni.....awful to serve that shit....take pride in your food... Now we decided to order a slice of taramisu ok store bought shit or made last Monday it was sour and smelt like what ever fridge it was in....and the complimentary "cappuccino " was that Swiss miss hot chocolate and cappuccino mix...with a shit load of whip cream on it..actually best part of the meal....this joint sucks...this ain't italian food....save yourself the trip....will I be back....only against my will....sorry guys if u read this...take some pride in your food and taste it before it leaves the kitchen.

hmeDh21MDOfwwNECnbMGhw.text: The food was below average, dry, salty and tough.  Our server was even worse, she didn't like the way someone looked at our table so she chose to have an attitude and ignore us.  The table next to was us seated 15 minutes after we arrived but had there order taken and food delivered before us.  No one in our party of 4 finished even 1/3 of there dinner nor did we ask to take it home it was so bad.  We will not be here again, we don't understand the good reviews.

vsVnJxIy0bfYer2ccLh8Xg.text: The food is just 'meh'. The sauce is way to sweet. The ambiance is nice. And the prices are good. But I won't be coming back here.   If you're from NY (like I am) and saw these good reviews you're going to question it when you're here. Steer Clear fellow New Yorkers. We know good Italian, and Battistas is not b

reogVzrcWwR1X-6glZkpyw.text: I love the Hole-in-the-wall.  It is a go to dinner joint for me every trip to Vegas!  Consistently great food and at a good value when you throw in the salad, garlic bread and house wine!  The accordion player is an iconic figure in Vegas in my eyes.

CljbxsxxXeQVaemhLxyclg.text: Dinner for two on a Saturday night with a wait time of only 20mins. Not bad was able to grab a beer at the bar while we waited for our food. Girlfriend treated me to dinner as she has been there before. This was my first time and it was absolutely amazing. Every dish from the house salad and bread sticks which we got a couple of refills for! Steak was amazing and the free house wines were excellent! Such a great atmosphere and eatery! This is a must stop when in vegas! Being a local we will be back again in no time!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dinner time!!

LuC0o1NOmJ1QrN3NA2Qizg.text: Ok so the inside looks like it could be your creepy aunts 1950's house---and when I say kitchy I mean that there are tons of tchotckes!  When I heard there was unlimited wine how could I pass up at least trying this place.  The service was very tentative and efficient.  Food wasn't too bad---there is just a lot of it--which depending on your appetite can be a good or a bad thing.  All dinners come with the unlimited house red and white wine, soup or salad, a side of pasta, and a cappuccino at the end of your meal.    Hubby had the steak pizziola and I had the chicken rio---both were pretty tasty.  The garlic bread nothing to get excited over.  The cappuccino that came after dinner had fluffy whipped cream on top and was delightful. Ample parking in the parking lot.  My experience was pretty good.  Probably a fun place to eat with a big group.

WUF7jLgNvmBMbNcbbpNebA.text: I went here because I heard it's famous and been around forever. I was not overly happy with my meal though. I ordered their famous meatballs and spaghetti. The food came out at most 5 minutes after i ordered it, which tells me it was not prepared freshly for me, but rather was either made en mass or sitting around. The spaghetti was sticky and old tasting. The meatballs were good. The same for the Salad, it came right after I ordered it, and it was a good salad but again, not fresh. I could tell by how the lettuce was wilting in the Salad dressing that it had been around for a while. Somewhat pricey for in fresh food too...

XbbP7UV-7mZtiKy5attESw.text: Great atmosphere! The food prices are a little off-putting, but it's definitely enough food to share with someone else (upcharge for sharing though). BUT, the atmosphere totally makes up for it with the unlimited wine and garlic bread, as well as Gordie's famous accordion playing (he played The Notre Dame fight song for us Irish fans). Got the Fettuccine Seafood Sauce and it was fantastic, and the after dinner cappuccinos hit the spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine Seafood Sauce- delicious, get it!

F8nv_mlmIkigvOoBFyMV8g.text: I NEED MORE ACCORDION!  I also need more wine too!!!  Yes if you are looking for that in Vegas, then you will find both here. And honestly we do need more of thesr things in the shadow of Sin City to have a good time.   The name here is cute but it is not really a whole in the wall.  It's not a dive restaurant. It just happens to be a restaurant off the strip and hidden behind the Flamingo Hilton/Barbary Coast Casinos.   You will find a wait here. In fact, make a reservation if you can.  This place is simple.  Order a meal and for a fixed price you get salad, main course, cappuccino and all you can drink wine. It is a deal.   I've had many memorable dinners here.  One of my favorites was with my wife, who happened to be my girlfriend at the time. We had a great meal and the carafe's of wine were flying off the table. Honestly by the time we left here, I'm not even sure we ate food. That was the wine talking. Long story short we ended up at the Bellagio with a private concert with Wyclef John. I am going to give Battista's and there bottomless wine the credit here. We must have looked like a fun couple standing in front of the dancing waters.  My words of advice...fun things happen to people having fun!  Okay back to Battista's...the food is not going to win any awards.  It is just basic old school Vegas Italian. If your looking for a 5 star reality show winner chef experience then go somewhere else. This place is about having fun.   I've also had a few work dinners here too and we've had some great times. I attribute that to the wine again. The wine sitting on the table is hard for anyone to resist it. So people who normally don't drink will pour themselves a few wines and why not because its on the house.   I want to mention the accordion player because it is big part of this place.  He is so cute but all he wants is that dollar or two.  He walks from table to table working the whole room. He probably makes a $100,000 per year. I remember once he walked up to our table.  Asked me, "Where you from kid?". I said, "Chicago". And he jumped in and started playing the song, Chicago by Sinatra.  And when he finished the song he threw out his hand like gimme 5 but he didn't want my hand slapping his unless there was a green bill in it.  This is a novelty here and I think it keeps people coming back for more.   So if your looking for something different from the usual Vegas Strip drama, then I highly recommend you check this place out. It is a fun time and if your not having fun, then have some more wine!

x3nzfz4slj2mj9jpojRAYQ.text: This is a must when you're in Vegas. Great atmosphere and our meal was fantastic. The salad, garlic toast, lasagna and the cappuccino at the end of the meal were all wonderful. The all you can drink wine was a great bonus too. Thank you Brittney for the great service!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GSkyWbtMTYv3BWSMt8wQzA.text: We are locals and had some family in town. We took them to Battista's and our guests haven't stopped talking about it. The food was AMAZING!!!! The chef personally came out to go over the menu and even checked on us afterwards. The staff was friendly and so helpful! Definitely made a lasting impression on us. Amazing!!!!! Thank you!!!!!!

Sjj9qKU8mq-lPPtLagayvQ.text: My husband, daughter & I were discriminated by a man named Ariel aka Papa since we were hispanic because he came to our table to take our order whenever he felt like it didn't bother telling us the daily specials or came to our table to see if we needed anything  & if it wasn't for the guy who was getting the tables ready for the next customers we would of never gotten our salads or soup. Ariel aka  Papa came up to every table & gave them excellent service & made sure had everything they needed. We were discriminated by an Argentina Man who spoke Spanish & we left him no tip for the shitty service he gave us. The manager was nice gave us cappuccinos to go & ice cream for our daughter.

fmMs0JvQef7d9-8Sqt8KEg.text: Service was great! Had reservations for 5 PM but half of our group was a little late so they accommodated us. They sat us down right away, unlimited wine was amazing!! I ordered the chicken alfredo and it was so delicious including their garlic bread.... omg to die for! Their cappuccino for desert was so good definitely recommend this place in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo &amp; unlimited wine . YUM!

4mvhHnr7AVdRW_8Wlzukpw.text: This restaurant is amazing! I went with friends and we had a great experience and the food tasted awesome. Service was very nice and the man playing the accordion at the end of our meal went perfect with our free cappuccinos! I highly recommend people to try this place out the food is delicious.

m7JIJSiy3h7Ae5GeIrPRMQ.text: Exelent service Goood food good wine. Price is not too bad just right Will come here again!!! Good service too!!!! GREAT WILL RECOMMEND

b19G-wectTSfSXVEU4yo7w.text: Walked back in time when we entered this place. Obviously it was the go-to place back in its heyday. Nostalgia galore with prominent and proud photos of many of the stars through the years.   I'm not sure you're really coming here for the food but it's all in all decent and not too hard on the pocketbook for a night out in Vegas.   We had Chicken Rio, lasagna and cannelloni. No one could finish our meals. The table wine that comes with your meal isn't 90point wine but decent enough with dinner.

SLRae1_8F_Cp8UwEmpJTJg.text: This is definitely a fun little spot for a mom and pop feel Italian restaurant. Located (basically) underneath the High Roller next to the LINQ, it's rather easy to get to for locals and visitors alike. It is a very quick Lyft from the strip, and for locals they have their own private lot. The lot is FREE. This is of course now rare when dining on the Strip (so it is HIGHLY appreciated).   Battista's is always busy, so you should absolutely make a reservation prior to arriving. Especially if you plan to visit on a weekend, or when there is a large event in town (so basically always). You can make a reservation directly on their website, and they'll email confirmation of your reserved time, very convenient.   Note that they do not split checks here, so if you plan to bring a group, either all bring cash to pay, or know one person will need to pay the tab and be paid back by the group (my personal friend circle uses Venmo and it works wonders).   When you arrive, you will walk through a mini corridor and into a mood lit place that is much larger than it appears. The hostess stand will be right in front of you with the small bar area to your left (you can sit here and order apps, but you must be seated to have dinner). We always sit here first and order drinks while we wait to be seated. It works well. Once your table is ready they will announce it over the speaker and lead you to your table. Once seated, they'll direct you to the walls to see their menu and specials. Its pretty much everywhere so no matter where you sit you'll be able to have a view of the menu. ALL of their dinners come with soup or salad, bread, and for dessert a cappuccino! So fun! The food itself is definitely above average. Not the best Italian I ever had, but still delicious and the servers are always friendly and quick. Did I mention the meals also included unlimited house wine??? You read that right, free red AND white house wine with dinner. Is it the best wine ever? Yes, because it's free wine!   Overall a fun little place to take the family and enjoy some good Italian food.

nuXJVKME9jbbNxCTPp6rAA.text: I came here with high expectations and left very disappointed. I brought my best friend to Battista's for her birthday. As soon as we were sat we were left at the table for about 15 minutes, one of the waiters came over and dropped off the free wine, and 2 glasses of water, never asked if we wanted anything else to drink. Never really welcomed us to the restaurant. Another waiter came over and let us know that the menu was on the wall, basically a wall menu for the whole room. There are no descriptions of the food in said menu. Once we were served our dinner we were only checked on once, we were never asked if we wanted dessert, they just brought us the free cappuccino and the check. Mind you I had let them know it was my best friends birthday. The food was ok, the service was bad, every different waiter that came to our table seemed miserable. I myself am a server so I don't like to complain, I try to be understanding if the place is busy. But our whole section which consisted of about 5 tables seemed to get the same service. I was very disappointed and apologized to my friend.  I won't be back.

YyFEwtt9Z2D3vRBTPYP1-g.text: Decided to check out Battista's after a friend recommended it and we had a great date night here. It is your standard Italian fare and the food was good, I would put it on par with Maggiano's or Bucca. The restaurant is dark - great for a date night - and there is an adorable old man who comes around with his accordion and sings (for tips of course). The wine is included with your meal - your choice of red or white - and the biggest point being it is unlimited which I think may be their claim to fame? Our service was good and overall we had a nice time here - I think it is definitely one of those places you just have to try at least once if you are in Vegas.

ABYyqivBoJyRUsZA7lsWmA.text: This used to be my favorite italian restaurant in Las Vegas.  "Used to be" are the key words!   First off we had to wait for a table for 30 minutes in a half empty restaurant!   What's that about? Some sort of marketing ploy to make people think they were doing better then they are?  They winded up giving us a tiny booth in the back of the place in a dark corner where we could not even read the menu! Super depressing.  Now, Let's start with the food.   First off, the bread. YUCK! The place used to give you really good italian bread and now you get cheap supermarket italian bread that is called "garlic bread. It's looks to be greased up with cheap margarine and topped with way too much parmesan cheese to disguise the cheapness of the bread! We had to send it back! It was gross! As the saying goes, you can always tell a meal by the bread!  The next course was the salad. It looked and tasted like it had been sitting for a week. The lettuce was all wilted and brown and they tried to disguise it with extra croutons and (again) that same parmesan cheese. It was one of the worse salads I have had in my life!  For the main course I had eggplant parmesan!  It looked and tasted like 3 day old fried eggplant, and was chewy and flavorless. I wonder if it was fried in canola oil, which is a GMO. That would explain why it tasted so bad!   My partner had the chicken parm. It was barely cooked and tasted like cheap fake plastic chicken that you would get in some fast food joint. Definitely not quality food.  We left most of our dinner, paid the $75 bill and walked out.   It had to be the worse meal we both ever had! And will never return!    When we got home we both got so sick from the little that we did eat. We believe it may have been food poisoning or way too many GMO's being used in the cheap food!    The place is not the same!  Something happened to it! Maybe new management, maybe new ownership! They are cutting corners big time! And in the end, it will be this restaurant's demise!  It's a darn shame, because this place is part of Las Vegas nostalgia. They just want to be a tourist trap now. Forget the locals! They want to get them in and don't care if they come back! Well guess what, not on my dime!

tc96gL92Q-wSYdnCTWyx-Q.text: Perhaps the WORST "Italian" restaurant in which I've ever eaten. * Dark and noisy. * Ridiculously expensive - the cheapest dish was in the neighborhood of $30 AND there's something like a $15 fee for sharing * Portions are small * Food is tasteless and uninspiring * "Wine" that was probably watered down - we joked that it was either a) old grape juice that had fermented slightly, or b) colored water that they showed a picture of a wine bottle to and told it "you're not the wine they want...you're the wine they need"  On the + side: * the little dude wandering around and playing accordion was hilarious. * the bread was good  Never going back there again.  This is a hole in the wall that should be spackled over, sanded, painted, and then set on fire to collect the insurance money.  Because that kind of thing NEVER happens in Italian restaurants.

5W8AbaVwQvaICWTXGSV1xg.text: This place is FREAKING AMAZING! Why it only has 3 1/2 stars, I don't know why! First off, they give 2 carafes of house wine. The meals are very big and filling! The Steak Pizzaiola! Holy crap! After dinner they give you a Cappuccino that is outstanding! I come to Vegas once a year and WILL COME HERE AGAIN!

0pLakHCi1TGEonxcBIQ1kQ.text: Yummo!  Wine on the table upon arriving, a fun and casual atmosphere.  Great salad, soup and entrees.  We had chicken parm and lasagna-- excellent choices!!  We also noted that it was my fiance's birthday on the reservation, and without further prompting, they brought out a birthday brownie and sang him happy birthday!   Great service, great food and great ambiance!

FNCjKtJJ7kAV9engrydoYw.text: Battista's has got da coldest damn water you will ever have, and I have had water at quite a few restaurants. 5 stars. Yeet.

ZNJJ9lyCy_PB8B2BGrc75g.text: This place is pretty good. I went here the 19th. I recommend the ravioli. We ordered a side of meatballs which I didn't care for. The menu is on the wall. If you want to split a plate, be prepared to pay a $14 up-charge. They start you off with either soup or salad and you end the meal with a cuppachino (sp?) which was pretty good. The waitstaff were not overly friendly and a little snippy. It also comes with red and white wine which no one in our party of 4 cared for.

_i8AaUAgaactMPwKbghEsw.text: Have been to this place many times in the past and it was wonderful. This time we took ten people and it was the worst restaurant I've ever ate at in my life. But sauce was burnt and the veal parmesan  was as thin as cardboard and as hard as a brick. Everyone at our table was very unhappy with their meal. The service was horrible. The only thing that was good was the garlic bread and minestrone soup. Would not recommend this to anyone and will never go back. Oh, the accordion player was awesome.

PkmbJcYMgopmF2zFAEm6ag.text: I took my dad here for his birthday, along with my whole family. We had a large group and were able to make reservations with no wait time when we got there. It's a cute little restaurant that is hidden unless you know what you're looking for. The unlimited wine with your meal is great. Prices aren't too bad, considering you get a meal with wine. The food was good. They don't have a whole lot of options, but they have something for everyone. We had people at the table who were vegetarians, who don't eat red sauce and some who will eat anything and all left happy. I love the little old accordion player that comes around. He played a song for his birthday.

0WHlU42xv76pwqNBPk0VAg.text: short and sweet... food was ok but i wouldn't go back and honestly, i didn't eat the leftovers... the service was not great, maybe because it was late? glad i tried it once...

hkHNasOfPh3f2HLy_ZaEWA.text: We ate here when we were in Vegas. Great meal! There was soooooo much food and it was all delicious! We just suggested it to our son and he and his friends loved it!! Unlimited wine and great Italian food is a winning recipe. We loved the memorabilia on the walls. Service was fantastic - very old school. I'd recommend it for those looking for traditional Italian in a bygone Vegas era.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P4H9d09QkHEenuHZ5_ReAw.text: I would never call this "haute cuisine", but if you want a slice of old Vegas, some fun seniors who know how to drink and some good red sauce, then shut up and go to Battista's. I have been there many time over the last XX years (too many), and it's always the same and that's part of the charm and why I will always feel at home. And that's a good feeling in Vegas sometimes.  The cocktails are good, skip the complimentary wine. It'll give you a headache but it works for an expense account and hey, it's part of the deal. We always like to sit in the bar area for at least 30 minutes just to calm down, chat up some old folks and take in the show. It's dark and clubby, TV's on the wall, really old cracked Naugahyde stools and Formica bar tables. No upscale design elements, thank you very much.  The menu is on blackboards all around. Just get what you like and maybe add a meatball. I always get Eggplant Parm and a side of two meatballs. You get pasta included and the iceberg lettuce salad or minestrone. Right? You're with me now, I feel it. I think the gravy/sauce is right on, slightly sweet, tomato-y, thick and rich. Of course the Parmesan cheese is in a little shaker along side the red pepper flakes.  Veal is good, lasagna is wonderful and since I always get the same thing, I can only go by what my colleagues tell me. I think you can get garlic bread instead of the "white Italian loaf" that comes with the meal.  If you are a little tired of how hard Vegas tries to be au courant, then relax and go to the Hole in the Wall. Then take a long walk back to your hotel or casino and enjoy the sights with a full belly and a happy countenance!

sDkRSeQxLlkz2EuPXg768g.text: Wow first time dining here, place has the look and feel of an old Italian restaurant located in Chicago, food was plentiful! Don't let the price on the menus (located on the Wall) scare you.. you get a lot for your $$$ wine, breads, soup, and best of all a cuppuccino !!! Great finish!!  A must try if your in Vegas!!!

0yByPP3QURu12C_M7vCMpQ.text: We thoroughly enjoyed Battista's. From the atmosphere, to the food, to the adorable gentleman playing the accordion, it is a fun, reasonably priced unique experience off the craziness of the strip.  We loved the eggplant parmigiana and lasagna, both in generous servings, and the included bread and soup were tasty as well. The did I mention the included wine? The cappuccino was so amazing, we almost went back later for another cup! We will definitely be returning to Battista's on our next Vegas trip.

atHHrPi-zI4e6nmWNa9aDQ.text: Eat at own risk Food was horrible, how dare they call themselves one of the best Italian restaurants in las vegas, olive garden blows this restaurant away. Not only did my family return all of our meals because the sauce was sour and over seasoned but nothing was fresh or hot, they still had the audacity to charge us for sir charge which was 14 dollars a person. So unless you enjoy being served disgusting food and go to a restaurant that suits its name, eat at your own risk.

2D83d4mSZd9bDwkeFZh_4Q.text: I seriously look forward to going to Vegas so I can eat here.  Battista's is a no-nonsense joint. Here's your wine (all-you-can-drink), "You want soup or salad?", here's your bread, order off the menu that's on the wall, and you get cappuccino that tastes suspiciously like ovaltine at the end. Perfect before a night of drinking and dabauchery.  Restaurant can get pretty busy (30-45 minute wait), but no prob, just pop on over to Stage Door next door for a quick drink. Mamasan (the best bartender ever) gave us a $10 off coupon. Thanks!  I'm notorious for eating off if everyone's plate, and it's all good. I notoriously avoid carbs in California, but savor the garlic bread here. Comfort food at its finest. I almost always get the chicken Parmesan and it's seriously better every time I order it. Oh, and the portions are HUGE. Come hungry AND thirsty!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All you can drink Red and White House Wine!

5zMdiqM4Qrh76f0KwOAzkA.text: Garlic read had weird texture. I usually LOVE garlic bread, but this was just not good. The menu says NOTHING about the dish, just the name. You have to ask. What the heck is a chicken rio? I was not born knowing this. $13 split plate charge. Super dark to hide the dirt.

386uXcTV9kxqHXGL9wKbcA.text: Some people recommended this place and I get why because the food is decent and comparatively in Vegas this place is pretty cheap.  It also has included unlimited garlic bread, soup or salad, and unlimited wine.  My wife and I are not big eaters so it made sense for us to split as we often do.  It's not a matter of being cheap its quantity.  This is why I am so-so on this place because the food was ok in my opinion.  My wife thought it was good.  We got the eggplant parmigiana.  It was done nicely but it is baked not fried.  This isn't a problem for us because we are health conscious anyways.  If you are eating and drinking on a budget I recommend this place or if you are looking for a lot of decent food for a "reasonable" price.  Otherwise there are better places to go.    One last note.  There is a $13 charge for the additional person that doesn't order a meal in addition to the cost of the plate but you get a salad/soup and all the wine and garlic bread.  I should add this also come with a side of some basic pasta too.  This is totally reasonable.  so again if you are looking to fill up on the cheap then this is it.  P.S.  I forgot they finish the dinner off with a cappuccino which was very nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappacino included.  It was good!

U7gdoRIAiY08_zACuArPAQ.text: A great off-strip dining experience. A dive-bar atmosphere, but huge portions or delicious Italian food.   Unlimited bread and wine.   Need I say more...

Bcu6wBTWwqgeksMcpKPnpw.text: Always a family favorite and can't visit Vegas without grabbing dinner. Service, atmosphere and food always on point. The wine, bread and extra added cuppacino for dessert are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordy the accordion player
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad, wine and garlic bread

8cBAiV14hQjcGBRXrG04PA.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Vegas. So many great memories. The cioppino is the best I've ever had, anywhere. Make sure to say hi to Gordy the accordion player, he always has a smile and a tune for everyone. Cheers!

yinNGuvJYfr0KXHj5E5XTA.text: Bastista's is an excellent place to eat authentic Italian food. Love the atmosphere with a TRUE accordion player and the Italian decor. Love love love the well portioned food. I haven't had wine in a long time but loved it here. Service was great and nice people. Definitely recommend this place. REALLY appreciate great food and service.

UW1wzNkXWA4Kz-m9VxmeOg.text: It's a joint off the strip, a bit-- that's points.  Bottomless house wine-- that's points.  They got an ol' timer with an accordion that runs around the joint serenading fools-- that's some next level action. My man wants to feel bad that I'm eating alone but I put that to rest quick with a request for something sappy an' let him know I wouldn't have it another way.  My man works for tips and it bums me out that a couple of old handbags in windbreaker jumpsuits want to take selfies with him but can't throw a five down on it. Them's chumps.  The old school Italian borders on absurd, but it's fun absurd.  Skip the dinner salad-- it's too depressing to think of someone in the kitchen counting out radishes and tomato slices, factory-makin' your greens.  Just get at that steak and drink deep straight from the carafe.

q4B7VD2-WaAYckS423SrBA.text: I loved this place first time here in all my years going to Vegas. The food was excellent will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas.

zPnPxUD8nUgR0Pf9_kdTVw.text: I was worried when my party was first seated at Battista's. I was recommended to the place by a co-worker and brought my girlfriend and her parents for dinner after seeing a show. The decor is nice, and clearly vintage. There are dozens of pictures of celebrities on the walls. We were seated in a back room near he kitchen, and quickly started thinking we were forgotten. It took a good 10 or 12 minutes before a waiter approached our table again. I was worried the service would be terrible and we would be there for hours.  I was proven very wrong. As soon as a waiter came to our table we had our bread in seconds, salads and soup maybe 2 minutes later, main course within 10 minutes, and coffee as soon as dinner was done.  The service was so fast I was stunned. Now the food:  I ordered the Chicken Parm, which came with free unlimited house wine (red and white, both quite good), soup or salad (I got the salad, kind of a cross between a regular Italian salad and antipasto; it had lettuce and dressing and olives and also salami and pepperoncini), a pasta side, garlic bread, and cappuccino.  Everything was delicious, and the price was very cheap for being so close to the Strip. I will not go to Vegas again without a stop at Battista's.

2f4kfIN3qJ4ABoOeDZGiQA.text: We had our wedding reception at Battista's and couldn't have had a better time! We had a party of 20, and the accommodations were perfect! The food selections were great, from seafood to traditional ravioli, and the flavors were right on the money.  Unlimited wine was a hit with our crew, and our waiter Gerson kept it flowing. He was such a professional with all of our special request, hopefully he waits on you when you visit! Can't say enough about Gordy the accordion player! Most of the family is from Ohio, and he rocked out the Ohio State fight song for an impromptu sing along!  This is a must visit when in Las Vegas! Fantastic time with friendly staff and terrific food!

MbvLlsHL4o6mCY_vRUD8kg.text: If I had to sum up this restaurant in one sentence, it would be...traditional Italian fare in an eclectic setting featuring old time Vegas memorabilia and charm.  But don't come here if you aren't hungry. You will be getting a lot of food!  You will also be leaving with garlic breath.  You have been warned.   Their all inclusive menu features:      Minestrone Soup or Italian Salad     Complimentary House Wine     Garlic Bread     Pasta Side     Homemade Cappuccino  My favorite dish (and only dish I have tried) is the eggplant parmigiana.  It's gooey, garlicy and tasty!

744hH7jEUDrZI7N62lqHHg.text: While this place does provide large portions of food the quality of it seemed subpar.
