My favorite part of the meal was the breadsticks and the salad, they were actually very tasty. The unlimited wine tasted watered down, but it's free so I didn't expect much out of it.   In conclusion the food was pretty pricy considering how bland it was. The service was good, although, when I made a reservation the night before, they had no recollection of my reservation when I arrived :/  2.5/5 would not go again.

RDpsEGs7hYVU7UvAGs0-tg.text: Truly phenomenal! As soon as you sit down, you are greeted with 2 huge carafes of red AND white wine which I dug right in. The white wine was perfectly sweet and chilled just enough. Garlic bread and salad came next. I usually don't like an oil-based dressing but this one was so delicious! I ate up the whole thing. For dinner, I chose the chicken alfredo. It was a perfect portion of pasta and coated perfectly in just enough sauce. The chicken on top was so tender and fell apart with a touch of the fork. It was so delicious! Soon after we were finished, the cappuccino came next. It was so yummy! I'm not usually a cappuccino person but this one was nutty, creamy, and sweet. So good!   What I love most was it was all included for one price. There was no question of what the final bill would be and they were so efficient in getting all the food and drinks coming quickly one after the other. Can't wait to go back!

qqfLo9t8cq1n0t17ItS0yQ.text: Of all the places I ate in Vegas, Battista's was my favorite. It was right across the street from Bally's where my coworkers and I stayed during the HIMSS conference. I love Italian food and was surprised when we walked in that they were able to accommodate 10 of us without a reservation. They brought us 2 bottles each of red and white wine, which are served FREE with every meal. :D I ordered the lasagna for $25.95 and it was excellent. Each meal includes either a salad or minestrone soup, garlic bread, and an after-dinner cappuccino (plus that free wine!) It was really loud and difficult to hear the person talking right next to you, but the quality of the food, and the expertise of our waitress who knew every detail of every menu item and recited them without hesitation upon request made up for that. The cutest old man with an accordion played us a nice little jig as well. Having recently visited Italy, the authenticity of the feast, friends, and fun felt like I was experiencing it all over again. My group thought Battista's looked shady from the outside and it kind of does since it's attached to a liquor store, but we were all pleasantly surprised and impressed. I highly recommend for the value, quality, service, and just-off-the-strip location hidden from tourists.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free wine! :D

09CjwcQOT_WBIbDWK1FZUg.text: Dark and dingy dated environment. Trying to be old school but instead is just old. Bland and flavorless one note food. I literally watched the soup/salad boy pour my minestrone soup from the cylindrical kitchen container into my bowl by the busing station. Of course all the ingredients were at the bottom so I received little of those. The lasagna was luke warm and bland. Not good food. Would have much rather had chain food like olive garden. Wont be back.

HPYkPRUImLZrhZDNnQ-T5g.text: Great value. For one price you get your meal, wine, salad and bread.  After dinner beverage included.  My lasagna was loaded with meat.  We had a party of six and all food was top notch.  They will keep bringing wine to the table so drink away.  Will visit again.

m3V0wYlkaXoXPjw9CgQvEw.text: Cool atmosphere, complimentary house wine with your meal. Despite great reviews and a friends recommendation, I didn't think this was really anything special. Shrimp scampi was a bit bland and definitely not the best I've had. Might have been a better deal had I drank lots of wine with my meal.

WUgWRbsNq3MfCNFagFFRFg.text: They were surprisingly nice to us despite the fact that we rolled in 20 deep and were obnoxiously drunk.  The all you can drink house red and white were already in carafes on our table and we were ready for more merriment.  Fairly loud restaurant (or maybe we were the ones being loud) that can easily accommodate large groups such as ours.  I'm actually surprised that we weren't kicked out with all the f-bombs that we were dropping.  The food seemed well rehearsed, as the bread came out quickly, as well as, the standard single-serving sides of salad or soup.  Our pasta orders were placed fairly quickly and the meal arrived on room service carts.   The after dinner cappuccino, with a healthy dollop of "whipped cream", arrived just as quickly afterwards.  Food is not too spectacular (seemed fairly Costco-y if you know what I mean) but the service was quick and they have a doorman that can take care of your after dinner entertainment.     Parking lot was right in front of the restaurant and fairly safe despite the look of the neighborhood.  They let me leave my car there, overnight, and it was alright the next day.    Made reservations and had to put down 10% on a credit card due to our large party size.    ~$32.5 pp including autograt of 20%.  I probably won't go back for the food, but works for large groups, not interested in buffets but interested in drinking copious amounts of cheap wine in plastic cups.  (2* for food, 4* for service)

rqmfmNS_oLIXZ1998Ng3jw.text: Went to Battista's Hole in the Wall this past weekend for a nice dinner party with nine others.  We all had a blast.  Complimentary soup or salad, red or white wine and cappuccino  with meal.  Old school Italian and Vegas pictures throughout creating a nice decor and ambiance inside.  The wall menu is simple yet diverse to satisfy any palate.  A must for everyone at least once.

SpSZaSVicS4KYlLOP1Dmeg.text: This place is awesome, some of the best hearty Italian food I have ever had and I love the ambiance of this little old place next to the big, glitzy strip.  Definitely a change of pace with a lot of cool memorabilia.  It is Reasonably priced.  Although it may not look like a five star restaurant, it reminds us of a simpler, smaller Las Vegas.  It is one of the few remaining remnants of the old days.  I'm not a wine connoisseur so I'm really happy with the free, all you can drink, take some home with you, wine that they offer with your meal.  We stop there any time we stay in Vegas ever since the first time we tried Battista's.

ZJlOu2L1S8XJ52TWREMMYg.text: The food is great. The decor is pretty cool. It reminds me of when I was a child and going to this old Italian restaurant in Long Island City with my grandparents. The prices are good for being so close to the strip as well. You pay one price for your food, all you can drink wine, a salad, and a cappuccino.  The wine is cheap table wine but its pretty good considering its free. Truly its more of a four star, but i want to give it a fifth to make up for the ignoramuses who previously reviewed this place.

RzFMQk8BWLxZSWfUrOGooQ.text: My favorite stop in Las Vegas, gone there for many years. Food is great, prices are good, ambiance is very cool.

FT26MiZEceF5rteAXXZCrA.text: I have gone to this place for years and USED to really love it.  I still love the atmosphere, but the food has gone WAY down hill.  If your looking for great decor, friendly staff and poor food this is your place.  Seems that they are resting on their fame now only.

QhkXQ1BLdGxYArFRCth-ig.text: On vacation, you do touristy things.  This is one of them.  As you look around, you can tell the dated decor has been home to many travelers of the past.  Business cards of past customers line the walls.  The pictures on the wall contain a rich history of the restaurant and the surrounding city.  As you eat, a charming accordion player makes his rounds.  Much has been written about the food, so I won't spill more ink on it (the spinach was the worst I ever had and the free wine reflects what you pay for it).  Rating the food only, I'd give this place two stars.  However, I think you go here for the experience of going to an old-world tourist trap and doing so inexpensively.  In that sense, I think the experience is worth a higher rating and I'll be penciling this place in on my next visit to Vegas.

BtiWBNBaRHyDzkbJITSRnw.text: Bachelorette party this past weekend and one of the gals made reservations here.  From what I hear it's been in the same location longer than 35 years and it's family owned.  The decor is kitchy...very old corny Italian place with a wall full of shot glasses and small liquer bottles, stuffed moose, turkey and other items.   The service was QUICK and much appreciated.  The staff was helpful and nice.  The overall idea is, I think, what Bucca tries to achieve.  The menu's on the wall...I ordered eggplant...yumm-o for the most part.  All dishes come with house wine (complimentary), garlic bread, salad or soup, entree, a pasta side (if pasta's not already somehow included in the dish) and cappucino.  Salad was not tasty at all...garlic bread was OK...eggplant was outstanding, pasta was ok, cappucino had yummy whipped cream on it and that's about all I have to say.  Oh,....the red wine was great.  All this for about $25 per person.   The BEST part was the little old guy playing the accordian table to table.  He asked what we were celebrating and then sang "Get Me to the Church on Time".....best 2 second show of my life.  Overall...I MAY return if someone really begs for it.

HqZM_uzG0yT1v210ePjyDw.text: No no no - this place is not good.  Food is not good (worst veal parm I have ever had), service sucked (dude was trying to fake an Italian accent, really demeaning) and the wine was horrible (it doesn't matter if its free).  When you are in Vegas you should treat yourself to a quality meal.  Do not come to Battista's because it seems like a great deal (its not).  The money you save on the all-inclusive option just isn't worth it.  There are only a handful of places worth leaving the strip for and this isn't one of the them.  Please do not trust the positive reviews and stay away.

zi5H5RsQ79pt-w_RIX118g.text: Great environment. Not too loud. We had a good time with the free wine. The food was very good, but not 5 stars worth. All of the extra, free things made up for it. Would eat there again!

tUckYRuJ8brjvW2tbfMxGA.text: I wanted to go but could not get in.I was dissapointed that I could not get a full meal at The Bar.They do serve a limited menu but being Diabetic that menu would not work and they would not make an exception for medical reasons.However they were very nice,very apologetic.Having a 90 minute wait the food has to be incredible so I hope to try it next time I go to Las Vegas.Next time I will make a reservation but did not think I would need one on a weeknight.You would think one person that could have squeezed in.

ZS-Npr9z2r0Vn_Ne4B5ZxQ.text: f- all the bad reviews! f- them all!!! hello free vino....what more do you want? so the wine isn't the best bottle you can ask for, but it is free.....F-R-E-E, FREE!!!!!! and besides, the cheaper it is the faster you get drunk! hahaha!  this is the place i have my annual viva dinner. we meet some friends here and do the town right, well, or wrong if you look at it as the drunks takin' over. this year was no different, except for the fact that we were seated in the same room as two wedding parties. no problem....we were all loud and we were all drunk. i like the food here and for a flat price you get soup or salad, main course, hot chocolate or cappuccino, and FREE vino! so everyone who didn't like the food, shut your pie holes and drink up, everything gets better the more you drink!  so, we drank through six carafes of white and red vino and through two wedding parties. by the time the third walked in we were on the topic of hula hoops, skip its, and bondage ball. we're a diverse group....what do ya want? we somewhat quieted, through giggles, as the best man gave his speech. however, once the praying started our eyes got wide and we felt as though we were in the wrong place at the wrong time! hahaha! whatever! jesus turned water into wine for a reason.....we were just drinkin' it up with the lord!  lastly, my man sings there. he's so cute and old with his musical talent. normally i hate the old, amongst other things, but this is one elderly man that i love to see once a year. so, needless to say i will be here next year again and i would recommend it for the experience and the FREE vino! take advantage kiddies! it is FREE!!!

ZC2kVJ2FiY2nDBhe-kyWCQ.text: As a frequent Vegas traveler, I always look forward to an evening meal at Battista's. The meals are somewhere in the vacinity of $25-$30/person, but you also get a carafe of house wine. If you are lucky, you can also catch this little short old guy playing the accordion, which makes for a romantic evening. The food is fabulous and you won't leave hungry, that's for sure.   The place is located right behind Flamingos, so if you are staying on the strip you have to give this place a try.

Ixyv5poOALyT0MWuifvEQA.text: Awesome atmosphere and great food. The cappuccino was actually hot cocoa with whip cream but other than that it was a fun experience. Very accomodating for our big group of 10. The wine was better than good too. Quick service, fast food. Overall, we were all happy with a good base before a night of drinking.

yrfce0HAnoy6Da58kwz53w.text: Battista's is a tremendous place to go for a large group dinner. The service is great and the food is fantastic.

z2w0yWoDhHjm0mBJRCzivA.text: Well if you like really Authenic Itallian Food and Nice Romantic Atmosphere, Battista's is the Place to be.. From Once you walk in to the Nicely Decorated Rooms to the Bottles of Free Red and White Wine you recieve at your table... And it is Close to the Strip and Excellent Service and Would Recomment it to Aanyone

kUlqumk6-z7b6ca00HiZ7w.text: You definitely don't go here for gourmet food.  However, the portions are pretty decent considering it includes salad, entree, cappuccino and ALL YOU CAN DRINK RED OR WHITE WINE.   I always get the spaghetti w/meat sauce since its almost as thick as bolognese.    Been here twice and love it each time. Maybe b/c I'm in Vegas, having the time of my life and ridiculously drunk.

ZDlzQurDAP9LFjl4_WahRQ.text: This place is an excellent value with great Italian food and a fun atmosphere!  It has a really comfy family feel.  All meals include salad, cappuccino (delicious!!), and all the red and white wine you can drink - seriously, we were drinking as fast as possible and they just kept bringing out more.  We visited while in Vegas for a bachelorette party and I will definitely return.  LOVE LOVE LOVE the little old man that plays the accordian, he was so sweet and sang to the bachelorette!

68Llrw9STF67H8O4tt6REg.text: Food was good.  Free red and white wine for the table.  Great atmosphere.  The accordian player serenading the table was fun and a nice touch.  A Vegas landmark!

vaFmrU4qE_IdalUzoUGP9A.text: We ate her a while a go and for some reason never got to leave a review. Was in Las Vegas two weeks ago and decided to stop by again. The place was crowded. Waiting time about 90 minutes so sadly we decided to walk away. This place is so eclectic and inviting all at the same time. Their food is to die for, tasty and portions are big. The meal even includes a glass of red wine! Hopefully we will be back this month and we will try again to get in. If you can and if you have the time don't hesistate. It is well worth it!

5YgEIuqYWYDnBUQn55V3yw.text: Very delicious authentic Italian food. We both got the lasagna. We probably should of got 2 separate dishes to try, but it was very good. You get free wine, salad or soup, garlic bread, and cappuccino with your meal which is something True of Italian meals. The place is dark, but gives that romantic feel. menus are on the wall. There is a cute lil old man that plays the accordion. Service was very good and quick. We went around 6:30pm on a weekday and it was just starting to get busy.

U5VDJM8xcYdbDMgnpe_Pbw.text: Stumbled upon this 5 star little gem just steps from the strip. Since the moment we walked in we were greeted and taken to our table immediately.    Included with every meal is red or white table wine, house salad or soup, garlic bread (delicious and so soft), main entree and a pasta side and a cappuccino. Meals start at $27.   On this visit I had the chicken parmegiana and was so glad I did. This hot cheesy, tomato, perfectly piece of chicken may easy be the best meal I had on my vacation. I expected it to be salty for a place that is so busy and just turning out customers. BUT IT WASN'T.   Our servers, Frank and, I believe, Gabriel were very fun, attentive and ensured everything was good.   Honestly cant wait to come back. This for sure will be a new tradition includes in all my Vegas trips!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappucino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmegiana

_om7quFbvLBFFhG9HdiY0g.text: We stopped in here for dinner this evening. This place is closer to the strip then we generally like to come, but we've been wondering about this place for a long time. So tonight was the night.  As we assumed traffic was a mess on Saturday night. We managed to get there on time for our reservation.  There were three girls working the desk when we walked in. They really need a lesson on how to greet guests that walk through the door. When we let them know we had a reservation they gave the attitude that we were bothering them. Oh well, let them go through life miserable. We were here to enjoy ourselves.   Our waiter was Doug, and he was awesome!  I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. My wife ordered ziti with meat balls. Both were excellent.  The meal comes with .... soup or salad.  A basket of bread.  Two large carafes of wine. One red and one white. After dinner cappuccinos   We also ordered a tiramisu for dessert.  Our total came to around $50. Can't complain about the price especially with all that comes with the meal.  I enjoyed the ambiance. The old photos on the wall really speaks to the history of the place.  They had an accordion player walking around playing music for folks.  The only negative I could find about this place, other than the 3 socially inept girls working the front, was this is another one of those places that likes to pack in the guest. Your so close to your fellow diners that you can practically join in on their conversations.  I know you want to get as many paying customers in as you can, but you've got a great reputation here. I'd rather pay a little more and have some elbow room.  All in all we really enjoyed ourselves here.

surwUc5okzKc8R75R0vNVg.text: This was probably the best Italian restaurant I've been to in ages! I commented the night before that it looked like you'd get stabbed if you were at the street corner the restaurant is located at but little did I know that this place was a hidden gem.  The lighting and decor are classic Italian. There is a very intimate feel and I felt like I was right at home. It was complete with a elderly gentleman who came around and sang to us with an accordion.   I gave it 4 out of 5 because the sauce was a little mild and sweet but the quality was a 10 out of 10. It's located right behind the Cromwell/flamingo and it's about a three minute walk from the uber pick up at the flamingo.  The meal came with either a salad or soup, main course which is served with wine and bread, and they bring you a cappuccino with fresh whipped cream (or a shot of lemon cello for a small fee). The service was out of this world and we had a waiter, server, and someone to get our drinks, which meant that we never wanted anything while we were eating because it was always taken care of. When we left, we boxed up our food, and the server even brought us more bread to take with us.  We will definitely be returning to this place every time we come to Vegas, I will recommend it to anyone who asks for a good place to eat. They don't make places like this anymore!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sitting at the bar waiting to be seated
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs is out of this world

aVdvjOCkEbt8M3PUn_uIqQ.text: One of my favorite places in Vegas. Old World culture and very reasonable priced. I stay at Bally's just to be close to Baristas! Wonderful food and staff, always doing their best to make the experience magical.  The Chicken Parm was one of the best I've ever had. Salads, great bread, and never an empty wine glass! Definitely recommending this restaurant to anyone visiting Vegas!

bgDgGFl-ftn34cuB4O9AHA.text: Fun Italian free flowing house wine and friendly staff. Seems a bit pricy at first but everything is included, bread,salad, a huge entree, red and white wine on the table. Who could ask for more? Price point 20-50 pp on average.

cc8kHozmXVCDqvMOtWWaig.text: We went there because of a friend's recommendation. We were staying close enough to walk so we gave it a whirl.  It was a Wednesday so it wasn't busy. We were seated shortly before we finished our first drink at the bar. We were met with 2 carafe's of wine - white and red. I think they should ask you what your preference was as in our case they didn't have to bring the white (was wasted)  My wife had the Eggplant Parm and I had the chicken fettuccine. She ended up not liking it but I think she tried it only due to her friend's recommendation but never had it before. It looked okay to me! My Fettuccine was definitely hand made and the Alfredo sauce was tasty. The serving was more than ample. The after dinner cappuccino was a nice touch.  As a side note the accordionist is a nice touch but I think he's about ready to call it a day. You rarely saw him as I imagine he tires out quite a bit thru the evening and takes a number of breaks.  I would come back!

ImNCTZZlnW5v7XPmMAzMQw.text: Garbage...Yelp let us down. Usually reviews are pretty spot on for taste, but our food was completely inedible. If food isn't that great, usually my bf and I will try to sit through it because we grew up never taking food for granted (poverty) and we hate to see food go to waste, but the food was so bad we could barely stomach it. We ordered the chicken parmigiana and shrimp alfredo, it was honestly so bad we couldn't eat it. The shrimp tasted rubbery and tasteless and the chicken parmigiana was so bad that spaghettio's was a 5 star comparison to the garbage we were served. Even the server wasn't surprised when we told him it was bad. It was like he already knew how bad it was before he even served us. He didn't try to comp the food or apologize, but instead gave us a $75 dollar check.....so we downed all the warm wine provided and went back to our room to have the night we should have had at this restaurant.   Do your stomach a favor and skip this restaurant. Overpriced

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The garbage we left behind
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. ~$75 - warm wine served with a warm plate of italian garbage. Save yourself the bad taste.

qMEPrDTE_XtERaDkldNgfg.text: It's not often I take a recommendation from an Uber Driver, but in this case I'm glad I did.  When I got to Vegas my driver said Battista's was the best Italian restaurant.  I'm not exactly sure about that...but I this was a solid experience.   Just off the strip it's a small and dark with an intimate atmosphere.  There's lots of random things hanging on the walls and ceilings.  I remember seeing a wall of police badges and wooden buckets upside down on the ceiling.   When you enter to the left there's a bar with some high tables.  It seems like people were in this area to drink.  My group got a drink as we waited for a table.  I was craving a Moscow mule, and I did appreciate the server telling me it wouldn't be in a copper mug (because that's the best way to drink a mule) however it tasted pretty weak. And my drink cost close to $10...yeah not doing that again.  We were finally seated in this little dining room.  Good for small groups.  I had a party of five, so we were probably at the biggest table available.  Right away they brought out water and a complimentary jug of red and white wine...sweet! They were served in small glasses, so you don't go overboard on the wine.   The menus were big signs on each of the three walls.  There weren't tons of options, but you had your traditional Italian dishes.   After ordering our food we were served tastiest garlic bread I've ever had.  The bread was soft, buttery, and seasoned to perfection.  With your meal you had the choice of soup or salad.  I got the soup which was minestrone which was decent...it looked better than the salad.   I ordered the lasagna for my meal.  It was big, meaty, and cheesy.  Very pleased with my meal. Kind of glad that I didn't finish it, so I had leftovers for later.  To top it all off, the meal ended with a cappuccino and whip cream.  I'm not a cappuccino person, but the drink was warm and comforting, and terrific way to end the meal.  All that cost each of us $25.  It's worth its value if you take advantage of everything that was offered.    A couple of things to note.  I noticed they never asked if we wanted anything else to drink.  I'm sure they would have got us something if we asked but was surprised that they didn't.  I was satisfied with the jug of wine.  The service was spot on, but not very friendly or personable.  When one of the servers was trying to be friendly, it felt more awkward.  She was commenting on the smell of a friend's lotion...weird.   Thanks Uber Driver for the recommendation it was a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup and bread

867FUx4drZ8kWXeaSstvTQ.text: Sorry but this place is not good, the food is good for older people, that would love food with out salt, or any flavor, got the garlic shrimp pasta and it was a joke, so nasty.  Not coming back for sure the wine is tasteless. I did like the garlic bread and the salad. But the price and the food taste was not the best. I love to give 5 stars but this place is not near a 1 star.

fQU3SGrPaxdTcU06zRuY9g.text: My daughter and I decided to eat here on a Saturday night. We have lived in Vegas for over 15 years and this was the first time we have dined here.   I made a reservation on OpenTable, but when we arrived, they did not have my reservation. I showed the gal my confirmation of the reservation and she gladly accommodated us. The other gal that sat us didn't really seat us.  She brought us to the one room in the restaurant and pointed out the table we were supposed to sit at. I feel like she had a lethargic attitude and couldn't be bothered with showing us to our table.   As soon as we sat down, the server's assistant gave us water and then our server, Giovanni, brought us a carafe of red and white wine. my daughter is not of age and he removed her little wine glass. He explained that the menus were on the wall and he would be back to take our order.   I ordered the ribeye and my daughter had the ravioli. The meal included garlic bread and your choice of minestrone soup or house salad. We both had the salad. The bread was really buttery and garlicky. The ribeye was good and cooked medium rare like I had asked. It came with potatoes, creamed spinach, and a side of ziti pasta with marinara sauce on it. My daughter's ravioli came with marinara sauce on it. The portions are big at this restaurant.   The house wine was decent. It included with your meal, so you can't really expect it to be Opus One quality or anything like that. It's house wine... just drink it.   We got full and ended up packing up half our entrees to go and then Giovanni brought us our cappuccinos (included with the meal) and our check. Throughout the meal, Giovanni checked on us to make sure our meal was satisfactory. All in all, we will be back. The only reason it was 4 stars instead of 5 was because of the 2nd hostess who pointed out the table instead of walking us to our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

itAw0aXM66qVhw-OdOfeWQ.text: Overall:  very good.  Visited on Sat night with a party of 2, had reservations and were seated immediately.  The place is hidden behind Bally's, look for the huge sign.  The prices are a bit high, but when you consider that it includes soup/salad, garlic bread and unlimited wine, it ends up being a decent deal.  If you don't drink wine, not so much.  The salad was excellent, as was the garlic bread.  I had the garlic shrimp, essentially shrimp scampi on pasta, and I had no complaints.  My friend had the ziti with sausage sauce, which he considered a bit bland.  I would recommend this place for a nice bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unlimited red &amp; white wine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic shrimp
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread

75xlKyXF8O214MdG1a6i0A.text: Great for a rowdy large group and for dope garlic bread. The unlimited wine is fun but doesn't taste great and the pasta is SUPER bland (very little sauce nor any seasoning on the pasta). My group of nine still had an amazing time though!

8wOYT6Bep72nmOW6uWMMfQ.text: Truly a hidden gem in Las Vegas. Have driven by this for years and have never stopped by. The food is amazing, generous portions, and made with love.  Have stopped by twice now and have tried the traditional (and as basic as it is, my favorite italian meal) Spaghetti with meatballs and the Manicotti. The sauce is hearty and sweet and is delicious on its own or used for dipping your garlic bread. I loved the Manicotti as well because it was filled with cheesy goodness mixed with spinach, enhancing thr overall meal. I asked for more red sauce to drench it     Regardless, of your meal it comes with a salad or soup, a cappuccino and all-you-can-drink red and white wine. This girl was in love lol.  All in all, a great deal for you, a delightful venue, complete with a serenade, and a heavenly meal.   I look forward to stopping by again!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

Rx7oE6k_WVazcj0kpFFeow.text: Had a pleasant experience here, had a beer at the bar while waiting to be seated. ..although it was a full house,  we were seated after 10 minutes. The place isn't all fancy and modern, but it has a cozy feel to it. The food was GREAT!! each meal selection comes with soup or salad, a bread basket, red and white wine, and at the end...a hot cup of cappuccino topped with whipped cream.  The servers did an excellent job. The place is lively..you hear people having a good time at their table, laughing and having conversations.  Its right in the center of Las Vegas action, however its sorta on the side..and parking spots are not an issue...we found one as soon as we drove up. I would definitely come back.  I give them 2 thumbs up

Tw_c1uU-VSb3Ehf0ex8YNg.text: Easily one of the best Italian meals I've ever had! You get salad or soup, bread and free wine with each meal, too - can't beat that!   I wasn't drinking this night, but my friends I was dining with said the wine was great. The house bread was delicious and the salad was awesome; the dressing was to die for! I ordered the ravioli and highly recommend it - the sauce tasted authentic and the cheese wasn't overpowering.   We made a reservation online and got in right away, the service was great and the decor and environment is such a fun experience. Can't say enough positive things about this place - it's a must-try if you're in the area!

3bYt-EDw85mU0wYR7oBwYw.text: after having passed by this place for over 20 years of my legal Vegas age as well as multiple word of mouth suggestions, finally got a chance to stop in. gotta say, we were not disappointed.  classic italian restaurant with the dim lighting and homey decor. old photos, and linen table cloths as well as complimentary wine! basic mom's italian kitchen menu, with heavy pasta and meatballs. no foo-foo stuff here. they combo dinner with a salad or soup and garlic bread and a cappucino at the end! such a bargain too. so happy we dropped in and highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ciao!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After dinner cappucino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Easy to read beer list!

2qvD3VuSYSVuHMx-Cph58A.text: Came here for our 25th class reunion and it was a hit. The food and wine were very good and the portions were huge! The service wasn't very attentive, but it was a dinner where people were talking a lot so maybe our waitress didn't want to interrupt, but it was a struggle trying to find someone when we needed help. I'd definitely check out this place when in the area. It's off the strip a little bit, a nice break from the hustle of Vegas.

DmKX2zLfVDV04G4-48z_Ug.text: Food here is amazing! We had spaghetti and meatballs and eggplant.  My bf and I had big portions.  Try to eat really light during the day or otherwise you won't be able to finish.  Overall this is one of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Parmegiana

JfVTNflAcr-qqgHqtQLjpQ.text: I haven't visited Batista's for about five years and decided to visit again to experience the elderly man who plays the accordion there while I had guests in town. I was embarrassed I had even picked this place after the experience my guests experienced while eating at the restaurant. First I will start with the hostess a young girl very long hair who was extremely rude upon our arrival but I said nothing hoping that maybe she was just having a bad day. We were seated and everything seemed quite rushed the waiter only came to the table twice and there was a party of eight of us who were left wishing we had additional drinks but we're not asked . At one point I had asked another waiter for a drink which did not come. when the bill came The drinks were on there but never received. The second time the waiter came back I asked him about the bill we also would like to have split the bill on a couple different credit cards and he said that was not possible we were unaware of this and he kind of laughed at us snarky was rude about it and when we seemed upset but he said he would try to fix it and charge multiple credit cards. Overall I thought the staff was rude didn't feel they had time to accommodate our table or any of our questions. I will never visit this restaurant again. The only positive thing I can say is that the elderly man who plays the accordion is awesome. Thankfully he was able to make my family visiting Las Vegas happy during this not so great dinner experience.

CZvFWA_x06392wrSsWLzcQ.text: Great little place with lots of character and charm as well as very reasonably priced (50.00) for two full course dinners.  The accordion player was a nice touch for entertainment.  They bring you 2 carafes of wine, salad and fresh bread while your looking over the menu that is posted conveniently on the wall.  The sauce was very good, not as good as my wifes but very good. It was a bit on the hot(spicy) side bit good. The waitress and her assistant were very good also. I would absolutely reccomend this place to my friends.

rXnWZPuGe2IaXsfv7EgoWw.text: Great little Italian place.  Good food and service!  The cappuccino is amazing. The wine is decent and loved the chicken Alfredo.

cwVaxnuAIAIJmi3DvAHJEQ.text: I had an amazing experience as always. The chicken Alfredo was absolutely spectacular. I could not get enough of the breadsticks. The cappuccino was incredibly delicious, and the wine was superb as expected. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone.

eq8Z7my3UMBaj5YiZHn2-Q.text: A great deal on the Strip! The meals are generously portioned, and a starter, fantastic garlic bread, cappuccino, and as much house wine as you want is all included! While it did take a while for our orders, I can't complain otherwise. Would return!

h06ekmbzfl5X9CYcb_8V6w.text: No fun to have hostesses make you wait 15 min for a table for 4 when the place is half empty but who am I to say what right and wrong .  The food is decent. Not great just decent.  My soup was room temp and had to send it back The bread is the best part of the night.  I had the lasagna and it was just ok.   Yes you get a salad and feee cheap wine but it's $22-$45 a person.  We were $90 each couple just wish food was better. Prob woulda tasted better if I didn't have to wait in beginning.  I hate waiting when place is 1/2 full

nYD5uQmakarPh5PWOcvo5g.text: Absolutely LOVED this place!!! Doug, our waiter, took such good care of us! The food was amazing and the entire meal was included in the price! Wine, bread, salad, entree, and cappuccino...I highly recommend this 'hole in the wall'...ENJOY!!!!

j5qwctRDjRHefKKSBYAP5g.text: Yelp ratings have almost always been on point but this place is the exception.  Most reviews raved about the huge portions, great value and awesome food.  Those reviews could not be farther from the truth.  Another dead giveaway that this place most likely didn't have great food is the "Free Wine."  I was in town for a bachelor party and this is one of the places they picked to check out.  I live in the suburbs of Philly and we are used to great Italian food due to the large Italian population in the tri state area along with fantastic Italian restaurants.  The only thing I can think is that most people don't get a chance to have Italian food often.   First the portions were not huge or even big.  They were average at best.  The highlight of the entire meal was the salad.  I had the Chicken Parm and it wasn't terrible but I would not send anyone there to try it.  The chicken was bland and the sauce wasn't much better.  In regard to the value...  $30 for a small salad, chicken parm, watered down wine and what they called cappuccino is far from a value.  If it was $12.99 i might agree.  Free wine!  I'm not sure you could even call it wine.  It was more like water with a taste of wine.    Cappuccino... it was closer to powered hot chocolate  The service was good so they earned two stars.  There are many other options in Vegas if you are looking for a deal that provide much better food and an atmosphere that doesn't resemble a cluttered basement.

nMChTSJbRmpwwyhGHn4jnA.text: I can't believe all this time I've been in Vegas and I've never been to Battista's. And all it took to get me here was a cousin visiting from another state who heard about it from her customers there. For shame. Nevertheless, we came here tonight to celebrate our birthdays. Our birthdays are just a couple of days (and 11 years) apart. So it was a mutual dinner celebration. She likes to make a bigger deal than I do so she wore a birthday sash. Almost as soon as we were seated the little old man who plays the accordion came by to play for us. He ended up playing Happy Birthday (twice throughout our dinner). That was a real treat.  The menu here is not extensive. And it is broken down by price. That is to say each price point has a handfull of options to choose from. There were five of us tonight. Three lasagnas were ordered. One chicken alfredo. I ordered eggplant parm.   Aside from the entrees, we were also served our choice of soup or salad. Its hot out so most of us ordered salad. It was a good salad too. Basically an anitpasti salad with meats, cheese, olives and pepperoncinis with a tangy Italian dressing. Standard but good. The minestrone looked good too but I did not try that.   Also on the table for our enjoyment was garlic bread and wine. Both red and white wines. They were both house wines and nothing spectacular but they come with the meal. I can live with that. I enjoyed the red more than the white. I usually do. The garlic bread was crisp and buttery. Garlic bread done right.  My eggplant parm was of a generous portion. Several slices of fried and layered goodness topped with sauce and a lot of cheese. It came served with a side of penne and marinara. The lasagnas and chicken alfredo looked good too. Again, generous portions. They all had left overs. Me, being the fatso I am, did not.   Finally, to cap off our already fantastic dinner, we were brough capuccino. Really more of a rich hot chocolate. Its a bit warm in August to be drinking a hot beverage on top of a filling meal but it sure was good. We all agreed it was about the best hot chocolate we had ever had.  This place may be called Battista's Hole In The Wall but it really is not. The place is huge. Deceptively so. It is dimly lit and full of kitch. There is a certain amount of retro charm that just feels right. Now that I have been here I want to come back. I want to share this with other members of my family. It was more than just dinner. It was an experience.

zynwou3T-O4984GKbKNW0w.text: If you are looking  for great Italian  food while in Vegas...this is the spot. Truly a hole in the wall with great atmosphere....red and white wine included with your meal. FOOD IS FANTASTIC. Garlic bread out of this world.

LawUasPKfX_4AWSmf7ku9w.text: First off... staff was great! We were looking for a nice place to celebrate my granddaughters graduation and after reading several glowing reviews we decided this was the place! Well I'm here to tell you what a mistake! Very limited menu...my choice was the sausage with ziti (one piece of sausage) $26. My grandson doesn't eat much so he just had the salad that comes with a meal..$13.00. There was a total of 6 of us..everyone ordering to take the bill over $200 and they couldn't comp a small dinner salad???? The chicken parm was nasty...no flavor same with the shrimp alfredo.. no flavor. Creamed spinach was tasty. As far as my group is concerned it was not authentic italian and I would not go back! Been there, done that!

SxgNdnyXsFU3VXbxVrdc_A.text: We asked one of our Uber drivers for good hole in the wall type of place to eat I think you misunderstood and directed us to the hole in the wall. He gave me some background story that the place used to be run and operated by the mafia and that the food was actually really good. My wife and I decided to go here for dinner and meet some of her friends that lived in the area they had never heard of the place once we got there we are very happy with the ambience and Amazed by the decoration and how every square inch of the place was covered with authentic stuff not manufactured or store-bought when we ordered the meals or very simple and the menu very clean and concise I decided to try the manicotti and my wife went with the muscles we are happily impressed that each meal came with a soup or salad you had two large bottles of both red and white wine your main course which had very large and feeling portions and a cappuccino to end the meal. I I went with the mix salad because I'm not a huge fan of minestrone soup. For a salad being a salad it was kind of boring however the manicotti was absolutely amazing. THE Filling was very flavorful and the sauce on top was simple yet went well with the entire meal. I sampled my wife's mussels and linguine and it also was very well seasoned and the flavor was amazing (sorry ma). If you're in town and with a party of two or more I highly recommend this if you like Italian food probably one of the top places I've ever eaten for Italian.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels and linguine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two very large manicotti
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad and wine

DezMUMlBpsOanjh1Gk7lAw.text: This is a late review. Never really tried the food, it was raining about a year ago. The people had the place so secured to keep in the heat. We were seated in the side room. I started to feel the effects of carbon dioxide poisoning. I alerted the staff and they did nothing, had to stand outside for 20 minutes to feel better. But only 5 minutes for the symptoms to come back.   Paid the according guy $10 for the table. He pushed the accordion together once and spoke the first two lines that's amore.

DBCSoVkTEgrzWBHHsUO2-w.text: Wow what a step back in time great food and great service! Food is fantastic prices are very good

j0NXqwV1a6wVyLSoxl_EXg.text: What a delightful evening. The service was excellent and the food was excellent. I got the in lasagna which was a bit too tomatoey my taste but still very good. The atmosphere absolutely cannot be beat. There has to be a picture of battista's in the dictionary under quaint! I would recommend that potential Patrons just look through the pictures on Yelp. They represent the restaurant very well. One of the most unique things about battista's is the traveling accordion player who visits each table and serenades them. The cheesecake dessert and the cappuccino was the perfect ending to the perfect meal. I could not have asked for more. Bravo battista's!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DFw0DCUNwLnVSLmO-Cuqqw.text: Very good.  Come hungry.  You get wine (all you can drink), salad or soup, bread, main dish and liquid dessert.  The food and staff are very good.

tLcw_ZBcK46J02W-cEiPKQ.text: The atmosphere is so friendly and the walls are covered with some amazing evidence of the life of this restaurant and the food is absolutely delicious! We will definitely be coming back!

RUrExF_FyLzeoMPjD-Q1dg.text: This is great Italian food. Great service as well! Not to mention they give you the best bread, salad and minestrone soup!!!  Along with a cappuccino to end your meal!

Isa87Jx4lCDAyU9zPS_REg.text: Sooooo good! The foods great and the vibe is awesome. Unique spot and great deal! Free wine and garlic bread w meals.

WfJ3iawY46bOPSjKIRML4g.text: Amazing! Food was great! Huge portions and great prices! Limited menu but that's what makes it fantastic! Decor was cool and old!

FyY9KsNKEvf0wyV3OKnv3Q.text: Come here every time we visit Vegas. All the feel and ambiance of a classic Italian restaurant and the food is absolutely delicious. I always have fettuccine alfredo with shrimp. The only negative thing I could say is that the service is quite mediocre, but I generally find myself too indulged in the food to be bothered.

mOSJn1V4Z2cuu5rReincLg.text: The wait time and the price of the meal didn't do anything for me. The wife had the Lasagna and I had the Manicotti. Both were good, but not worth the price.

RJ80Gc_kPFiWQjfIwhZNrA.text: This place pretends it's a locals joint, and not a tourist trap.  Even the name "Hole in the Wall" suggests that.  Note that actual "hole in the wall" restaurants don't name themselves as such.  Similar to how girls named "HotChick6969" in AOL chat rooms were rarely actually hot, or even chicks, for that matter.  Anything a block from the strip is not geared towards locals.  If you really want a locals experience, you have to get far enough from the strip to where you can't walk back without your legs hurting.  The food is mediocre.  Not horrible, but if you're expecting a solid, surprisingly good meal from a hidden Italian locals joint, you're going to be disappointed.  I remember when I came in and found out about the free wine.  My heart sank when I heard that.  I knew the wine would be terrible if it was free.  Indeed, it wasn't good.  I didn't even order a second glass.  I felt weird NOT drinking it, because it was included in the price.  Look, if you just want to visit for the accordions and the funky photos on the wall, have at it.  But just remember, someone set this place up in order to draw in dumb tourists walking down Flamingo, who think they're finding some hidden gem off the beaten path.  It's just not what it portrays itself to be, and I think that's what bothers me the most.

EdiUcCjpyNfav53TsxoMyw.text: Service was great... Cocktails okay.. Food mediocre.. Bar area.. Wait for table an hour.. Big portions.. I would not go out if my way to return.. But wouldn't avoid it if that's where the group wanted to go..

tH8txSlipOEZ7s8cPBRPcA.text: In anywhere but Las Vegas it would get 1 star, however given Las Vegas is so ridiculously overpriced and overrated (nope, NOT a fan, won't be going back ugh) this place gets an extra star simply as it was less ridiculous than most of its neighbours. And as the service was great.  Aside from that the menu was annoying (set menus only so you're forced to buy all sorts of stuff you may not want). The food was pretty awful, except the steak was really good for the price. The garlic bread was weird and lukewarm, we had no idea what the lump of fried carb stuff even was on the plate, and the wine was basically undrinkable. Seriously could they just give you one glass of drinkable wine rather than a carafe of awful wine cordial?! Ick.  The staff were nice.

1pOdD30XPgzqpf6D7KWFdw.text: This place was recommended by a friend several years ago and we finally made it there for dinner this trip. The place has plenty of character and the staff and service was fantastic. The pasta and garlic bread was great and a bonus is the all you can drink wine that comes with your meal. Be prepared to wait an hour or so for a table but it is well worth it.

KBG1EujDTqlzohnFlg-Kaw.text: Love this place.  When people say old school Vegas, this is the place they mean.  Tons of pictures of celebrities on the wall but I'm lucky if I can name 1 in 10 of them.  The menu is limited and posted on boards on the wall.  You pretty much just pick whatever item you want and it comes with soup or salad, beverage including house wine, and a cappucino thing after dinner.  Most meals are about $22 and include everything I just mentioned, so pricewise its a good deal.  I've always found the food to be good but I usually just stick to the pasta dishes.  If you're a high maintenance or trendy type of person this is not the place for you - you'll be unhappy as soon as you walk in the door.  If you're laid back and like things a little retro or different then you'll really appreciate this place.

xCRsr2hNx4x3qIoPLkq70Q.text: A M A Z I N G ! While my BF and I were on the shuttle ride to the flamingo hotel another couple was raging about how great this restaurant was. So I decided we would try it out. I recommend making a reservation because it gets pretty busy. I reserved online and we were seated right away. The ambiance was nice, dim lighting, neat pictures hanging on the wall and things hanging on the ceiling. As soon as we sat they brought us red and white wine along with water. A min after we had a yummy salad & garlic bread. I ordered the manicotti (delicious) and bf ordered chicken parm (also amazing) all you can drink wine, a salad, garlic bread, cappuccino, and 2 entrees for $60 not bad at all. I highly recommend this delicious hole in the wall. Best Italian I've had in a while!

0aSIq3RdZYPM6lSN22_5Dg.text: This place was great. Food was excellent,atmosphere was interesting. Good value on the strip.

WHKaIKDl7xPHgpxuCsSiBA.text: Wow!  So glad I decided to give this a try.  This serves as dinner and an evening's entertainment all wrapped into one. And, you simply can't beat the price.  First, if you are into tiny, artful dishes on equally beautiful plates then don't bother with Battista's.  This is hearty classic Italian like your mother might make.  The salad was wonderful and included with the meal.  We weren't offered a choice of dressing.  However, the house Italian was light and delicious.  The garlic bread was pretty standard.  The wine.  I can't say it was great but it went well with the meal.  It's free so you can stop your whining if you have issues and go to the nearest casino and pay $10 a glass if it makes you feel better.  I felt happy with the FREE unlimited wine provided.  Thank you.  The free cappuccino was the finishing touch.  Very nice.  This being said, we paid just a bit more for our meal at Battista's than the meal last night in the food court and it put that sub to shame!

pOJ1R25Cjb78cgac7dDdtw.text: I was really impressed by Battista's. A colleague of mine frequents Vegas and recommended Battista's to my friends and I. It has a wide range of options for a decent price, and you received garlic bread, a soup or salad, unlimited red or white house wine, cappuccino, a pasta side, and your main. My friends and I had the soup and garlic bread, which were both delicious. We were also very impressed with the house wine, which wasn't too dry. We also tried the linguini with clams, the spaghetti with meatballs, and the pomodoro. All were very good, and we couldn't even eat half of our portions. Also, I highly recommend that you try the cappuccino even if you are full. It was probably the best cappuccino I've ever had.

P7UHfwgOwxF1J2z7KdPZYA.text: Went to Battistas on a recommendation. What a mistake. Food was very poor quality. Ordered calamari. Pretty much all breaking and almost no calamari. Spaghetti came out. Not even enough sauce to cover the pasta. Sauce for marinara was spivey. Overall terrible experience.

5aO6mtHoOOnj3hSRpxxHsA.text: Ummmm.....well..........uh..........hmmmmm. Frozen tasting meatballs. Steak Caruso was closer to Chinese takeout.  Garlic bread was soggy and under cooked.  Wine was "wine like"  soup was cold.  Besides that awesome!

5NdwU53vg7Q5xqUj993xuQ.text: So disappointed in how awful this Vegas "gem" has become. The gangsters who made this town are turning in their graves!  PARKING - forget it !! RESERVATIONS - yes you need them but why bother ?? We had reservations for 4 at 8:30 pm and didn't get seated until 9:10 pm.  HOSTESSES - hope you like to be treated like a first grader. Told the girl our whole party was present and she proceeded to say let me know when your whole party arrives !! What ??  FOOD - I'm either a food snob, enjoy my own cooking or know why I don't frequent Olive Garden either. This food is below sub par. Truthfully. We sent 2 of the 4 dinners back. Linguine with canned clam sauce ?? We were told they ran out of whole clams ! And you decided that canned clams were acceptable rather than having us make a different food choice ?? Ok ... What about the steak pizzaole ?? Is the steak suppose to be tough (NO !) and is the marinara sauce suppose to be tasteless ?? NO !!! Send it back !! CAPPUCCINO - really ?? Powdered cappuccino with whipped cream ?? Who puts whipped cream in cappuccino ??? Probably those first graders I referred to earlier.   If you want a great authentic Italian meal (yes I'm Italian and yes my son is a chef) ... SKIP THIS RESTAURANT !!!!!! Awful

jyyy4QdrJAKqseOIjayolg.text: I would give this place 5 stars, but the idiot hostess was so terrible that I knocked it down to 3 stars. First I called to make a reservation. She said she had a reservation available at 6:00; I said great. She hung up on me without getting my name. So I called back and got the same gal. This time she said they don't take reservations for the next 30 minutes (it was 5:20), but she didn't have anything until 7:30 anyway and we should just walk in. I asked how long the wait was: 15 minutes. So we showed up; same girl said she could take us right away. So we started to follow her partner who started walking towards the dining room and the hostess says no, it's going to be 20 minutes. "But you JUST said you could take us right away." "Yeah, but I don't have a table." WTH?!?!?  When we were seated she failed to give us menus. Once the service was handed off to the waiter, however, things improved considerably. Food was great, waiter was great. Prices seem high until you account for the fact that wine is included. Cappuccino too!  Edited: I returned to Battista's on a subsequent trip to Las Vegas and had a thoroughly pleasant experience.  They even gave me my cappuccino to go since I had to meet someone after dinner.  Upgrading my rating to 4 stars.

9zkNGBOjS_31vDehhID_Wg.text: The food lacked flavor! I had lasagna and honestly, Trader Joes frozen lasagna is much much better. My companion had spaghetti and meatballs and said it was lacking flavor as well. The garlic bread was quite tasty! The service was excellent and the staff was very nice. If you need pre-drinking carbs for a reasonable price it's ok, but don't go here for flavorful food.

aZ9ARL8l9MrCW9hFqt7s-A.text: What a fantastic experience! This place has been here for 46 years killin the game! A must do here in Vegas! Confidently located directly off the strip and what a deal! Check this place out y'all! Ps the wine is included with the meal ;)

ItGVoeJ_ZVBz-ftolex3Aw.text: I enjoyed the meal, but missed out on the potatoes that I had last year. I had talked the potatoes up to friends, only to find that they weren't an option this time.

xx9Z_ODWbymx0_oL8ZZkCg.text: Taste of Italy atmosphere.   Gordy on accordion is priceless. House wine - people chill out!  It's free and fits the mood of the place.  Food is beyond exquisite!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome menu

ljqoEYYYUhhZYLXnCQ_7HQ.text: When in Vegas, you have this desire to check out "famous" places.  I was a little underwhelmed by this place. It was very dark and the decor very outdated.  I did not like looking at menus on the wall, nor did I like having my meal as a package deal. I don't drink wine. I can't eat 10 pounds of food.  If you like wine and can eat a lot, this is a pretty fairly priced option.  In any case, I had the minestrone with my meal which was pretty ordinary. Tasted a bit like it came out of a can. For my entree, I had the veal parm. Again, it was pretty ordinary. The veal wasn't particularly tender. The "cappuccino" at the end of the meal wasn't cappuccino. It really tasted like some sugary powdered coffee-like drink.  Our waitress was unattentive and slow. Took forever to get anything.  All in all, I would skip this place. There are so many better options.

0Fi2kEWw9vrpihIW7zS5ug.text: Wonderfully old-school.  Italian comfort food.  Complementary wine.

5Y8ABSskSk6vJSbycX2C1w.text: I heard so much about this "Hole in the Wall" next to the busy strip.  There were 3 of us.  We ordered 2 main dishes that were way overpriced, and decided to share.  The  empty plate costs $13 but include wine, side salad, side of pasta and cappuccino.  When the food came we did not receive the side pasta.  When we asked the waiter why we did not get them, he answered that ONLY those that order a steak plate ($40) are getting them.  The cappuccino was not an espresso drink but hot chocolate with whip cream.  The food was okay but not worth the price. The waiter was too busy to give us quality time and care.

T7y57kT0JFMgyxQn2bKhbw.text: A friend of mine recommended this place. So we checked it out- very old school Italian. The menu is posted to the wall and meals come with a house wine. You can also order off a wine list. Excellent meal the marinara sauce was one of he best I've ever had. The cappuccino at the end of the meal was wonderful and the tiramisu was to die for! Definitely recommend.

tvDFgK0_z3FNHK1Y8ElS2g.text: I had a great time recently at Battistas.  A friend and I went there for dinner when it was recommended to us by someone at Bally's.  Reservations are important, but you can get one same day if you need to.  We got there a few minutes early and were seated right on time for our reservation.  The first thing they did was put a big bottle of wine on our table and say that we could have all we could drink of it (yay!).  The menu is pretty simple, different kinds of delicious italian food separated by price range (about $21-30 a plate, including soup/salad, wine, garlic bread, and meal).  The garlic bread was delicious and the wine was decent (but free, and for some reason I liked it more and more as the night progressed...).  The salad was a pretty average italian salad, but the lasagna was wonderful (although by that point I had quite a bit of wine in me, but I think it would have been great anyway).  So I would definitely recommend this place, I found myself disappointed when I was full because there was plenty of food left on my plate and I wished there was room for more of it in my stomach.  It was a night ender though because my friend and I were both completely trashed from all the free wine by the end of the meal.

-0-hw8m2gdVBF8FB3lZYvA.text: Very expensive for the quality of food. $13 split charge for meal sharing, service was just OK. Soup is not very good. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

FlCTVlGPhlo4eqoP8veykw.text: It was everything I thought it would be. Ambience was great and the food was even better! Definitely recommend it!

VH2HI179arHz8zUjX9G22Q.text: My favorite italian restaurant I ever ate at! With great company paul kosco. Chicken cacciatore and steak pizziola was to die for and i had to have the meatballs

4gwSFL4L5h4_juANVxhpUA.text: I was here with a group of 20+. The food was good. The service was ok at best. The bartender was extremely horrible, and the meal servers were not very attentive to our group. For the price of meals in this restaurant, I would expect much better service. They also do not carry a variety of beers that pair with italian food. With so many things going for this place, they are very lacking in service and beer.

JilQZCmFLAk444pRFXE36w.text: This place was recommended from a friend of a friend & it didn't disappoint. The place is dark on the inside but don't let that fool you. You're served unlimited house white & red wine. Garlic bread & salad were served with our meals as well & they were both excellent. I ordered the Sausage Cacciatore & it was delicious. The portions are huge so you will not leave hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage Cacciatore with Cream Spinach. Delicious!

pzGHsfuD3XQMR3FN761SyQ.text: Great place to look around and see all the autographed pictures, but that is it. They had the heat cranked up so I high I was sweating. The food was subpar and a big let down for the amount of money you are spending. The Italian salad was over saturated with dressing and the lettuce was drowning. The lasagna was a nice size portion but was not anything special. The cappuccino tasted like nestquick out of powdered mix. I would not dine here again.

FTuix2lB-WLi-ouURNfpGQ.text: I swore I wouldn't overeat tonight!  And I managed to pull it off, thanks to the clam linguine.  We love this place.  Just remember to make reservations....you'll be glad you did.  Dinner is a production, so allow plenty of time.

UFIFjhRL2DHT_Xf1rV8Ctg.text: Don't just stay on the strip! Go of the beaten path but not far   it's just across from Bally's! If you like Italian Amazingly good! Can't beat eating all the food we did and all you  can drink wine!! Don't forget to ask for Shannon as your server! Great service from a great girl!!

D5u5SSi_AMlEBA__Q3VCtQ.text: Service was bad and food was not very good. $30 a plate was not worth it very disappointing because I ate here numerous times few years bad and they were great now don't waste your time and as a local sad to say but I've had better

lHv53OsLVYDHMrJslUEBkw.text: Nope!!! If I wanted a large portion of frozen Italian food and cheap warm wine I'd just go pick-up a Stouffer's family size, some Sutter Home at room temp and save myself the drive to Vegas. Only thing I'd be missing would be a rude hostess and a creepy waitress to make me uncomfortable.

D8M7AUtU3TzwtI0EYevxKQ.text: Not the most impressive Italian food I've ever had, but it's a classic red sauce kind of place. It's definitely worth the price and you won't be surprised by how much your meal costs in the end. The menu is cut and dry. Pick an entree off the list and order soup or salad with it. They'll bring you garlic bread and unlimited house wine along with a side of pasta with your meal. The wine is probably from a box, but it's very drinkable and goes down smooth. Where else in Vegas can you get such a deal? The menu has staples like lasagna and veal parmigiana. It's basic, but very hearty and filling. The servers have it down to a science. These kind of family-run businesses are a rarity. There's a funny accordion player that will work his way to your table. Tip the old guy as he is very charming! I like the vibe of Battista's and I will definitely be back. It's the kind of place to take an old friend, but not a work client you want to impress. My boyfriend and I appreciate kitsch, so it worked for us! We used a coupon and got $10 off $50 or more, so our meal was more than affordable. I just can't believe they made a big deal out of the coupon being on a smart phone instead of printed out when it says on the coupon that you can just show the server your phone. Weird...I hate being hassled, but ultimately they granted the $10 off, so no harm done.   I'm just sorry it took me this long to finally eat here. I will be back for the one-of-a-kind ambiance and experience.

LqzdShtr6nJO2DblY9ygtg.text: While this may not be the best Italian food I've ever had, its certainly the best Italian restaurant that I've ever been to.. The ambiance is fantastic.  Complete with the old man with an accordion.    The Garlic Bread is delicious, complete with garlic cloves!  Free Red or White Wine with the meal is also a bonus, and I've never had a better Cappuccino   Parking is surprisingly ample too.  All and all I really enjoyed my experience at Battista's

5Eb5lM5vsySgmcrQArzglQ.text: As a vegetarian, I've tried lots of different Eggplant Parm dishes from many places. Batista's absolutely has the best, hands down. Everyone I sat with enjoyed their meals. The bread is good. Unlimited wine you can't beat. Enjoyed our server. The bar staff was a little bland with their customer service. And who doesn't love the man who plays accordion! He was my favorite part of the night. I would definitely go back again and again.

AEYV_63yryuED3fHK5hjkA.text: This place is my too die for! I love, I LOVE the cappuccino and the Caesar salad. That was all I needed!!! I did not even eat my meal! I ate salad and asked for my cappuccino before my meal! I ended up eating most of the salad at the table and drinking my boyfriend's cappuccino! OH, if I could get that cappuccino by the jug, I wish, I WISH I could!!! I did not care for my pasta meal, but my salad and cappuccino.. the best thing I've ever had! ssshhh, don't tell my boyfriend! LOL

FByFF0euQvpxox8dOXilxA.text: Night of visit: November 23, 2013- I MUST CONFESS, I AM NOT A BIG FAN OF ITALIAN FOOD-BUT, WITH THAT SAID, I KNOW THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN GOOD, BAD AND UGLY.  I am a local looking for favorite little places to put on a 'go to' list when I want a night off the Strip. ATMOSPHERE: Great, Old Vegas Feel....had me with eager hopes for good food to match....SIGH.... SERVICE: average - with many 'points to the MENU on the wall'. FOOD: Ok, the menu on the wall brags of 'Free wine (white or red)', 'free soup or salad', 'free garlic bread', 'free sugar/syrup cappuccino' -ALL of this "free with your meal".   The Lowest meal is $21.00 --this for a plate of pasta, sauce and two hard little meatballs.  Humm,  think we are really paying for all this crap.  I'm blonde but not stupid. OK, IF the food was GOOD-I would pay twice the price for all that 'free stuff'.  But, I think I could get better pasta at one of the cheapest Buffets in town.  The spaghetti and meatball dinner was bad, but the eggplant parm was like a Banquet frozen dinner and I think $24.  hahaha   How do you spell RAGU?   The wine is watered down cheap red, which I expected. The garlic bread, was not toasted, but warm and dried out like it sat around in the oven and turned to hard crumbs. Soup, canned.  Salad, blah.  I am  totally shocked to see the high stars and great ratings for food.  I guess pasta lovers ...just plain love pasta, no matter how crappy? Another place X'd off my 'restaurants to try list'.

6Xvwyi2Q4SZeXocv-qfB5A.text: The food isn't nasty, but it's not worth the time or effort, and it requires both.  The food is cafeteria quality and assembly line style.    It might have been cute and interesting before, but it's now not worth the upset stomach.

rlDTSnJMLLEfKM8mh1FkzQ.text: Tried this place for the first time. Must say...not impressed at all.  Over priced for so so food. The server had no personality and pretty much was a robot.   Ambience was fantastic! But our table was to close to each other and the lady next to us was extremely loud and could not talk over her voice.  Church voice please!  Taking a pass on this place.

pWN_KjV2c8CuZ7KpHahvcw.text: The garlic bread was the most disappointing part of the meal; lacked any flavor. The red wine was served cold which was a first for me. I ordered the salmon which was very good and very hot.

5EFmE4w_0xXm5h4YMThz5g.text: This place is awesome! This legendary place has been around since 1970! A real old school family business! Just look at the pictures on the walls of all the celebrities that have been there over the decades. I can't believe I never knew about this place the whole time I lived in Vegas. But I'm glad I finally tried it, it's so great. I love the old school set menu of entree, garlic bread, soup or salad, pasta, and wine. And not just a glass of wine, a carafe! Great Italian food and right off the heart of the Las Vegas strip. You got to try this legendary place.

GrULhCU2rl07qSdQuaGQvA.text: Fool me once, Battista's, shame on you. Fool me twice....  I originally went to Battista's around 2006, when I first moved to Vegas and had heard about how it was this awesome old Italian joint. Ok, checked it out. But the food sucked. I'm no chef, and I remember walking out of there thinking, "I could have made better ravioli than that! And it wasn't even cheap!" I vowed never to go back.  Fast forward to 2015. I read a glowing review of Battista's from Rick Moonen in the LV Weekly, and thought, "maybe they've changed the food!" We were in the area a couple weeks ago and decided to return, give it another chance.  The inside still has that cool mob hangout feel and there's an old guy walking around playing an accordion. That's why they get the 2nd star.  Overview for those who haven't been: everybody orders a "dinner" which comes with entree, soup or salad, garlic bread, unlimited house wine, and coffee. If you choose not to order an entree, you still have to pay for a dinner: $19 since you could be cheating and drinking out of somebody else's baby wine glass of $3 wine (what they serve is on par with 2 buck chuck, no question).  I wouldn't even care about the weird setup if the food was actually good. The salad (a handful of lettuce with a piece of salami and shredded carrots on top) came out about the time the words "I'll have the salad" were coming out of my mouth. Soup was fine for minestrone. Where they really failed was the entree. I asked the waiter what was their signature dish, but he seemed baffled by the question, and instead asked, "you mean something you can't get anywhere else? That's the chicken rio." Ok fine, I'll take the chicken rio. It's chicken and pasta in a white sauce. Only the chicken is blobby and the white sauce isn't really sauce. More like straight heavy cream they poured on the plate. It seriously has no taste, just a fatty consistency.   My original review stands: I could make better Italian food at home. Or purchase it at Fresh & Easy and heat it up. And it would be 10 times better. I honestly think they paid Rick Moonen to write that review. Or maybe he got some special food?   Insult to injury: this meal cost me over $30!

QGOYYsAZbFIJjUAOVxYsmA.text: Old school red-sauce-Italian kind of place.  Warning: it's definitely been discovered. Expect a long wait over a drink or two in the bar until you're seated.  Thr traveling tableside accordion-player (who is old enough to have come with the place) is hilarious.  Note: the dessert "espresso"... ISN'T.  But the ambience is so undeniably kitschy Vegas, you gotta do it.

WRAd8C3ff8ma13NxAWgiLg.text: The ambience of this restaurant is what makes it so unique. It is decorated with pictures throughout, things on every wall even on the ceiling. Reminds me of the rainbow room in California. Every meal comes with wine which is kind of neat except when your party of 4 includes two kids. If our party was all adults it would have been more worthwhile. This is the reason it gets three stars. If it were the food alone it would probably just get two. We paid $44 for 2 plates of spaghetti with butter? Damn! The sausage cacciatore was good not great but not bad just good. Same with the chicken parmigiana. Good not great not bad just good. Service was good.

wA1iiGCdtLXd7YnwnEwT_A.text: If you want something a little low key and inexpensive, for dinner, in Vegas, try what looks to me like the original Buca Di Beppo.  The bar was nice, but not fancy. We did not have a reservation, so it was really nice to sit, at the bar, and have a drink while we waited, for a table.  I guess since we didn't have a reservation, we got the booth we got; in the corner kind of squeezed behind a booth, and next to a table.  But, that was fine, since we didn't have to get up too much, since there was no way not to knock into the woman's chair closest, to us.  The service was friendly.  They have complimentary house wine, which is a very nice touch. If you are picky I am sure you can buy a bottle, as well.  There was complimentary garlic bread, too.  The house salad was really nice.  The Chicken Parmesan was good, but the spinach was incredible. I could have eaten a huge bowl! There was also a side of pasta.  The Spumoni dessert was different than I had ever seen. It was like a slice of cake. It was much too cold, and hard. I would have liked it better, if it had sat out for  about 20 minutes. I love Angelo  Brocato's Spumoni, in New Orleans, so I was comparing.  But, the star of the meal (dare I say, even better than the spinach) was the complimentary cappuccino. It was out of this world.  I am glad we went and it was nice, because it was a short walk, from our hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Salad
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary wine and garlic bread (I think the bread was complimentary...)

gFwl-1-e90NQ6HwROClFyA.text: We thought it would be fun to give this place a try while here in Las Vegas.   The decor is what everyone says, over the top chinch. The autographed pictures on the wall of star from bygone era.   The food was quite possibly the worst Italian food I've ever eaten.  I ordered the cannelloni because it's a dish often served for special occasions. The dish arrives decorated in the green white and red colors of the Italian flag and thoroughly heated through.   The amount of salt in this dish was off the charts!  Two forkfuls into it I was reaching for the water.  When the server came back to ask how everything was i stated that I didn't like my dish because of the salt.   She just said "okay I'll tell them" and walked away.  No offer to replace the dish and at the end no offer to remove any part of the dish off the bill.    I will not return to this place nor do I recommend this place.  Stay away!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamed spinach, cream sauce and tomato gravy  cannelloni dish hiding the over the top salt content

8Rb23LUi0um7N7y1PCCYbw.text: I always see this place but never stop in. I finally did and was very pleased. The menu is pretty straight forward and posted all over the walls. Despite what you order you're getting a carafe of wine (red or white), salad or soup, garlic bread, and pasta with marinara, and finish the meal off with a cappuccino. I ordered Steak Pizzaiola. It was a huge sirloin (big enough for 2) covered with a tomato and vegetable sauce. The meat was tender and I left feeling nice and stuffed. I will certainly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak pizzaiola with penne in marinara. Big enough for two

7Wl7AYnbmwSc69O5T1GUhg.text: This is a classic piece of Old Vegas history. It is Old family style Italian restaurant . The food is very good. THEY MAY NEED A NO PRUDES ALLOWED sign but, it is a can't miss place to eat The Sausage Cacciatore is to die for. When Gordy is singing and playing the Accordion,  he takes it to a NEW LEVEL!!   Save your money and avoid the overpriced hype of a Guy place. Relax with family and friends at Battistas.  You'll be glad you did.

tX3LLDVmfIMVU-pAALK42g.text: Overpriced but you get a lot with your dishes. Unlimited wine, cappuccino, soup or salad, garlic bread, some have pasta side. The decor was cluttered random interesting items. Staff friendly and prompt. Food tastes pretty good. Above your typical Olive Garden but not the best Italian food of your life. Garlic bread was a bit greasy so watch out. Cappuccino is sweetened, thin and hot! I enjoyed it but tasted more like a cafeteria hot chocolate

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with meatballs. Needed more sauce and salt but not bad
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Alfredo. Sauce was nice and creamy. Chicken cooked well but still juicy
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor

j5gWtYYF5BH1ikMcj5qI3w.text: We visit Las Vegas three times a year for Bowling Tournaments for years.  Every year we have visited Battista's with group of 8 or 10 people.  It is always fun to see all the memorabilia and greet the friendly Staff.  We especially enjoy the sweet little man that visits your table and sing something special.  Our visit in July 2016 was probably our last.  The food had no taste.  We all had different selections.  The restaurant feels old and not welcoming.  The person who sat us at our table was rushing ys and unfriendly.  They had just opened so they were not busy.  Our waiter was nice and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
