pSRLV__4Z_SCDmKHYbHr9Q.text: we went here for the 1st time back in Oct. and it was great, we went again Feb. 4th and after that, we probably wouldn't waste good money going here again. my food was room temp at best and 3 people in our group ended up getting sick. I regretted suggesting it for out of town guests to celebrate a birthday. the service wasn't very good either. none of us even got the side of pasta that it says comes with the meal. for these prices, I would suggest finding another place to go to...

zf3QRRt3DHD56aiKLi3vLQ.text: This place is a nice place to go very cool atmosphere and the food is delicious and authentic.

YqyCSveBcqL-eawQq3tFjg.text: Loved it every single time we went there! Food is great, wine is good and the atmosphere is unbelievable.  The steak was cooked to perfection. It was tender and rich flavored. The alfredo sauce was the one you only get in a places where it is homemade.  We will be back again!

uvNuIi5NWPu87kwGH3iDAg.text: The atmosphere is the best part of the dinner. The accordionist was charming!  The food not so good. Actually it is incredibly average.  The sauce is nothing special. Some bottled sauces are actually better. Go for the experience not the food.

3kA5tAX3qyL9Col64ey-RQ.text: Best and last True Italian spot in Vegas. Good food with great portions, and you get your money's worth!

CFai3lMOHyKmyrvR8vzQNQ.text: Was really looking forward to some lasagna tonight.  We sat down next to a couple that had ordered lasagna so we asked- they said don't order it, was sloppy and way too much sauce and tasted ok at best.  Well, that changed my mind.  My wife ordered chicken rio and I went safe with the NY Steak medium.  We were both very disappointed.  The chicken rio was bland and served with way too much cheese attempting to cover up the lack of flavor.  My NY steak was overcooked and the knife was terribly dull to the point that I could not cut the steak.  Very disappointed!  The free wine with your meal is baked into the all inclusive pricing scheme the wine served tasted like the cheapest they could buy in bulk.  Would not recommended this place, service was quick without interaction, food is lacking flavor while charging Vegas strip pricing.

YDuwroQptm-r5Yfzrg1H7w.text: Worth the wait! Excellent food and great atmosphere. Menu is on the wall. Meals include wine, bread, salad, entree and cappuccino. The service was great and very accommodating. I asked about a dish that wasn't on the menu and they suggested substituting chicken for the veal. Perfect! I will definitely go back. Just a few blocks back from Cromwell. Give yourself a few hours, but well worth the wait.

YArTs2WskiUTDRoRZYXU7w.text: The food was mediocre but our server was great and very patient. We had a party of 13 and asked before we made the reservation if we could have separate checks. They told us yes but after we finished eating the server brought one check and informed us they couldn't split the $526.00 tab! The manager came to us and said she would not separate the check because she was busy and had a house to run. Frank, our server, went ahead and split the check. He was very nice and extremely patient. The manager was a witch! We will never eat there again! Honestly, for the hassle, the food is not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The complimentary hot chocolate was delicious!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed salmon, hard and extremely over cooked!

M2p1EIWuVfL-hTE93TTpeA.text: Great atmosphere.  Food is good, not 5 star but respectable.  You're here for the experience and this place will not disappoint.  Simple but great menu concept.  Just off the strip and very reasonable by Vegas standards.

NUo25F0F6JWxp30DDGHeAA.text: you should def stop here at least one night when you're in Vegas before you go out- sooo much food and the garlic bread is delicious and also......Bottomless Wine.

lMZw7xeF79N2V0PIxwyZpQ.text: Great meal at a good value very close to the strip. Started with great garlic bread and the wine that comes with your dinner - which is actually quite good. I had the chicken parm, it was a nice big piece of chicken and very delicious. My wife had the chicken alfredo - also very good. Atmosphere is fantastic, perhaps a little dark. Capped off the meal with a delicious cappuccino that also comes with your meal.

X9QqbqYg4c07OIxA23VvaQ.text: Best fettuccine I've had. It was delicious. We came her last week on Friday for dinner. They had our table ready and the service was quick. The bartender was clearing in a mood, and upset a few people in our party. Other than her the service was really good. We were all happy with our choice and everyone enjoyed their meals.

L8ESUGaAtWwZxncCw9SeuQ.text: I came here in 1992 and it was SO lacking in flavor, charm, value or anything else that I've remembered it all these years later.  Until today I was willing to forgive and forget but then I saw in the photos here on yelp that nothing has changed since then!  Where the hell WERE you back then, yelp?  THOUSANDS from around the world could've been warned at least 23 years earlier.  Especially me.  Came here with a party of 12 and the service was ok.  One person asked if the broiled salmon was fresh or frozen.  "FRESH!" the waitress replied enthusiastically.  It was frozen.  Every item on the menu came either out of a can or out of a freezer.  Pasta was boiled ahead of time and reheated.  EVERYTHING was greasy, running with butter and/or margarine.  As you can imagine, the wine was the cheapest jug p!ss money can buy.  Even the garlic bread was foul.  How can you ruin GARLIC BREAD?!!!  It didn't even offer much to entertain us at the level of kitsch.  COWBOY-Italian decor would best describe it.  COWBOY-Italian?  I am of Italian descent and was very offended that they had the nerve to call this Italian food.  I could have understood better perhaps if it was still 1973 and Nixon was still in office.  It wasn't even cheap.  Frankly, you couldn't PAY me to eat this slop but I suspect that hordes of tourists from China and American flyover country will keep them in business for many years to come, putting ketchup on their chicken parm and drinking their powdered instant cappuccino with whipped cream.  The way I see it, you can either join them or live.  'Nuff said.

6y70NfDUfzjNPENxlsL0TA.text: AUTHENTIC old "Mafioso" feel! Very good food, with wine included! Huge portions and charming ambiance!! Great for large or small groups!

fxdnZA2-czJMBlWYW5A6OQ.text: Gets a 1-star because I can't find 'No-star'.  The ambiance is great; but, do you go to a restaurant for the ambiance or to have a good meal?  The plates we received were not exactly what we ordered.  OK, perhaps the wait staff is overworked and missed a detail (twice) - easy to do if you don't write down the order.  The garlic bread was embarrassing - too much garlic and so drenched with something (oil or butter?) that it could't possibly toast well.  Garlic bread should have a slight hint of a taste of garlic, not be a weapon of mass Dracula destruction.  The green salad was drowned in dressing.  The pasta came sticky, an indication that it wasn't freshly prepared but had been sitting around a while.  The red sauce tasted no better than cheap jar sauce you can buy at any grocery stores.  The sausage had no taste.  The veal piccante (piccata) had no taste.  The red house wine is truly pathetic.    In Italy, this restaurant would be run out of town!  In fact, I'll go as far as saying that Italian stray dogs would turn their noses and run -  the absolute worst food experience EVER!  Just in case I wasn't clear enough, we were extremely disappointed and much poorer for the experience.  If you want better Italian food (and cheaper), Uber yourself away from the Strip.

s6_hkaTxK0aNbwh9rpKhJw.text: Amazing food. Recommend the chicken rio. Best thing on menu. Free wine wasn't great...but hey! It was free! Will return every time I visit vegas.

oCcycazMxM2PsEsrnkzL5g.text: We live in vegas and have never been. We heard it was amazing! Ummm. No... $80+ for two ppl, for fast food tasting Italian food. Flavorless.... and the wine was nasty. We could have spent the money at a good restaurant. Grrrr

CZMTPiG1ObemM9hI7ZKRpA.text: My favorite peice of "Old Vegas"  No, this isn't the fine dining Italian that you'd find elsewhere on The Strip - but that's why I love it! It's an adorable restaurant with great service, and one of the best deals in Vegas. Just don't fill up on the delicious garlic bread before your food arrives.

r45S33FIpyZF4pfzQP8xnQ.text: I can honestly say this was the worst restaurant I have ever been to in my entire life. And I don't even have high standards. All I need is mildly decent service and pretty good, inexpensive food. This place didn't even come close to that. It was seriously laughable.   For starters, there isn't a normal menu. It's this weird small menu stuck to the wall that is crazy overpriced and the food wasn't even mildly decent to justify it. You have to order an entree dish and it comes with garlic bread, soup or salad, some pasta dish, a coffee, and a complimentary glass of red or white wine. No a la carte or appetizers possible.   Our waiter was the most socially awkward person ever. He didn't make eye contact and would walk away from our table as we were placing our orders. We would start talking to him and he'd start walking away from the table every time mid-conversation like he had somewhere else really important to be and he couldn't be bothered with us.  I kind of feel like we were on the show boiling point from MTV. We kept expecting someone to pop out with a camera telling us it was all a huge joke. It was that uncomfortable. When we finally got our food, our waiter forgot our complimentary wine and when we asked if he was going to bring it he stared aimlessly over our heads and responded saying yeah, like he was really confused and then finally brought it over. We also asked for bottled water and he brought us a carafe of tap water when we specifically asked for bottled water.  Also, even if you aren't eating, if you have a bite of someone else's food they charge you $13.... Wtf is that?  There was a 70 year old man who came to each table serenading you with his accordion hoping for a tip which was just so sad and awkward. It made us feel so uncomfortable especially when he finished and none of us had cash. So weird. We just wanted to eat real quick, no serenade needed. The food was nothing special either. My boyfriend ordered the meatball dish and asked our waiter to have his meatballs cut into smaller pieces and they came in full form. So clearly the waiter didn't listen to his request at all. Also, we never received any side pasta dish like the menu said you would get with your entree. (Not like we wanted it anyways with how horrible the food quality was). But still, you expect to get what you pay for.   All in all this place had horrible food, extremely unprofessional staff and made us very uncomfortable. Do yourself a solid and go elsewhere.

Y4blL3mjJ4-W-dta4Mwojg.text: Every time I go to Vegas I have to stop in at Batista's I have been coming here for more than 20 years. Now that I'm older my kids like it too. It's dark, its old, its garlicy and it has history. Let's not forget the little guy that plays the accordion....been here forever. It's not fancy but its good food especially with a large group. The cappuccino at the end is a little weird and tastes like powdered coffee.

azg4CX6QnNb99ILFFAwpSg.text: Well this place does not look like much from the outside but is everything you want in an Italian meal it was amazing we wanted some real Italian food and the reviews on this place were looking pretty good so we decided to try it although our weight was very long break Tuesday night we still sat there but the food was totally worth it and they have free wine with your meal white or red whatever you prefer

FVmg5s1ExzWgn8rCC5Fa6A.text: On April 5th, 2017, my wife and I had dinner here. We made reservations the day previous and when we arrived, we were greeted warmly and immediately seated. Once seated the waiter, brought us wine and garlic bread. The bread was excellent, the red wine just "meh" (not great, not horrible). Wife had Eggplant Parmesan and I had the Lasagna. Both were served in a nice portion, fresh out of the over, and were tasty! We really enjoyed them but couldn't eat it all (We are looking forward to lunch today with the left overs!). Our only distraction at Battista's was the speed of the waiters; they are working so hard to get folks in and out they move like the wind! They provided great service, but we got tired just watching their frenetic pace! We highly recommend Battista's and we will go here again on our next visit!

t-YsuNjc5uPD1-2KzVGJsg.text: So I know this place is kinda cheesy. Okay a lot cheesy. But I liked it! Stop judging me. The food is typical italian american. Think chicken parm, lasagna, alfredo etc. Lots of garlic bread, house salad drowned in vinaigrette, cappuccinos with whipped cream at the end of your meal, free house wine. It's an experience. It's a great place to go with a group- especially if you're traveling with older folks. It's an experience.

BK1CXqk96cMi-oRYpK3qFA.text: Worst tasting Italian cuisine I had in my life It is costly and not worth the money, minimum $35-40 for 1 person We were a group of 4 and ordered 4-5 dishes and not one was satisfactory. Disappointed!!

2DaIMn8r8vgO6NRfixKdtw.text: Service good. Food is really bad. Soup from a can. Salad from a bag. Pre prepped meals. Over priced. Didn't try the "free" wine.   I've lived out here five years and heard this place was a legend. Maybe once it was a good place to eat but you really gotta hate money and food to go here. Overpriced. Tasted like tv dinner but worse. Can't stress how bad it is. "Cappicuino" is actually some powdered sugar coffee drink like nescafe with whip cream. The bring like 20 on a cart and just let them sit until people are done eating. Salad had sliced up lunch meat, flavorless shredded cheese and some sour dressing.  Meal took turn for the worse when a scary old man the size of a child with accordion comes uncomfortably close to us, party of three. Says creepily "I have the perfect song for 3 guys." Proceeds to play "take me out to the ball game" and replaces the word peanuts with penis. Super weird. Just not the right time at all for that kind of humor. Wanted to leave right there. Should have; we were there to eat not have some creepy old dude talk about penis while we eat. I am not offended by it specifically it's just in really poor taste. Kids within earshot. He made sure to get really close in to our space when he said penis; as if we didn't get it.  He ends the song obviously expecting a tip. Says "thank you guys so much" three or four times but in an insincere way. I have a tip; stop making sexually awkward jokes like that with strangers in your place of business so they don't out you on the internet. I have seen other posters say he is the owner.   If so you're put on notice; your restaurant sucks. Your food sucks. You suck. Your wait staff is solid; that's about it. Didn't even try your garbage wine. Your restaurant is selling nostalgia and a lot of crap on the walls.   Hostess and server were both attentive and polite. Swear they both knew the food was crap and were embarrassed for us. Fat tip left for staff. Other than that please do not support this business. They are ripping people off with their low quality food and that old guy is a creep.    I'll never understand all these positive reviews. Spend the $$ and go to maggiano's. Or just go the grocery store and get some Stouffer's. Both are better options especially since you won't have some strange old goon pretending to play the accordion and making bad jokes while you eat.   Just can't possibly imagine how low someone's standards have to be to give this place a positive food review. It's terrible especially at the price point of about  minimum of 40 per person after tip. Really some of the worst food I have ever eaten in my life. Could not finish anything served from the salad to the "cappicuino."  Anyone giving this 5 stars for food quality is either lying for some reason or is absolutely unqualified to judge the quality of food. Just absolutely shocking to me than anyone with $40 dollars to spend on dinner could possibly find this acceptable. It's terrible. Do not go here.

Qu_z5lcvLZex-QhikzN37A.text: The food here is about a 3.5 out of 5. It's not the best Italian food I have eaten but the ambiance and unlimited house wine included with your meal puts this place up near the top! I love Battistas and recommend this place for anyone visiting Vegas especially on a date night. My hot Sicilian wife loved this place and now I am King, lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome ambiance here!

k3829bLQHte_H9J78inagQ.text: I wish I could give negative stars. Had been there multiple times before and had a decent experience but this time it was just BAD.  BAD SERVICE. BAD FOOD. BAD MANAGEMENT.    So, we order the chicken parm and spaghetti with meatballs. It comes out and my chicken is dry and sauce tastes like they put all the garlic they could find in it so they could cover the can taste. My bfs  meatball was  ice cold in the middle. We both ate about 2 bites then stopped eating and waited for our server.   And we waited...    And we waited ...  And we waited...  Finally 15 mins later he comes over and brings the check. Didn't even notice that we didn't eat our food until I spoke up and asked for a manager.  He got kind of insulted when I said we had been there multiple times  before and have never had such a bad experience. He got loud and said "Oh so what, the food is just horrible?!" So I responded "well I wouldn't say it that way.. but yes".   He scoops our $100 off the table with the check then comes back 5 mins later and says "The manager took off your entrees but charged you the cover charge of $13 each. So you got more than half off." Throws down the change and walks away.   No apology from the server and Manager never even came over.   We paid $28 (after tax) for food we didn't eat. Which comes down to us basically paying $28 for water and bread since we don't drink alcohol so we don't drink the "free wine"

wzVmd05zQ64gipTstvDghw.text: Food was Great! Really tasted like old school Italian.

AixCU-lRKDgnIrN02-o4wA.text: Always a stop whenever I'm in Vegas.  Been here forever.  Being Sicilian, I'm very picky with Italian restaurants.  This one is the best.  It's not cheap, but worth every pennt.

3SIOSUXjGehp20Ee5756hQ.text: The is overpriced olivegarden. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I go to Italy every year and this food does not even come close to the taste. Try the spinach its canned for sure and taste like black licorice. The Red sauce taste canned  I really hope someone goes there and trys the sauce and spinach and tell me im not right. Terrible

qxYvbOnx4DMYKirs0TQSgg.text: Love the food.  The wine?  Well, let's just say it might have been a tad watered down.  Seriously, I'd rather pay for better wine.  Other than that, the little accordian cat was adorable and loved the ambience.

dU6f8PwQ4ZxtqHR_sC5mkA.text: I went to Battista's on Cinco de Mayo. It is True that the restaurant has an interesting ambiance. But for me that is where it ended. I have read reviews about the garlic bread. It was good, but just that. The free wine that everyone likes. I thought the red was terrible and the white was less than average. I didn't expect Napa, but this wine was not good. I had Veal Parmasaen and it was over cooked and over sauced. The sauce bothered me the entire evening, way too much paste. It was awful and for the price I was just bewildered how this establishment is still around. My wife couldn't finish her food (Seafood Pasta) and my friend made negative comments about his dish. Service was good.  I'm sure this place has it's loyal customers and maybe it used to be a good place, but I'll never eat here again.

5O_m87z-0O70-8Khdl3Q8Q.text: What a great deal!  My friends recommended this place, thank god they did.  The food is well above average,  and for one great price, around $25 you get all the red or white wine you can drink, plus a post meal cappuccino.  Very family friendly and comfortable, a great deal right off the strip.   This will be one of the places we visit every time we go to Vegas.

KGbJRekvu-AHeRs1jFm92Q.text: Typical Italian restaurant but it has good food and is always busy. The portions are gigantic and I love the cappuccino that is served at the end of the meal. Good stuff, just remember to come here hungry!

epb_MIsoeO0WtIazGK1XIQ.text: This is an interesting place to go to while in Vegas.  Its right off the strip,an easy walk or short cab ride.  It has a very "old Vegas" vibe to it. Don't expect great food though.  My linguine with clam sauce was overpowered with basil.  The garlic bread was not very good and I think if you drank more than one glass of the inclusive wine you would end up with a headache.  The service is excellent though and all the memorabilia on the walls are fun too look at.  Check it out if you want something different and off the strip but just don't expect too much.

P7waPXWycsp9PGfHlkrYWQ.text: If you enjoy old school Italian places, this is it. A throw back to the days of the Rat Pack, this place excels at food, service, and atmosphere. The dimly lit atmosphere, accordion player, and True Italian recipes make this place a winner.

suUK38ryhOuUil0ec5yFPA.text: This is good old school Italian. For $32 We got soup (delicious minestrone) or salad, garlic bread, very good veal parmigiana, a full liter of house wine and a delicious cappuccino for dessert. It was worth the cost.

VgrNRlwg6iLiktTqQKaWNA.text: What a surprise.  Have been coming to Vegas many years and have seen the place but, I guess the name and location just caused me to go past it without a thought.  We took a large group there and they took wonderful care of us.  If you are seeking fancy dining, linen tablecloths and classical music playing...this is not the place.  It is noisy, tables are close together, and menus are on the wall.  We loved the atmosphere and cheesiness of the place.  The prices aren't awful but the food was spot on.  Ate at the Pasta Pirate downtown earlier in the week and this place blows it away.  You won't be disappointed if your expectations are realistic.

R7ljZuJdLnRSICXeaxKRdQ.text: All-you-can-drink red or white wine, endless basket of delicious garlic bread, large bowl of Ziti with Meat Sauce, minestrone soup and homemade cappuccino, all for $21.95! It doesn't get better than this! LOVE THIS PLACE! Great authentic Italian food with romantic (dim lighting) atmosphere.

SHDJ3sRfywjM-wAHFmhqfQ.text: Great little hole in the wall! Free wine with dinner so you can't go too far wrong. The portions are huge so girls I would suggest sharing especially if you plan on going out after! The best is they have an elderly probably ninety year old little Italian man that plays the accordion he alternates between take me out to the ball game and I left my heart in San Francisco... It's fabulous!  This is a True las Vegas gem that is a nice break from the neon lights of the strip

B4hXFeVQ0PjPswG6us12Ng.text: I like the atmosphere in this easy laid back hole in the wall.The food is average but the all you can drink wine helps.Garlic bread is great salad is nice.To me Gordie is the star of this place,Gordie walks from table to table with his accordion asks where your from or why your there and breaks into song,just tip him great entrainment .Keep in mind that Gordie once stood over 6ft tall but carrying around that accordion for over 40 years has caused him to shrink!

4s_o6wOqH7v3X3RGiTyZxQ.text: Great food, white and red wine included with your dinner. Authentic Italian food. Prices are veru good amout of food is healthy. We are going  back tonight.

OlohJWFs5c9oQxZERhjvXg.text: Great taste of "old Vegas" here. Great food that comes to you in the simplest of menus that include all the house wine you can drink! Watchout for dinner rush.

ImlWHxylI-HgMMgpKz1gGA.text: We went for my Birthday July 3rd and once again it was excellent !! I will continue to take people there when I am in Vegas :)

6gLGa2FJ2X3qRVy-7-dkwA.text: Always a fan of this place. Terrific Italian good and atmosphere. Be sure to prepare yourself for lots of good food!

h39J5CprXpe9SM-tpnvrVg.text: This place is the definition of a hidden gem. It's tucked right behind the Flamingo. The menu is on the wall and each item ranges from $25.95-$39.95. That may seem high, but you get unlimited wine, unlimited bread, your choice of salad or minestrone soup, your entree and a cappuccino. Each meal is pretty large so when we go with 3, we order 2 meals and pay a $13 cover charge. But keep in mind, the extra $13 gets you wine, bread, soup or salad and a cappuccino. I don't understand why people here complain about the wine; they have other options available, so if you're that "high class," then you should be able to pay for your own good wine. This is an awesome flashback to the era of the RatPack. Our absolute favorite is the chicken alfredo. If you're coming for "high-class wine," don't come here. If you're coming for the experience, drinkable wine, and good food, this is your place. They have an accordion player, Gordy, that has been playing here since 1981; He is AWESOME! He makes you feel at home and like he knows you. Overall, this place is a must do in Vegas.

65xRNRnXe9oEfnxLq8zkFg.text: Prices have gone up,better deals and better italian around for less cash.Cool place if you were never there but so many better choices all over the strip.

7EwatURU2gT4AKnnUvF1xg.text: Amazing manicotti and garlic bread! Exactly what I was looking for. Unlimited red and white wine came with your meal, as did a cappuccino to top it off. My waiter and his assistant were fantastic. Very organized and I did not want for anything. Awesome dinner! Thank you!

_f6noEZ8AHX5NwnqNiIazQ.text: Drinking too much always makes me crave carbs, so it's no wonder that during a recent trip to Las Vegas (where there is liquor-a-plenty) I found myself with a craving for a big bowl of pasta.  We were staying at the Flamingo and could see Battista's from our hotel window, and considered it a sign!  Besides, Yelp seems to like this place, and I always trust my fellow Yelpers.   Yelp, I owe you one.  This was a great find!  My husband and I both had bowls of pasta which were delicious.  I had spaghetti with marinara while my hubby had ziti with a spicier red sauce.  Both were amazing, and really hit the spot!   Also, every dinner comes with buttery garlic bread, a salad, and unlimited wine.  Yes, you heard that right - UNLIMITED.  Amazing.   The decor is classic Italian meets Vegas for sure.  There are lots of autographed pictures of older celebrities, a giant collection of miniature liquors, plus just about everything else you can imagine.  It's very interesting and entertaining.    Bottom line is:  I came here with a hangover, and left with a full belly and feeling a little tipsy.  That's what I call a win!

ou9i0X8--hM5N8oC9ocLug.text: How can you go wrong with a meal that comes with all the fixins' - soup/salad, garlic bread, and wine!  My gf had been before and recommended we check it out.  I got the tortellini special of the evening with salad.  It was very tasty and I loved their "capuccino" dessert.  Prices are reasonable, ambiance is old school, and service is aite.

AaeOf3_ipQoKak7SJcwOig.text: House Red and White wine is pretty good. The garlic bread and minestrone soup are very good for appetizers as well. Service was excellent, and interior decor was entertaining. I ordered the steak caruso...medium, came with cream spinach and a side of rigatoni...not bad. Definitely get your money's worth here ;)

nZYBkfyn8y02Zw7q4zrXNg.text: It's ok. I was referred by a local.  The unlimited wine was nice but the food was ok.  I don't care about how much free stuff I get but the food has to be good.  The cappuccino was excellent but the food was mediocre.

7-Y4RbKq5fBiv3NLkt_FVw.text: This is an Italian restaurant for tourists on a budget. Simply awful!  Gloppy sauce, limited menu, and the rubbery meatballs tasted like horse meat. Cluttered, dusty decor.Skip this!

gF9qvAJJEtRoHCNyHMG_Gg.text: My favorite restaurant in Vegas by far. The accordion player sang me Happy Birthday and the food was phenomenal. I had the Chicken Rio. Will send everyone I know visiting Vegas to Battistas.

5M6GCi6-uNshJAyKbFTaQA.text: The food is excellent with large portions.  The ambiance is somewhere between a TGI Fridays & your corner mom and pop hole in the wall.  The service isn't the best but that's because they're swamped every night. The all you can drink red & white wine is awesome.

KOB2HDgbkkEqe8cDeqnvAg.text: I'm 100% Italian-American. I grew up on Italian, home-cooked food, I've spent a month in Italy and literally ate my way through the country, and have an eleven-letter Italian last name that people constantly butcher when they try to pronounce it.  It is that experience that prompted me to sign up for Yelp and give Battista's its deserved one star. It was dismal.   The main reason I am writing this is to dispel myths circling around (from LOCALS no less) that this place is fun and has good Italian food. Neither is True. Though our wait staff was attentive and prompt, the good service we got just didn't outweigh the bad food.   The decor is kitschy - crap all over the place. The food pricing is way too expensive for iceberg salad, adequate garlic bread and mediocre wine. I ordered a chicken dish and had minestrone. They were both way too salty (a trick used by restaurants to hide poor quality or good-tasting food). And yes, the accordion player was awkward to say the least.   Over-priced, overrated and a tourist trap with a miraculously good reputation. My advice? Go to Maggiano's for GREAT Italian food. Or Olive Garden. Or Buca di Beppo's even.  Just please, don't go here. Don't perpetuate the Battista's myth.

X8lZga95uLqqibHuj-RgiA.text: This is a hidden gem. The food is very good. The atmosphere is nice . The service was pretty good. All meals come with all the wine you can drink. I don't drink , kind of a downer. You get either soup or salad and a cappuccino at the end.

OA7VOEYB3dznLskmpMkAYw.text: RIDICULOUSLY EXPENSIVE.  huge portions but you cannot split them without being charged the price of a meal.

k4O--njg9pe-lQ5BQR3eDg.text: The place has a wonderful look inside but that is where the wonderful stops. We had a group of 10 and service was terrible. We were lucky to see the waiter 4 times the whole meal. The menu is limited and at $25-35 a plate less than stellar. The food was not good. Pastas was dry and not tasty. Then when one person at the table found a long hair in her food, the plate was taken away by the waiter that we had to request to see three times. And never talked about again until we got the bill and he quietly mentioned that it had been removed from the bill. No apology, no visit from the manager, nothing. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

tF9i5bMujYe5Ui0lrGjO8Q.text: Very dissapointed! Came for dinner and it was so bland..  My meal looked liked it was a wod of cheese just wrapped in noodle. My fiance ordered the clam dish and it was not what was expected the noodles seemed old and there was no sauce with it. It was not worth the price I paid.

qijOynfCqt7w2weGns2pBw.text: Great food, complimentary wine, awesome garlic bread! Limited menu but worth the walk!

KJ1O8nyRLHYPKqlfSveLNw.text: This place is a piece of Las Vegas history.  You could spend hours looking at all the photos plastered all over the wall of famous and semi-famous people that ate there throughout the years.  The atmosphere is sort of romantic and casual depending on where they seat you.  The menu is on every wall and is all inclusive.  So what ever meal you order ($21-$45) it includes soup or salad, garlic bread, entree, cappuccino and all the free wine you can drink (red/white).  One word of caution on the wine if you love and know good wines, this stuff is not that.  It is the cheapest stuff you'll ever choke down.  I've have the veal in the past and the spaghetti with sausage which are ok at best.  I've spent a lot less and had much better food at other places like The Olive Garden. The only reason I've been here several times is because my wife loves it.  If it wasn't for her I would not be back!

Coz37z2APHAIPTPhVHSw_A.text: My friends and I were so excited to try this restaurant. When we heard bottomless wine and Italian food, we couldn't get there fast enough! We went this past Monday at 5:30 - not exactly what I would call a busy time. We had bread, salad, and food within 30 minutes, so we were feeling very rushed. I wasn't even halfway through my entree when the server was already coming by asking if we wanted cappuccino. The food was sub-par, nothing to write home about (the salad was DRENCHED in dressing and inedible). They gave us two carafes of wine - one white, one red. There were 5 of us, and we were never offered any more. From seating to signing the bill was exactly 1 hour. We asked our server Gerson for another carafe as we still had quite some time to kill before our show. His response was, "I can absolutely give you more wine; however I need this table so you will need to drink this in the lounge." I have NEVER in my life been asked to get up from a table, ESPECIALLY after only one hour. We were absolutely appalled, and this will probably keep me from going there in the future.

gOy6zzGuuZjcndtbI8m_2g.text: I can't  comment on the food but the customer service from manager to staff was spectacular. I lost my wallet and they tried to help in every which way even staying beyond closing and accessing the internet to find my phone.  I did find it and thank Battista's soo much.

Vn8c5MMka6GcBwcXyYlksQ.text: Tried to have dinner here but couldn't get past the garlic bread appetizer at the bar and the nasty wine. It is dark and lots of figurines in the glass cases. Yes the place looks like Al Capone could have stopped in a time or two. The people that love it really love it. Sorry it wasn't for us.

JOgs9dQ6HNE7_Zv72ajJRg.text: This place was great, the bartender Jane was in training and she had a great personality and always made sure we had nice and cold drinks..The customers that are regulars their were really friendly..We actually left and ended up coming back later LOL..Make sure you visit Jane during graveyard you will not be disappointed

IAgsJUQLFY0VcwZMu63USg.text: Just OK. Overpriced because they include their house wine,  salad, side pasta, and a cappuccino with their meals.  The wine was either a chablis  or burgundy both which were undrinkable. The salad was dressed with Italian - no choice. Someone brought our salads but it took awhile for the waitress to come back to get our order. The eggplant parmesan and lasagna were good. Don't drink coffee so the cappuccino wasn't an option.  Won't be back. Went early.  Lots of unsuspecting people waiting by the time we left.

vqSnXEOAjmTohoJMf9iXEw.text: The worst Italian food I have ever had. Easily worse than Olive Garden

9Y9jr0Zi94pANTDPKBxb_A.text: It was simply OK.  We ate about 9:00 and service was very slow.  I'm not sure if that had anything to do with them closing a section of the place, but it was still busy in the section we ate.  Salad was odd but good; main course not so much.  Decor was old Vegas which was nice.  Wine and coffee is included in meal.  Overall, OK to eat at once but wouldn't go back again.

ok5Ee9DYM75FGUFnqNMrKg.text: Excellent.  Reminder of "classic" Vegas. Easily sat our table of 8 adults. Everyone enjoyed their meal, plenty of drinks, quick service, entertaining and friendly staff.

X3-ajUk4Wv-mDL2hAgI_XA.text: Battista's is awesome.  You can find higher quality Italian food out there, but the food is still better than most, especially better than your generic crap like Buca di Beppo.    Battista's is all about its convenient location to the Strip and all the stuff you get with your meal.  Your entree comes with a soup or salad, cappucino, garlic bread and UNLIMITED wine!  The cappucino is delicious in my opinion, a great way to end the meal.    I've had the spaghetti and meatballs, chicken parm and ziti w meat sauce.  I will recommend that you stick with the meatballs / meat sauce.  The chicken parm is not worth the extra 5 bucks or whatever.  It is good but not high tier for chicken parms.  The meat sauce is definitely above average, along with the meatballs.  Some people here say it is too expensive.  Sure, I can go down to South Las Vegas and get unlimited wine and beer from Studio B at the M Resort, but Battista's gets you filled up and full of wine 1 minute from the strip.  It is right behind the Flamingo.    I milk it a bit, take a while to order while I enjoy the wine.  I get my money's worth.  Accordion player comes around to serenade you and your hot date.    Overall, I agree with the majority of posts here, the food is good, not the best, but solid.  You get a bang for your buck.  My advice is to stick to the cheaper options for a value play on Vegas.

h6RIkGEtLmy5JrjjemYrSg.text: Love this place! Old school at its best..The food is great! Now I have had better...but the atmosphere and the all you can drink wine are the best! Better check it out ..before its demolished for a fancy hotel/casino!

bHCwwbbDoMLT2OacNQVyOw.text: Place is amazing. Go there more for the ambience,  and all you can drink wine and wmest garlic bread that is out of this world.  The food is good, not great but the overall value is out of this world. A Las Vegas original.

wU-awV0uGkZdjnIFsgoTQA.text: I loved this place.  Dark, cozy booths - Check  Old Vegas Vibe - Check  NOT on the strip - Check  Good Italian - Check  Free bottle of wine - Check  This place is everything that the strip restaurants are not.  The food was great, the red sauce was sweet but it worked well.  After a day on the strip, take a short cab over to Battistas and more than likely you'll be back the next time you are in Vegas.

IpkXM4mvBykM4n0SaS8I_Q.text: What a great, quaint place! I love the house wine and family-style dishes. We had the whole family here, with everyone sharing and trying new things, what a great time. Just make sure your full party arrives on-time or they won't sit you, that was the only drawback, and difficult with the location and parking difficulties. We bought a Groupon after visiting, we will be back!

frRaO_7o3dEm29BcaNCQqA.text: We try to go here evey time we go to vegas! It reminds me of an old school east coast italian spot...the menu is simple...you get free garlic bread with every order...and either a salad or soup! Plus another bonus is that you get free wine! They have all the italian classic dishes! But dont load up on the garlic bread or you wont be able to finish your meal! The staff is always great! THiS IS A MUST DO!

JfE_szNByNezB7W1EAJLYw.text: Food was delicious.  Atmosphere is wonderful.  Dinner pricing comes all inclusive with soup/salad/bread and all you can drink wine.

CQ75uAIG1lv1Uv-RaBEF7Q.text: I contacted Battista's back several months ago about my daughters wedding and they were so helpful and reassuring. I read the Yelp reviews and as with all restaurants, some people liked it and some people didn't. As for me and the 35 guest that either drove in or flew in from as far away as Australia, we all loved it. The restaurant had suggested a great bakery to make a wedding cake and they also were great. All my guests and my daughter as well as my new son in law had a great time and they couldn't stop talking about all the fun.   To all the staff at Battista's we just want to thank you so much!  As for you that are reading this, go, have a good time and enjoy yourself.

I3kyF3_azEixxLsOtuihmQ.text: Best Restaurant Ever if you want quality, homegrown Italian food in a casual family environment. Not the fanciest place in the world, but man it shouldn't be missed.  Bang for your buck I think this is the best restaurant in Vegas...

gl5PuslZK5UjwkcCfAecVQ.text: We had a great time at this restaurant. Old school and fun atmosphere. The food was truly plentiful and pleasing. The all inclusive menu makes it a pretty good deal. Will return to try the linguine with clams!

mkMpEJIOptB7tmrrtA3xzw.text: I was going to be a first-time customer but looks like I'll never be a customer at all. I had a family emergency and I had to leave town and I purchased a Groupon for the $40 for the $25 purchased. My coupon literally expires the day that I fly back in to town. I was told by one of the assistant managers to ask for Doug the general manager because he's very good at approving coupons especially for brand new customers and upon calling them today the inflection in his voice and the way he handled the phone call was very arrogant and very careless and did not seem to care that I would not only lose money on my coupon but also the fact that I was a new customer and would rather argue then make an exception even after I was told he is good at these things and has no issues whatsoever but apparently he does not care about customers especially new ones. I always thought the customer was right but I guess I thought wrong. As long as Doug is managing Battista's Hole in the Wall, I will never evem consider to patron and I'll be sure to let other people know just the same. Such a shame!

lff3pobtiwLgE56Z47XP-Q.text: This was absolutely a adorable restaurant! Busy yet you and youre date still feel secluded. For it to be a "hole in the wall" its actually pretty big and nice. You get complimentary, Wine, Bread/Soup, Salad and Cappuccino! Meal are pretty big portions! Especially after all the complimentary stuff! Did I mention the complimentary wine is unlimited...!!!!! Average meal 25-30 $ but absolutely worth it! Relaxing evening with the hubby, its a cute date night spot... or just nice friendly dinner with friend. Definitely some interesting decorations around. But this to be our first time, it wont be are last. BY THE WAY, the food was quite delicious, not over cooked, not frozen... FRESH, not flavorless but not over seasoned, and just overall tasty! I honestly cant wait for our next visit!

xF-iQ7BabeGBxl3poyYSAw.text: Food was good about 1hr wait to be seated  given it was sat (730pm ish) was looking for some good Italian pizza but got shot down. No pizza boo!! Accordion player was cool

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OGZSZovTk2DEtvxIem7mSw.text: 5 stars for a 5 star job of taking care of our party of 33 without any problems!  I called a week before and made the reservation, no problems.  We were seated once our entire group arrived, which was a tad annoying that we had to wait for everyone, but it is understandable.  Everyone's order was correct.  No one made a face about having to deal with such a large group. Service was fast and friendly.   They won't split the check on huge groups, but we managed to all chip in enough to cover the bill in one go.    Vegetarians can get the usual Italian stuff - manicotti, ravioli, pasta with marinara.  All meals come with soup or salad, garlic bread, a side of pasta (if you don't get pasta as your meal), cappuccino, and most importantly - free house wine (and yes they bring refills)!  Plan on $25-40/person depending on how nuts you want to get.  The garlic bread is a particular winner.

nUSi5X3lr3Cmn9RvMyAGyw.text: I would've had a better evening if I stayed home and opened a can of SpaghettiOs. That is an insult to whoever makes SpaghettiOs. We had four different dishes, each one came with the same tasteless brown colored tomato sauce, unless you consider tin a flavor. Everything on the menu was overpriced they include house wine that tasted like vinegar, the soup was lukewarm, have no idea what the salad tasted like, the garlic bread was exactly that garlicky nothing else to it except grease. Plus it cost $13.00 to split a meal. Worst food ever.

_sodGCaJZOgRkotg6HxDOA.text: Seriously the best meal I had in vegas. If you are looking for Italian, this is where to go. Bread, salad (or minestrone), WINE, and cappuccino are all included. The service was great. The good was amazing. And the price was better than anywhere else we ate.

YMOlkgvGCrbQsPyptCZABQ.text: Never a bad experience.  I always make a reservation to make sure am not having to  wait. The food is always delicious. I was only  able to dine there once a year visiting but now that I moved to Vegas it sure is great to visit a couple times a month. A must go

HrPyOGe_9idnupXdsth4tg.text: Ate there on Valentines Day while on my trip to Vegas with a friend. An hour long wait. The food was decent, reasonably priced, and the service was excellent. How can you beat all-inclusive price for dinner (salad or soup, entree, cappuccino, and wine) in Vegas for under $30/pp. Fun atmosphere. Accordian player was adorable.

YI0Nvq4EpU0XFBELYjW-1g.text: Food is great and all but waaaaay expensive!!!! The all you can drink wine is great but not tasty. Definitely the right "date-place"!

X2B5gT73yoT3IWUM89Z1tg.text: I have been coming here for over 25 years and have always considered this one of my favorite Vegas attractions. I went here Friday night and took my wife for the first time. We did have to wait about an hour, but luckily the bar was open and we had a couple of drinks. The food is pretty good, not perfect, but considering you get soup or salad, pasta, bread, and a wonderful cappuccino (favorite), and unlimited wine for around $25, it's tough to beat. Got plenty well liquored up pre-evening and would recommend this place for a old-time Vegas mobster feel.

HsavXAT6BWZhddya31sNTg.text: Abundant portions of good food and never ending supply of red and white wine and garlic bread. Can't go wrong. Also this place has got character in excess; an adorable old man plays the accordion and chats with you as he did once with Elvis Presley, Frank Sinatra, and Dean Martin.

NSXsqv-_HapAOUqCwagEaA.text: I read the reviews and should have steered away...but it looked interesting.  Salad was wilted, menus are on the wall, with no explanation so you are ordering blind, service was NOT with a smile from the bartender to the waitress, to the server who helped the waitress, and the waitress never checked back to see how everything is.  Terribly overpriced for what you get, and as an Italian, this does not even pass for a facsimile thereof!  Stay away for sure.  I only gave them one star, as I had to fill something in, they should get no stars!

zCkeOSdR5PHRSy_oY0MNMA.text: Let's start with the positives.  I like the atmosphere.  The little guy playing the accordion is cool.  OK, I'm done.  The wine is served in large quantities, but it is not good.  Stay away from the white wine.  It's bad.  Don't drink the white wine, man.  The food is not good.  I would say the food tasted like ass, but that would be mean.  There are better Italian restaurants in your home town.  Frequent a nice, independent Italian restaurant when you get back home.

2DECrukmumziXTBI20idTA.text: I would give this place an extra half star for the memorabilia if I could.  This place is classic old Italian.  It has a half barrel for a front door and no windows that I could see.  It is a little dark and all the walls are lined with classic photos of mid-century movie stars, movers and shakers, et cetera.. I didn't know who everybody was but these walls are definitely preserving unique Vegas history.  The food is solid Italian with four prix fixed menus to choose from that all offer all you can drink wine, soup or salad, and a cappuccino to end your meal properly.    The service was excellent and I thought the 20-30 dollar a person price with all that it included was a good value.

ij6NApIJaWsCzdYSUrS2Dg.text: Very charming place inside an old strip mall off the strip.  Old style Italian food with a sense of humor.  Pretty reasonable, big portions.  Menu is small, written on the wall.    I had a special mushroom ravoli, it was really good.  Salad was token iceburg with a huge slice of salami on top (yuck...  guess they don't get many vegetarians!?).  Garlic bread is huge and greasy.  Love that you get a carafe of wine with the meal.  Classy.    Sweet old accordian player comes to seranade you.  He had a WI Badger sticker on the accordian and we told him we were from Wisconsin so he played the On Wisconsin song for us.    Cute.  Definately an experience!...  a change from the glitz of the strip!

o7FA6VkIG6Hf9B9UZ2kwkw.text: I like this place :) I lived in Vegas back in 2002 and would take visitors here before going to the strip. The food is good, the wine is free (not top of the line, but what do you really expect for free?) and the service has always been good.   I just moved back and I thought it was just as I remembered. Great place to have a date :) I got the eggplant parm, which I thought was good. Eggplant can go badly and this one definitely did not!  I still think it's a fun place to eat and will continue to bring my friends here for a meal when they come to visit.

OzhI-uJ7No15AA_pIc1BNw.text: Ate here for a wedding rehearsal dinner. The fare was good, the portions were HUGE though. I flove eggplant parm but couldnt eat more than half of my plate.   The most adorable old man on the planet was there playing the accordion and serenaded the bride and groom, it was good stuff.   The cappuccino was PHENOMENAL. I regret not grabbing a second cup before leaving Vegas.

YXn5zPGPI_qkfJ25FBUYhg.text: Man, talk about a rough crowd!  Battista's is the perfect place to go with family or a group of people you want to share a great experience, dinner and set the stage for some memorable times.  Battista's offers just that and more.  Contrary to the many other reviews here, we had wonderful food, and got to share the experience with 15+ family members.  Aside from one particular grump at the table, EVERYONE loved the food and had an amazing time, and we were paid a visit .  Yeah, the wine is a little "off" but hey, it's a package deal.  Up the ante if you want something more and stop complaining.    Folks, this is a Las Vegas landmark.  If you're up for a good time, great company, and yummy food, hit up Battista's with an open mind and you will not be disappointed.  In fact, you'll walk out the door saying "I'm hot tonight!"

TzwZ3RRtboLjIK600svMbA.text: This place is so over rated, it's not even funny.    First of all, way to expensive. 20 plus dollars for everything. Any type of pasta dish is over 20 bucks.    Secondly the food. I ordered the veal parma. It was not fresh, it tasted frozen and reheated. Not mention it was over thirty dollars. They serve it with a side of some green stuff I couldn't make out what is was. Maybe spinach. Tasted like dirt. It also came with a side of pasta. Under cooked. I tried my wives pasta, it to was under cooked.    It's a bottomless house wine place. I think the price of this place is trying to make up for this free house wine.   I was celebrating my return to work and my wife's vacation. A friend of mine joined us. He has been here at this restaurant fifteen years ago. He warned us it isn't all that. I never have been here before.I should of took his advise and went to my favorite Italian restaurant down the street. Bucca di Beppo (it would of been a lot cheaper also). Did I mention I know the ex-chef. I'll be sending him a personal note also.  The other reviews I have read talks a lot about the ambience. It seemed old. It looked like it needed a good cleaning threw out the dinning area. I didn't feel like home. I'm Italian and this is not 'authentic' italian food. I know authentic and the difference of re-heated.   All in all I will not be returning to this place ever....

YBFsdtY5fwHbP1cqDpaXNA.text: Ok...I see the reviews that talk about long waits, high prices, poor wine and poor food....but honestly..my wife and I loved this place!    Everyone has to rate it on their own experience and let me tell you about ours...it was the highlight of our food experiences while in Vegas!  We had NO wait...we came early (5pm) by Vegas standards since we were meeting friends later..and although it filled up quickly, we were seated immediately.  Hint: go early.  Solid value...Not sure if bad reviews about price are from folks that frequent McDonald's, but I thought price was fine.  We spent more money at a couple casino food courts that had absolutely horrible food....and spent 4 x the price at a steak house that, although good, did not satisfy us like batistas.    Food and wine were super!  I am not much for wine...my wife is a good bit more discerning in this area...but we both enjoyed the complimentary red and white.  If you have to have high end stuff...buy it...but batistas version is fine and heck, it costs the same amount to have a sip or to have multiple carafs...we chose the latter approach and enjoyed a bunch of red and white...and it tasted better with every sip.  As for the food...we come from a solid Italian community with lots of good home grown restaurants that make olive garden seem inadequate...and we really enjoyed our food at batistas.  I had veal, my wife had some type of shrimp dish... we had a good bit of it before the wine clouded our judgement, and it was well prepared, large portions, and very tasty.    So....GO!   You'll love the atmosphere...the pictures, the dark, the small cut up rooms, the garlic bread, the wine, the food, the value, the desert cappacino, and the little ol guy....we will definitely be back!

L9ylZK9eu80_2DN0qrUsbA.text: I thought the food here was horrible and overpriced.     I'm surprised it has such good review.  Sorry I went here.  It was just poorly prepared foo.

kDgkqaDvOVAcBZfThRU-aQ.text: Not good. Everything tastes canned and low quality. The minestone is absolutely gross and the pasta sauce just seems like tomato paste, water and a few cheap herbs. Nothing was really great at this place. The atmosphere could really work if this place had halfway decent food. It's very expensive for what you actually get. No one I was with finished their meal and it wasn't because they were full. Yuck!

dPlYI8V43zS2nVJ_yMGOKA.text: In town for another week/end in Las Vegas, this was a consensus pick for a "night on the town" dinner destination.  It's an "italian family style" type place, though the particular style of Battista's marks it as a uniquely Vegas location.  The menu is on the wall- 15 choices ranging from spaghetti to "Steak Caruso".  Free white and red wine is included with the meal.  The portions are enormous.  My veal parmesan was terrible, but I was expecting the food to be terrible, so it wasn't that big a deal.  The free cappucinio that came with the meal was hot chocolate?  Why don't they just put it on the menu like that?  The cheesy decor is fun.

_UnZcZo4w-Lv25ExBDGMlg.text: Wine included with your meal?  No cheesy casino 'rings' around it?    Great Italian, family style cuisine...good ambience, and great for big groups...celebrated a fantastic birthday here with friends during a birthday debauchery weekend..and it was NICE to get the hell off the strip for a bit (how much strip can one person take at a time?)  There was this cute old man who played the accordion and serenaded me too..  Loved it. GO! Get the hell off the strip.

75CUY1_76Mgy_WDmFratCw.text: Another classic in homely Italian eateries. Not to pompous, not to flashy. Just good food, with good people. Just as I said before with my review of Volare back home in San Diego, just come to eat for a good time and don't expect a flashy scene and you'll have a blast with good food. And Hello, endless wine! 5 stars just for that.   Great atmosphere, great food, great experience.

eroXRDR7SiKZIU0yIsBakw.text: We asked about this place at our poker table. A local told us "everyone should experience Battista's.". It's a family run Italian restaurant located between Flamingo and Bally's. It is not in a casino, but is located by a mini-mart. Reservations are recommended and it is only open for dinner (4:00 - 10:00). All meals include garlic bread, soup or salad, all the wine you can drink (house wine red or white only) and a cappuccino. We had the lasagna and chicken parmesan, which came with a side of pasta. Complete meals range from $20 to $40. A little old Italian guy goes from table to table and plays his accordion for tips.  The food was OK, nothing great. The wine was not good, but it was free. The garlic bread was great and the cappuccino was excellent (and I don't like coffee).

Rgc8WEwdkil00IvpPUFr1Q.text: What a blast! This place was recommended by someone from home (Boston, MA) to our traveling group of 8 and we figured why the hell not.  They pack you in there, but that was half the fun-- there was even a rehearsal dinner while we were there and the whole room stopped to hear the toast of thanks from the bride to be. Very cozy. The accordion player is a real delight as well.  Overall-- fantastic! My lasagna was to die for and soup or salad, red and white wine and cappuccino are all included in the meals, priced about $20-30.  I really do love the glitz and glamour of Vegas, but this was a nice respite, and so close by, for one meal.

kZrGLRePd9fnfuGNII7EmQ.text: Need an additional star for this restaurant, the atmosphere, service and food were ALL very good! I'll be back!!!

j6hBevZiY4Mgi7FguPcADA.text: If you go to Vegas occasionally or are just looking for that local Italian Mom and Pop restaurant, Battista's is the place to go!   Battista's is  just a block off the center of the strip right by Bally's and the ambiance is a fun Bucca Di Peppo like feel but with TRUE Vegas style and history!   The portions of the food are HUGE and quite delicious coming from a True Italian- the garlic bread is UNBELIEVABLE and added bonus you get free unlimited table wine with your meal.

kJTbxPDzywc5n5zTEqRP7Q.text: Nothing that I ate here stood out, and it was not a particularly cheap place.   I had the broiled catch of the day (Salmon that day), and while the cut of fish was good, the glaze was meh, and the side vegetables were bordering on mushy.   I tried some of the included pasta that was being passed around our massive table of 20+ folks, and it was also meh. I tend to judge italian places by the quality of their marinara, and I wasn't impressed - it was flat tasting and didn't seem particularly fresh.  The redeeming qualities of this place are the all-italian, make you feel like you're in Brooklyn staff, and the unlimited house wine (which was surprisingly OK).   The accordion player was so genuinely happy to be there and playing his accordion for us, and I'd say he was the highlight of my night.   With all of the similarly priced yet exceptional food in Vegas, it's hard to say that I would make an effort to come back, but it was nice for a single visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ts5EQRO3WgYwUMgbtiIqVg.text: This restaurant is a gem just off the Strip.  Plenty of free parking and easy access.  While the meals are priced in the moderate range they do include extras that a lot of other restaurants charge extra.  A soup/salad, garlic bread, cappuccino, house wine are all included in the price.  Chicken Parm is around $30, steaks around $40 and lasagna/veals around $35.  Service was great, food tasted great and serving size were adequate.  Management was attentive to the patrons and made their rounds.

yy2PtFcoNx886A6VFd7tnA.text: Love the food. Love the ambience. Love the accordion player. Ditch the "me-too" places on the strip for this Vegas original.

jC2d5Jxit5lnia7TAIY6zg.text: I was hopeful.  I really was.  The pics looked pretty good.  I may be jaded having just returned from Italy for 10 days.    The people next to me kept saying "this is DAMN GOOD bread!"  Over and over.  Did I have a different recipe?  It was hard and crusty and for the most part, cut the inside of my mouth.    I ordered the soup.  A salad came out.  They fixed that right away.    House wine was a C-.  Spaghetti and meatballs were gummy.  Portion was huge.  The noodles tasted like they had been cooked in stale water or something. No flavor at all   The service was amazing, I must say.  They were quick and attentive and very nice to this gal dining alone. There was a long wait when I left.  Place was packed.    I don't get it.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House white.

JHQ8HV3HamXBrEjUDdiO2w.text: Had been to Battista's several years ago, and it has gone downhill in a hurry.  Meals are $20-$40 and come with soup or salad, garlic bread, and unlimited red and white wine.  Servers were great, very attentive and an older gentleman named Gordon plays his accordion at your table.  For that reason alone I add the second star.  Beware....the wine is not drinkable.  The salad didn't appear fresh and was served so quickly that they had to be mass produced and sitting around in the kitchen.  The meatballs were good, but the sausage was lacking in taste.  We had ravioli and spaghetti as well, I can't believe how bad the sauce was....bitter and tasteless.  There has to be better Italian food in Vegas....and I'll be searching for it next visit.

F2zYApdDRvBDKeh4Dbd3wg.text: Parking (4/5): Parking is easy to find right outside of the building and there are plenty of spots available. It's kind of dirty, but its not a big issue unless if you are planning to eat in the lot.  Ambiance (1/5): Light is very dark. When I walked into the restaurant, I felt like a navy seal trying to break into Binladen's compound using night vision goggles. They seriously need to lighten up this joint. Noise level is average for your average Italian restaurant.  Service (2/5): I had reserved a table for 4 and we were sited immediately when our full party arrived. I would recommend reserving a table ahead of time, especially on weekend. The server was very good, he got us the wine and garlic bread right after we ordered and he wasn't annoying like other places where waiters keep bothering you to see how you are doing. Also, avoid the musician whom goes from table to table literally playing nothing but a small tune and you feel obligated to give him money.   Food (4/5): Food is pretty good.  Meals range from $23-45 and they courses contain salad/soup, garlic bread, house wine (red/white), entree, and a cappuccino. I ordered salad, which was good; it wasn't drenched in dressing like many other places. House wine is all you can drink, but you get what you pay for.  Garlic bread was pretty good. It wasn't overly laced with garlic butter, so it complemented well with the main entree. My main entree was sausage with penne and meat sauce. Meat sauce was delicious, not to sour, and just the right amount of sweetness. The spicy sausage was amazing in flavor and it was cooked to perfection. The best part of the meal was cappuccino, which comes with all meals and it was one of the best post meal hot-dessert I've ever had.   Overall (3/5), it's a decent off the strip joint. The prices are very reasonable for good meals, but the ambiance and service does need some work.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage with meat sauce and penne.

ztqfODcsObGJcBM2VPCjmw.text: Batista's was recommended to my husband and myself by a coworker and I wish we hadn't heeded her suggestion...  The ambiance in the place was cluttered and cloistering.   I get what they are going for, an obviously have been working on it forever, but the place could really use a sprucing up after all these years...  There are no menus they are just plastered on the walls ...EVERY wall. Entrees run $28 to $38 dollars and include free house wine (which should be a trigger) soup or salad, garlic bread, a pasta side if your entee does not include pasta, and a cup of cappuccino.  Maybe I'm a food snob, but this place needs Kitchen Nightmares called on it!  To start with, the free house wine tasted like grape juice and vinegar and was completely undrinkable. The salad was served overdressed in Italian dressing, which made the lettuce soggy.  This was the oddest salad I'd ever been served.  It included a single black olive, a single grape tomato, one whole pepperoncini, sliced carrots, a huge slice of salami, and a big chunk of cheese.  The "garlic" bread did not taste of garlic at all. It just tasted like Parmesan cheese and Italian seasoning on really greasy bad bread.  My husband ordered the shrimp scampi and he said that the shrimp was pretty good but the rest was just average. I ordered the chicken parmesan. The pasta side dish with cooked fine and the sauce was not bad. The chicken was cooked properly but the giant hunk of melted mozzarella did nothing to cover up the fact that the breading on the chicken soggy and tasteless.   The topper was the side of creamed spinach... call 1973 they want their side dish back!  Our water was served in plastic cafeteria cups and the cup of cappuccino at the end of the meal was served in a plastic mug.  It tasted like powdered cappuccino mix, but was honestly probably the best part of the meal!  I would give Battista's 1 star for the food but the service was not bad so I'm giving them 2.  What we thought might be a rare gem off the strip turned out to be nothing to write home about...  Don't bother wandering off to a bad part of town looking for good food... stay in your hotel.. there's bound to be better food there!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm...
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What passes for salad...
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A menu.. on EVERY wall..

80gcO75u1D4Mk_VSP9i6vQ.text: Pretty good tourist-y Vegas destination for Italian food near the Strip.   Slightly pricy, but the menu is all-inclusive with the entree, soup/salad, unlimited wine, side orders, bread, and cappuccino.  If I had any complaints, it'd be the price (which is to be expected from a touristy area and the lack of notice that the dinners also come with creamed spinach.  (I'd have asked them to leave it off my plate.)  Otherwise, the service was good and they accept reservations, which is always a plus in Vegas.

pbhQcNMCiN4iXtQoqHcE7Q.text: It was an hour wait so the two of us sat in the bar and Amanda was our server! She gave the best customer service. Definitely coming back here again for our next visit to Vegas!   Food was great! Cappuccino is a must. Sweet and Delish!

jR3---6g2NFKwqUk1EpkKw.text: Incredible ambiance, great service, awesome food!  From salad to the cappuccino at the end of the meal and the cutest accordion player ever.  We each enjoyed 4 different dishes - lasagna, cannelloni, sausage and veal - loved all of them!  Will definitely be back.

HFf0tGrLrHvJI08Og4KZuw.text: This place was extremely good! Friendly service. With two of us, we got 2 carafes of wine: a red and white. The wine was actually good! We also got soup or salad, amazing garlic bread, our entree and cappachino with our meal! Everything was excellent! It was all for about $25 a person.  Also a cute old guy came over and played the accordion and sang an individualized song to each table!   Go there and you won't be sorry. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine!

9Tezw53nPUTYiof1tDZIwA.text: Mediocre at best. Service below par. Food bland. The accordion player is cool.  This place was on my bucket list for years.  Oh well ... disappointing.

vUulMR93CaiZxCELVVhNfA.text: I don't usually give 5 stars, but when I do, it involves home made food and drink with a wandering accordion player.  This was an incredible meal and even being with 15+ people, the speed we got our food was impressive and the overall service was excellent. Cannot go wrong with any of the specials either, make it a point to get here.

pUpx8TjvQRGlwdeXqurWiw.text: This place was pretty good but I think it's overpriced. They give you all you can drink red and white wine and some delicious garlic bread. It tasted like every other Italian place I have been and nothing really stood out to me. I ordered the manicotti and it was very tasty.

4DNB8X5MYiX8UHccIaE3hQ.text: Very good authentic italian place! Went here for birthday celebration!  Beautiful  inside very decorative! :plates are  exellemt! Kinda pricey but worth it! Average plate is 30.95 but includes soup or salad and endless red or white wine also garlic bread and desert is a scrumptious cappuccino!  So alot included! Servive is awesome  rigjt on point very attentive! !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup and red wine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall of shot bottles!

MaKZmoL8nPDK2yBw2EmHeQ.text: I would give it 3 stars for food, 4 for atmosphere,  and 5 for wine. Wife and I shared the lasagne. Comes with a nice salad and bread. $13 extra for sharing. Which is ok because you get an extra salad, bread, cappuccino and of course wine. All the food was fair. Nothing great nothing bad. Atmosphere was old school Italian,  very inviting.  Menus were on the wall.  You get red and/or white a bottle of wine on your table. Cappuccino was definitely Americanized,  very sweet with whipped cream on top. Good but not Italian (breakfast drink in Italy). Accordion player worked a tip out of us. Pretty old guy, didn't really play well but was nice. I would go back for atmosphere and wine.

1Wp9HCS7JlH8YxKEbnyKKQ.text: Poppa was our waiter, whom we always ask for. We come here 3-4 times a year from San Diego. This is old school Italian dining at its best. Chicken parm..spinach is awesome. We add garlic to ours...Yum. Make sure you ask for Poppa..Great guy!

zM2Vix9bb1k-IUnlGsYyhA.text: This was recommended by our PinkJeep tour guide as we went past the restaurant on the way out to Red Rock. He told us about the neat interior and the history behind the restaurant. We decided to make reservations for our last night in Las Vegas. He was spot on in his recommendation. It was a good thing we made reservations as they were solidly booked and had people waiting. The interior walls are filled with pictures of famous people, some signed and some not. Menu was  on a board by the table. Included in the meal is garlic bread(fantastic), soup or salad, white and/or red wine(a carafe of each), the main entree and a cappuccino at the end. Portions were enormous, but authentic. We were so glad we checked it out. I think it will be one of our must dos when we visit Vegas!

GQeY-dyZaifMgJbcS5eC2A.text: One of the best restaurants in Vegas. You can't beat delicious Italian food, all you can drink wine and the best cappuccinos. It gets really busy so earlier is better.

v0RRcw737pj6FD1WtS681g.text: This restaurant is the epitome of a hole in the wall, a place you would never think to stop by but is quite a find. To keep it simple, the food is amazing, the prices are right, and the service is excellent. We stepped in, as it was a minute walk from our hotel, and we were all glad we did. As a family of five and knowing their portions were large we got three dinners and passed them around. The lasagna, ravioli, and sausage and peppers were all delicious. Along with the meal you get bottomless red and white wine, salad or soup, and homemade cappuccinos.  The environment is very homey and the service topped it off to make the experience memorable. If you're in the mood for some traditional Italian food, I would definitely recommend you check out this hole in the wall.

qmzekF9exxTnqs3SACGHBA.text: THIS IS A TOURIST TRAP! Don't bother with this hole in the wall. We live in Vegas and there are so many delicious Italian restaurants to go to, specially so close to the Strip. I had a Groupon and figured we would give this place a try. It wasn't worth the $100+ (before groupon was applied) for a party of 4 and a baby.   The unlimited wine was absolutely nasty, the red as well as the white. The garlic bread was greasy and don't get me started on the cappuccino that was just a water down sugary instant coffee mix of some sort...  Now for the main dish. I had the veal parmigiano. It was really big but a bit soggy and the breading was thicker than the meat itself. The side dish of pasta marinara was so small my 21 month old son ended eating all of it as well my husband's and still wanted more. At least he enjoyed it, but I couldn't tell you how they were cooked since I didn't have not one bite, that's how small it was...  I'm very disappointed and would not go back there again! Spend your money on the Strip or even at Buca di Beppo right down the street. I would give this place a big fat 0 star if I could... just sad food

5ImiHwg0yIXnUXQGwAvm6g.text: I read several reviews before coming here. I was a little apprehensive due to some of the negative comments but one of the girls I was traveling with kept raving about the place and wanted to stop by.   I have to preface this with the fact that I wasn't expecting much since my expectations were so low it wasn't hard to exceed them.   I thought the food was great! I had the fettucino alfredo and it was decent, flavorful and fresh. Was it the best alfredo? No. Was it good, yes.   This place is more about the ambiance and history. It's an all inclusive price for each meal (ranging from $22 - $40). My dish included all you can drink red and white wine. The red wine was "meh" but it was free so no complaints here. Not a fan of white wine so I didn't really enjoy it.   The salad was surprisingly simple and tasty. The garlic bread was fresh and tasted great. The after dinner cappuccino wasn't very good, super sweet and luke warm.   All in all, I would recommend this place especially if you're with a group of people. If you want an amazing, fancy dinner this isn't your place. If you want to experience a local eatery with a lot of charm and decent food, then this is your place. Keep in mind that the dinner is somewhat pricey but you get a ton of food!   As they promised - it's a "hole in the wall" and they delivered.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken alfredo

cTPSWnaT6A6lrRLtU3V5qQ.text: We just went to Battista's last night, 10/2/17 and we were really impressed. The service was awesome and the different dishes were brought out to us at just the right times. The portions were great and everything tastes awesome.  I had the veal parmigiana and my wife had the chicken parmigiana. I had the salad and my wife had the soup. Both came with garlic bread, house wine, a side of pasta and a capacino. I didn't realize it came with the side of pasta and wanted to order a side of spaghetti, so I was really happy that it came with the meal.  Both dishes and all of the sides tasted great. I don't like wine, but my wife said it was pretty good. Kind of about what you'd expect for a house wine that is included with your meal.  The side to the main course was spinach. I personally don't like spinach, but I did try it. It had good flavors, but I couldn't get past the texture. My wife thought it was good though.  Overall, I was very impressed with Battista's and would happily go back again and will be sure to tell my friends to go there.

GdI4qVqd4Q-iXE7xZCAu3g.text: Excellent service. The garlic bread was great. We had the lasagna and eggplant parmigiana. Very good and the sauce was delicious. The cappuccino was outstanding. The salad and minestrone were also very good.

hb0W3D8J0JGpJ4sq4Ur0EA.text: So let's break it down: first impressions. Kind of dark, interesting atmosphere. If you're tall, take off your ball cap so nothing bops you on the head. Got sat, and was greeted about five minutes later. Water and drinks were brought by ten minutes later. Unlimited red and white wine that my companion liked. The tables are placed in such a manner that you are very intimate with other tables. Garlic bread was brought out and it was delicious. Some of the best I've ever had. I ordered minestrone and the lobster raviolli, and my companion ordered eggplant parm. Both were very good, even though I felt my portion was a little small. But I'm also a big guy. Following the meal they present you with a cappuccino that tastes more like hot chocolate. Overall a good meal, with everything included in the price you see on the menu, which is on the wall if you're looking for it. I'll probably go back next time I'm in Vegas.

B_k3zuOLjjuISIfV1ghOpw.text: Honestly my favorite Italian food ever!!!! Great quality and the bread and salad is terrific!!! Free wine and reasonable prices!   It's my go to spot every time I come to vegas

40HgJJRqxbQ0EDWHGWEA1g.text: This was a great experience!  This was prob the best Italian I had!  The food was amazing and everything that you get for the price is the best deal around!  You get two bottles of house wine, salad or soup, the best garlic bread I ever had and desert with your meal for about $30. Absolutely an amazing place will recommend to everyone!

YSf816rOTa52ZfZd99Da3Q.text: Interesting decor, mediocre food, slightly creepy accordion player.   Free wine with dinner was horrible and food comes out on carts - looks like they are serving a huge number of people as quick as they can.  Salads were made way ahead (not good) and pasta was just ok.   Large volume of food at reasonable (for Vegas) price

96gFArVD2C77k19f47TqKg.text: Best cappuccino ever! And even more awesome that it's complimentary along with house wine, salad, and breadsticks! Fast service,  reasonably priced and great taste!

9v_XyaZbANKbClBKK_Y9Fg.text: This place. It's like a step back in time. Do yourself a favor and enjoy some amazing Italian food. We thoroughly enjoyed it.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W9pqrlnA0cflco8rzst8sg.text: Cool casual vibe, dimmed lights and awesome service. Place was a bit warm maybe because it's starting to get cold outside. Food was AMAZING! We went during dinner so it comes with complementary red and white wine for the entire table. At the end of dinner they give you cappuccino too which is the best I have ever had! Definitely will be back!

oITBH9X9a6H4BjMe0ZsaGw.text: Amazing  spaghetti  and meat sauce !!  All the house white or  red and the best cappuccino come with your meal. Nice comfortable atmosphere to enjoy with a loved one or a group of friends. Will definetly be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3c2YNt_LdL-7z5KM57P_Qg.text: What a great find. Interesting place with great ambiance and delicious food. Includes house wine, garlic bread and cappacino!!  Plus the old man with the accordion was Great! Go if you can because it's worth it.
