aMz8tSVAfWwJORY58YcPZg.text: Loved everything about this place. It is a truly old-school nostalgic restaurant right off the Las Vegas trip. When you enter there is an old man named Gordy who plays an accordion who tells stories about how Sinatra and the Rat Pack were regulars here.  The place is filled with pictures and autographs of stars and singers from the Vegas heyday. What is amazing as soon as they seat you they bring two kinds of house wine which is included with your meal. The wine is very good as well.  You also get oversized garlic bread and a great Italian salad with really good dressing before your meal. The seats are very big but the waiters and waitresses are awesome and friendly. I had the egg plant Parmesan which was fantastic and I also was thrilled because they brought out cappuccino with whip cream to end the meal. I think my total bill was about $38 but it was well worth it.  Definitely will go back.

rFvTi_5F4MFBa0YW59AwFw.text: We've been going here for years.  A definite drop in the quality of the food , stale garlic bread, mediocre salad and bland pasta. What happened to this fun place?  I know they are busy but we felt really rushed like they needed the table but there were plenty of empty tables.   Sad to see the decline of this once great place

8vmXyudFLUzG6ZLALGdL5A.text: Went for a surprise birthday dinner for my wife. Host was great. But thats it. Server didn't get to use for 15 minutes, we asked for drinks and he responded"we will get to that what do you want to eat" after 30 minutes we got our drinks with our food. Steaks were horrible- overcooked and cold imagine that. Garlic bread is delicious though. Bill was $700 and i would of been happier eating at a burger joint.

Gf-Vd8jhC27tDk2T_6EpuA.text: Amazing! Great wine! Great food! Great atmosphere! 100% recommend!!! We cannot wait to return and share Battista's with family and friends.

dHvrgL1q_yc4M6Sv1vEMZA.text: Appetizer is good, main course a disaster and dessert a corn sirup nightmare. The wine (red) is very good for the price. Service is above average. Would I go back? Never, the main course was so bad (chicken alfredo, sauce not to be identified, wife said it tastes of vomit and the meat sauce was anything but Italian).  Sorry guys, you can do so much better with less and keep the wine and the price and get rid of the corn sirup.  Classic Vegas???? I would dare challenge that as Vegas has a bit more to offer than a dark ambiance.  Fellow eaters be warned...... you will be disappointed and risk Diabetes mellitus....

ABLJctESnG2-xOJ4e8RwBA.text: Hole in the wall is right. I've lived in LV for 4 years and finally decided to try this joint. At first I was impressed.... Great decor, dim lighting atmosphere, Dino Spimoni playing, an accordion man, good eye candy staff. Then we saw the forced menu (red house wine was great by the way!!!!!) im a fairly picky eater but managed the chicken vegetable soup (minus big vegetable chunks, mostly sipped the broth). Only got 1 thing of garlic bread, Homie asked if we wanted more but never brought it. Uuhhh what a tease I wanted more garlic bread. I ended up ordering the Ziti with 2(haha 2 balls) 2 meat balls. These meatballs looked like they were seared for a mere 30 seconds, my friends was basically just raw meat rolled in a ball. I took one bite and didn't wanna risk food borne illness (plus I fear vomiting more than anything in this world). The price was high. The Cappuccino was 99% hot chocolate 0.5 cappuccino, and 0.5 hot gas. I'm so frill never again will I endure the pain, suffering and agony of Battistas. My friend and I came to the conclusion ex WWE superstar Batista is the owner and if you bad mouth it he'll come out and give you a Batista Bomb!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My ultra rare meatballs (complete with food borne illness)

WsdnGgDqhGmBwOGZn37ODw.text: Great ambiance and good food. Lot's of history in this place. The cappuccino after dinner is the bomb. I had the chicken parmigiana and it was pretty good. Nice portion too. Free red & white wine while you dine also.

Gfs-hbumdgbcCB8rS2dbxQ.text: Unlimited wine! Red and white wine are place on the table as soon as you are seated they are complementary, the pastas are simple not the best but still good. Would visit again it's a cute little place and the service was great.

qZTQsXZV_AqGmeZRBoQzNQ.text: Simone and I have always loved Battista's Hole In the Wall located just off the strip in Las Vegas. It has an old Vegas vibe, and always has very good home cooked Italian food.  We first went to Battista's during our honeymoon on the advise of a travel book and we have been back three or four times since. With our vacation winding down and the reality of going back to our everyday world creeping in, we decided what better way to cheer ourselves up then to visit our old standby.  Although located in a easy to miss small strip mall behind the Flamingo Hotel and Casino Battista's is always busy, no matter what time or what day you go, be prepared to either make a reservation or wait for at least 15 minutes. They are only open for dinner and locals and tourists alike fill up the many tables quickly.  Waiting for a table at Battista's is torture for the soul. As you sit and take in the many pictures of celebrities, the mini Liquor bottle collection and the strange Knic-knacks that fill the ceiling you are overcome by the delicious aroma from the kitchen of fresh baked Garlic Bread and Ripe Tomato Sauce. After about a 15 minute wait Simone and I were led to a table in one of the side rooms. It was only a few seconds before the waitress got to our table with two full pitchers of House Red and White Wine. This is one of the wonderful surprises that you get at Battista's. With every meal comes lots of House Red and White wine, and while a wine snob may not find this to be the best they have ever tasted, to a Maine redneck like me, it is perfection in a pitcher. Also free with the meal is some very toasty Garlic bread that is pasted with crushed whole cloves of garlic. Don't worry about saving the bread for dinner, when you finish it they'll bring you more... Each meal also comes with Minestrone Soup or a fresh Italian Salad with house made vinaigrette, salami, cheese, tomatoes and an olive.  We have never had the soup ( don't want to fill up on all that broth) but we do enjoy the salad. To finish off the free stuff you also get a side of basic pasta with your choice of sauce. There are no menus on the table at Battista's. They are posted on the wall of every room. Although the prices at first glance seem pricey ( chicken at 27.00- insanity !) keep in mind you are getting endless wine and bread, fresh soup or salad, pasta and oh yeah, the best damn Cappuccino ever to finish the meal. More on that later. For her meal, Simone had Spaghetti and Meatballs and I ordered Veal Parmesan. While we waited for our meal we were greeted with a song from our favorite little old man accordion player. It is rumored that he has been going from table to table performing since Battista's first came to Vegas more then 30 years ago. He looks to be in his nineties, but he plays a damn good accordion, and in my opinion ( which is always correct) He really just puts the icing on the whole Battista experience. Italian wine, Italian food and Italian music. You get it all when you are here. The food arrived shortly after our evening serenade and although I have seen prettier dishes, they were cooked perfectly. The Veal was literally drowning in melted Mozzarella and fresh ripe tasting Tomato Sauce. If you do not love your cheese then avoid this. If you do love cheese ( and also baby cow) then this is the dish for you.  Along with the Veal was a side of intense flavored spinach seasoned with spices including a good dose of nutmeg. This was different but good. Simone shared her meatballs which were also very good. Large, tender and well seasoned they mixed perfectly with the tomato sauce and al dente spaghetti. Surprisingly we finished everything ( including most of the wine-yow!)   After some deliberation we decided to finish the meal with the Italian specialty Cannoli, with of course two (free) Cappuccino's. The Cannoli shell was crispy and mildly vanilla flavored while the smooth and creamy cheese filling was rich and dense.  The Cappuccino is not to be missed, it is unlike any other - Its not at all like coffee. Its not bitter but slightly chocolaty sweet and it is the perfect way to end your meal.   We love it here and would suggest it to anyone looking to get away from the craziness of the strip, get drunk on cheap wine, and have some damn good Italian food while being brought back to the old

ep71KVL7ilAamb0nSOJx5w.text: I used to really like this place. It was a must everytime I was in Vegas since the 90's. I brought someone new and I was pretty disappointed this time. I made reservations on a Saturday night for 8:30 for a party of two. We ordered two drinks a sea breeze with Shcmirnoff vodka and a gin and tonic. It was $26 for the two I was pretty surprised how expensive they were. Then we had dinner I ordered sausage Cacciatore with ziti pasta. I was surprised how small the portion was for $26 and they charge a minimum of $13 for a split fee but there is not enough food to split it. Two regular  size bowls of pasta at $26 each is outrageous?? It also comes with a salad which is also a joke it has one slice of salami which is thin enough to almost see through a few olives and one block of mozzarella about an inch and a half long. Everything is in chunks so you have to cut everything up. The plates are small so you don't have much room... The sausage Cacciatore wasn't much better. They just throw in one uncut long sausage link. My ziti was overcooked and mushy and my friend thought so as well. He wanted the spaghetti and meatballs but we were told that it has cheese in it. He can't eat cheese. Who puts cheese in their meatballs? All they suggested is it you can get spaghetti with meat sauce. How boring I felt bad. He ordered his with spaghetti and it was spot-on not overcooked it all. I was completely disappointed in my ziti pasta. I told them I wanted the the spaghetti instead since the ziti was overcooked and mushy. I could tell our waitress was not happy. No apology just brought me the tiniest little plate of spaghetti plain and then hardly saw her much after that. A different person served us cappuccinos for dessert. What they call Cappuccino is a complete joke for being an Italian restaurant. It doesn't taste anything like cappuccino it tasted more like instant hot chocolate that had way too much sugar in it. I don't know if I will ever come back again which is sad because I'm always really like this place. I was hoping to show my friend the accordion player but I was told that he was already gone for the night which was a bummer because he's been there forever... sad to say that was the worst experience I've had at Bautista's and I've probably eaten there at least a half-dozen times....

1xf6LHwSLmmtmcWMVpOD1w.text: Food was ok nothing spectacular.  could use more flavor or seasoning.  Service was good, like the concept of free wine with dinner really cool and I'm not even a wine drinker.  Don't like the menu being on the walls tacky yet fun.  Thought prices could be a little lower but factor in the free wine its cool. $25-$35 per person however this is not upscale dinning

kYlQCOlamqDO1EKKEuQ6cg.text: We are local and love this place.  If you're looking for gourmet may food this may not be the place for you.  Generous portions of old school homemade style Italian food love the chicken parm veal parm not your typical fancy upscale restaurant on the strip the accordion player no songs plays the songs and you gotta love them prices are fair at $30 for full meal with a yes cheap but drinkable Italian wine greater experience great ambiance we go there when we have friends in from out of town and sometimes when we just want a nice big Italian meal

12-ZCyQ31D9FxWp2OBsbHQ.text: If you want to find a little piece of heaven just go to Battistas Hole in the wall.  When you first arrive you will most likely notice the decorations. It reminded us of almost an Old Italian mob scene. It was all so interesting to look at and entertaining! I have never been to a restaurant that I found it entertaining just to look at the walls and ceiling. Old black and white pictures covered the walls and they hung pots, pans, and baskets to the ceiling, which I felt gave it a very Italian feeling.   Now the food; AMAZING. Seriously, I don't think I can ever, I mean ever, eat at another Italian restaurant again. First we were offered breadsticks, salad, and soup. The garlic breadstick, to die for! I have never tasted bread that has tasted so delicious; I practically filled up on those before I could even order. For the main course I ordered cheese raviolis. Those where also the best I have ever had. The cheese literally melted in your mouth like butter. I couldn't stop my self from eating! My boyfriend got the eggplant Parmesan. Now that is some good food. I highly recommend that. It is now my favorite dish out of all the restaurants we go too. Its that kind of amazingly perfect good taste that can't be described.  After we ate we thought we would go out for desert. That didn't happen though! They brought out delicious cappuccinos. (They are apart of the dinner course so you are not charged for them) They were better then any hot chocolate/coffee/cappuccino I have ever had from anywhere else. It was the perfect amount of sweet and even though I was stuffed I drank the whole cup! (Which is a decent size)  Now I am really ready to go, but wait! It was my birthday and my boyfriend had surprised them and told them when he called for the reservations. They brought out a small piece of cake. AMAZING, AGAIN! It blows my mind that every course of this meal was spot on. It seemed like it was a moist sponge cake with delicious cream on top. I could have eaten like 10 of those.  The environment was also wonderful. I forget that on the strip people just want to have a good time. So even though we felt like the guests sat to close it was actually worth it. We joked with them and had such a good time. Our waitress was so sweet. I really felt like she took excellent care of us.  Now there are two reasons way I did not give this a 5 star. The location is the first. I would have never even known it was there. It is literally a hole in the wall. The area isn't the nicest but I am always paranoid about that.  The second reason was the "lives music". This man would walk table to table and plan a small 2-second snip of a song (of his choosing) and then ask YOU for a tip. I thought it was rude because we didn't ask him to come over so being forced to tip after was a little uncomfortable. I couldn't hear him sing over his accordion so I didn't get to enjoy it anyway. We only had a five so when my boyfriend asked for change back he acted like he didn't hear him and walked away. When he made his second round he made sure not to stop at our table (even though 5 dollars was probably his best tip of the night)  Over all I say GO! We defiantly will be!

MsdpO9Kb8eC1f5VPgnr_Bg.text: AMBIANCE: Eclectic, casual and fun. It starts with the stuffed moose head over the receptionist's station dubbed, "Moose-olini" and spreads to the walls filled with tiny airline-sized bottles of booze, pictures of celebrities and anything else one can think of except the kitchen sink. Who knows everything that is stuck in the ceiling. I was almost afraid to look. One thing I am sure of--it's all been there for a very long time. ENTERTAINMENT: A tiny, wizened, ancient little man who is seemingly dwarfed by his big accordion. He comes around every half hour for about two minutes, plays very badly (in a "it's so bad it's great" sort of way), panders shamelessly for tips and then disappears (probably to get oxygen and rebuild his strength for another two minute appearance a half hour later). Ref: yelp.com/biz_photos/yNVc... CONCEPT: Charge double the value for run-of-the-mill Italian meals that are posted on a board and then try to compensate with free vino by the carafe. In a similar vein to Olive Garden, you can stuff yourself with unlimited garlic bread too. If you drink enough wine and chow down on the garlic bread, you'll enjoy the accordion serenades, go away full, and really not care about the quality of the meal and the price tag. If you're with good friends, it probably will be an enjoyable experience. OUR EXPERIENCE: We walked over to this little hole in the wall before a Penn and Teller show based on our concierge's recommendation. We drank the "free" wine, ate a lot of garlic bread, sang a lot of "Happy Birthday's" to various folks in the room, listened to the little old man butcher "O Sole Mio", and ate pasta dishes. I ordered linguini chopped clams in a white sauce for $26.95. The other dishes were all priced in the mid-twenties. My clams and linguini were of the $11.95 caliber. The wine was simply bad. In summary, Battista's must have a very good working concept to stay in business for over 3 decades. That concept just doesn't work for me. I'd even recommend the place for those in a Monty Pythonish mood and looking for "something completely different." If this is the case, just go in with the right expectations which shouldn't be centered around their culinary excellence. Battista's was the only recommendation by our excellent concierge that I don't heartily endorse.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ancient guy playing the accordian

wIPxtxaDppqLKjL-jxMXTw.text: We happened across this gem after stopping by an info booth at Paris and asking for a good italian restaurant recommendation inside Paris or Bally's so we didn't have to go outside in the cold. The woman coyly asked "Do you want a good place?", which of course we answered yes. She told us about Battista's, mentioning more than once that it was the best in town and it was owned by the mob. We asked if it was expensive and she said no, because it was owned by the mob and it wasn't in one of the casinos. We were sold and were happy to make the quick walk outside and across the street to check it out.  The ambiance is charming. A sweet man was working outside and opening the door for guests to get in from the cold. Once inside, it was dark and cluttered with random memorabilia of all kinds. We knew immediately this was going to be good. It's what a lot of restaurant chains try to accomplish but this place did authentically. It was going to be an hour to an hour and a half wait, but neither of us seemed to mind, so we grabbed a seat in the bar area and had a glass of wine and some calamari.  The calamari was very tender and a good snack while we waited.   We were seated about an hour later, taken to the back corner of one of the seating sections. Every meal comes with soup or salad, garlic bread, free house wine (red or white) and a homemade cappuccino. All for about $25 for the basic half of the menu, up to $35 for some of the fancier options. They only have 25 items on their menu, and I'm sure they make them all exactly like your sweet Italian grandmother would. It was comfort food at it's best. The salad was simple, but a nice start to the meal. The garlic bread was perfect, toasted so it was crunchy on the outside with a garlic mixture and cheese on top. Once the entrees came, we were just so pleased. The portions were hearty, and you could taste the tradition and love that went into the food. It was simple and classic and delicious! The wine isn't incredible, but it's not bad either, and pairs very well with the food (I'm guessing they use the same wine to cook with). And where else on the strip can you get a full meal for $25 that includes all the wine you can drink?!?  Then, the perfect ending to the meal was the cappuccino they bring you (also included). It comes topped with whipped cream and has a lovely flavor (maybe amaretto?) that just made me melt into my seat in our cozy little corner of the restaurant. It was the perfect ending to our meal experience, no additional dessert required (though it's available if you want to add it on).   And Gordy! Gordy is the sweet, little (seriously, he is tiny) old man that walks around playing the accordion (and has been since 1981). As he approached our table, I wasn't trying to avoid making eye contact like i would most musicians in restaurants when I'm trying to eat. He was just cheerful and pleasant and adorable. He played a short song for me and my friend and was just cuter than words can describe.   If you are looking for deluxe, high end italian fusion, Battista's in not the place for you. If you are looking for a great, classic italian meal experience, you don't want to miss this place (my friend said she hadn't had cooking like this since she was in Italy about a year ago). AND, all for a total of about $25! This is definitely on the list of places we will always stop by when we come to Vegas!

jaHqRJDoRHTFtWIufJY-Gw.text: The good: all-inclusive pricing, including house wine.  The bad: mediocre attempt at the dishes (veal piccata and eggplant parmesan) we ordered.  The meal began with a delicious bowl of garlic bread, accompanied by a poor choice of white wine (too sweet) and an adequate-but-uninteresting red. Soup or salad--one choice each and no other choices on dressing except the italian. Entrees were accompanied by a little plate of pasta (penne) and some underwhelming sauce.   Because the pricing was inclusive (hers $28; mine $32), the hit wasn't bad. But the quality was middling, at best. If we return, I'll look for something (perhaps lasagne?) more in their wheelhouse. But we'll likely just skip this in the future.

GWxNZxa9PGemhnNxgR6Iaw.text: Our group loved it! The food is excellent. At first glance the price seems high. However, with your soup or sale included with a generous entre, wine and a cappacino, the price is extremely reasonable. Cute Las Vegas atmosphere with all the private seatings. Fun place!

XZKiQxh8z3Iz-GLW7mXgDA.text: I was gonna give it 2 stars, but they do serve free red and white wine.  Price was kinda high, and the chicken fettuccine was.......bleh. Blandest i've ever had.  I know places in OREGON that truly has better tasting chicken fettuccine.  There was a lot of food, and the garlic bread was good.  Actual cloves of roasted garlic are pressed into the bread.    Really i feel it's more of the EXPERIENCE that makes this place what it is.  It's cool they have pictures of Elvis and other famous faces, but really when it comes down to italian the next time were down, we're looking for something else....BUT HEY!!! Thx for all that wine!!!

19jZdCTF0D2rb_lgN2Lpcw.text: I was truly was disappointed. I have been going here for years, but the other night was my last time. I have been tell my friend what a cool place it was. my friends meal was over cooked, sent it back and got changed more then the meal  because the waitress charged my friend for the wine, soup, bread and a minimum charge for dinning. Terrible service. The soup was being service out of a big stainless steal pot with no top, that sat on a roller cart. The cart was in the walkway with a lot of foot traffic.

rHKDIZWXwNfB3ittDVZZqQ.text: The fake Italian drawl from the server, the crappy free house wine, the mushy lukewarm minestrone soup.   The garlic bread that was more buttered than garlic....  The fettuccini Alfredo was creamy, but bland, the tastiest thing was the char grilled chicken breast slices. It was a decent amount.  However, for $27.95, I'm underwhelmed lol. Oh well!

Danc0vSwrn-ny7t9EbxamQ.text: Just barely ok.  Below average free wine.  Food looks like mass prepared in mess hall. It's ok but but not wonderfully by any stretch.   Pretty pricey for what it is - IMO.  I wouldn't go back nor recommend to any of my friends. Expected so much better.

IVWP3JYemjQ9Sw_zRflv6A.text: One of my favorite stops while in Vegas. Love the house wine, the accordion player, and by the way the food isn't too shabby either! Try the lasagna or the chicken parm; your cant go wrong with either. Save room for dessert too!

8i8HKHLrgabI5WM7SYQnww.text: For years, DH and I have wanted to visit Battista's when in Vegas.  Finally, on Wednesday, November 23, the day before Thanksgiving, we came to have dinner.  It definitely gets a star for environment.  It's like stepping into Old Vegas.  You expect to see Sinatra and his Rat Pack sitting around the corner.  DH and I commented that our parents would have been right at home in this replica of the 1960s Italian hangout.  We were seated and immediately offered red and white wine.  As the waitress said, "It's on the house."  Of course, it's on the house.  It's common red table wine, a bit vinegary for my taste but what the heck!  Immediately, DH said, "Look at the tablecloth." I glanced down to see old food stains on the tablecloth.  Don't they wash their table clothes??  Yuck!   Should have gotten up and left right there.  We saw our waitress three times.  When she brought the wine.  When she took our order.  And, when she brought the bill.  The second star goes to the young man who was the bus boy.  He took it upon himself to serve our food and check up on us.    Now, let's talk food.  Having the menu off the wall was a cute gimmick.  DH ordered the Chicken Cacciatore and I ordered the Manicotti.  His soup was ok but a bit watery with a few veggies floating on it.  I had the salad.  Really liked the dressing that came with it.  A bit strange to see a piece of lunch meat on the top of a green salad, however.  Our entrees came.  Extremely generous portions.  Both of us commented that we could have shared one dish.  DH's chicken had a very interesting sauce on top.  I've never seen an off red sauce on Chicken Cacciatore before. I had a bite and the sauce tasted like it had tons of celery.  DH liked it.  Whatever was placed in front of me was definitely not Manicotti.  Manicotti is a long tube pasta.  I got what looked like a round ravioli filled with way too much ricotta cheese.  We didn't have their dessert drink because it doesn't come decaf.  The nice bus boy brought us decaf coffee instead.  Overall, average food if the prices were low.  But, considering the prices ($20s and $30s), it's outrageously  and inexcusably bad.  Finally, I want to say something about the creepy old man with the accordion.  I know that some people think he's absolutely adorable.  Sorry, I don't share the feeling.  He really made me feel very uncomfortable by leaning into me.  I even told DH to quickly tip him so he could leave us alone.  Thankfully, he never came back for more.    We came, ate, and will never come back.

6zWiZkkJ8aFaLrYpGtVFnQ.text: This place is really good. One of the  best Italian food I've tried. I had the eggplant Parmigiana lasagna and my bf had the chicken fettucini. Both were flavorful.  It comes w/two free house wines (white and red)  and garlic bread!   My co-worker and his girlfriend recommended this place to me a while ago.  So now,  every time i'm in Vegas with just my boyfriend, this place is a MUST go to place because i'm a fan!

SH9zp25Keq_23yggSEyqGg.text: Value Value Value... and a little accordion music!  This place is hidden away, just a few steps off the strip across Flamingo from Bali's.  You will wait to be seated, and then you will read your dinner off blackboards on the wall.  That price includes everything for your dinner including the wine!  Go ahead, empty the carafe, they'll bring another.   Want good food, funky atmosphere and NO PRETENSE, this is the place.

I0nOEXDe17ZV7ozi6XhIwg.text: I give Batista's a four star because it is affordable, fun and predictable. It is an old Vegas landmark.   Food is decent. Think more family style than upscale!  Meals come with wine, bread, soup or salad, entree and a cappuccino.

NTKgUTj56fPdIbWNU_sF5A.text: Awesome Italian food! Meals include wine, garlic bread ( amazing), minestrone or salad, entree and cappuccino. Great deal for Las Vegas! I had the shrimp scampi which included a very big portion of jumbo sized shrimps. WELL done! Reservations are highly suggested as it gets busy.

zCqOIF81wMtiyjF4ssh4fQ.text: This is not my first time to Battistas. Always a favorite. One low price, you get garlic toast, soup or salad, your entree, cappuccino and all the wine you can drink. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere - down to the accordion player serenading your table. Check out all the pictures of celebrities who have eaten there!

T0XNt5mSrKUdpdOL5HcYcA.text: I can't believe the reviews about this place I really couldn't find anything good about this place...... My food was horrible I ordered a shrimp scampi which they told me wasn't hot and it totally was, the servers kept forgetting drinks we ordered and the the free wine I was too scared to even try because I did t want to get a headache. It's pretty small so you can hear all the tables around you which can get pretty annoying especially when you have a little old man playing music right next to you. I would not recommend this place for any kind of party, date or occasion it's VERY VERY hard to hear the person next to you.

LK6mIuD8F3G40vfKJ2i6hQ.text: If you know what real Italian food is like don't eat here. The food is not good and the wine that comes with the dinner is u drinkable.  There are so many other restaurants to go to in Las Vegas. Stay away from this one

hS5XvnjpiiRl9_4_RUX5qQ.text: It's a True hole in the wall, that's for sure, but you must check it out! Really great Italian dinners with all you can drink wines, and it even includes dessert and a cappuccino. How are they even making money on that kind of deal! If you go, prepare to stuff yourself with great food and a great time!

CL54De9-wKmorya3QyMUHQ.text: We made dinner reservations here on the recommendation of our friends who dine here often. It was a birthday celebration and we were not disappointed. We loved the funky ambience, good food at reasonable prices & excellent service. The location is in a strip mall within walking distance from the corner of Flamingo and LVB. Recommend reservations. Highly recommend!

mi6QZW0OP7TfMxE2KY8EsQ.text: Batista's Hole in the Wall Italian Restaurant is wonderful.  The service and food are excellent.  It's only a 5 minute walk from the Flamingo, or The Strip. Plenty of garlic bread, all the wine you can drink, an after dinner cappuccino are all standard. Arrive hungry as the entree portions of lasagna, eggplant parmigiana, etc., are large and delicious.  This is a great place to take special friends and relatives.  All attending will be happy. This is truly a "hole in the wall" treasure.

DKcNQGXxY7ScQ1B4VxTpiA.text: This place is such a trip man. If you need a break from the flash and glitz of the strip take a short walk behind ballys and you will find this little nugget tucked into a strip mall. Don't go here for the food. Go for the history, the atmosphere and the free wine :).  Food actually isn't too bad. Not great. Don't plan on going out and fist pumping in the club afterwards. You will be too full to walk.

4n3jn8FIH5zwX2g1QXOicQ.text: Pasta had obviously been pre-cooked and was dried out- actually crunchy.   The red sauce was way too acidic.  I know and LOVE Italian,  this is NOT good Italian.   Meatballs have NO flavor and were definitely processed in a factory.   The service was OK but the food was very disappointing.   This is an expensive restaurant considering the sub-par food.  Sorry,  but don't waste your time here.  I've had better Italian out of a can.

lO1-U6OP-AFTNdXonJV4Pw.text: Four stars mainly for atmosphere. The free wine during dinner is great and the dinner salad was amazing.  The actual meals are decent but not as good as other restaurants.  You also get a what they call a cappuccino after dinner which is good but is basically a hot chocolate.

uptRPdKT8Xo2x_PeZPaTRg.text: This place is a fraud, a sham! We were sat in a booth and waited 5 minutes to receive menus, another 5 minutes to get a red plastic glass of water. We waited another 10 minutes before our waiter even acknowledged us if you can call his perfunctory semi greeting an acknowledgement. We ordered veal picante and chicken cacciatore. We waited 25 minutes or so to get our food after the soup and salad. The waiter NEVER checked back on us after the food was delivered. Never, not once!  The food was just OK, a C minus, D plus.  We are locals here in Las Vegas and dine out all the time at fabulous restaurants and some of them a good bit less expensive than this place. $68.00 with no beverages and no desserts. We won't return and neither should you. Buyer beware of this abominable "hole in the wall".

T3OW5mXJfK68IhC9_QXtaw.text: Have eaten a Battista's in the past. Decided to try it again but found the attitude of the hostess a bit unfriendly so we decided to leave.

ZhQ-o7194K83Y8YJ_zqk3Q.text: Overall this place was good. Service was top notch. Our server was Doug. He was polite, enjoyable and seemed genuinely engaged in his job. 10/10 for service. Red wine was much better than expected for being included with the meal. 10/10 Bread was fantastic. 10/10 Minestrone soup was solid. 8/10 My wife had the salad, she said though good it was drowned in dressing. 8/10 I had meat lasagna. It was a huge portion. Overall I would give the lasagna 7/10. Good cheese but overall it didn't have as much flavor as I like lasagna to have. Still a good value. My wife had chicken Parmesan. Another huge portion. She gave it 6/10. I had a bite and would have to agree. Another situation where I would say it lacked flavor. Cappuccino came with the meal. Good presentation but I would say it's comparable to gas station instant cappuccino. 6/10 I would very much recommend this place to anyone looking for something off the beaten path. It was quiet and a genuinely good place to recharge from the busy Vegas strip. Dollar for dollar it is ahead of many places in Vegas.

OAt0Nc8LAuqzUzCZ0uQhsw.text: I was skeptical when my husband chose this place for dinner on our recent trip to Vegas.  The free salad, bread, cappuccino and wine struck me as a quantity-over-quality gimmick.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The wine isn't winning any contests, but is drinkable.  The salad was lightly dressed and crisp.  The bread was fresh-baked and tasted of yeast and garlic.  The lasagna I ordered wasn't the best I've ever had--noodles were overlooked, but the filling was delightful.  We loved the dark, dusky atmosphere, and appreciated the attentive service.  We would certainly go back.

YQEhdIxLIn-JUvaiFFfZuQ.text: We had reservations for 9:30 but when all our party arrived the table wasn't ready.  When we finally sat down we were rushed through our dinner.  The marinara sauce tasted like it came from a cheap jar at the store.  The complimentary cappuccino tasted like hot chocolate.  The restaurant decor was neat with old pictures of movie stars.  The temperature was very warm.

t54Ci3447w-vCc7VRTTPMg.text: My wife and I hit Battista's every trip to Vegas, and will in the future.    Let's keep everything in perspective.  It's a $25 meal, all-you-can-drink wine included, a 2-minute walk from the strip.  And you get what you pay for in Vegas, just like everywhere else.  With that in mind:  The highlights:    - The food isn't Gordon Ramsay quality, but it's not bad either.  The lasagna is better than a lot of restaurants I've had, and the Chicken Rio is worth trying.  Tons of garlic bread helps to soak up the wine so you can still do enough math to leave a tip.  - The wine isn't really that great.  But I'm usually hammered from gambling and drinking all day, so it's not like I'm looking for a $50 bottle anyway.  It's definitely quantity over quality here, but you're not going to even notice it after you polish off the first bottle.  - The service is average to above average.  I've never had a problem there.  - RESERVATIONS.  It's usually crowded, so save yourself a long wait and call ahead.    - The atmosphere is laid back and old school Vegas.  It's dark, there's stuff all over the walls.  Whoever decorated this place probably isn't even allowed in the Venetian, but it's a nice change from most upscale strip restaurants.  - Pay the old accordion player to play you a song.  He doesn't look like he'll be around a whole lot longer.    Once, I didn't want to leave half a bottle of wine (can't waste that stuff, you know), so I asked for a to-go cup.  They gave me one, no questions asked.  Only in Vegas.

FSOKeUcJmzzrPlaBxehdLA.text: This place is like a little piece of Las Vegas history.  An older gentleman serenades you with the accordion and a song that is relevant to your table...he's adorable and talented.  You get FREE (really) house white wine and red wine with your meal, as well as a house salad or minestrone, and after your meal, you get "cappuccino" which is more like hot chocolate with whipped cream on top.  I didn't have very high expectations for this joint, as my father was born in Sicily, so I get the "real deal" at home.  But, I had the cannelloni - and it was pretty darn good!!  Came with a side of cheesy, creamed spinach.  My husband had Cioppino- which had half a lobster tail, chunks of salmon, mussels, and scallops - a big bowl of good seafood in a mildly spicy tomato broth.  And every table gets unlimited garlic cheese Italian bread.  Portions are huge- taste is good-service is spot on.  It's as close to the real deal for those prices as you will ever get!  And you are privileged to dine in a nostalgic place, where the west was once wild, albeit Italian.  That's Amore!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All meals include their house made wine!!!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The decor

P7J-51nQ44es5YFkHzTMlw.text: I was looking for fresh delicious Italian food that you can't find in a chain restaurant...and I found it at Batistas. And this review has nothing to do with the wine that comes included with every meal, although that is a plus. The food is fresh, very flavorful and served simply.  I'll take that over a chain restaurants microwaved wannabe 's anytime. No matter what anyone else may say about this place what counts is: 1 - Is the food fresh? and 2-Does it taste good?  Yes on both counts here at Batistas. If you are someone who likes the fancy servings and high prices of the strip casino restaurants, this place is not for you. If you like good food served simple, then I recommend Batistas.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh baled Lasagna with fresh Mozzarella.

atVAmkD_MpVvRiYy_CPO-g.text: Unlimited wine included with the meal, unlimited wine included with the meal, unlimited wine included with the meal! I thought that needed repeating.   We were a group of ten who made reservations two hours before we arrived. Battista's had no problem seating us as soon as we got there on a Friday night. I have read a lot of reviews saying the food here is sub par but if you have been to chain restaurants such as Olive Garden and Carino's, the food here is comparable but with a more enjoyable atmosphere .   Depending on what you order, the price varies between $21.95 to $40.00 and you receive soup or salad, garlic bread, entree, unlimited wine, and a cappuccino. I ordered the salad which I enjoyed, and the seafood linguini which included shrimp, scallops and sea bass. I did not regret my decision as it was delicious.    The wine is not a French Bordeaux or Traverse City Two Lads Riesling but it is drinkable and I enjoyed the red more than the white.   All in all, I left sustained and inebriated and happy.

ej6JvkoJWnNU47rUhdZqkA.text: It really isn't organize. I was told that I had a 45 min wait for a table for two- Went back 30 mins later and she counted to see if my 45minz was up...... like there was a table available but I just had to wait 45 mins. Nobody was standing around .... nobody was waiting ...... beside me -!

ZZX75yw4RbsRyvRkkUjDNw.text: Lots of great places to eat in Las Vegas, but nothing tops Battista's as far as an overall dining experience. Old school Vegas dining with new world service. The joint is dark, small, and usually crowded with eclectic stuff everywhere. Combine that with great Italian food and wonderful service and its a must for my wife and I every time we are in Las Vegas.

QbJqDQq6ProtW6iUAl0xRw.text: This restaurant is a nice step back in time. The servings are ample and the waiters are attentive, but not obtrusive. The food is simple and good. I had the shrimp scampi with butter and garlic. I got 9 large tails, pasta, bread, salad, wine, and a cuppucino for a reasonable $36.95.  You have to give this place a try to catch some of the spirit of old Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spumoni ice cream pie. Yummmm!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi, garlic &amp; butter.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o9y05o-GACSF_-MkiC5q4A.text: What bad can be said about this place? Honestly, it's a hole in the wall, but hell, this place is good eatin'!!   Is it old school? Yep. Is it Maggiano's? No. Is it pricey? Not really. Is it worth a trip past the dive bar next door? You betcha.   I really liked this spot. The food was good, service was great and it felt like mobsters ate there. This is old shook Vegas at its finest. I imagined my grandparents eating there back in the day.   I hope this place never changes. Ignore the reviews about the small glass of wine...they give you a full carafe, so there's that. There's complimentary bread and salad/soup AND cappuccino after dinner. What more can you ask for?   Check this place out when in town!

MKEklBoSCQABMluRisyyXA.text: Favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! Simple, homestyle Italian. I feel like Dino and Frank are going to be sitting at the next table! Awesome!

lTCx76DPMlDYCjEFpk7glg.text: Second time here. I love it.  It is a gem.  Huge portions wine soup and yummy huge portions for a great all inclusive price.  Try the Veal Piccata! This is somewhere I will go in Vegas every time I go.

Us2zypxz1ss8vzd5hP9iaQ.text: Loved the little older gentleman with the accordion! He went around each table and did a little diddy. White and red wine come with your meal automatically. Menus are on the wall. It's a cute nostalgic place. I was kind of disappointed with my linguine and white clam dinner. Too much green spice (parsley?) and definitely lacking garlic. The soup also could've been hotter as it was just warm. Good time, not great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bKd3vVUbQDm6Vv-mT2Rgeg.text: It isn't gourmet... it's down-home Italian.... It isn't elegant... it's comfortable....  mostly good food, (too much butter, exactly enough garlic)... friendly and family EXCEPT fri-night sat-night because of the huge crowds and lines.

oQraKb_kvlQ5bqvkOyLJBg.text: We enjoyed another visit to Battista's. This was a request of our daughters and the restaurant didn't disappoint us this time either. The generous portions allowed us to take home leftovers and have lunch the next day. The eggplant and chicken Parmesan are both family favorites and they make it hard to try new things. The house red and white wine that come with dinner are always a great addition to the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent eggplant Parmesan!

wyLi0FIFibQKMiz4ZvQTYA.text: The garlic bread is amazing! We came on a busy night without a reservation and the wait was about 45 minutes. We decided to eat at the bar instead (the meals don't include unlimited wine at the bar) but we still had a great meal! Will be back next time with a reservation so we can enjoy the full experience!

nuQ-w69QF19b_0T8p2tUJQ.text: My wife and I stopped on a Saturday in April.  This was our first visit here and I was worried about a long wait.  We arrived at 4:40. I don't think they start serving food until 5.  We were promptly greeted and seated.  All orders come with wine (red and white), minestrone soup or salad, pasta, garlic bread, and cappuccino.  I had the chicken parm and my wife had the chicken rio.  We both really enjoyed our meals.  Portions were decent.  Environment is eclectic.  Definitely an old school vibe.  Complete with an accordion player that has to be 90.  With everything you get, I was fine with the price.  Service was great as well.  Keep up the good work!

ajN3Lt4wToOyWnjTDH10tA.text: We had a coworker suggest going here, which is somewhere he goes anytime in Vegas. We were there on a Tuesday night and it was packed but we were still able to get a table pretty quick. The restaurant had a lot of tchotchkes and is darker but a cool place. (Don't he turned off by it being next to a liquor store)  Staff was friendly and very attentive. Best part was the little old guy that has been playing the accordion there for 38 years! He comes to your table and plays a little song for you, it was great!   The menu is on the wall and all dinners come with salad, garlic bread(which was so good), also a red and white wine. You can pick just one if you like.  We had chicken Alfredo, chicken parm and pasta with red meat sauce. All of it was great, chicken was tender and well seasoned. Each entree is in a price point so dinner is anywhere from 22-40 a person. However if you want to share, the minimum price a person is 13 so you can split an entree but everyone still get salad or soup, bread,  wine and the cappuccino. 4 of us went and shared 3 entrees and it was perfect.   There's no dessert but every meal includes a cappuccino which was amazing! I don't care if you're not a coffee drinker, it's at least worth a try, so good!   Would definitely go here again!

GLQTioc4vCUodgQXF8AKXg.text: The food honestly underwhelming. The decorations makes it look like a former Buca Di Beppos turned new restaurant - whether that's True or not...  They offer "free" house wine but, I think it's to make up for the lack of quality in food. If you're used to Olive Garden and you think that's good, then this place might pass your test. BUT if you're looking for good Italian food, skip this one. Food definitely lacked favor!

P6bk5iKS4GvAmFZmO_3Fxg.text: I got the ravioli cheese and this was the worse dish ever. The dish was cold and the marinara sauce was plain. Our next dish was the linguini and clams it was delicious. The garlic bread was okay, I had better. 2-3 stars not the first place I would ever run to.

DKTFq1JA7h5tvNE9bhMo1A.text: Great dinner with my daughters gymnastic friends And families.  Simple but tasty food.  Service great for a party of 18.  Made reservations and sat us all within 10 min of arrival.  No check splitting so bring a phone and pen and paper to figure out everyone's bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IkMYWmLlgamkpeg1HLeTww.text: A friend and I had a 7:30 reservation for dinner. We arrived on time but were not seated until 8:10. That was the only negative. The food was very good. The service was also very good. Portions were more than ample. We would definitely return the next time we're in Vegas.

WTsFOquN361BNGNhAtFwcQ.text: Been going for years.  Still love this place foods always good.  People ar ed very nice

Yb-e_uaELQhNXLSyxbFSRg.text: Atmosphere is great but expect a wait. Old school joint. Go just to see that old Vegas still exists. Food is decent. Experience is more the reason to visit. Prices are good. Lively group so go if you want to have fun.

0_RcNRdERYriq-YKzjKIGw.text: This place has food that is just out of this world with flavor. We went here because it had 'hole in the wall' in the description. Usually, those places are pretty good. This was no exception to that rule. The place was a little dim as far as lighting is concerned. We actually thought about using our cell phone as a light but there was no need because the menu was in huge lettering on the wall. When the food came, the portions were large so we did have some to take home. I think the best part though is that wine pairing was included in the meal! And to top things off, an accordion player came along to play some notes for us while we ate.

q_ODnwsOaas5XsJE1P1oIQ.text: The decor is very grandma Italian house even Withrow the collecting of items and things hanging on the wall. As soon as you sit down. You are given a menu and ask soup or salad - right to the point I like it. Every meal comes with the house white or red wine / salad or soup / garlic bread which is amazing btw / your entree / and then a great desert cappuccino - the choices of entrees are grouped up to make it easy and the meat sauce is meaty they do not skimp.  Also there is an older gentleman who comes and does some small conversation and either has something to say or makes up something to talk about - he was confused when he came to our table and then wanted a tip - it sounded like he was a staple for this place even though he wasn't employed by the restaurant. By and by the food and atmosphere was great and that was the main thing and it's a local place not some huge chain.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sUmIJ7MN9lomII61Ewifrg.text: Dined at Battista's this week.  For those who complain about the prices at Battista's, I think it is important to point out that you get a bottomless glass of red or white wine included in the price.  The red was certainly not fine wine, rather I'd call it an easy drinking wine.  The food is pretty darned good.  I'll pay $22 every day for a decent egg plant parm and all the wine I can stomach.  An added feature of note is the accordian player who makes his rounds serenading each table.  While I'm not a big fan of musicians performing at my table, this old dude is a real gem.

f1-igHq9gq97Seg8mWtCFg.text: Battista's is my fave Italian joint in Vegas . . . it may not be the gourmet Italian, but it has real Vegas flavor! This was a place we always took guests whenever they were visiting and a place we have to visit now when we're in town (used to be locals). Favorite things about this place are: unlimited free house wine and Gordie, the accordian player. When they have the wild mushroom ravioli on special (not a regular item), that is a MUST get. We called ahead this trip and the chef agreed to make it special for us. I couldn't be happier!

WuA8p824gJEeY8WOS8nMtw.text: well we had originally made reservations here on valentines because we thought it was a cool little place. the menu was on the wall.. and was it family style? single dishes? the waiter gave us a carafe of red wine while we waited. we figured out it was single dishes and for the price, it did not seem worth it at all. $20 for spaghetti and meatballs in this little dump?  i chugged a glass of wine wine and we slipped out the door & went to ventuno at the flamingo and had one of the best meals ever.

mhfEYcfBdT8QrcqStvcLyQ.text: we stayed at the Planet Hollywood hotel and were walking around looking for somewhere to eat and we stumbled across Battista's.  wow, this place is an experience!   we saw 'free wine' and we were sold!  the menu is on the wall, i ordered ravioli and my husband ordered chicken alfredo.   the salad and bread were good. the wine was so so, and our food was just ok. there was so much food, we could not eat it all.   the food is ok, the wine is cheap but the atmosphere is amazing. there is so much to see, i was looking around the entire time.   i really liked the cozy feel of this restaurant, it was pretty cool, i would love to come back.

BSNR2UCRe7bhHXVL4B-odQ.text: Please    listen...Do not waste your money!!!!  Horrible,  Horrible, Horrible. The  food you get its way over priced,my husband and I could not eat our food ,starting with the rot-gut wine to the soggy ice-berg lettuce salad ,the meal just got worst ...no stars is my real review

6rpvxLo71bI-4PCZ0wt3Kw.text: THe best thing about this restaurant is the great sides.  I love the complimentary wine, garlic bread, salad, and cappucino.  OMG they were amazing.  The food was unfortunately ok.  But, I will definitely return for the garlic bread.  It was amazing!  Also, service was great as well!  OH, the spaghetti and meatballs were delicious.  Definitely get that.

iFQUJ5dQ-YVDS-_jSp4OkQ.text: Battista's. Hot dang, the food was gross. Terribly, terribly gross. My manicoti was just a solid block of bad cheese with pergo-like sauce on it. But then it was paired with something (spinach) that was inedible. Seriously, I don't know how one makes spinach taste like that, my only guess would be artificial flavoring. Yes, it's that type of place. Then cap it off with cheap wine that'll give you a killer headache and some sweet hot chocolate standing in for coffee. Blech.

xf43VilOim5Rerr7nk1d-g.text: I wish they served a full menu at the bar since I often come here on business and sip vino and catch up on the days events.  It's typical italian with all the charm of a old school restaurant.  Since I hate the strip and I'm forced to eat there enough I love little places sticking it to the big guys - and this is one of them.  I was debating between 3 and 4 starts and after reading some weird reviews (lowball) on this place I figured 4.  The food is solid, the place is usually packed and the staff has always treated me well.

3_wqlpeSlMT67ql-RLBs3Q.text: The first time I went I was very satisfied. The second time I went it seemed that the prices had been raised and it just wasn't as good as I remembered it being. The atmosphere is cool, but the menu is kind of pricey considering the service and the food. The best part about it all is the wine carafe that is 'free with dinner' so I don't know if you can really call it free or not. The old guy with the accordion is a really great scam, he pretends he's going to play a whole song for you but never actually finishes one and the proceeds to linger for his tip. The second time I used the 'no eye contact' strategy so that he wouldn't come bothering my table for money. Everyone pretended to be busy or on the phone!

a1GowvKWZPmQbuwf3we9ww.text: went on a sat nite due to a Friends recommendation. atmosphere great food not so much. veal tasted stale  & steak Caruso was very bland.endless table wine a plus

z1XyDIXTq_IjKkz475rXdg.text: Since this place was right behind the Flamingo Hotel, thought we would try it out since it got good reviews from locals. You have about 10 meal items to choose from and all come with wine, salad or soup, bread and meat selection. I don't drink wine so that was a waste, salad was OK, bread was excellent but the main dish, Lasagna, was poor. My wife's had the steak and she had the same reviews. Cost to eat here was around $80 for two of us.  We had better italian food @ Buca di Beppo at Excalibar and half the price.

mVFOppwnx7q3bgtndVYSbA.text: $27 + tip for a very hearty and tasty meal!   I got a dinner salad, delicious, chicken Parma with a side of pasta and marinara sauce, I've had better but I wasn't dissatisfied, endless white wine, pretty good also, and a cappucino (didn't really drink it because I was stuffed!).  I'd go back again and I'd definitely recommend it.  The waitress was also very attentive.  A very good experience!  4 stars because I wasn't blown away!

iLKSwf6SV2hLWA56tPNNCQ.text: DOG FOOD! This is by far the WORST place I've ever eaten in my life. Nothing more than microwaved frozen, low quality, tasteless, no worse... really bad tasing food. Then they force on to patrons all the wine you can drink, which is undrinkable. Nothing good about this place, overpriced, dark and dingy, poor staff attitudes, a total disaster. And a prevailing feeling by our table of four. Whomever gave this place any kind of a favorable rating are probably paid to do so.

G3h_69mltacfMaUWc9wsEQ.text: Possibly the best meal I've ever had.  For my courses I had minestrone soup, garlic-butter shrimp on pasta, all the wine I could drink and the most amazing cappuccino.  Both the food and service were great.  There was even a cute old man walking around playing music. Next time in Vegas I will definitely be going here again.

Q3rySOdZma_RPtFIGQ5ftQ.text: This place is a great value.  Food was served in generous portions, you get complimentary wine and prices were very reasonable for dinner (especially if you like Italian food).  I'd say the entrees were better than average but some were better than others.  The garlic bread is so dangerous.  They just kept refilling our baskets.  so tricky..  It's a nice change from spending too much in one of the hotel spots and it has "character" (or something like that cozy feeling).  Apparently, it's been around for a while and they have all these pictures of stuff/people from the past.  It's right off the Strip too but definitely gets pretty busy so make reservations.

vt5bje3STgJLtiW5_q1fXQ.text: House white and red wines included! The food wasn't excellent, but it wasn't disastrous. The plates look small, but they fill you up! I had the cheese ravioli, and the ravioli was big.. not like the Old Spaghetti Factory kind. The best part was the cappuccino.. mmm It's not really a hole in the wall either.. in my opinion. If you want pasta, just pasta with cheese or meat sauce or whatever, price is either 18.95 or 20.95. Meat.. is more obviously..24.95 and up. Not bad, considering you get the bread, salad or soup, the meal, cappucino and of course.. the house wine.

XuYvmc1f7P-vn3oao00G9Q.text: I do not know what all the hoopla is about this place. It is average and a little expensive if you ask me. Typical Italian restaurant. The food is OK not exceptional. the shrimp scampi was a little disappointing to me. Nothing to get excited about.

vAOzupqM4EjadDahLBGHjQ.text: Everything here was wonderful.  The atmosphere is unique, especially with the menu on the wall.  My wife had the alfredo sauce and loved it.  I had the sausage with penne which was great.  A carafe of wine comes with the meal.  I'd suggest the white wine, even for people that don't like wine.  The white wine has subtle taste that works well with the italian food.  The espresso at the end is much more like hot chocolate than a normal espresso.   The only issue is the owner coming around with a accordion.  It's very awkward if you don't have anything to tip him with.

d3p3wo9KMbfK61PQg0S0_w.text: great place if you love wine.  neat place to go to--the food is pretty good, the atmosphere is fun--somewhat on the noisy side, but it is worth the wait.  and the wine--red or white----or both if you must. and it keeps on coming and coming.  best to have a cab or a designated driver if you like wine.

hOd3pu6VekT5Vp33UBq3OA.text: MY BOYFRIEND AND I LOVEEEEEE THIS PLACE!!! every time WE GO TO vegas we eat here, no questions asked. The hours are the only bad part. The eggplant is sooooo good and I love the fact that there is UNLIMITED wine :) who wouldn't?! There is an old man who sings and he is quite funny, not the best singer but he def. puts a smile on your face. I also LOVEEEE the capachino they serve to you after you eat. Everything is amazing. It does not look like it would be that great from the looks on the outside but DON'T JUDGE IT till you eat there. YUMMY!!!!!

nLRzWJGIX9PAKMaGTBQYPQ.text: We had hi expectations based on all the reviews  and the entrance and place itself was pretty cool a throwback to the old Vegas. We did not have a reservation so we put our names down and found s seat at the bar. The very nice lady at the bar was overwhelmed and perhaps that explained her less than friendly attitude. We compared the bar menu to the regular menu and there was not much of a difference between the two. We decided to have a few drinks and order a appetizer. The calamari was greasy and the sauce was more like plain tomato sauce . At that point and with a little help (or lack of) the help we called it a night.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dZzOwPUA4B18uM-4lL0N-g.text: Gordy is still alive and slaying it! Just come and see, that's all I will say. I upped my review to 5 stars for the food and the value. For $50, we got two salads, two entrees, a huge heaping of delicious garlic bread, and a carafe of red and white wine, that was surprisingly good! I had the sausage cacciatorie (I know I spelled that wrong) over spaghetti - definitely my favorite entree over the lasagna. My husband had the cannelloni which was delicious as well. The service was prompt and on point as well. We will definitely be back every time we are in Vegas!

wmaqz3Ak6wQGAL41rpyIbw.text: Such a perfect Saturday night, date night! The company was better than great! The food was insanely delicious! And, the atmosphere was very cool!   First off, they let you choose a salad or soup. I enjoyed my salad but, the garlic bread was absolutely delicious! It tasted fresh straight out of the oven. And it was very warm.   For entrees... I chose the chicken Alfredo which was really good and he got the spaghetti with meatballs which was also good. The tomato sauce tasted very flavorful like it was simmering all day!   After our entrees, they served us cappuccino with whip cream! Absolutely delicious. We asked for extra whip cream and we got it.   Also, you should know that they serve unlimited wine, red or white! The service was excellent! If you haven't been here, definitely come!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The atmosphere is very beautiful and chill. Very very romantic!

Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I have a chicken Alfredo which was excellent and he had a spaghetti and meatballs which was very flavorful. The garlic bread was amazing!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We loved the cappuccino with whipped cream and the unlimited wine!

7QnCKXM5W_q9bqUtsJDsKw.text: First visit - sorry, but I was not over impressed at this over priced, run of the mill, Italian restaurant.  Service was good. $26.95 for wine, soup, lasagna and a cappuccino is high. Taste was just ok. Serving size was fair.   I am originally from the NYC area so I may be overly critical based on having tons of GREAT Restaurants to go to.  Either way I will continue my quest for finding outstanding Italian food in Vegas.

n8Yf-c5Kvub_AiI6JQ41cg.text: May 1st~Catching up on a few reviews  I can't believe I have never reviewed Battistas before. This is our go to spot when family and friends are in town. Best to have reservations. Just a note~If you make reservations everyone in your party has to be present in order to be seated. Also if you opt to share a meal there is a $13 fee. After you're seated you are greeted by someone (not your waiter). This person brings all you can drink red and white wine and all you can eat basket of bread sticks.  Then the person ask if you want salad or soup. You usually get your soup and salad before waiter comes to take your order. You also get garlic bread. The best I've ever had!!! While you wait it's a perfect time to look around at all the cool things on the walls, and ceilings. This place is full of cool stuff! You can actually see the menus on each wall or they can bring you a menu. The setting is kinda dark. Mood lighting. After you order it's usually to your table within 10-15 minutes. If you come on a night the accordion guy Gordy is playing he will come by and sing you a song while he plays the accordion. I love Gordy! Always look forward to seeing him. Be sweet and tip him a dollar or two. When your food comes you will not be disappointed. I recommend the chicken Alfredo. Everything is good on the menu! After dinner you get a cappuccino with your order. I have been known to come in just for the cappuccino. It's that good! They do have a dessert menu. But the cappuccino serves as a dessert. I can't think of anything I don't like about Battista's. Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordy!!!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappachino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soup or salad

OsoeTMVFIBuN9xPYw3Y6fg.text: Skip this place. The place is relatively cheap for the strip.  However, it is expensive fast food.  The dinner is all-inclusive and it's major selling point is a carafe of box-wine comes with it. I had the veal piccatta and it was over cooked and filled with gristle.  My friends eggplant parmesan was not seasoned and tasted like a frozen dinner.  Since zero variations are allowed with the meal, it is pretty certain that everything is made ahead and microwaved to serve.

jjjuGbF6cDu9Z5T3MGDmEg.text: Everyone seems to really love this place but it's not a place I would recommend to someone when they ask for an good Italian restaurant near the strip. The food (we ordered chicken parm and chicken Alfredo) was just ok. Are server really had no personality and never came to check on our two top. It took over 20 minutes for us just to get our bill when we were done with our meal.  On a positive side the free wine was cool and the cappuccino was really tasty.

kHqfP-gxGTs_cADdCM9umQ.text: Old school Vegas establishment! Dark and loungy place. Service was excellent. Food was well portioned and very tasty.. all you can drink House wine served chilled- Red or White(Bonus)

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battista Style Cioppino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Caruso

QGFcKMz4yvmvKnl9ORPx3g.text: An easy go to when I'm in town when I want a good priced dinner. Decent food for the money. I eat in the bar area when by myself.   Problem....Guy playing accordion plays 1/4 of a song and wouldn't play a second song without a tip. If he was smart he'd had made a lot more tip money if he just played the damn second song I asked..... maybe he's been screwed in the past but play a whole song or the second and you'd be surprised what you get. I may not go back because of this experience. You blew it Gordy.

_8jQa0IA18lqzu4KZxJDwg.text: My date and I decided to try this well know Italian Restaurant.  What a pleasant surprise!  Classic Southern Italian old world food.  It is a bit noisy so you have to stay close when talking.  The food was very good and the drinks were perfect.  My date loves Cosmos and I Sunrises so we had our fill before we left (thank goodness for Uber).  Wow!  Service was outstanding.  Highly recommended all around if you don't mind the noise.  We will be back again!

pjjySm_hy0psC6vDQkvoYA.text: A place with really good food with a fun atmosphere. They are super accommodating and handle large groups very well. The price is very reasonable. While Vegas is full of over the top great places to eat this one knocks it out of the park with down to earth comfort. We have been here twice and will definitely be back!

2TTepfR45ngVoFWRwVnHcQ.text: The best Italian place I have ever been to. I heard about it from other people who have been there and I had to try it out. Well worth it!

pOmRKhzgHZtnZVgb87BBVA.text: A few weeks ago my family and I decided to take a trip to Vegas just to try it and see the history and everything. As we were disappointed with the fact that there's not a lot of history we decide to try a little places that are not so main stream. This place hit the nail on the head! I have to say without a shadow of a doubt the best place in Vegas to eat Italian food. The food was so amazing! The price may be a little high but from what it includes it is totally worth it. And they had this accordion player he was such a sweet old man he played Frank Sinatra's New York New York for me and my family. If you're not from Vegas and you're just visiting I definitely recommend eating here at least once you will not regret it!

jQk1mPoNVlvYlvjC60QX4w.text: The only thing disappointing about Battista's is that it took me so long to find. This place is incredible!  The food is amazing and large-portioned, they give you free table wine, it's right off the strip, and it's very well priced.  We had a range of items including lasagna and different types of pastas. We all loved our meals, even the house salad beforehand. I'm definitely coming back here every time I'm in Vegas.

RjsBFliXcJ7SLqf8akuU_g.text: A Vegas native brought us here and informed us that this was a affordable spot that locals go to and man was she right!!   First off, I recommend that you make a reservation in order to avoid the long waits.   Red and White wines are included with the meal!! Yes, you read that right. Unlimited wine.   The bread was the best bread I think I have ever tasted. It was light, garlicly, crispy on the outside but still airy on the inside. I could eat that everyday if my hips would allow me.   The lighting of this restaurant was extremely dark- like so dark that it was really hard for my eyes to adjust. It is the ambiance they are going for, but just something to consider.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine included!

feAUTrVEPfCsP7IqTkqizw.text: A Vegas classic. It's old-school AMAZING.  Every meal comes with house wine in white or red, soup or salad, a pasta side and hands down the best sweet cappuccino with whipped cream for dessert. The service and value is outstanding. The accordion player had been playing that restaurant for 40+ years - he added quite the touch to our evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BAd1XZUyi4Gd9SUePj9X8Q.text: This was exactly what I was looking for when we got to Vegas. An iconic "hole in the wall" Italian restaurant. We had ridden our razor for almost 500 miles through dirt to get here and it was the absolute perfect experience to finish an amazing week of traveling off road through the Nevada desert. We didn't have reservations so we had to wait about an hour for our table for two but it was well worth it. We sat at the bar and shared an appetizer a glass of champagne and watched the news while chatting with the bartender. When we got to our table we were tended to right away with wine water and garlic bread. There was an accordion player at another table which definitely added a little liveliness to the atmosphere. We ordered the lasagna and the shrimp mushroom pasta that was recommended by the server. Both dishes were delicious. We had so much food left over that we were able to eat it on our way home the following day. My husband and I both agreed that it even tasted better the next day. I'm going to make this restaurant my go to place when I visit Vegas. It hit the spot. (I forgot to mention that we ALMOST decided to go to a higher rated restaurant because Las Vegas has a million to choose from but I'm glad I stuck to my plan and gave Battista's  it a try!)

ASg2-HEnWXwFA-_-nHVZ-w.text: Absolutely love this place. Prices went up but the food is excellent but still cheaper than other eateries  Still love this place a few years later.

eYIqoJ8vy6vMllrWKBTzKw.text: Very disappointed and not worth a reservation. I ordered the shrimp pasta in garlic butter and it was flavourless. My companion ordered the meat lasagne $26 and it was very heavy and also meh when it came to flavour. Yes it comes with crappy garlic bread and a salad that was fine and a oh too sweet cappuccino for $36. It was plain spaghetti with shrimp- boring. Because the food wasn't very good we left lots  and were far from  satisfied. I'd take a hard pass . Not worth either the time or money, can not understand why you need to make a reservation for a lousy restaurant.

3Mp2J5nnm4yYwGO4kIZdXQ.text: I will admit it. I would have never chosen this place, but my boss likes it and he took the team to dinner here while we had meetings in Vegas. As it turns out, I glad we came. It has a traditional, almost kitschy charm and I will be damned if my cannelloni wasn't great. I mean, really good. The salad was tasty as well. I wouldn't bother with the "complimentary" wine, but you'll get a decent traditional Italian meal, complete with accordian player that will softly massage all of your Italian restaurant stereotypes.   On the pricey side, but not when you consider your salad/soup, wine, bread and dessert coffee are included. Service is robotic and friendly. Like tour guides that do it a thousand times a day.  It's kinda fun though.

bhs4qyxZG5dVHjNocvLhMQ.text: Last time we were here, and we go pretty often since we are in Las Vegas at least four times a year, I took away a star because the service was lack luster.  This time I'm taking away another star for the same reason and for the fact that the food just wasn't as good.  Again as a party of two we were stuck in a dark corner.  It took the server about 10 minutes to acknowledge our existence and then it was the assistant who finally brought water and checked on our starter.  The server asked whether we wanted red or white wine and then promptly brought the wrong one.  There was a large party coming in to be seated next to us, and for the life of me I can't figure out why restaurants insist on sitting two people only to be crunched in by a large party.  The server was so intent on making sure the napkins were folded properly, etc for the large party - bigger tip than two - that we finally had to call him over 15 minutes later to order our main meal.  When it came, I had linguine with chopped clams and hubby had mancotti, it just wasn't as good as usual.  While mine was topped with several who clams, there certainly weren't many chopped ones on top of the dish.  Hubby said his was ok but nothing to write home about.  So hot we declined the ending coffee and left.  Not sure we'll go back since the service seems to be all about the big parties and too bad for the tables of two.

S2MMs8XuDk_1bas_2k5MZw.text: Definitely not the highest quality of Italian cuisine that I have experienced, however the atmosphere has a strange appeal.... I really wanted to like this place....  We had reservations and despite the extreme amount of people at the door we were seated right away, which I loved. Thank you for observing a reservation!!  As the other reviews mention, you get for the price of your dinner, unlimited wine, bread, a dinner salad or soup, entree, and cappuccino.   The wine was of course cheap and not anything close to what you would get at another restaurant that charges by the glass or bottle.... but seriously, its unlimited and free??? if you expected a good quality free wine in Las Vegas.... You also thought you were going to win at the casino, right??  The garlic bread was good... Salad was okay (no choice of dressing, house dressing or nothing) I had the spaghetti and meatballs.... ugh.... pick something else... this was so bland and tasteless.  I really wish I had tried another entree!!  My husband had the eggplant parmesan and he said his was pretty good. Prepared well and good flavor and portion.   We passed on the cappuccino... I wasn't feeling so good after drinking all that cheap wine........

qyTLsCPvobzdaVi8ZapAVg.text: Battista's is one of my favorite Vegas go-to's. What's not to love about this amazing old school joint? Huge plates of food, a man serenading you and playing the accordion, and free wine with your meal!? I would suggest sharing because the portions are insane. I have tried the lasagna and the eggplant parm and they are both amazing. Word to the wise, don't drink an entire bottle of wine like my boyfriend did. You will be hurting the next day!

1nfW_MZjJNyVYfq3zZt8ow.text: Yelp lists 2 stars as Meh, I've experienced better and that's the most fitting for Battista's.    Walking into the "Old Vegas" institution I thought this might be a great find, or a mistake, you can say that about many things in Vegas.  I had a glass of wine at the bar before sitting down to get the feel of the place, lots of folks had reservations.  I should have stayed in the bar and ordered there instead of venturing into the dinner fixed price menu.  Service is great, the wait staff is the normal drink and food, union deal you find in Vegas.  Both servers were attentive.  The fixed price menu offers normal Italian fare, which is OK, the salad was OK, the pasta and meatballs were OK, the garlic bread was OK.  I've had better salads, spaghetti, meatballs, and sauce in many places.  Got - it's OK, just OK, not great, or good, just OK.    The dinner menu includes "wine", you get to choose red or white, the waiter said their house wine is a burgundy, I'm thinking something between a drier malbec and a chianti, then I noticed it was refrigerated like a white.  It didn't taste like wine, it tasted more like a MD red, watered down with grape juice and water with a dash of vinegar thrown in for acidity.  I like wine, I'm not a wine snob, but I do know some, this was bad stuff, impressively bad.  I sipped through a full glass of this swill, attempting to determine if it was indeed that bad, and then what one would mix to make such an abomination.    I don't see how the hole in the wall maintains a 4 star rating on most websites, they must have a small army of very dedicated folks entering great reviews to counter the actual reviews.  If you must eat here, stay at the bar and order a la carte, unless you really want to experience the house wine, if you do venture in to sample this liquid darkness, please post a response and tell me what you think is mixed together to make such a concoction.   So to summarize - Great service, OK Food, old Vegas atmosphere, incredibly bad house wine.

-DVCBxuXB27tO5V39s8gCA.text: I have been twice in the past month with large parties (more than 15 people), and they did an amazing job of pleasing a variety of palates. Love that the wine is included with the price of the meal - I mean who does that? The meal starts with unlimited garlic bread, salad or minestrone soup - all good. I had the amazing lobster ravioli with vodka sauce (special) the first visit and excellent  linguini with white clam sauce during the second round. The meal is topped off with a sweet cappuccino that satisfies the dessert course. The ambience is fun with Old school Italian props and an 87 year old Italian man playing the accordion! I will definitely be back to this hole in the wall!

2MU-HUPTeI9iAoh0qcSarw.text: Love their homemade cappuccino!!! And one bottle of wine's included when you ordered a meal! What a wonderful restaurant lol plus, nice smiley host and servers are welcoming you ! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love their homemade cappuccino!!! Good dessert after the meal :)

qPgKPbpdHR7Uz7FvTmq3Zg.text: This place is so cute, great service, amazing food and over an amazing experience. The staff was just delightful and the flavors were decadent. I will definitely be back with friends!
