XHkZ1Lpx-SK_qN8MFecUaw.text: Omg! This place is so good! First of all, when you walk towards the building it's smells amazing!!! Then you open the door, and BAM! It smells 100 times better once you walk in... then you get prompt wine and salad or soup and really good garlic bread! Omg! We will definitely be coming back here with a large party, and date night again!

UKoyOhcaVP_Yz6RAeAvvZQ.text: I enjoyed every moment of being here! The wait staff was super friendly and gave great suggestions on what they liked the best for food. The garlic bread kept flowing and so did the unlimited wine. The white wine was my favorite and our party of 3 ended up going through 3 "bottles" and they would have brought us more if we weren't done eating.   I got the chicken Parmesan and my boyfriend had the STEAK CARUSO. Everything was delicious and HUGE portions. I absolutely want to come back! It was a little on the pricey side, but you get huge portions of food, a salad or soup, unlimited garlic bread and unlimited wine. I definitely think it is worth the price and would recommend this for a nice date or if you want some damn good Italian food!

v_L3Vmm_S47Iqhz_m-Wx8g.text: Apparently u need to go with a group of 4 or 3 vs 2 as we got there about 20 min earlier than a group of 4 and had to wait an extra 20 min after they got sat. I complained and they explained that they only have so many 2 man seats. That's complete bullshit. It's completely diff if it's a table that sits 8-10. Obv they don't want to sit 2 but to say 3/4 gets priority is crazy. Also, they have way to much bar seating that u can order from the bar the whole menu but not get the wine along with it. Makes no sense. I haven't even eaten and I hate this place but I'm too hungry to leave. Better be good!

Qy2P00lmDHWGDU9X-9oVrQ.text: This place is way over priced, even with a Groupon it's NOT WORTH IT.    30.00 a dish,  then a 13.00 plate sharing charge.    What a rip off.   43.00 for a veal parm dish for 2 people, the dish came with two tiny banana split type plates of pasta.... It was really sad.    Oh sorry you also get 2 bottles of wine, one red and one white..BOTH sucked.  Try  Buca di Beppo instead of this HOLE IN THE WALL.   This place sucks.

q4bvl-Wr_umsBr7-KOfuvg.text: Battista's Hole In The Wall celebrates the fact that they have been operating at the same location since 1970. In that regard it has established itself as a destination for authentic Italian food for locals and tourists alike. For many it may provide a nostalgic look and feel of old Vegas. However, beyond that their entree's, while not bad, offer in my estimation poor "value to money" in regards to price and portion. If you want to visit a restaurant with an old Vegas feel and has good "value to money" I would recommend the Peppermill Restaurant and Fireside Lounge. And while there are many fine Italian restaurants in Las Vegas, I would recommend Nora's Italian Cuisine for good Italian food.

3TUhKp6ra5jIazTTK0uKUw.text: This is the equivalent to what you will find in New Jersey . We are talking old-school American Pasta restaurant with over cooked egg plant Parmesan and mediocre steaks  Las Vegas institution it maybe. but I will  not be back as this is not the Las Vegas experience I am hoping for. I don't need to have this kind of food outside Of New Jersey.

Qw_B2IHoMgxJ9vEl4fF2CQ.text: One of the worst Italian restaurants I have been to. Their fixed menu that included multitudes of things was just bad. I don't even want to elaborate the details. Stay away.

UR_VYblKmlNqxvT7kRUhDQ.text: Great food- seated quickly once our entire group arrived (10+ ppl) great service. Food came extremely fast considering how busy they were. The environment is fun. Will def frequent this place next time I'm in Vegas!!

NUtlXY5CIXU6-JNi7P1p_w.text: Very good food with a old school Italian restaurant feel. It is dark old and broken up into small rooms. I could see this being a great mob hangout in the 50's. I had the lasagna and it was great. Free wine with your meal is available but I don't care for wine. If you want good food this is the spot.

3ZF8j_5sU2ArnIUnGhhHjA.text: Great local place off the beaten path, feels like your in Italy. Food, atmosphere and service were outstanding. After dinner they bring cappuccino which I believe was the best i have had. During dinner there is an older guy who walks around and plays the accordion, make sure you ask for him.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. During dinner tunes.....
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken rio (I think) was great!

DYVNJgP6_-Ky-N7dbX2-WQ.text: When I travel, I like to go to local spots and enjoy some local culture that can't be found elsewhere. In Las Vegas, there are a lot of big-money, generic restaurants that aren't all that original or interesting.  Battista's is not one of them.  It definitely has its unique charm and its culture that isn't found anywhere else.  The food was absolutely amazing.  From the garlic bread to the eggplant dish I had, it was delicious and I left feeling like maybe I could have used some restraint.  I would definitely recommend making reservations ahead of time.  It was packed and even with our reservations we had to wait ten or so minutes.  Definitely a place I'd recommend in Las Vegas if you want something local and interesting.

QCbV5-mbE0HL_zwgZLAB2A.text: Good place for a big group Italian meal. The place is getting a little run down looking though. The food is okay...just okay...had something on my eggplant dish that was supposed to be cheese and was more like white rubber.  But overall the place is okay

2hRRP9oAa-g8OoyegpIT_Q.text: This is a treasure amongst the flashing lights and sounds of Las Vegas. You get a very "home," old school Italian feel as soon as you enter. You can order anything off of the menu, and you will love it! Free wine, garlic bread, and a cappuccino with every meal. You might think they are overpriced, but wait until you see your meal! You definitely get what you pay for!

zGNKe5h3AY05LslLmghKXg.text: I've never had a bad experience here. All you can each bread and wine. The entree's are very good for the price and the old man playing the accordian even knew my college fight song. I will be back.

eFWakB6HuljDvoLTNQBGYg.text: Vegas sucks in 2015.. it really does. I love vegas, but its changed. Battista's still gives me that old vegas feeling. I feel young again everytime i walk through the doors. I've been to this restaurant at least 10 times and every time i'm there it makes me feel so awesome. The Veal Parm is freaking amazing.

gnim22OE-qcssha1N5Sbkw.text: I have been coming here since I was little. A few years ago you couldn't pay me enough to go back, but a few nights ago we had a decent experience and I will continue giving it a try.  The best part of the meal is that it includes table wine, salad, bread and cappuccino. Even just off-strip you could expect to pay $20-30 for just an entree, not including any of the extras. The place feels very kitschy and has a lot more character than anywhere else you can go, if that is what you're looking for.   This particular night I had the veal, which I can't say that I recommend due to its intense saltiness! However, I tried a bite of each other dish--fish ravioli, chicken alfredo, chicken rio, chicken parmesan--and they were all tasty.  I'll be back because it's a good deal and it's a fun piece of Vegas history, but no veal next time.

DZMH6P-JIGhVuZNlQCHj6A.text: Food was great, atmosphere was great.  Highly recommended.  And the accordion player was really cool.

3n_NsArGzRhiLUW3XxTP8w.text: We had a great time and the food was great too.  The portions were huge!  Very yummy and the service was great.  Very fast.  The only downside was that I forgot to use my coupon.  :-(  Next time!

kEBSjRj5B8128Z1pmYv-nA.text: 20 min wait to get greeted. Yes complementary cheap wine, had wait an extra 20 min just for water when it super hot outside! And we asked 4 times. Food is no where near worth the price of what you pay for it. Basic pasta with canned tomatoe sauce the bread was stale and hard and we could never find our server for anything. The table next to us never got greeted so they it up and left. They give you complementary cappuccino from this machine that taste like hot coco. All and all it's a tourist trap.

xWgdxZo345dc_5Dkqcvx5w.text: I'm not an Italian food fan, but the food here was good. You get several courses: salad, soup, bread, meal, and cappuccino. It was good quality for a very reasonable price. I wanted something that I could wear normal clothes and get a decent meal and this fit that bill.

5w81TK_v9r7yGiarjkj0Mw.text: We dine here at least once on EVERY trip to Vegas. Food is awesome the atmosphere is great. You can sit there and just soak up "old Vegas" and let your mind wander thinking of how much "business" was handled "back in the day'

JLO-9JLSa6nD-iu-P22W0Q.text: Worst Italian food ever. Sauces were bland and overcooked. Same for vegetables in pasta dishes. Salad ok. Garlic bread was so oily. High point is cappuccino. Sent back uneaten sausage cacciatore. No offer by restaurant to deduct or substitute meal.

19LA6SEuejcig5BlpFVScg.text: *** spoiled New Yorkers review*** were used to affordable delicious Italian food where we're from. This place is horrendous. The prices are obscene for the quality of food. Our table of 5 unanimously did not eat our entrees and decided it was the worst Italian we have ever had. We told the waitress we didn't enjoy our food and she ignored us. No apology or any acknowledgement. Highlights= "free" wine and cappuccino. The cappuccino taste like hot chocolate with a hint of coffee. Best thing we had all night.

hAA7bia7NYqKUiESsQfGJQ.text: Very good food and atmosphere. A little old man comes around and plays the accordion for you while you eat. And complimentary house wine! It's a bit pricey, so try to download the Groupon first.

SwgYEQYw7ktr3xcqIQm-UQ.text: Mixed bag.  First couple times I went with my husband the food was great.  Love the atmosphere.  Last time we went the food wasn't great.  Neither of us drink wine, so felt overall the prices weren't worth the food.  We'd rather eat at Mark Rich where the value is much better.  Wins on atmosphere.

PRAfJvZssDn_Ggyh9RNj5A.text: A staple on my trips to the desert. Great staff "free" wine and you will not leave hungry. I can't tell you how long this place is been here but I can tell you it's over 15 years that I know I've been coming here.

oYYadKEyiBjsa6jdYO7XJA.text: Save your money unless your just needing to fill your belly. Nice people but food not worth having. More out of the can but with a little effort, could be very good.

Yo7RZ03cedyIHxSrEMFGrQ.text: Came in after looking for an Italian place.  I had the chicken Alfredo and friend had the lasagna. Both came out luke warm. The chicken seemed to be precooked and heated up for the dish. The wine was all you can drink for a reason.  But for the price you pay you don't really get that great of a deal, especially there in Vegas. However, it is the old world atmosphere that I find charming.

n367Gjt8lALQy2bTT1GGpw.text: One of my favorite Italian spots in Vegas!  My husband and I try to go whenever we are in town.  I love the location right behind the Flamingo and The Cromwell. They have never disappointed us and we try to get something different each time.  Never had a bad experiencel there.  We always recommend it to any friends going to Vegas.  There is an older gentleman that plays the accordian and serenades.  The cappuccino at the end of the meal is the absolute best!  I highly recommend this amazing place!

10tc2T4GdcnvOoO83BQySg.text: To use a cliche, "it is what it is."  This place is basically your family owned Olive Garden with a kitschy decor of trinkets and air/railroad liquor bottles. Free flowing jug wine can turn this $20 pasta entree place into a pretty good deal if you drink enough of it.  It's a laid back place just off the Vegas strip behind Flamingo and Sam's (fka Barbary Coast). OK for an occasional visit - just don't go with high expectations.

ybF3TYt0wNFMDIKsI3MNkw.text: We had a big party, about 20 or so and we were all craving Italian.  We had a different place in mind, but couldn't get reservations.  Overall experience was ok.  Food was decent, but not great.  I order the spaghetti and meatballs.  The price was about $23 or so, but it did include wine and bread.    Don't think i'll be back, but decent overall.

ThIpQ7HGG9itaXfgx-HzKA.text: There's not much to say, the food was nothing special and the service was not good. But the price was the worst part. Too expensive for the quality Believe the bad reviews. I wish I read them before we went there

yKOZrptennpy-EU82xnLrQ.text: Ok ,this was my second time here .  My first dining experience was  great.  Service was good food was good.  But this time the  same dish I ordered eggplant parm  was totally different  bland, cold which is the worst .  My party of 6  also agreed with me about their entrees  ravioli , meatballs. Ect.. So I have to warn newcomers that this place has changed and not  my pick for Italian in Las Vegas

kockWPx3YaZg8tOboSTCBg.text: I am literally sitting in here waiting for our order to b taken. The girl looked at us 3 times and did not stop and ask for our drinks or anything. This place is shit. Don't come here!

KxWAMdlg-3m3HET4zg5ZRQ.text: I truly loved my experience here! We heard that there was an hour wait, so we went to the bar and ordered drinks while we were waiting. I enjoyed a Fat Tire Ale *love* and the bartender was sassy and a lot of fun. We had a good time chatting with the people who were waiting at the bar as well. I really liked the decor and we had calamari as an appetizer, which came out really quickly and was super.   The meal was delicious and the house wine was good, even though I shouldn't drink wine due to a sensitive stomach; my half glass was good! We all got the feeling that the server didn't really like us, for whatever reason, be it our behavior (we were actually pretty well behaved at this point in the trip) or his night not going so well.   Keep in mind the portions are very large and the minimum charge per person isn't so bad, even if you share a dish between two and have to tag on the extra $, because you will leave full and satisfied.   All in all, the food was tasty and we had a great time!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love Fat Tire

mJhbqbHc4BE4A_2_wll0Fg.text: All around good food, great atmosphere, awesome music and just a good time. I really enjoyed the food and the company. A great as spot to relax and unwind, a real hole in the wall. Lol.

xSASIDGm13Q5497cPGy9oQ.text: Old, dated and dark...  Just like some of the most fun Italian restaurants where I've had great Italian food.  Bring your friends and, oh yea - you can be loud and talk with your hands all you want (no, I'm not an Italian but It's funny how you just get adopted anyway).  Free table wine if that's your thing.  I had the Ribeye and it was good.  Tried some sugo and theirs was good.  Large tables, but make some reservations just in case.  Yous can wear a jacket if you feel like it.

HyVe2HJ3wqXY9zv01S0ZGw.text: The food was okay our server was great! And the guy with the accordion was sweet!   We called in advanced for a reservation for 13 people.  We asked in advanced when making the reservation if separate checks were okay as we are here on business and company policy dictates this... and were told yes separate checks were okay. At the end of our meal they brought out 1 check with the normal additional gratuity added for large parties. Which we expect. When we asked the server for the separate checks he said that they could not do that.  We asked for the manager, who rudely told us no even after we explained the hostess had said it was okay.  She stated that she did not have time to deal with this as she was busy operating the house and walked off. The server was able to accommodate us eventually by running our cards for the individual meals we ordered..  Due to the manager being uncaring  and rude we will never be back again.. I feel for the servers there..but know as this place is one of those nostalgic places people will continue to go.  It is doubtful that the owner/manager will respond to this  based on what she said to us tonight .

D20ZBHsQdXhuCAOJWoew4g.text: We love coming to Battista's whenever we are in Vegas. It's a charming little place off the strip with a fantastic atmosphere. The food is always very good and the wine is included. There's no such thing as bad free wine. The accordion man also knows "There is No Place Like Nebraska," so that makes him far cooler than any musician in the entire city.

iCQF4V7FZoRmuTXdT6f2Tg.text: When I first moved to Las Vegas, I walked by this place every day on my way to work, and never stopped in, thinking it was a tourist trap.  Now I wish I had taken the risk..  I would call this "meat and potatoes" Italian.   If you are looking for high end, delicate/innovative italian, this isn't it. This is old school italian.   It reminds me of what my grandmother used to make.  Stated another way, this isn't the  high end italian you would find in New York or San Francisco but it is eons above what you would find at Olive Garden.  I can tell a lot about a restaurant by the salad and dressing they serve.  So many restaurants in Las Vegas serve iceberg and drown it in gloppy dressing.   This restaurant  used a variety of greens and didn't drown the lettuce with an inch of dressing - good first start.  Service was friendly and prompt.   Server recommended the lasagna, and it was excellent..  They don't use cheap cheese here either.  And, unlike some of the other reviewers, I enjoyed their red sauce.    Wine was fine - reminded me of some hole in the wall italian restaurants in Rome I found myself in a couple of decades ago.   If you are a wine connoisseur and belong to three wine clubs in Sonoma, you are going to have issues, but for standard table wine, it was fine.    In sum, I would say good value for the money.   Efficient and friendly service, solid food, with quality ingredients.  For a strip restaurant, I didn't feel it was over priced, nor did I feel like I was eating at a chain restaurant.  We'll be back.  Do make a reservation.  I was shocked to see how many people were there on a dead Sunday nite in Las Vegas.

pYauxEFDBG8l1uD6jmp9EA.text: Great good..Great service. Great atmosphere..the garlic bread was delicious and so was the awesome lasagna.

4G3oIm24dI1_AkyvUGviAg.text: Not worth it. The all you can drink wine is terrible. Tastes like a cheap reisling. The food was average, similar to what I could drum up at home from a Stouffer's box of frozen lasagna.  No gluten free menu and the waiter was un-sympathetic.  Time to retire this place.

aV8VTj1w39NqF0FVcC_3HA.text: This place is a step back to 1977 and for a really good meal at very reasonable prices it rocks. Very attentive and very knowledgable service. The prix fixe menu that includes highly drinkable red or white wine is great. If you want to see 70's celeb pics EVERYWHERE (99% of whom are deceased) and feel like it's the 70's again go check it out. A very professionally and well run spot. And fun. ***Great for large parties at the last minute!!*** as that's what we did and it was a blast.

WCtQ7LzAstsrhWQA0mDICQ.text: This is a Las Vegas must visit kind of place. From the pictures on the wall to the accordion player, this place screams "old school charm". Don't expect gourmet food, but do enjoy good food and great service from an awesome little slice of Vegas history.

PGKo6-n9QclAUrTRCW6ilw.text: This is truly a hole in the wall AND a perfect place to come hang when you want a nice environment with a quiet ambience. They supposedly have an accordion player. Cure place, I'll definitely make it  one of my "locals" getaway. I've been told that the food here "aint' bad", I'll get back with you when I know more about that, but for now, it's such a great place for groups of friends to hang out together, be NEAR the Strip but not on it,  have a great bar, drinks that aren't overpriced, Cider (which I love) and, at some point...some dude on accordion.  Where, in Vega$$, can you get all that???

dsTwYQSD5JUE6bp8-t7xqQ.text: Wow, we were truly disappointed....just where do we start....?   -First off, I'm not a fan of being served on old PLASTIC plates and cups versus glassware.. -Second, the older waitress did not even offer us the menu, she simply passed by and said " the menu is on the wall" yet, the table that sat right next to us a few moments later where greeted with much more delight... -Third, we noticed that all entrees come with a TEN OUNCE meat of choice...therefore my we decided to "split" one entree since it comes with such a huge portion of meat, a salad, a pasta dish, bread sticks, wine and a cappuccino.  However, we were told we were NOT allowed to do so or we would incur an additional $13 charge for doing that...it's absolutely absurd that a restaurant charges you for wanting to share your plate with whomever you choose.  -Fourth of all, the wine was horrible.  Not near a quality red wine at all! -Fifth, the food is by no means FRESH...it is evident that the bread sticks were previously frozen and not freshly baked.  My fettuccine entree was absolutely disgusting, It was smothered in sooo much nasty sauce that I had to ask for an additional plate just to scoop all that extra sauce off my plate. The sauce seemed as if it was straight out of can, I'm almost certain that it was not prepared in the kitchen either.  Overall, this place is great for people who enjoy BIG portions without caring much about the quality of the food....

PoyI2tPaLNpag2xaRroxCQ.text: Just loved this restaurant on our last visit. Love the idea about having an all in one meal!!  The Cappuccino at the end of the meal.

XzNXMBeXUYkT8wVAxYtLHQ.text: Hole in the Wall is probably the best thing you can say about this place.  I fully understand why they serve "free wine" with you meal - you need to get loaded for you to think this food is good. We went as a large group and ordered apps including fried ravioli, fried zucchini, calamari, meatballs and fried cheesesticks.  I was surprised that the apps were not hot, but it seemed they were luke warm at best. Then I ordered the cioppino.  Although it was full of various pieces of seafood, it was bleh.  The fish was overcooked and did not taste fresh.  The broth was a thick mush of slurry tomatoes - it was odd. The person I was sitting next to ordered the "catch of the day" and had the blackened swordfish.  It was burnt and as thick as dvd container.  He said it was the worst fish he has ever had - I believe him. The place is a total tourist trap and expensive.  If you are going to spend that much money, you should get a real Italian meal anywhere else.

6gJURlkBnIskmCVz7hpKkA.text: 1 price for salad, wine, breadsticks, and entree.  You get what you pay for.  The wine is bottom of the line. The cappucino is hot chocolate.  Worth going to only if you want to have bottomless wine with less than mediocre food.  There's definitely a scene for that but it's not for me.

Zde3F_cfqrlLH5yN5oqqjg.text: This is the most HORRIBLE restaurant I have ever ate at. The food is overpriced for some watered down pasta, that's bland, the soup tasted like it was out of a can. The place is dark and dingy, it was dusty and nasty. there was actually a toilet seat hanging on the wall above our head that was so gross. the so called cappuccino is hot chocolate from nestle, nothing tasted authentic, you will have better luck at the Olive Garden. The wine is cheap vinegar that they refill after every use. I don't know how this place is still open.

8rnr3rYscVfjW6EhLZXhxA.text: You ever find yourself so full you are almost in pain, but the food is SO good that you wish could still eat more! That is how good the food is here. They make it the way it has been made by everybody's grandma has made it for generations. It is not over spiced like all the places now seem to do. Simple fresh flavors that let the food speak for itself, and believe me they sing. The prices when you see them may seem high but when you realize that they include soup or salad, endless wine (red and white), garlic bread, your main dish, and coffee after diner it is a very good deal! The atmosphere is fun, and loud like in a real Italian house during diner. If you want real Italian home cooking then this is it.

8oB3FLDMVf5kW6ZoDMVEGA.text: This place used to get a lot of hype, stopped in for dinner, waiter Anthony was very nice. You get a bang for your buck here, dinners all come with bread, salad, entree, and unlimited red or white wine, as well as a cappuccino drink afterwards. The food is just ok though, had the chicken parm, was not crazy about the sauce, or the pasta side. I might give them another try.

6BSs6FFj0rkI9RZKXc2c-w.text: Good Italian food for Las Vegas. We went to celebrate after friends got married in vegas. It was late and we were hungry. The portions are large. Be warned they charge for sharing. The food is good the wine is yummy and the garlic bread is delicious.

m622H6Lj4yCgnDAmaajVHw.text: This place is one-of-a-kind!! The atmosphere was romantic, with low levels of noise. And the lights were turned down low.   We were seated quickly, after a short wait during dinner rush. Our wait staff was helpful and attentive to our needs. It was my first visit, so there were explanations to get my expectations adjusted for how it works.   The menus are posted around the room walls and are simple to see/understand. The cuisine is much like you would expect for an Italian kitchen. All entrees are served to the table with your choice of wine (red or white) kept at the table, in carafes.    Our food came quickly, but not before a round of bread that was toasted and buttered and smothered in garlic. I can't be sure, but the bread may have been delivered straight from Heaven. A side salad or soup is offered while waiting for dinner. The salad was a garden variety with Italian dressing. It wasn't large, but it went well with the bread and wine.   The portions were quite satisfying. I was able to eat all of my Lasagna, and I was happy to walk from the restaurant to The Strip for an after-dinner show. The lasagna was served with a meat sauce and covered with a thin layer of cheese and baked to perfection.   I can definitely recommend this place and will definitely be returning.

S6-8gJnfPsxAO3ePANqnAQ.text: We read all the reviews online and they were so good we were so excited to go. Wow what a let down! My husband ordered the veal Parmesan what a let down, at the prices you pay it should have been a veal steak but it was a veal cutlet, plastic, red diner cups for water, small juice glass as your wine glass, not impressed. I ordered a steak dish that was tough, pepper were raw, sauce ok. Just an all around bad experience

qE5XG6Cvm9ZWR5MnF5JGMQ.text: I love this place. Words can't even describe how much but I'll try.   At it's core it's an amazing old school red sauce joint like you'd find back Northeast. Great food, great service, old men playing accordions and singing - literally what else could you ask for?!?  Think of all the amazing restaurants in Vegas - and this is the one I come to every time I'm in town! You will not be disappointed.

AmA65GjC4v0uig85hx067g.text: If you want a classic Italian place while in Vegas, this is where you need to go. Old school feel when you walk in, and lots of classic Italian dishes on the menu. Highly recommend the lasagna. Perfect blend of sauce, cheese, and meat. Great for a date night or the place to go with your friends before heading out for the night.

8BlRWV72Z0KMXZgUdtIIHA.text: Amazing food with huge portions!  This is a must go when in Vegas. The wine, after dinner cappuccino and bread were just icing on the preverbal cake. A great price for the amount and quality of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eMDIeqWe2QKBCPsFtaY3iw.text: When I think of Italian food, Battista's always comes to mind. The hidden gem in plain sight. You've probably driven by countless times and never noticed it. Next time you're at The Linq, keep an eye out, it's right around the corner.   Walking through the door is like walking through a time machine. Back to the days of well dressed gentleman and classy dames. White linen tables and cozy booths, romantic lighting and always full of laughter. There's a quirky accordion player walking up and down the aisles offering tunes for a tip. The atmosphere definitely adds to the experience.   All the menus are displayed on the walls above you. So if you're blind like me, bring your glasses. Be prepared for large portions. Sharing is recommended. You start your meal with complimentary garlic bread and salad which are very tasty. Oh and did I mention the unlimited house wine. Red for me please! ;)   Shrimp Scampi, Chicken Alfredo, Steak Pizzaiola are all at the top of my list. I'm glad I was introduced to Battista's by a very dear friend of mine and happy to share it with you. Save room for the cappuccino, worth it for the whipped cream alone. Mmmmmmm.

DSEyifqBLjgRzH7dpQyfYQ.text: A solid 4 stars. Would rate it higher except that the wine was marginal. Tasted like inexpensive Chianti or jug wine. The rest of the meal was great. Fresh garlic bread (and plenty of it), delicious minestrone soup, tasty parmigiana (free side of pasta) and large portions. Would be difficult to finish for one person. Cost two us $80 including tip for chicken parmigiana and clam linguini. All of the above is included with the meal. It's close to Caesar's Palace, so a great place to go before seeing Absinthe or riding one of the sky rides. I was able to take my leftover cheap wine into the show, saving me $10+ on that. Our server, Frank was professional, top-notch. My only recommendation is having a wine upgrade available for $5 to $10.

3pokYN-zPtbTs8gdKYKJ_w.text: Great atmosphere  Good food  Great service  Every meal comes with a carafe of wine, soup or salad and a cappuccino  Large portions  Go hungry and still have more to take home

9QvEkIKS8l_HcYK8PA6mEQ.text: I should have believed the other negative reviews. I am a visiting native Nyc'er. I know good Italian food this was not good Italian food. I would have enjoyed chef boy ar dee canned ravioli at a fraction of the cost 1/100. Purchased veal parm and spag & meatballs. Wine was cheap cappuccino = hot coco.

yHC-hRZkW8ZKwNz2fpsPdQ.text: Such an awesome place for dinner. Lower prices than in the casinos and far better food. It is amazing. Want to rate a 10 cause can't say enough good here.

9U44OxmyU12qPdoLWpzP1Q.text: The food was good but the ambiance was AWESOME! Dimly lit, old mobster style feel, this was one of the best dinners of our trip. The highlight of the dinner was the elderly gentleman, Gordy, who played the accordian. He played (and sang) My Old Kentucky Home, which impressed and delighted us. And the cappuccino at the end of the meal? OMG. Delicious.

RKMDn9fko1dqwADFW1_NNw.text: For what you get this place is solid!  Sure it might not fit everyone's idea but it was fun, good service, and the food was decent. I would go here again and recommend.

FjNkomdhe-nmH6nrJ044Wg.text: We were recommended this by a friend and absolutely loved it. The service was fantastic and the food was sooo unbelievably tasty. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A picture is worth a thousand words...

-v4TjM1T8yg7gw640Xs8OQ.text: This is a local favorite off the strip. Good prices and excellent service. You also get house wine w the meal (not very good but included). The portions were enormous. I had the chicken parmigiana and didn't come close to finishing. It was good, but not great. The included salad was my favorite part of the meal.  I would recommend if you want to get away from the pricey spots on the strip and have a relaxing Italian meal.

N1QEJGI_g2RwQLloTujwKQ.text: First time visiting, and I always visit a self-proclaimed italian restaurant, order the same item . Oh, so first off the menu is VERY limited, and is displayed. You get soup or salad, bread, and cappucino with each order. The sauce was ok, but didnt think that penne pasta was a proper type of pasta to go with the eggplant but ok.The eggplant was very thin, and well breaded, smothered in mozzarella. My husband ordered the salmon dish. **Lights are super dimmed, but your eyes adjust.** Pro: place was clean, cozy, and you get a full course. The salmon with garlic and butter was delicious (but still salty). Cons: food is extremely SALTY...we both felt like it was packaged and heated rather than cooked fresh. Eggplant is a 2 out of 10. Dry, too much bread, and very salty. Just cheese, bread, and salt :/ Their soup was ok. Nothing extraordinary. The salad was bland.  Not the best spot to dine at in Vegas, in my humble opinion.

ZHw3vW1tdlu-kJl25RIUQQ.text: It's more than the food, it's the vibe. It's the history. But it's also the food. So many great times here.

r30DeRKzgM3dIaP8rP-YkQ.text: The food was good, but my overall experience was subpar. Prices are too high; the lighting (at least in the back corner room near the kitchen) was so low that I wanted to go to sleep; and the lack of customization of your meal choices is a big downside. Each meal comes with house wine, garlic bread, soup/salad, and cappuccino - which probably explains the overly priced plates. However, it felt like we were almost forced into getting all of the extras. For example, besides trying it out, we didn't drink any of the wine - which makes me wonder, how much wine do they waste in a night? Similarly, the cappuccino is served to you whether or not you want it. Some people in our group didn't drink theirs, and I probably would have passed on it too had they even asked us - especially if it would lower the price of the meal!  The biggest area for improvement, though, would have to be the service. Simple things (or what I think is simple or even common sense) like introducing yourself, smiling, and pointing out useful information can go a long way (e.g., the menu is on the wall, but we initially thought it was just part of the decor. It would have been nice if the hostess pointed that out when showing us our table.) Our server was decent and a little more friendly, but he had an assistant (or maybe he was the food runner?) that was uncomfortably awkward. It's hard to put into words what he was doing, but basically, he and the hostess could definitely improve on their customer service skills.  I want to like the restaurant - especially because it seems like it has a lot of history and the main dishes are good. However, I don't think my future visits to Vegas will include going to this hole in the wall place. The staff has plenty room for improvement in their communication and customer service skills.

A1OWtj_erZOTlG90dwpb7w.text: Very retro place amongst the craziness of Las Vegas really good food super fast service wonderful atmosphere a blast from the Vegas past I recommend it

RPOC-DNhDh5FI3KKcLl8AA.text: Reasonably priced fare delivered quick and hot. Plenty of food - not the best Italian I've ever had but still delicious. Atmosphere is worth the visit alone. Menu on the wall, lots of decorations and plenty of entertainment.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Evening ending Cappuccino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi with Marinara
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House Salad

cwGPBF08BMJLJdIF4OkPTQ.text: The atmosphere was great and unique. The food was average, not sure if it was worth the price. There is an musician that goes table to table even if you dont ask him, he plays a little something and then waits for a tip. It is super awkward when you dont carry cash for tips.

vS2KZldOTTlhOLBWc-agTw.text: Been a couple years since I've been, so probably don't remember everything. But it was amazing when I went. I did have a reservation, so got seated fast. Love the food, really loved the vibe! Was really dark(which I liked), felt Italian. Food was amazing. Would recommend this place.

0dptuxoCSwkNce2NQVaS6Q.text: Battista's Hole In the Wall has been around for years.  It's off the strip and has a "beer barrel door" as it's front entry.  It's kind of funky with it's "old style decor."  The food is OK, but I think it used to be better.  We've gone there almost every year, kind of a tradition, although I'm not sure I'll go back next year.  Chalkboard menu includes, soup or salad, entree, cappuccino (tastes like hot chocolate with whipped cream) and all the house wine you can drink.  Think the wine thing is why we first started going here ... we were younger.  But probably the best part is the fact that there is an elderly Italian gentleman who walks through the restaurant with his accordian playing Italian tunes and taking requests.  Was surprised that he was still there (he's 87) ... apparent he still plays a couple of nights a week.  And while he doesn't remember all the words anymore he still brightens up the atmosphere and it's fun to see him.  Our waiter said he makes more tips the the waiter himself. LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining with my buddies

dLdc3929xTJELMqDBNL6XQ.text: Solid 4 stars. Very Hole in the Wall place indeed, you get two carafes of wine with your meal for free (obviously built into the price ranging from $21.95-46.95 depending on what your order for an entree) one red and one white. Decent quality, I might add. We did not have a reservation, it was a Wednesday evening too I might add, but I've been here once before on a weekend and was able to get in without a reservation that time too.  The veal Parm was good as was the eggplant Parm. I like home cooked best, but for going out it was definitely one of the better eggplant Parms if not the best for dining out. You also have choice or soup or salad and your meal is also served with garlic bread which was very delicious too. To top it all off you get a cappuccino wuth your meal at the end which tastes more like hot cocoa mixed with coffee, but nevertheless still delicious!  I love the atmosphere and ambiance, old school mafia style dining, dimly lit but nice and roomy. If you've never been, check it out, little off the beaten path located behind the flamingo, but definitely a better place to try, less tourist trappy feeling.

fMeFxRf7V5TRGc2S046Vig.text: So my mom remembered coming here when she was around 19 years old and still talked about it being a great authentic Italian experience so I looked it up while we were in town and it is still open! We made the walk from Planet Hollywood and it wasn't unbearable. We got seated right away and given a free carafe of red or white wine and then we ordered - I got the linguine with clams which was LOADED with clams and had a delicious white wine butter sauce on top. My husband got the chicken alfredo which was also delicious and large portioned.  There was also an older man going from table to table playing the accordion which was fun and added to the old school Italian ambiance which I felt here. Really enjoyed our time; would recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

51QMUrVvkrzTJDjuH6T8pg.text: This was my first time eating at Battista's Hole in the Wall. The funny thing is I always thought this was a bar. I've passed by this restaurant so many times and never stopped to try it out... until TODAY.   A couple of my friends and I came here for dinner (6:00pm reservation on a Thursday). Parking wasn't that bad (they have some in the front of the restaurant). My first impression of when I walked into the restaurant was "its so dark & it has a ton of random stuff all over the place".   They had our rsvp and sat us at our table. They kicked us off with some FREE white and red wine. (unlimited wine) Then dropped off some garlic bread. We were given option for the Minestrone soup or the house salad. I had the salad and it was pretty yummy.  For dinner I ordered the eggplant Parmesan. It was pretty good. There was so much cheese but not enough marinara sauce, so it was kind of dry. It did come with a side of pasta. For desert we ordered the Spumoni Ice Cream Pie; it was not impressing at all. Wasn't worth the calories.   The service wasn't good at all. Our server wasn't engaged at all. Came to the table only to drop things off. No conversation what so ever. The worst part was he dropped the check without even asking if we wanted desert. It wasn't even busy on a Thursday and we felt like we were rushed to eat and leave.   I would maybe give this restaurant another try and update my review.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5hhfYJYQcSQ9ZTYCJgcbUg.text: Every time we come to Vegas, we have to make a stop here. Just slightly off the strip behind the Flamingo is this family style Italian restaurant. Every meal comes with house wine in white or red, soup or salad, a pasta side and hands down the best sweet cappuccino with whipped cream for dessert.   We started off the meal with red wine and salad. The salad is smothered in Italian dressing, which is delicious- but be aware if you're not a dressing fan. The wine is extremely drinkable. Just like a house wine you'd expect to get. We both settled for the spaghetti with two meatballs for our entree, which was perfectly sized for both of us (not the typical oversized plates you get at restaurants). They skipped the pasta side, but we didn't need it anyway. It was too hot of a day to worry about it. The sweet cappuccino with whipping cream was the perfect end to the meal.   Service was ok this time. It's been better in the past.   Spend your dinner sorting through the photos on the walls and taking stock of the odd assortment of items hanging from the ceiling.   Be warned: It's pretty dark in there. The dimmed lighting is a welcome shift from the glaring sun on the strip, but it's not good for taking photos.   If you're walking from the strip, be aware that the short walk to the restaurant may look a bit sketchy. But it's only about a block and you're still on a main stretch of road next to Bally's. Just don't be surprised if you see a panhandler or two and smell a lot of weed along the way.

i2Asb64JnNdFoiH0XlsazA.text: This is a Las Vegas must do for me and my family for over twenty years. The food is about $30 but includes a soup or salad and garlic bread, house red/white wine, your entree and a cappuccino that tastes like hot chocolate.   Service has always been great for us. Classic Italian decor and tonight I even got to sit across a pic of Michael Landon :)

u5BO-vu_rleN2pyhgFzO2g.text: Ok. A difficult one to rate. The food was mostly excellent but the ambience and service was lacking.  Ordered the Steak Caruso, medium rare, and the Linguine Chopped Clam. Both were excellent.   The wine, which is included, was left mostly unconsumed because the quality was awful but the garlic bread was piping hot and yummy.  I would like to like this restaurant more but Vegas is a competitive market and there are many other options.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine Chopped Clams

uKE-5yOi_wCL_5vhU2SxQw.text: I was with a large party that visited Battista's recently and would not recommend it or go back.  Everything on their website and prior reviews says it all about what to order, how, etc.   They're in a bit if a hurry to move you in and out and the food is average at best.  Spaghetti with meat sauce was all meat and sugary sauce while the house wines weren't great.  Salad and garlic bread to start was fine.  The best part of the evening is the accordion playing gentleman who has been there forever I'm sure and is quite the character.

wwdTY0FTtAss_hfmI2FglA.text: It was okay, I think, speaking as a non-Italian. Spaghetti with meat balls was simple, and same thing applies to the chicken parmesan. Just tasted more plain than normal but idk maybe this is the authentic Italian food??   The only thing I really like was the clams spaghetti, full of seafood flavor!!!! At the end, there's a complimentary cappuccino that's super duper sweet and I tasted diabetes.

e7FoAY8p1DTs_MxTCATIUA.text: Fun, affordable, off-strip, legendary Italian joint where our group thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.   I would have never expected to enjoy our team dinner at Battista's but I did. The experience started by entering the building through a parking lot that is dodgy compared to the strip. The inside is dark and covered in all sorts of framed pictures and memorabilia related to celebrities who have eaten here over the years. Also on the walls are oversized menus that give you selections based upon price. Note that free white and red wine is included in the meal price, as is your choice of soup/ salad. I chose a delicious Italian salad along with spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were outstanding and the pasta was well cooked. The wine, while not high end, reminded me of homemade wine I used to drink at my best friends home growing up. Mama Rosa would be proud.   Service was great. The bartender was snarky and somewhat indifferent but I liked her style. Our servers were perfect, moving us along at a pace the suites us.   Overall I recommend Battista's highly but go there expecting it to be what it is, not some high end restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FxTbPJjTluDbaVfH-iYtOQ.text: The food was good, and big portions, I didn't realize so much food was involved. Starts with comp house wine, your choice red or white, my b.f chose red and said it was tasty. then you get either salad with 1000 island dressing or minestrone soup and a basket of garlic bread then your meal, which is scorching hot. then a cappuccino for dessert con: garlic bread doesn't stay soft after awhile and wasn't the best i ever had. servers were on it though props to them, sorry we'd bee. drinking names were maybe Frank and idk.im awful, sorry guys

l4KlAcFgba6HqfFq366b-w.text: OK, so I was in Glitter Gulch last weekend for some R&R (as well as some gambling), and I decided to eat dinner at Battista's Hole In The Wall.   Short version: A kitschy Old-World Italian trattoria with lots of atmosphere, big portions, lots of wine and pretty decent food. If you want to see Old Las Vegas before the Disneyland transformation, this is it!   Long version: Battista's has been a staple of off-Strip dining since 1970, back when Las Vegas was REALLY "Sin City." It's in a crude strip center next to a liquor store, and for a lot of tourists it's off the grid.   Yeah, the facade looks like an Italian flop-house, but go inside - good value awaits you there!   Battista's is only open for dinner, so plan accordingly. Don't eat too much at the lunch buffet at your hotel, because you'll need the extra room in your pants for the portions.   The menu never varies except for the price. Almost everything is prix-fixe, meaning that you get a 3-course meal for under $30, including a free carafe of house wine. Yes, I said FREE. Whoa.   I got there at about 5 pm (7 pm Central time, when I usually eat) and immediately got a cozy table next to the bar. There was a lot of old celebrity memorabilia and pics all over the restaurant. It's not uncommon to eat between pictures of Sophia Loren and Dean Martin at your booth or table.   Another amusing part of this kitschy restaurant is the strolling accordion player, who is all of four feet tall and probably 100 years old. This guy not only can play classic favorites, but he sings as well! Cool!   Since I was in a carb mood, I ordered the lasagna. It came with a choice of soup or house salad, lots of garlic bread, a carafe of red wine (my choice) and cappuccino as a dessert. Price? $28. WHOA.   It was too hot for soup, so I ordered the house salad. It was a nice leafy blend of greens but it could have used a bit more dressing. I would have liked some on the side, but still, it was a hearty affair.   Now on to the lasagna. One word - DELICIOUS. It was also huge as life. Nice and piping hot and baked in ovenware. Pics attached as proof.    It was pleasantly flavored but since I like a lot of pepper and kick to my Italian food, I was happy to find both crushed red pepper flakes and Parmesan cheese on the table next to the salt and pepper. Nice.   It was so big that I could barely finish it. I'm sure that people with smaller appetites would take the leftovers home - like my idiot sister, who has the appetite of a baby sparrow (not to mention the IQ of one). But I digress.   The cappuccino was a bit of a let-down. As others have mentioned here, it tastes more like hot chocolate than an espresso with milk. I have a feeling that they pre-make it, because when I asked if I could have a decaf version, the waitress said "no - it would be a special order if we did, and it would cost extra." Gotcha.   So, here's the Peter Hughes Exit Question - would I come back? The answer is a resounding YES. If you are tired of fast food, hotel buffets and pricey restaurants inspired by obnoxious celebrity "chefs," then Battista's is a hole-in-one for you. ABUNDANZA!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A piping-hot serving of meat lasagna!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A nice bowl of the house salad, with my carafe of red wine in the background.

6euk32AarhKp48uFdsr5xg.text: Perfect. The staff, food, red wine, everything was perfect! The garlic bread was buttery. The chicken parmigiana was the best I've ever had. The atmosphere here was great! I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmegiana

8AazLK8gsiiuaN0f7xKjRQ.text: The service was unbelievably great. The staff and the accordionists was fabulous. The decor was interesting and cool. The vibe was positive and energetic and happy and fun. The food was not great. The pasta gravy was flavorless. The veal had the right texture, sort of, but had no flavor. The pasta itself was cooked to perfection but it had nothing to give it flavor. The Chianti was terrible.   It's hard to give Batista's only a three but the price point did them in. It's not cheap and so they have to keep their end of the bargain. The food must be of good quality and flavorful and worth eating. What I was served was not.

They also include red and white wine with your dinner. Can't go wrong with that. Salad was tasty and the bread is addicting. This is a must try restaurant for a delicious dinner.  You will not be disappointed.

s6Waa5CB47jPvF_baTcDOA.text: This is my third visit to Battista's, and I will keep coming back! The atmosphere is top notch, the wine is good, the menu is easy, and I always have a great time with my companions here. This time I had the fettuccine  mussels, and it was a fantastic choice. Very savory, not too spicy, and a generous portion. The cappuccino at the end of the meal is always a delight. Kari provided top notch service on this visit! Missed the master accordionist this trip, but overall, another fine dining experience in Vegas. Do yourself a favor and plan stop here on your next visit.

o7cnJPROdAE8dXTqoaI60A.text: Disappointed, really wanted to like Battista's I had heard so much about it. First of the staff, I made reservations. When we arrived went up to the check in stand, only to have the hostess roll her eyes as I gave our name. It gets better our waiter just went thru the motions, as little interaction as possible.  They do serve complimentary red and white wine, nice touch. Tried the red and it wasn't bad. We were served hard crunchy garlic bread.  Around this time an Older hunched over man approaches with an accordion wants to know where we are from. California we say, so he breaks into signing and playing a line from California Here I Come! Ok, then he says "aren't you going to give me something"? Ummm, my husband says Sorry just have an ATM card, no cash. He gets angry, my husband says I'll try and catch you on the way out, so he begins to argue about how we aren't leaving him a tip so why bother!  So here comes the salad, it's ok. We ordered pasta and lasagna, just average not bad, but just ok. Prices are a little high probably to off set the wine. Sadly we won't be back, way to many great restaurants in Las Vegas.

QFUDn5c0Hk4CtPIDZ4rWlQ.text: This place is great! The atmosphere makes it! Very low lighting and cozy vibe- the perfect dinner date restaurant! Very unique and old time style decor- you can tell it's been here a while! The food was good- large portions and not bad for the price! Not the best Italian I've ever had but you can't beat free wine and a 3 course meal for $34! The service was fast. Maybe even (dare I say) too fast? What I mean by that is the waitress was curt and didn't really engage us...would have loved it if she had been more personable and friendly, but either way I can't say it was bad! We got our food in a timely manner and had so much we couldn't even finish it! Definitely stop in here if you haven't before- it's worth it to enjoy an authentic Old Vegas dining experience!

aN1m-CIFPFT6O3cKDuNRbQ.text: Not sure what all the hype with this place is all about . I was very excited to take my BF here and to try it based on the hype and recommendations from a friend.  I made dinner reservations weeks in advance for 6pm. Arrived early and were seated right way after the hostess and a manager debated over if They could seat us because they only had 6 other open tables. Stupid.  At this point I was still excited but the menu isn't very extensive and the prices super high for the quality of food that we were served.   We started off with house salads that were kinda boring with field greens, spinach and a sprinkling of cheese. The garlic bread they bring to the table is delicious however.  The bring house wine that is complimentary but probably the most bitter wine I have ever had so I ordered a cosmopolitan. I would have ordered a second because it tasted good but was never offered another. The cosmo was almost 11.00 btw.  The BF ordered the evening special the steak Bella. The mushroom pasta that he was served was delicious.  I ordered the Chicken Parm, it is served with a tiny amount of penne pasta and it was just okay.  It wasn't very flavorful. I think the Chicken parm was 32.00-36.00   The after dinner drink that is included with dinner is a cappuccino. It was most likely from an instant cappuccino machine and if it wasn't it tasted like it did.   They do not have a dessert menu. You get a cappuccino after dinner.   I was expecting authentic, flavorful Italian food and left disappointed.  Disappointed that for the price we paid the food should have been much better.   The noise level escalated when they sat a table of 25 in our section.   FYI: Also I heard the waitress tell the table next to ours that they charge 13.00 if you share dishes.   Take some cash with you because there is a senior that will come around playing the accordion and it would be nice to tip him.   Pricing: includes soup or salad, garlic bread, entree, and cappuccino. Oh and the unlimited amount of table wine.  Prices range from 21.00-36.00   Parking wasn't an issue in front of the restaurant.
