dBPubzbTkcyeA9eMM8NaUg.text: I friend recommended this place and since I travel to Vegas at least 2 or 3 times a year, I thought I'd give it a try. I'm glad I did.  I thought the food was great. I've had the chicken parmesan and on another visit, spaghetti with red sauce.  Both dishes were great, and the portions were HUGE.  Even better was the free wine they kept bringing (it's all you can drink, and it's a house red or white served in a carafe).   The place reminds you of gangster hangouts you've seen in the movies.  It's dark inside, no windows (reducing the chance of driveby's), with lot's of nooks and crannies (small rooms, and even smaller rooms). One great advantage to their location is their proximity to the hotels on the strip, but your not on the strip.

ehFu8MYf7MSdjf8LA36-vw.text: After a buddy and I landed in Las Vegas, we asked the cab driver to take us to a hole-in-the-wall restaurant, away from the strip. He actually took us to a restaurant named, "Hole in the Wall." Who knew?  Menu is on the wall. Bottomless jug of wine on the table. Food served in your mother's bowl and plates. What is not to like?  Sure you can eat at one of those restaurants on the strip that is owned by some famous chef that I never heard of, and pay $50 a head. Or you can go to a family style restaurant that doesn't take itself seriously, has a casual atmosphere about it and get a good meal for the money.  The food quality may not be top notch, but just have another canter of house wine. Welcome to Vegas baby!

lBPOPfh2-2QfCCGjLaCuzA.text: Hole in the Wall?  I think Sh!t hole is more appropriate.  While the server was pleasant and professional, they served my daughter sour, curdled milk.  How does that happen?  The garlic bread was stale, the wine was horrible, neither of my girls could stomach their meatballs and the salad was limp.  It was like stepping back in time... and not a good time.

lZGGZxwm1qwrBG-Bbh1waw.text: 25 people of varying ages and tastes. Had entire section 4 us. Great service, took care of all requests. Great value for party unlimited wine included. All 25 served at same time. Only added 18 pct tip in my world unheard of low. Best value for fun large group in Vegas. Last of old time Vegas on strip.

Y0JUVEoJzXgJDrzgkHgyQw.text: Went with a sales group of 43 people. Had no idea where we were going and was concerned that any restaurant could do a good job with that many people. They were totally prepared ( of course we had reservations) I knew that our head server was a lifer. 27 years. This place was cool. We got our money's worth for sure. Chicken parm was very good. Food was hot and fresh. Will be back for sure. Accordion player was good too.

p07C1nEN3W0awQvsJ6qgcw.text: I love finding a good hole in the wall restaurant.  The food was excellent and so was the service.  Complimentary garlic bread and two carafes of wine was a plus.  I had the chicken rio which I highly recommend.    Overall, a great fun experience.  Will definitely return when I'm back in Las Vegas, NV.

pKZvnk-E8kzMeVSqgyBWCA.text: Yelpers, I love ya, I really used your feedback to plan my latest trip to Vegas.  So take it from me, this place sucks.  We were staying at Bally's, upgraded to a great suite, having a great time.  Also having fun finding the best low-cost meals (see Ellis Island and Gold Coast reviews).  But we had a hankering for Italian and the restaurant inside the Bally's (for which we had scored 1/2 price coupons) was closed (!).  We had seen Battista's on our way to Ellis Island, and decided to try it, despite not-so-stellar reviews.  The outside is ugly, but the inside atmosphere isn't bad, typically Italian, pictures on the wall, old menus, photos of old Vegas, whatever.  Oddly, fishing nets on the ceiling -- did this used to be a fish joint?  Impossible to know.  Now one of the problems with this place is -- entrees are expensive.  But, that's because salad and hosue wine are included.  Big deal.  We order, and the waitress asks us if we want red or white.  Me -- white, wife -- red. So she brings two full carafes!  We barely drank 1/10 of each -- there goes most of our money.  The wine wasn't that good, BTW.  Then the fabled little man with the accordion stops by.  Seriously, he is old and bent over.  It's like having Gollum come to your table to play music.  To be honest, he wasn't as creepy or disturbing as we feared, given previous reviews, but he definitely plays a few moments of a tune and then wants a tip.  I gave him three bucks and thankfully he went away permenently.  Then we got our food.  I got fettucine alfredo with chicken, and I did not like it.  It tasted like the kind you would get from Sbarro (a place we had considered) -- not cheesy enough.  Admittedly, the wife really liked her eggplant parmesan.  But I almost immediately started feeling sick.  We got the check, and hopped the monorail to the tropicana to see Bobby Slayton, but by then I was feeling pretty bad and we ended up skipping the show.  We didn't care -- Slayton was a cheap ticket and just a way to fill time.   But as far as Battista's goes -- I don't recommend it.  There must be better opportunities.  P.S.  Bally's rocks, and for dinner, Ellis Island and the Gold Coast buffet rock.

rOBhd-T-O0lAZ4u07VFGDw.text: Food is basic Italian and comes with all you can drink wine, but it's around 30 bucks per person.  Not worth it...

P2XKRKB--LUSG2_4a8Pqig.text: Was desperate for food. Stumbled in here. There was a huge line. We waited a hour. I was disappointed. The set meals were run of the mill. Try somewhere else unless you are really hungry. The decor is cool,I thought there was going to be mob hit LOL,

NKvzNKNlxTFdwX_ypLh1FA.text: Came here with 15 other girls and expected to have much more fun than we actually did. The house wine was below average but the salad and garlic bread were good.  We waited for the accordion player but he never showed up. I had the chicken Parmesan which was good and a very substantial amount of food.  The host was fun and took plenty of pictures when we asked, we just expected a better time.

jd43FN3rgnVe98lbTZ7MIg.text: This place is a legend in Las Vegas dining.  I felt i was eating at the original bucca di beppo's.  Nothing to go out of the way for.  Not cheap either.

4riayMjgsN31MxhGb-DknQ.text: The food is bad. The wine is bad. The salad is wilted lettuce drenched in Italian dressing. The guy playing the accordion is not very good, although he is old and appears to be ill in some way, so i feel bad saying anything. I'm not sure when this place was considered cool, but it is not. Anyhow go if you want a bunch of tourist drunk on cheap wine screaming quotes from Goodfellows, and the Godfather.   Your in Vegas for God sake live it up, and plunk down a few extra bucks for a good restaurant.

rpsIHSZAS1XFBWPLxPu3bw.text: My wife and I were married in Vegas in November 2013. I have eaten here half a dozen times and am a huge fan. However, I called three times during the week and the Friday right before the wedding to confirm they would be staffed appropriately for 20 people getting appetizers. We'll we showed up and they acted clueless. It took thirty minutes for appetizers. The food was good as usual, but the service was not satisfying.

GAr1oFwl_Du003IPxrwagA.text: I think this place deserves better reviews.  It is about 2 blocks off the strip distance wise.  In other ways, it is years away from the Strip and that is a good thing.  No CHA CHING CHING CHING of the slot machines and no Paris Hilton wanna bees (don't get me wrong, I like that but need a respite).  Good food and reasonably priced.  If you are on the Strip and getting overloaded, go here.

cDPEiHrfsQ21LH0yrm_uLg.text: Big limousine outside the entrance, many photos of stars posing with the owner. Thanks for the song about Portugal!

XapS_0aVYpqzC2WpKAxPPQ.text: A group of us had dinner here at the end of April 2011 and the food was better than the previous visits, a step up from their usual pretty good.  Service was fast, staff was very friendly and Gordy was rockin' (so to speak).  Great evening out for a group!

mwgaVywmQ__k_A4FghUVtw.text: Classic vegas, great italian, and complimentary wine.... Love this place!

-R5i1wJJ5VXqPc6dBMbchw.text: I gotta say ...the food...eh. its ok. but this place is so cute . All you can drink for twenty dollars with your food...the wine is probably carlo rossi or whatever that stuff id that comes in a box, but i wouldnt go for the food. Id go to just look at the pics on the wall and listen to the cute older gentleman serenade me. Its really nice to get away from the main part of the strip crowded with people and full of snobs.. this place has a "family " vibe and I think everyone should visit it at least once. because we all know the "old " vegas landmarks can only hold on for so long before they get plowed over for a new starbucks or mac store can be built in its place...

m4jl8q0bMj0mnVTUWg__lA.text: My experience with Italian restaurants is that the best ones are not overseen by some chef wanting to make his or her mark on the cuisine, but by an immigrant who had spent the majority of his or her life feeding the family, and now that the kids are grown, has taken those skills to care for the restaurant's patrons. These establishments are usually holes in the wall, garlic and tomato-scented spots inserted into strip malls between a convenience store and a dry cleaners.  With that in mind, I chose Battista's Hole in the Wall when I went out to dinner with a group of convention-goers in Las Vegas last week.  First off, this place is FUN! The walls were as crowded as the restaurant itself with pictures of Las Vegas royalty from years past. Trinkets and chotchkies hung in the room's nooks and crannies. Entering this restaurant is to enter the home of a person devoted to living life around the dining table, for that is where the day begins, pauses for respite, and ends.  Once seated, a stern waiter placed carafes of wine on our table, announcing that the wine and garlic bread are free, and the menus are on the wall. And indeed they were, but we hadn't noticed them until this fellow had called them to our attention.  During our meal, a petite octogenarian traversed the dining room with an accordion as big as he (if not bigger), playing various tunes on request and hamming it up for the crowded tables. He focused on the pretty lady at our table and played her the tarantella, pausing to point at the black buttons on the left hand of the accordion to passionately cry: "The BASS! Nobody plays BASS anymore!" This was indeed dinner and a show.  I had the cannelloni. It was OK. The accompanying spinach reminded me of frozen spinach, the kind that came out of a box and most of us generally detested as kids. A similar complaint came from another member of the group, who'd had the salmon and expressed concern that it had freezer burn. I'm not an expert in meat, so perhaps group-think has since led me to believe that the meat in my cannelloni was similarly spiced. Another member of the group called the cappacino that the restaurant gives for free at the end of the meal: "truck stop cappacino," referring to the machines that make it. It's no Starbucks drink, and it does taste like hot chocolate, which is why I liked it.  Would I come here if I were dining alone? No. Would I come here with my date? Not a chance. This restaurant is not suited for such moments in our lives, neither where food nor ambiance are concerned. However: would I come here with a bunch of acquaintances who want to have a good time and perhaps eat a little food in the process? Sure. Battista's Hole in the Wall drops the pretentions of normal dining, challenges us to not take things as seriously as we normally do, and pay attention to those oft-ignored things that we rely upon throughout life.  For, in the words of the restaurant's owner: "The BASS! Oh, NOBODY plays the BASS anymore!"

5Thg8-jXrB7XZ4gHe5S3aQ.text: Very very meh. The food was ok, the wine was nasty. Had fun with the group of people I was with, but it's not likely I would go back.

eirzWDa3shSymxYxk5URLw.text: The quintessential home-style Italian restaurant. A very simple menu with a main course including apps (salad or minestrone, and garlic bread), wine, and cappuccino at the end of your meal.   The price isn't cheap if you aren't very hungry and are looking for something small, but it's an amazing value especially when you are hungry. Everything is made in house.   Ambience is very family style, loud, and slow. Nobody is in a rush when you come to eat. Lots of cool stuff hanging on the walls, with a claim of the worlds largest mini bottle collection. Could seem gimmicky, but you're in Vegas. Still family owned and I definitely plan on coming back the next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parmigiana with creamed spinach and a side of pasta. For such a large piece of chicken, it was perfectly cooked

wZL1DyFpip1RxD-48azkyw.text: This "hole in the wall" has been around for many years, and is actually a pretty spacious and fun establishment conveniently located around the corner from the main Strip, just off the beaten path near The LinQ and Flamingo hotels. I recently went with a group of 12 for dinner. The service was good and the noise level was a bit boisterous. Let's not forget about the old-school Italian ambiance. The food was good, not great, but the portions were generous, very reasonably priced and included a lot - in addition to the main dish each meal came with a side of salad, pasta , a cappuccino (although it was actually hot chocolate), and unlimited red and white house wine. It's definitely a must-visit, especially if you're coming in a group - bring your appetites!

qrwYdo7czorestaTWxxU1Q.text: Well, the place is amazing. Like a history museum. The stuff was nice and there was 45 minute wait time. Here is the thing at least for me... IT IS Italian place HOW COME you don't have PIZZA.

pAWFd556A5EYUs3gXIAE6w.text: Mixed bag that gives what you put into it  I've been here a few times with large groups and it always come down to the group on how I enjoy my visit.   The food is ok at best. it's simple, not fancy and does come as a full meal with house wine. Let me restate this is nothing fancy, including the wine. What Battista is good for is delivering a good deal. On all of my visits the service was middle of the road. There's nothing special in that area. It's slow but does deliver.  If you have a large party of friends and family who want a deal on mediocre Italian and cheap wine, this is your Hole In The Wall. If you're looking for something more, stick closer to the strip.

9uluxAC4xFX9R63pibzHWw.text: This place was absolutely amazing and professional!!! My husband and I had our wedding dinner here with about 40-50 guests this last weekend and were so pleased! First: The food is amazing! If you are looking for comfort Italian food this is the place. Living in New York for 8 years I know good Italian and this place is delicious. My guests, my husband, and myself loved it! No complaints. Second: The price is unbeatable. They include all the essentials to a wonderful meal, even table wine. We spent, including tax and tip, $1500 on dinner. With that being said, we did do a limited menu but our guests still had over 10 options with chicken and even a few seafood selections. We also brought in an outside cake in which they cut and plated for us right at the table for no additional charge. Third: The service was incredible!!! Our waitress was Kim. She was so awesome and so in control. She assured us as soon as we sat down that we would have a wonderful time and we did. Everything came out in a timely matter, the right things ordered, and her whole team was so sweet! Lastly: Making the reservation was a breeze. They sat us on time, the host crew and management crew were so kind and knowledgeable in all my questions leading up to the big day! I want to thank these guys so much!!! For anyone considering this place, do it!!!

ImRmbcosm5BGFDLWJlsTiw.text: The place is clean and very old school Vegas which was awesome.  Food was mediocre and over priced. Cappuccino at the end was the best I have ever had!!  If I ever return it will be fore the cappuccino!!  Edit: 7/2017 - Ok so I ended up going back and it was amazing.  The first time I had the fettuccine alfredo - I dont recommend I thought the sauce was very bland.  This time I had Lasagna.  It was amazing!!  They also make the best garlic bread., yum! I also asked them to chill the wine in ice because I don't like warm white wine.  So now I give it 5 stars instead of 3.  Also on a note, the wait staff is amazing.  Hostesses not so much - but A+ servers.  Still think it's a bit overpriced.

gksmEGhXG5hD0ytuqheTFg.text: "Hole in the Wall"... Well... Despite the name, (and that the location and atmosphere match up to the name) I enjoyed my experience. The menu is simple and the dishes are delightful; keeping in mind that most of the dishes are made in bulk. Bread: average All you can drink wine: white- blah, red- fine (all you can drink I'm not going to get picky Spaghetti and meatballs: delicious  Cappuccino: more like a dessert (served with whipped cream) Soup: average  Mostly this restaurant earned a four star because I enjoyed my experience. Got sat right away (Monday night around 8:30) and the ambiance was good: dark & swanky! Not four stars for the food. Food: 3 stars.   I would make this a should do IF you're over the flashy and pricey restaurants on the strip.

cI27mNk7mzinAkbTJ8sszA.text: Kept having people telling us to check this place out! Atmosphere was simply amazing for old school Italian style. Food was old school Italian which was very good.  Very heavy tho so don't plan a night out of drinking after cause your stuffed.  Free red and white wine pitchers on table but it was very tangy taste.  But  free. lol Its a must check out restaurant in vegas off the strip.  It's right behind flamingo casino. Walking distance like 1 block.

n0R3Un1u7iXdNqBCJ7jmYw.text: Hole in the Wall is a misnomer. Usually, you expect a low key greatness but I guess when they put that in the name, we should have known better. This place was....terrible. I've had better Italian food at Olive Garden (yikes!). #sorrynotsorry. We all ordered different meals, Chicken Alfredo, Lasagna, Penne with Cacciatore, and Eggplant. All entrees come with salad or soup, garlic bread and wine. Let's start with the wine. It's watered down and blah. The garlic bread was ok but it's more Parmesan than garlic. The entrees were bland and tasteless. The chicken in my chicken Alfredo was tender but bland. The Alfredo sauce itself didn't taste like anything. The other person who got it said his was bland. My friend's meatball was more like a meat clump and the sauce was a disgrace. The salad was the only part of the meal I enjoyed. Those that got the soup were not terribly disappointed but not impressed. Service was a bit slow but the staff was nice. For Vegas, the prices were not bad but because the food was so disappointing, we all felt cheated out of $40/person for crappy food. You can skip this place.

D3eMtn5aBsiBTmi8hPiMkQ.text: This place is the best kept secret of the Las Vegas strip. I a friend of mine recommended this place to me and I been coming here since then. Typically, go to Vegas for work now, but still make a point to stop in here. You can get a salad, entree and a jug of wine and you are not breaking the bank! Love all the flare in the bar waiting area. Definitely a great local place.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jug of Complimentary House Wine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from the outside!

SsbRepw5gVNizY0NoJ0U9g.text: To start we waited almost 10 minutes before our server greeted us... it went downhill from there.  We had a side of meatballs, chicken parm and linguine with chopped clams. The meatballs tasted store bought, chicken was drowning  in a acidic marinara and the linguine with clams was tasteless. The highlight of the meal was was a mediocre minestrone soup and garlic bread. We opted out of the cappuccino since the table next to us said it tasted like hot chocolate. To top it off our server (Rick I think) was preoccupied with everything other than his tables.  It is completely overpriced for the quality....Won't be back

avRayWkWmaYwme-ovbdiiw.text: What a fun place to go! We took a group of 7 and made reservations. The table was ready when we arrived. The atmosphere was old time Vegas.   The service was fast but we never felt like we were rushed. The cappuccino at the end was the perfect way to end the meal.   Will definitely come back the next time we are in Vegas

gO3A-YFWxSAZx0b5t6co8Q.text: All you can drink red or white wine included!!  Carafes on the table throughout the meal. I don't drink, but the rest of my family does so this saved us probably at least 100 bucks in drink charges.   A family of four, all of us got a full dinner, great salad, excellent minestrone, yummy, super buttery garlic bread and a "cappuccino" after. I had the manicotti which I couldn't finish. Took it home and had it for another 2 meals the next day!  Hubby and mom had lasagna. Dad had spaghetti meatballs.   We will return!  Dark, romantic, little place with a ton of old school memorabilia. This is our second visit and I think we'll make it a staple for our Vegas trips. It offers a nice break from the flashy noise and exorbitant prices on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Takin&#39; the folks to Vegas!

Dh3KaqKC-S1cGf-HDeDc8w.text: Love. Love. Love this place! Been to Vegas plenty of times and this was our first time to try. We had the Lasagna, awesome!!! Wine is included with dinner (Red AND White), so be prepared to drink! The bread was so hot, delicious and homemade. We had soup and salad, also delicious! The cappuccino, which is also included with dinner was the best I have ever had! Don't let the name fool you, this is a very authentic Italian place with a great old school personality. Reminds me of "old Vegas", a place The Rat Pack probably frequented. We will be back!!! As I can't wait to try other dishes.

eDE1dhxjggwv0XKmEibNjA.text: Came here with a large group of family on the advice of a Vegas regular.  It's in a tiny strip mall behind the casinos near Bally's.  From the front, you wouldn't think anything of the place, but the food is great!  If you want an old-school Italian restaurant experience, make the short walk over and check it out.

FixxuSMrcrXvQTqvv0Z0mw.text: Aside from getting food poisoning, it was a pleasant experience. The decent service and the old Vegas ambiance almost made up for the fact that I soiled myself before making it home. I highly recommend this joint if you're looking for a meal that will ruin your night but not your figure.

TkHCVRHWQS8RQc9dq13KUg.text: The easiset way to describe this place is I felt like I was in Italy.  The atmosphere and ambiance was incredible.  Well established place The portions were enpurmous and they serve wine red and white with meals.  It also comes with a capacino Delicious.

1AV77-oSK0tx0s3B4IBlfw.text: This is without a doubt my favorite restaurant in Vegas. I travel to Vegas three times a year on business and always make sure we eat here. The service is always spot on and is undoubtedly the best Italian food I've had. The house wine is great but the after dinner cappuccino is the bomb! It's definitely a must try!!!

eHrdoKG0qBjEvtzIXLbqIw.text: The lasagna was one of the best I have ever had.   Amazing.   Salad was fresh and crisp. Service was top notch.     Definitely a do over.

fVDLLzcgy8m2BYhXCN91Gw.text: You know what? We really thought this place was pretty neat!! I had heard about it many years ago, but we never had a chance to go until recently. The decor is very eclectic!  We were staying at The Linq, so it was a quick 10-15 minute walk. We had reservations and were seated immediately. The tables are close together so you can hear the other tables conversations. We were given a large carafe of both white and red wine at our table. The food is old school Italian- the minestrone soup was really good, as was the garlic bread. I had lasagna (huge portion!) and my husband had spaghetti with meatballs. The cappuccino was great as a dessert! Our bill was $50-60 for two- a great deal for this much food in Vegas!!  We will return!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rest of my lasagna that I took home with me!

d-n8jI1r23ES4iA_pqgmZQ.text: Take a Lyft from the strip. It's $5.   Get the minestrone soup. The salad is fine, but it's a generic salad--though it has salami and pepperoncini in it. Nice.   Forgot to review it when I was there this week. Absolutely the best Italian place in terms of ambiance and food. The place is old Vegas, clean, and fun. Most of all, they leave you the hell alone without the fake waiter upsell/tip earning crap at a chain restaurant. They don't care what you think, they're just going to bring you the best food imaginable. I suggest everyone order something different--that way you can share.   The wine is fantastic. People complaining about it being table wine are probably the types of folk that swish $80 cab blends, make up some loosey-goosey adjective about its smokey aromatic legs, and spit it in a bucket at country club events. You don't need that kind of negativity in your life.   Make sure you have $1 or $2 in cash to tip the accordion player. Stop bitching and just do it. He's earned it.   As spineless as it sounds, get the spaghetti and meatballs. It's cheap and wonderful. The steak pizzaiola is a good backup. Veal parmegiana [sic] is a good 3rd, if you are cool with eating children. I was.   Cover that shit in red pepper flake--being Italian in the 21st century means not an ounce of spice in the prep, sadly. It'll kick it up a bit, unless you're the sad sack that thinks sea salt is exotic.

wTAU8ZYSErr-S3TdY_6irg.text: Three stars has to be the highest rating I have ever given to a restaurant where I found the food to be nearly inedible, but my wife liked her linguine shrimp, and the restaurant is so popular that I must be missing something.    First of all, if you look up "tourist trap" in the dictionary, you will find a picture of Battista's.  I speculate (emphasizing the word "speculation" and not "allegation" here) that, in a nod to its alleged mob past, someone is greasing the palms of every cab driver and concierge in town.  Whatever they are doing, it is working.  The place seems to be mobbed (pardon the pun) every night.  (Make a reservation!)  People seem to like the complimentary wine, garlic bread, and soup or salad.  Personally, I thought they were worth every penny, so to speak.  The only exception was the complimentary cappuccino, which was pretty good.  I would have ordered a different salad, but the very sparse one-page menu has no other salads, or soups for that matter.   Or wine list.  You eat and drink what they put in front of you.  I ordered the sausage cacciatori, which consisted of a pretty bland sweet Italian sausage link in a bed of some very weird sauce.  My guess is that the sauce was mostly green peppers, with a touch of tomato and garlic, run through a blender for ten minutes.  Yuck.  I also tried the side order of meatballs, which were also bland but at least the sauce tasted more or less like canned tomatoes.  Time to start thinking about drive through at McDonald's on the way home.  The service was okay, I guess.  Kind of slow and kind of disinterested, but the food got to the table.  The ambiance was busy, with lots of knick knacks and photos of entertainers on the walls.  The prices were not a huge bargain, but were acceptable if you count some of it as going to the complimentary wine.  (Here's a secret:  If you sit in the bar you can order a version of the full dinner menu without the "complimentary" wine, at a much lower price.  And also avoid the wait for a table.  They don't trumpet this deal, so you heard it here first.)  So, anyway, we won't be going back to Battista's.  If you are willing to wait 45 minutes for a table at an Italian restaurant, I would recommend going a couple of miles west on Flamingo Boulevard and eating at Nora's Italian Cuisine.  Much better food at comparable prices.

KYHdrR7hURlb7TccGGaOaw.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Battista's!  We have been going there for for over 20 years.  Great service, and food!  If you want True Italian food with a great atmosphere you won't be disappointed! Only issue we had on the last visit was it was a little hot. We sat in the very far back and it was getting pretty hot back there. The place was packed so we thought that could be part of the problem. We have never had that happen before so I'm not taking away from the 5 stars for that.

ibCfhpOTtXZGBXc3bbdjbg.text: I have to give it to Battista's. Service outstanding for a party of 28. They were on their A game and everyone had a great time. Food good, all you can eat garlic bread and wine. Oh did I mention wine is Included with the meal? Yep, good deal for our crowd.

pqUkZVJcDvA5rQzLOnEFPg.text: This is a small but romantic place that serves great food.  It is well worth a visit and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice Italian, home-style cooked meal.

ZRnID_7_ldaUd4P-aLqbLg.text: One of the places I have to go to whenever we're in Vegas.  I've been telling everyone how much we like coming here.  The atmosphere, food, wine and the acordian dude.  OMG always a fun night.  This time had the shrimp scampi. Fantastic!!!  Finish with the BATTISTAS Cappuccino and what great dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nNNb0xcGwJwgfIgIG41IQA.text: This place is so cute and kitschy!!  You really feel like you've stepped back in time...when the Rat Pack used to rule this fine city.  During our dinner here, several comments were made about how we were sure there were many mob hits ordered over dinner in this joint throughout the years.   But that is actually a huge compliment to the establishment... Mobsters always seem to find the best restaurants to frequent! :-)  Anyway, I really enjoy the environment of this restaurant!  And the food is pretty damn good as well! They have a few good option for vegetarians.   I had the eggplant parmesan with creamed spinach and I recommend both selections highly.  The salad, garlic bread and free wine are almost excellent as well!!  The only thing that raises an eyebrow is the drink they give you at the end of the meal, which is called cappuccino but tastes more like really sugary hot chocolate.  But I guess I shouldn't complain... It's included in the price and it's nice of them to round off the meals in such a way.    I love this place and you should definitely hit it up!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very tasty eggplant parmesan and creamed spinach... And notice the nice glass of FREE red wine......

SBMLQyroNH_aIXdcCXEjRQ.text: Amazing food for a good price! Parking is minimal so get there early or you'll be waiting and waking far.

fCNRAEDgADDcEqZhAop-zQ.text: January 2, 2015   We will NOT return!  What a waste of $60.00!  *Minestrone Soup was BLAND! So we exchanged it for a salad.    *Italian Salad 1 piece of cheese (block) not shredded, NO grape olives, No cucumbers, No Carrots, No red or yellow bell peppers, No ricotta or crumbled feta.  *Garlic Bread was soggy! YOU CAN SEE THE SOGG SEEPING THROUGH THE NAPKIN IT WAS WRAPPED IN.  *All you can drink complimentary wine WATERED DOWN!   *I ordered #2 (Lasagna) bland, with lots of gooey cheese on top.  *Hunny ordered #3 (Canelloni w/ side of Cream Spinach), he only ate 1 of the Cannelloni chunks.  TOO cheesy, meat inside was very bland.   *For an Italian Restaurant there was ABSOLUTELY NO seasoning, food was very BLAND!  We were very disappointed.   *WE WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!

soggy garlic bread

qrsc8NIteAKiR8BRoGAw_g.text: Nice little place. Very good meatballs and yummy bread. I'll come back. Wine selection is decent for what the place is like.

Rdz0Ku8aobkcH2YDD7dFAg.text: Battista's Hole in the Wall  Location/Parking: Battista's is a quick, easy walk from the Strip in a little strip mall across from Bally's. Look for the big sign. You can't miss it. But don't even think about driving there, because by the end of dinner you won't be able to drive home.   Atmosphere:  Always crowded. Always a wait. Plan ahead. Seriously. Don't just show up when you're hungry on a Friday evening and think you're gonna waltz right in. Not even on a random Tuesday night. It's always packed with at least an hour wait. Call ahead.   That said, it's totally worth the wait. Very friendly, cozy, warm atmosphere with a wandering accordion player. Nice touch, that. Not too loud, not too stuffy, no screaming brats. Nothing fancy and it probably hasn't been renovated since well, ever, but it's a nice place for dinner with friends or a long, relaxing date. Just maybe not a first date.  Cleanliness/Service: Decent enough service. No issues regarding cleanliness. I've been here half a dozen times and have never had a bad experience.  Food/Drinks: It's not authentic homemade Italian like your Grandma used to make, but it's not high school cafeteria crap either. Huge portions so don't fill up on the bread. Well, unless you're already on your second carafe of wine. Think Olive Garden or Carrabba's quality with unlimited wine.   So far I've tried the Lasagna, Chicken Parmegiana, and Chicken Rio. They're all good but the Chicken Rio is my favorite. A friend of mine had the salmon (fresh fish of the day) and said it was very good. I keep meaning to try something different, you know, to give a more thorough review, but the Chicken Rio is just so good. Maybe next time.   And the after dinner Cappuccino. Best. Cappuccino. Ever. Yum. I mean seriously. I would go there just for that. It's delicious. Very hot chocolate-y. Not sure if it's a legit cappuccino or not, but honestly, who cares?!   Price: About $28 per person, but that includes your entree, unlimited hot garlic bread, salad or soup, and wine. Yes, wine. House red, house white, or both if you ask nicely. The unlimited wine makes the price much better. It's definitely a good value for the money. You'll never leave hungry. Or sober.   I love this place and try to visit two or three times a year. It never gets old. Don't forget to tip the accordion player to play you a tune. He's old. He might not be there next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battista&#39;s sign
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish of the Day, Salmon
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

T2Rx0FfUvxXL_dBHscd8gQ.text: I love this old school, authentic Italian restaurant! I try to go there every time I'm in Vegas. I love the food and atmosphere.

cAdVdZh8rPJHAqgHMjI1JQ.text: While I cannot complain about the wait staff , this is possibly the worst restaurant in Las Vegas. I ordered the Chicken Rio.  Included was a salad and good garlic bread. The Chicken Rio, not seasoned at all; tasteless, and the vegetables were not warm. Robert Irvine would send it back!  The FREE red wine that is offered is a cheap burgundy, that no one in their right mind would drink.  A regular glass of Pinot Noir was ordered and sent back since it was about 2 shots of horrible wine.  The included cappuccino was not even coffee.  It was obviously the powdered International Coffees from Kraft, with added whipped cream to mask the Falseness of the drink. A very unpleasant experience. With the hundreds of restaurants in Las Vegas, this is a major failure.

Bu_5EuKcH-O8tMsuj2Swag.text: My father  brought me here when I was a little girl. Loved it then love it more now. I can appreciate the endless wine.... food a little salty but oh so good... the Italian servers are to funny..

kLXP29cAZiF1qhuZi7g0bw.text: Great food.  For the price that you're paying and the quality of presentation, as well as the taste... Maaaan it is worth coming to at least try this place out.     If you're a Las Vegas native, then you've probably eaten at this place at least once.  If you haven't and you are a LV-native, the "what the hell are you waiting for?!"  It's been around for a long time and usually when an establishment lasts a long time, especially a restaurant, it's because people actually care about the establishment.    My wife had the Seafood Fettuccine and I had the Sausage Cacciatore with an order of meatballs (we love Meatballs).  All was great.  We were welcomed with the house White and Red wine (it was free by the way).  Garlic bread was good and we both chose the salad.    The main course took a while to prepare and the waiter was not very friendly.  Hence I gave the place a 4 star, instead of 5.  If this place had a drive-thru, then I'd probably give it a 5 star.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White and Red wine (both free) + House Salads + Garlic bread all included.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Fettuccine and Sausage Cacciatore with a side of Meatballs.

6q66AS39URIGHSTBVSFU5g.text: The food tastes like is comes from a can. I had the ziti, my friend the spaghetti. I know this is a popular spot, but I think they depend on the "unlimited wine" to drive their business. This tastes like drive through food at $23 + a plate. I would pass on this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HAIG3VKCgJdSCiBCwrVJBQ.text: One of the more affordable places to eat near the strip. We came here with a group of girls for a bachelorette party. Love that all entrees include wine and soup or salad. Not only is the food good, but I'm pretty sure it's the owner that walks around with his accordion and sings. Great food in a fun and relaxing environment. What more do you need than that?

gH2LrRzPZDjtiEVbO87a0A.text: Went here last night with a big group,  and it was my first time here. Our friends recommended it, and I'm sure as hell glad that they did.   First and foremost, the ambiance is way cool. I love all the trinkets hanging from the ceiling, the showcase of all the mini-alcohol bottles, the signs on the walls, etc. It is a tad bit dark, but it is called a "hole in the wall", and I feel like it fits perfectly. Think Buca Di Beppo, but way more authentic and awesome looking.   Second, the staff is/are really nice and helpful. Our waiter was very informative, patient, and efficient with his service. There's also a sweet older gentleman that walks around playing the accordian at each table--and he takes requests!   Third, the food is amazing. We were informed by our waiter that it does take awhile to make and get your food because they do take their time and ensure that everything is done correctly and deliciously. The food was indeed awesome. We are big garlic lovers, so to us, even the (unlimited) garlic bread was pristine. What was very cool about this place is that literally everything is included in the price of your meal--unlimited red and white house wine (Burgundy and Chablis) carafes,  garlic bread, your choice of soup or salad, and a delicious cappucino to finish the meal. I was sold on the fact that I could essentially have my own personal carafe of red wine since no one else at our table drank.  It was an all around wonderful experience. I look forward to coming here again and again in the future. This place will definitely become a Vegas tradition for our group of friends.

gK5NOx0DG-ArgOtDg7dieA.text: I was taken here by girlfriend's for my birthday dinner before we went to a show.  I was really excited as I'd  always wanted to eat here..... having lived in Vegas over 15 years.  It's one of those Vegas iconic spots.  Their menu set up is unique but sticks to a modest range of  mostly traditional dishes. They offer salad or minestrone soup with each dinner..... but ONLY offer Italian dressing.  I hate vinegar so i was  bummed about that.  We all ordered something different so we could try each others.  We ordered lasagna, eggplant parm, spaghetti with meat sauce and chicken rio.  We were all most excited about the chicken Rio as none of us had ever even heard of it.  When we cut into the chicken to share it..... it was raw, like totally pink.  Ugh!!!!  They quickly took it back and  brought another plate out pretty quick but acted like nothing happened. The eggplant parm had 4 nice size pieces of eggplant but 2 of them were undercooked and couldn't even be cut with a knife, no one ate them. The pasta that came with the eggplant was cold. The lasagna was good. The sauce, in general, is just bland. We were never offered desert and my water was never refilled. I was never asked if i wanted a 2nd glass of Moscato. I started this review with 2 stars and as i wrote this i downgraded to 1..... they get 1 for ambiance.  We had reservations for 4 at 445pm on Saturday.

MZWRBPXyuw4vsVhj8jmHBA.text: Some of the best service ever... We walked in without reservations and hostess said she could seat us immediately if we finished within an hour. Servers were quick and attentive too.   Regarding food, it was impressive how our 4 dishes had different flavors - despite all of them having a tomato sauce base. I had the steak pizziola or something like that and it had an intense garlic mushroom tomato sauce. Someone else on the table had lasagna and someone else had the cheese tortellini - all were very good and the tomato sauces were each different. Not the greatest dishes ever but solid and tasty.   The all inclusive is a nice touch. Bottomless house  wine! And a cappuccino! Reasonable prices, not too expensive, but not a super great deal.   All in all I'd come back here and recommend to friends!

pANYoLPwoCCJjZrBAgju5A.text: All you can drink house wines are really good! The menu is short and simple, but taste's great. The atmosphere is what really makes this place pop, and I love the little old guy with the accordion! It's a local fav, and easy to find. Parking is limited, so walk from the Flamingo.

YZ2WVLqxFxOMRf-bIQVgZw.text: It is hard to review this restaurant without shedding a tear.   I first visited Battista's around 1978.  It was fantastic experience.  Deserved six stars.  That was "before" it became a tourist attraction.  In the early days only the "locals" knew and supported Bassista's.  Battista himself was there as well as some of his family.  An entertainer would come by and tell "very naughty" and also very funny jokes with an Italian flair.  Unlimited wine was also served for one price per person.  The last time I visited was back around 2003.  I was with a very savvy business woman and we ended up in one of the back unused rooms and spoke to several of the original (or close to original) employees.  While Battista's remains an over good place for many - unless you visited them before they expanded decades ago, you'll never know what you are missing.  It wasn't just a good meal, it was an experience.

ssgtLrfz-0O8IXguNcgBXA.text: An adorable little place just off the strip.  I think it's a bargin compared to some of the other places we ate...about $25 for en entire meal (salad, bread, pasta, wine) w/generous portions.  The food was good, but nothing fancy.   I liked the little accordion player, and the service was decent.  It was a nice change of pace from the strip.  I definitely recommend it.  We actually went twice in the same week.

CPFzHYNvBMxUunxTKzMdsg.text: Really busy place on a Saturday night...glad we made a reservation but the line seemed short anyway.  the food was ok.  I had the special which was a rib-eye in a Marsala wine sauce, mash potatoes and some squash.  waitress was nice but over worked  and little time at the table, but our glasses never ran dry.  the white wine would have been better if it was chilled and the lighting was dim.  really would have rated 3.5 given the chance.

u3VbO6g71CWBrDLPY1WdjQ.text: Anyone who gave this restaurant a rating above 1 star is obviously not familiar with good food.  It deserves zero stars.  Our meal last night was the worst we ever had. We don't understand why the place was packed.  Was it for the Cannelloni filled with stringy, grey meat or the Chicken Parmesan that was a processed, unidentifiable object?  We are not sure.  To all diners considering eating there--don't. Put the money in the slots--you will have a  better time.

k1PBgRjoLLlHipOjKmOjSQ.text: good food.. actually great food (the wine sucked) but again food was delicious.

bPMGmdXDWEIjuFnxdTm-0A.text: You can go on the strip and pay $50+ for your average dinner and $100 for a gourmet dinner; without booze. You can go to Buca or Olive Garden for generic Italian food.-YUCK (the people who think Buca or Olive Garden are True Italian restaurants are the type of people who think Italian is pronounced with a Long i. lol Or you can stop at Battista's which is old world kitschy-old school; dark and woodsy with huge collections of salt and pepper shakers ...the menu is on the wall...prices range from $20-35. Each meal includes soup or salad, garlic bread, carafes of Chablis or Cabernet and your entree and then capp after your meal. I ordered the boring spaghetti and meatballs....loved loved loved the dish.  I rarely finish a meal as pasta seems to fill you up so fast but I hated to leave the pasta bowl. It was a wonderful sauce seasoned just right with huge meatballs-home made. Service was just fine and the accordian was a nice touch.

BndpOk11FPzuLt2sMoe3PA.text: first time I ate there I couldn't believe it! tasted just like my moms who was full blooded Italian and had passed a couple of yrs earlier. this brought back memories of her and the family get togethers. think I even cried a little bit! I went in  the back and talked to the cook shook his hand. it was perfect. gordie the accordion player was super cool too. almost the best part of the experience. now for the bad news... went back for the same awesome food but it was gone! different cook maby? the sauce was under cooked. real acidy. had heartburn all night. maby it was like cocaine, chasin that first high! what ever it was, it wasn't the same. have not been back since then don't know if ill ever go back. don't want to get disappointed again. ill go back when they get the old recipie back. although the atmosphere inside brings you back to the hay-day of vegas. very cool inside!

AYUwTbHr1jviuFx9oQCemw.text: Decent Italian restaurant off the strip. Good sauce, excellent calamari, tasty desserts and nice portions.  A little on the expensive side, though.

Lza2RDio3a0o5XPdJvK5Hg.text: Hole in the wall says it all. Food is almost cafeteria like but it's old Vegas style and it beats the chain italian joints by far because of the atmosphere.  Gordie the accordian player is quite the entertainer. Good fun with a bunch of friends.

wVLvtW5s4f_T1ErmB-qu6A.text: I am italian, the experiance that I aved on new year eve was the worst on my life. I will never comin back and never reccomand to anybody! Nothing was italian, it was  orrible!!

y_4gprdXxggnY6Ok6s3EFw.text: You don't come to Battista's for the food, you come for the atmosphere and the all-you-can-drink wine.  If you're not into either of those... get the hell out, because I don't need you bringing down my party.  That being said, the food isn't bad.  Certainly not the best Italian in Vegas, but decent... and large portions to boot.  The fixed-price meals are a good deal if you're drinking a lot of wine.  The live accordion music is... unique.  And of course he does requests.

11bP7CCylqr4h6DkGn2WRw.text: My fiance and I finally had a date night after I don't know how long and we had heard this place had been in Vegas for a long time and had an old school feel to it plus great food and all you can drink wine. Double bonus....but to our surprise the food was sooo tv dinner ;but with less flavor and 1000% increase in price than Stouffers...which would have been tremendously better.  The service was good, and the salad was average. The garlic bread had flavor but was stale, and my fettuccine alfredo had no flavor...i had to salt my dish 4 times! My finance's dish was equally disappointing...and the wine tasted like it came out of a cardboard box. We are foodies and my fiance just so happens to be a chef that cooks the cuisine of northern and southern Italy..so this was the worst food we had ever paid for.  Never again.....could have made good food for 40 for the price we paid.  If you have the palate of the average person, I would definitely suggest saving your money and either going to the frozen food section of the grocery store or cooking at home.  Even if you cant cook, look up a recipe and try it yourself.  It would be more fun and better tasting ........REGARDLESS!!!!!

bBodnzMFNDtbSTiEF4T5GQ.text: Terrible food, bad value. You show up and they ply you with cheap wine on the house. There's only a set menu including wine, salad or soup, entree, bread and 'cappuccino.' Salad was so limp it  had obviously been sitting in dressing for hours and made me miss the olive garden. They actually managed to make spaghetti with meat sauce taste bad, and I'm not sure how that's even possible. 'Cappuccino' was actually a mug of instant hot chocolate. Would not recommend this place.

xSVFzKGG2LM-fEw3aJgNqQ.text: Go for the fun stuff on the walls. Yeah, this is your basic italian spot with moderately decent food, but it's cheap, it's fun, and service was excellent. So the table wine may not be something to write home about, but it will get your Mother-in-Law drunk, and that's really all that matters, right?

faOiz6Dfsqt5LYYUUbiyTg.text: all you can drink wine and a little old man enthusiastically playing the accordion while giving you and your girlfriend little winks??  sold.

mCIRpM4a2qRdLT_my4oEMw.text: We came in with a party of 8 on Sept. 11, 2010 at 7:00pm.  The original number of people was 7 but the restaurant had no problem accomodating us.  We were taken to our table promptly and within 5 minutes the waiter came to take our order.  Since we were not ready, we asked him to return 5 more minutes which he did.  The red and white bottle of wine were placed on our table, which I enjoyed.  After our order was taken, we were served soup or salad, and both were very good.  The bread was good as well.  I had the ziti with meat sauce and to me it was very tasty.  My daughter enjoyed the cappuchino.  I'm not sure why other people give this restaurant negative marks.  To me, I loved the service, FREE wine, food and atmosphere.  Would definitely go back again!

axFHNp0BoQ-sHZ75Wb0dlg.text: Its kind of like a buca de bepo.  Food is ok.  Nothing really taste fresh, but it doesnt taste that bad either.  Atmosphere is pretty coo but a litte pricey in my opinion.  The best part of my meal i would have to say is the garlic bread in the beginning.  Lasagna was ok and my wife had a chicken dish which was ok as well.   I would go somewhere else unless you have your heart set out on some OK Italian.

9uyUUIHsI6d8ZzKqwDeRog.text: Some places are good if you're with your buddies, other places are good if you're with your wife. This place fits any bill! It's dark and romantic, yet fun. It's not the cheapest place in town (Meals start at about $20) and it's absolutely no good if you don't like cheap wine. But, if you can afford it, and you like cheap wine... This is it! There's even a strolling accordion player named Gordy to serenade you during your meal. You get your choice of standard Italian entrees (My favorites are the Lasagna and the Veal Parmigiana) and meals include, salad, great garlic bread, your entree, hot chocolate (they call it a cappuccino, but it's hot chocolate) AND, oh my god, are you sitting down for this? ALL THE CHEAP WINE YOU CAN DRINK!!! They'll ask you if you like white or red. If you're smart, one person at the table will say "red" and someone else will say "white", that way they'll bring two carafes right off the bat... then they just keep bringing them! Oh, you'll feel so sick in the morning!

hgzgDpTeZB4W-AgETBN1vQ.text: This place is terrible. Oh and the wine is not free its just included in the over priced meals I mean really $22 for chicken alfredo and some salty soup and warm bread. Do not go here

oKiWvdiaUDlZh0YJ4lo4gQ.text: So I have to say this place is an experience. We came here on a recommendation from a local. The decor and history of this place is very interesting and the food was just what I had wanted for the evening. We had garlic bread, salads, our main meal and lots of wine. I could have been just a nice uneventful evening enjoying food if it had not been for the folks in the both behind us. I think what caught our attention was the loud guys saying, "Fucking Wetbacks" and then continuing to quote fox news, Rush Limbaugh, and Bill O' Riley. I would have just been amused by the politics and ignorance but the racism was just uncalled for and made the dinner a bit less than enjoyable. I do not fault the restaurant or penalize stars but just had to share. It was good to know I was not the only one annoyed because another patron stood up and told the guy he was glad to be leaving so he didn't have to listen to such a "Blowhard" any longer.....but I digress, I would be back for sure, great food, service and value for Vegas.

9UbM45-OaTHVUXsbUi8wWg.text: Went to Batista's Last Thursday after my friends wedding. We suggested it because we ate her 5 years ago and remember it well. I LOVE this place. The atmosphere is just so old school. The menu's are on the wall, and simple. They start you off with white and red wine included in your meal and garlic bread. Then comes the house salad which is super yumm. I had the chicken alfredo and i must say it's the BEST i have ever had. They finish you off with a cappucino. They even treated the happy couple with a wedding cake after. We were basically finished after this meal because it was a lot, but cannot wait to go back, will never go to Vegas without a stop at Batista's. Oh and got a tid bit from a cabbi, the reason it's named HOLE IN THE WALL  is because back in the day during prohibition they used to have a fake brick wall in the back and when the police would come by they would go through a trap door with thier alcohol. Just had to add it, thought it was a cool story. And Thanks Vito for being the best waiter!!!!

Bv2G7AR9piL-7_Otma4zGQ.text: For Italian food, there are much better choices in Las Vegas. This place trades on the past, and on an overblown reputation. I found the prices high, the portions small and the food mediocre. If you enjoy looking at black-and-white photographs of dead celebrities who ate there once 50 years ago, then you might enjoy this place. The only thing that keeps it afloat is that it is near the Strip and they get a lot of walk-in traffic. You won't see many locals there, because we know of better restaurants that cost less. If you decide not to order anything, they will charge you $4.50 just to sit at the table.

2Max3pa5oliKZCoVPjIbXA.text: The House Red Wine is outstanding and it's all you can drink with your meal so it's worth a trip just for that.  The food is Olive Garden quality.  The restaurant has a neat feel to it and feels very authentic--both authentic Italian and authentic old school Vegas.  I only wish the food was as authentic as the atmosphee.

VIfh37k3QfoTgNgmImWIEw.text: this is a special sort of place, one that's almost worthwhile visiting just to set the one star benchmark. on subsequent bad dining experiences elsewhere, you'll be saying "that place sucked, but not quite as awful as that hole in the wall italian place in vegas".

po9TCed4MQ3-G80wUXvMpQ.text: if you want a great Italian dining experience it doesn't get any better than this! the prices are awesome, the food is fabulous, the environment is welcoming and energetic, the service is always primo, and they are truly an all around experience of fun.

iUKoGokO2l6ptmGKLNsrKg.text: Been coming here for over 10 years.  I have a friend who visits once a year and we always eat here.  That is pretty much the only time I eat here.  The food is decent, usually depends on the night.  I've had great meals and mediocre meals here.  The house wine is nothing special but its free, love the garlic bread.  I usually get cheese raviolis or lasagna.  The eggplant parm and shrimp with garlic butter sauce are also pretty good.  Service is usually average.  I love Gordy the accordion player.  He wasn't there on my last visit.  Hope he is ok...

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp with garlic butter

DcAvRTod8Hd_X1_CcWog3g.text: We were recommended this place by friends of ours who were taken here by friends of theirs who live in Vegas, keep up people it's not too complicated. 3 of us rolled in with a reservation and even though it was busy they sat us close to our time. Loved the concept of the menu and the minestrone soup was excellent, they dropped one red and one white wine on the table, the girls liked the red and the white was to my liking except I had to drop ice in it as it was room temperature, but since it kept flowing I didn't care. Service was spot on and not intrusive and there was a nice break between the appetizers and main course that allowed the garlic bread (which felt like it was made right in the back) and soup/salad to works its way in a downward direction so that you didn't feel like you had to rush to eat because they wanted your table and your money.  Chicken parm was goooooood, not typically oversized like you find in so many restaurants these days, normal people eat normal meals for one person not 5. Not everything in life needs to be supersized and I think they've found that balance. I'll be back in Vegas in February and will definitely be returning, for the menu and the cost you really can't beat it.

bgLoKPEL40b9F8Z3XvhT1g.text: I haven't been to battista's in over 20 years, as I walked in I realized it hasn't changed if at all. The menu selections are on the wall and they give you table wine your choice of red or white, both chilled. For $40 plus tip I got a salad, bread, table wine and the Cioppino. Not a bad deal. The Cioppino was very tasty and had sufficient amount of seafood including crab legs, lobster, shrimp, scallops and mussels. Everybody seemed to enjoy the meal and the ambience. The service was attentive and friendly. Old school, touristy, and good for families.

FRQoguw8ucK6JimmkjL-Cg.text: Great experience and food. The garlic bread & cappuccino was...OMG good!!!  This place is a must!

HqvYw8zd5AXtxYX7PO3oCw.text: Seriously you can find hundreds of places to eat better than here. I lived in Chicago for 28 years so I can say this Italian food was terrible.  We had the STEAK PIZZAIOLA and decided to share it. We were charged an extra $13 for sharing even though we only wanted 1 of everything:(  the pasta was over cooked and the sauce was bland and terrible.  The steak was the worst we have ever had. It tasted like it was made the day before and microwaved before serving it to us.  The wine is cheap crap but even if the best wine was served, it wouldn't make up for the terrible food.  The garlic butter on the bread tasted spoiled.  The ice water that they gave us tasted like sewage water. Needless to say,  I suffered a bad stomach ache.

IaX7R2O_31QdIm2wqYaxDw.text: Made reservations for Tuesday night at 6:00 p.m.  Arrived just before and was seated right away. Was greeted by bus boy with water.  Waiter arrived 10 minutes after that and took our order.  Salad(good) and garlic bread arrived shortly thereafter with wine.  Wine was chilled and very good. Dinner took its time arriving. Chick Parm arrived with penne and the cream spinach. The portion was large and very good. Spouse had Linguini with white clam sauce. It too was a large portion and good. It was dark inside and had a presence of old Vegas.... Accordion player visited the table and entertained the room for a bit. Perfect! Overall a good place to eat in Vegas for a decent price. Located out the back of Bally's and just across the street.

jUsqlhCUblwrXfrpmB35gA.text: I liked it, but girlfriend didn't. I always wanted to go here. We made reservations and yet still had to wait 10+ mins. (Pet peeve) It was busy and it was hard to find parking. It had that old vegas atmosphere. The waiter was busy so he hardly had time to check up on us. I needed more water but the complimentary bottle of house wine will suffice. My girlfriend ordered the eggplant and took maybe 2 bites and that's all she wrote. My steak pasta was good. The cappuccinos and tiramisu made up for the dinner. Overall a good experience. A bit pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Caruso

ypQz9ATcY7IJ0llq2N4XwA.text: I had reservations for over 2 months and last night was the night finally to enjoy the most memorable Italian cuisine since my late mother made. Boy, was I disappointed, she would have rolled over in her grave! First, I must say the atmosphere was very special with all the old pictures of the past stars and super stars that supposedly ventured into this establishment, but that was the ONLY thing that was enjoyable! As soon as the four of us were seated, the fast train began! The wine and bread were on the table in seconds (which I thought was nice for quick service, but I had no idea how fast!) Then the waiter came over to take our order within 5 minutes, not too shabby!  Then the BEST part was the little old iconic man (36 years) came by too sing a song of someone's home town, but he was quickly told to move out of the way by another waiter bringing our food to us! This was within 10 minutes of receiving our salads, which were 5 minutes after our orders were placed. Stay with me now, the best is here! Once we shoveled down our supposed great food prepared in 10 minutes or less with the most bland "homemade sauce", the plates were quickly scooped up and our overly sweet cappuccinos were brought (no chance to order anything different) which we tried to enjoy, but the waiter then came and politely told us "they needed the table and we had to leave!"  The sad thing was we already paid the bill with a generous tip! If I had known that we would be told to leave because they needed the table and 3 other tables were also empty, I would have left them a tip equal to the quality of the service and food...$1.00! I have been in many places on very busy nights and NEVER told we had to leave to make room!  Maybe they should convert the place to "take-out" only, where one could go through the line, look at pictures of how they USED to treat customers, place your order, look at more pics while being serenaded by the gentle little old man in a cage high off the floor (so he's not in the way), pay and pick up our fast food and leave! Now I know why it's called Battista's Hole in the Wall, but a little putty will fill any leak!

VmLZrEYmlSNEwcirg7gUyw.text: Frozen everything except the white wine which was luke warm. We will not be coming  back any time soon.   Bummed because it had so much ambience potential!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Interesting menu

OxzQjzbHeEdb_Z7POBkldA.text: Outstanding !! If you are looking for excellent Italian food in a convivial environment, this is the place. The service is wonderful. The menu is limited to a  20 to 30 excellent dishes all prepared perfectly. Wine is included as is cappuccino and for a little extra you can get some excellent Spinoni. This place is not only about dining, it's about having a great time with a wonderful staff. Great place to take your family or go out with your buddies for a night on the town.

vNflRxSl1nd5yoWc9KC7aA.text: Battistas was a surprise to me. I have never been here before but I have lived here for about five years. Thought it was time to try it out. We went in on a Saturday night around 7pm barely had to wait and were greeted by friendly staff.  The server came and greeted us with two bottles of wine, garlic bread and answered all our questions. I got the lasagna and my boyfriend got three chicken parm. The lasagna was a good size portion, just enough cheese and meat. I really liked it but it wasn't amazing just good. The chicken parm was pretty thick-not the best way to serve a chicken parm in my opinion. It should have been thinner and easier to eat. It came with cream of spinach and the portion was also really big. You will be full no matter what you get here. Plus the wine is unlimited! The free cappuccino is also awesome don't forget it at the end!!  Will be back the next time I want to be wasted and full.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken parm
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance

B9rFK1QwtHCDmdX9i4dbfQ.text: We were visiting from Florida and the tour guide recommended this place. We are glad we went because the food was great and ambiance too.

9bamCV9UNSmQp-X2aU4M3w.text: Free wine, bread and a cappuccino with ANY meal here. Had the ziti with meat sauce which was a larger portion than what I needed since they're start you off with your choice of salad and soup so I took left overs home. The ambiance is great. The service was awesome. Happy we explored and found this gem :)

O14nswLmy0Ysqk7sfno4ZA.text: We arrived a few minutes early to a very crowded establishment. But atvexactly 6:30 PM, our Open Table reservation was honored. For $26, I got home made minestrone soup that was excellent.  There is complimentary red and white wine that my husband enjoyed  (I don't drink wine). I had the ravioli which were cooked perfectly and in a thick, rich tomato sauce. It was served with a very flavorful home made garlic bread. I took home half of the ravioli because I was stuffed. To finish the meal, they save complimentary cappuccino. I would have given 5 stars but the service fell short one our main meal was served. It was nearly impossible to flag down the server after the main course.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Pgg4_GB3tHq0AZUw58qKw.text: Best Italian food in Las Vegas!! Will definitely return!! Loved the accordion player with our meal.

1D225XtRbp197kDGLlcKSQ.text: Had dinner there on my own tonight. Ok, atmosphere is the key here. Had two delightful waitpersons, Eric and Shannon... the latter really went out of her way to ensure I had a fulfilling experience. Food.. well its abundant. A carafe(s) of wine is included in the set price.. the red is drinkable. For a full dinner at a set price... mine was $26.00 for eggplant parmesana (salad, pasta side dish,  cappuccino).. its  ok. Canned black olives, Kraft type grated parmesan cheese, block mozzarella, slightly overcooked eggplant.. but realize the price and location! That buys you a cocktail in some places nearby. Dinner was edible, service was personal, atmosphere and the ancient accordion player was fun, and the reason to go here once. Fills fast, get a reservation.. that says something in itself.

C4BGOY1y6Rrxcw4Mca3ZAQ.text: What a great restaurant in Las Vegas. Great traditional Italian food with an all-time vibe. The menu is on the wall, red or white wine comes with all meals. All-around great time great food will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;The menu&#34;
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food. Nice history. Been in Vegas for years.

VAPp1MFFLgmqrgef_hx38A.text: We picked this restaurant because the reviews were superb. We were unimpressed. The staff was friendly, but not as attentive as the reviews said. We weren't sure if it's because we were a large party and the gratuity was already included. We had to ask for checks several times. It was our friends 30th birthday and they brought out a cold brownie that no staff member would've eaten themselves. Lastly, the food in general was not amazing. I could've had the same quality by buying boxed pasta and sauce in a bottle from a local store. Wouldn't recommend.

kbly0k_st-mS4_PTQ4ZCBw.text: My husband and I have been coming to Vegas for years, and have always been intrigued by this restaurant, but have never ventured inside. We chose to eat here on this trip, and were not as sold on it as some reviewers have been. The ambiance is cozy, with celebrity photos adorning the walls, but we had to use the flashlight on our phones to read the menu. The food was good, but not extraordinary enough to warrant the inflated prices of the entrees. Checked this off of our bucket list, but we don't feel the need to visit again ...

h684ahBlJ6LGvG2A8WfJxQ.text: I am a chef and I also take my Italian food very seriously and this is suppose to be authentic? We attended a wedding reception my family is Italian and we had the Alfredo in was flavorless, marinara was bland and the ravioli was dry. The beef however was very tender. To me it's no better than Olive Garden atleast when I go there my expectations are set pretty low. My family didn't really finish any of their food we ended up taking everyone's left overs home so I could give it to my dogs. There's cheaper and higher quality Italian restaurants around or go to the Olive Garden it tastes no different to me.

e-vsK0u9AgMPJVV0q0-WRw.text: We have been living in Las Vegas for years and always seen the sign, but never thought of going there to eat.  Friends of the family came to visit from out of state, and they were looking for a place to eat, I suggested the Italian restaurant across the street from where they were staying.  We made reservations,  and they held our table till the party was together ( they were late).   The waitress came immediately to the table, introduced herself, then a young waiter came over to the table and brought 2 bottles of wine,  asked us what did want for appetizer,  that was brought out quick, soon after the waitress took our orders, that also came out quick.  Everyone ordered something different, and my daughter is not a meat eater and the food was to made exactly as she ordered it.  The food was delicious, very tasty, fresh, and very well seasoned. Afterwards everyone was full.  A lot of food for your money, and I would recommend this restaurant to all who are looking for a good place to eat, with friends or families.  They can accommodate small group and large groups. We had an enjoyable night.

YhtBrWQwNY5d5KL_mTbscQ.text: The food is amazing! I would go in right when it opens so you won't have to wait that long or make reservations because it is ALWAYS packed.

VlnqGFgJ88NN2ZylAdKW8Q.text: We ate here tonight, food was excellent, delicious but not too filling. Service was fast and very polite and efficient. Their prices were for a whole meal including red and white wine as well as garlic bread and a milky sweet cappacino, my favorite kind. We have smaller appetites so we ordered 3 meals for 5 of us so 2 covers of $13/ each were added. It would be nice if they had a price without alcohol as most of our party didn't drink.

KxC7ZxI53ClVT1_Fo5s8pw.text: A group of girls and I went to Vegas for a bachelorette party...surprise! We put this place on our itinerary because it was convenient, took reservations, and seemed like a really good deal.   The server was extremely nice and pretty attentive, especially for such a large group. The salad and garlic bread were both pretty good. I wish I had tried the minestrone soup, it looked yummy and my friend seemed to like it. Then my entree came and I was pretty disappointed. I chose the cannelloni with meat and definitely would have preferred something else. There was a weird cream sauce on half of it, luckily the other half had the normal red sauce. Still, the filling wasn't very good and I only ate a little bit of it, opting for more garlic bread to fill me up instead.   Some of the girls did like their food. After trying some of their choices, it was better than mine, but I still wouldn't be likely to recommend Battista's based on the food.   So what about the all you can drink wine? Well...along with everything else, it was mediocre. If we had visited our first night rather than our last, maybe we would have been more into the wine.   Overall, if you're not expecting much, go for it. It doesn't hurt to try once, especially if you're up for drinking a lot of average wine and eating unremarkable Italian food for not a bad price. But if I were you, I'd probably skip it. Sorry Battista's.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2WxPGpxtHsMZ4zarSEeQ6w.text: I was excited to review this place because of the polar opposite reviews I had read and how old and famous the place is!  I went with a big group, so I had the chance to see many menu items plated and try more than one dish.  Ambience: Very kitschy and dark, lots of old photos and vintage cans, signs & baskets.  Equal parts fun and tacky.  Drinks: Free bottomless house wine.  Not a drinker, but apparently its passable but no memorable.  Service: not friendly, just efficient.  Not super helpful either.  Salad: (included with the meal) 2 stars, boring, lightly vinaigretted greens with a chunk of cheese and a slice of pastrami.  Garlic Bread: (included) Superb, 4 stars.  Warm, fresh, crispy and soft.  Chicken Alfredo (entree): 3 stars. The sauce was fine, the grilled chicken was good.  Filet Mignon: (entree) 1 star.  I eat steak all the time, this was awful: tasteless, under cooked, & dry.  It's hard to mess up a piece of meat but Battistas has done it.  Almost identical to the memorable time I ordered steak at an Applebee's in 2006.  That bad.  Manicotti: (entree) 2 stars, the cheese was fine, but not much taste, and the sauce was pretty boring, kinda sweet.  Just bland overall.  Cappuccino: (included) was really just hot chocolate with whipped cream.  Good, but not what you expect.  Spumoni Dessert: 3 stars, it was tasty layered ice cream.  Can't mess it up, delicious and recommended.  Tiramisu: overstrong flavor, but it looks pretty.  I can't rate it with justice because I don't like tiramisu.  Most at the table did not eat much of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spumoni Ice Cream Cake
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad

w4jyZm7rne7btzrAzXWXjw.text: This bizarre and unique spot is the kind of thing you can only find in Vegas. Honesty, I only want to find it in Vegas because what happens here, stays here.   From the one price for everything including all you can drink cheap wine, to the large portions, and the accordion player from the planet Klepto, there is clearly no other place like it. It never changes. Whether you've visited 20 years ago like I have, or more recently like I have, not one single solitary thing has been altered. You still enter through a weird barrel, the bar is still crazily decorated, and the restaurant itself crams in potentially 100's of people to gorge on Italian American food, wine, and the finest hilarious accordion music in the Western Hemisphere.   No review can do it justice. Try it once. I dare you.

bHGAKtRJd5It7iP0BHszLQ.text: On a recent girls trip to Vegas we dined at Battista. We wanted to try a restaurant off the strip and noticed this place on an Uber ride. It's one block away from the strip so we decided to check it out. The atmosphere and old Italian feel is wonderful and feels as if other restaurants have tried to recreate it and have failed.   As for the the food, the menu is very traditional and includes salad/soup and tasty garlic bread plus all you can drink white and red wine, yes please!! I stuck with spaghetti and meatballs and thought it was tasty but not the best I've ever had. My friends felt the same about their meals. I will say the after dinner cappuccino was delightful. The perfect dessert!   Lastly, the accordion player was a very nice touch! He played "Back home again in Indiana" for us Indiana girls!

o0OPSJ0wHuvdT758Cu2_dg.text: The big draw here is the cheap unlimited free wine!  The food was panned food sitting around for a long time.   It's a one hit wonder. Don't expect anything too flavorful. If you're a Foodie, don't expect you'll make a second trip here. This is a place where you'd find your frugal grandparents at.  The seating flow at this restaurant is unexplained like Area 51, place looks empty but there's a long wait. I suspect it's the people lounging around drinking the free wine after dinner. Move along folks, people are waiting!

mR4C-O5gl-qzNPEiquEIOw.text: I can't believe I've been missing out on this place for so many years when in town. The staff was incredible and very accommodating. Our party grew just before our reservation time and they still sat us on time with no problem. The garlic bread was quite possibly the greatest garlic bread I've had in my life.. I can't wait to come back!

2fnyPh60I85TyH35hwJj8w.text: Went there last night with family. I had always wanted to try the place out because of the nostalgia. It's comfort food, plain and simple.  I was expecting that for a family type restaurant that has been in the city as long as this one has that the customer service would've been better. Sadly, it wasn't.  The waiter came to our table and simply asked "Soup or salad?" A member of our table had to remind the waiter that he should greet us first, perhaps maybe even welcome us to Battista's before simply bombarding us with "Soup or salad?" But that seemed to be the norm for the place. Nonchalant attitudes from everyone there. Like, they could care less that you were there in the first place.  I'm debating whether to give this place a 1 star, but I have to remind myself it's "Sunday dinner, at your family's house." and sometimes family members have bad days. So I'll give 3 stars because I did enjoy my food.  I just won't be back. There are better places to eat where the patronage is appreciated.

PsMBFX1uWxJlxit4X6hfYQ.text: We went here for my friends bachelor party. We were all very unimpressed. If you are from the east coast or from an Italian family you will not like this place. We all liked our salds and soup but after that it was all down hill. The meals were very plain and one step below an Oliver Garden. They give you free wine but it was super watered down.
