The white was perfectly pleasant "chablis," and though I didn't sample the "burgundy," my companions pronounced it to be nearly palatable.  Then the garlic bread appeared. Like an idiot, I gorged myself on it. It was quintessential - fluffy but chewy, loaded with salty garlic-ness.   The minestrone soup (also included) tasted fine, though the base was a bit gummy. Most of my tablemates opted for the salad - I just do not understand.  By the time my lasagna arrived, big as a brick and covered in molten cheese, I was so full I could only take two bites. But man, was it good!   The food is very straightforward, American-style Italian, cooked to generally pleasing textures. Very appetizing stuff. So good that I took several more bites of lasagna than I should have.   To cap the night, they offer you this little mug of cappuccino topped with whipped cream. Honestly, it tasted like hot cocoa, which is fine by me!  The prices were outrageous, of course, this being just off the Las Vegas Strip. At $25, my lasagna was one of the cheaper entrees on the board. But considering the extras, the large portion sizes, and the appealing renditions of American-Italian classics, I'd say it's worth a shot.

9QSLAYgb_rF2holSJtwdLw.text: Well it is average at best do you get a ton of food and unlimited liquor yes if that's what your looking for this is the place for you.  I personally would rather have one good glass of wine over a gallon of the cheapest watered down wine I have ever had. The food was ok for the price I guess it was good but I would rather spend s little more and get great food

5oD7njlRo9buna4tDwxERA.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our supper at Battista's! Free wine at each table with fun miniature glasses to drink it from. Delicious salad and garlic bread to start. I had the meatballs with ziti which were delicious! I couldn't finish the pasta but made sure to eat all of the yummy meatballs. My hubby had the chicken rio and loved it as well. Wasn't sure we would like the cappuccino at the end but it was amazing. Kind of just want to go back and get that again! Highly recommend checking this place out. Reasonably priced and delicious.

xmLbObpSmMXosERULRbDLw.text: Very good, old fashioned Italian restaurant. A hidden gem of Las Vegas. The food was very good. You get wine and dessert cappuccino included in all meals. Atmosphere was medium noise. There's an older man who comes around to each table and plays accordion fir you. Definitely go here if you want to get away from the Vegas craziness for a couple hours.

JDSErxXzr8ez1NPUz8_8_Q.text: meh . . totally disappointed, we REALLY expected more from an establishment thats been in business since 1970.  we had been wanting to try this place forever and since ive been on a pasta kick lately, i made reservations for friday night @6.  we were seated in a room along w/like 8other tables all at the same time . . the waiter welcomed us and pointed to the wall where the menu was posted and took our drink orders. we all (meaning the entire room) ordered at the same time, were served salads and bread at the same time and then our entrees. . all at the same time.  it felt like we were at a catered event, which wouldve been fine if the food was good, but it wasnt.. im hispanic and i make better tasting spaghetti than battistas!! lol the spaghetti i got was totally bland . . srsly tasteless!!! my husb had the chicken cacciatore. his tasted like they just plopped the sauce on top of a chkn breast then added the peppers and onions - the flavors were not married like they should've been.   at the end of our meal, the server brought everyone a cappucino (comes w/every meal) which tasted like hot cocoa.. and dropped the check. he asked if we had any questions, which i replied "do u have any desserts?" and he said why yes, and he mumbled them off real fast... hmmm... that was odd, he shouldve offered some to us before dropping the check, but in his mind was 'get em in, get em out!!' i figured they must re seat the entire room every hour or so. whatever, we were already discouraged ... we felt super rushed... we WERE super rushed!! lol we drove off @7:05, so all in all we were there for exactly one hour... it sucked. dont go there...

WCk4OXO3mTrcDH6dMIq4Rg.text: I really liked it! Wine is included, as you may have read, it's not the best ,but very good for an included wine. We had to take our spaghetti back to our hotel, too much food! I thought it was a great value, good atmosphere and easy to walk to from the strip.

QjZUB__N5wODOGWgns19Fg.text: Love this place. Old school! Heaven! Near flamingo hotel . A traditional gem in the new undesirable club/ boom boom vegas! This is my Vegas!!thank u Battista's for existing!! Decor is unbelievable!!

hYjn2RrGyN1ULPlsx03gkQ.text: Everyone is crazy writing a review of more than 1 star for this garbage dump.  I'm Italian and from New York and this is not Italian food.  Horrible tasting sauce.  I still cant figure out what they add to it to make it so disgusting.  The atmosphere is just plain stupid and tacky.   The service just wants to flip the tables to get the next group in who has never eaten real Italian food. Blah stay away . Oh and for the food the prices suck.  So what you get crappy house wine, soggy garlic bread and wilted salad with your meal. Gee thanks

1OI2-DS_BiONjvkDWK61ug.text: Bought a Groupon- 6 of us went and we got $80 with the coupon. This place is not fancy by any means- as most reviews state- but the food was good, service was quick and it has a good location not far from strip. Everyone found something they liked (2 vegetarians with us) and nobody left hungry. I did have trouble determining who our server was- 3 different people served us & so had to flag down somebody at the end for the coupon.

VswJuRqxfSOdzrq4OygffA.text: Amazing place! I had the chicken parm and I have every intention of going back. All you can drink wine, soup/salad, garlic bread, food and a cappuccino is amazing. It's expensive but worth it for the amount you get. I'm pretty picky when it comes to food and I know what the good food is. This place is A+. Four stars given because the accordion player played for like 3 seconds before expecting tips then leaving.

DxlJ49BrAOCQrRuJ2GrpyQ.text: Relax, let the noisy ambiance soothe your frayed nerves, enjoy a carafe or two of wine (it's free!), listen to the little old Italian accordian player (he takes requests as long as they come with a tip), and playfully flirt with your handsome young waiter. Fill up on the salad and garlic bread as the main course is only so-so. But the cappuccino dessert (another freebie!) is to die for. It's not expensive, by Vegas standards, and who wants to eat at fancy places EVERY day of the week?

AFYklmTvEv7aqq8UUsltSw.text: Decent Italian food with good service and lots of complimentary wine. Not the greatest, but the atmosphere is unique and .....did I say lots of complimentary wine?

o-tWeifNjasw8qe-MfzvuA.text: This is a nice place to eat and it's just off the strip by the big wheel in the sky and near the Flamingo. It is old, quaint, and famous. You'll see celebrity pics and autographs on the wall. The service is very good, the atmosphere is nice (it's dark in there), and the food is good. My lady really enjoyed their red sauce and garlic bread. It's a little pricey but you will get all of the red and white wine you can drink. I'd recommend coming here for sure at least once. Oh, you get a very tasty cappuccino after dinner and I loved the flavor of it!

1PRNXNYbdPL_S1Hav_0XFQ.text: Food was really good service not so much. No really interaction with server. Restaurant was really cool looking.

tG3xFxkpavSte4IFFBzP3Q.text: Can I give these guys extra stars? Is that possible? The atmosphere is nice and relaxed and dark and cool. There's an accordion player and nice waiters. The menu is simple but you can tell that it's been perfected and there is no need to change anything. As an Italian, I knew that I was in safe hands when I saw the little wine glasses on the table. Delicious red sauce. I am totally snobby and usually don't eat anyone's sauce outside the family but I would eat here once a week if I lived here.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Pizzaiola. Outstanding. The ziti on the side had an amazing sauce. I think this dinner has been the highlight of my trip.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti Pomodoro. Fresh!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The minestrone appetizer. Absolutely delicious.

8ww8rxqlx5xZOjjKFZTAuQ.text: This is one of me and my wife's absolute favorite places to eat I Vegas. We only found it when  we were at "Tickets for Tonight" getting tickets for Blue Man Group when the ticket agent asked where we planned to eat that night and if he could interest us in a discounted meal someplace. My wife was in the mood for Italian and none of their discounts were for an Italian restaurant. Instead, he told us we should go check out Battista's if we wanted a really great Italian meal. We went that night and have been going back every time were in town ever since. From the moment you step inside until the moment you leave it feels like you've entered a cozy restaurant in Italy.  The food is great! The all you can drink red or white house wine is pretty tasty. It's a multi-course meal finished off with a cappuccino. I highly recommend it to everyone who visits Vegas and wants a great meal experience.

0hPBAzRvVgK8a4EkK8OfPw.text: I was a little disappointed in the speed of seating guests. I had an 8:30 reservation and was not seated until 8:45, aside from arriving at 8:15. After being seated, service was not bad. The food was tasty and they give you large portions. I had shrimp alfredo and was pleased. They serve you bread a salad before your entree and they are both delish! After your meal, they also serve cappuccino. It was very tasty. I love the "hole in the wall" ambience and decor. They even have the menu up on the wall lol. Overall it was a nice experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Alfredo over linguine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad

t8fwNxXXRUo7efRKGePMHA.text: Food was way overpriced for what it was. Unlimited wine, not the best quality. You also get a free cappuccino. Atmosphere was pleasant, went to celebrate my friends birthday.  Wouldn't come back, but it was nice to try it.

mLWylehzJrwc97UscZlVbg.text: Ahh good old Battista's off the strip!  This place is just a Las Vegas legend and will take you back to the Rat Pack days of Old School Las Vegas.  I have been coming here once a year or more for almost 20 years and it never changes.  Ever.  This is a good thing.  Prices really aren't that bad for what you get especially when you look at many other choices in Vegas.  I just have to laugh and shake my head when I see bad reviews of this fun little place.  Oh boo hoo the wine isn't top shelf, the waiter took too long, the prices are too high.  Seriously?  Take the stick out of your ass, try to smile and enjoy this gem of a restaurant for what it is.  It is a legendary, fun, kitschy, classic old Italian restaurant that isn't trying to be something it's not.  Relax, and take some time to look at all the decor and pictures on the walls.  Everyone from Elvis to Ol' Blue eyes to Liberace and everyone in between has eaten here.  That's just cool old school.  Soak in the ambiance and the low lighting,  Get tipsy with the free wine.  Yes, the 2 full carafe's of both red and white wine and the bread is FREE.  The dinner is standard Italian fare and is always delicious if not predictable.  The bread is always fresh and the bring you a nice cappuccino to complete your meal.    The very best part of eating at Battista's however is Gordy.  This 90+ years young gentleman is the salt of the earth.  He will play you a song on his accordion that will make you smile every time, guaranteed.   Wearing a baseball cap?  He will play take me out to the ballgame.  Feeling romantic, he will play That's Amore.  Wonderful man and a treasure in Las Vegas.

_lFLo1XwPTrAxuNE6Qd-vg.text: Amazing atmosphere with so much character.  Dinners are large portions, accompanied with wine and dessert cappuccinos included that are in the $25 - $35 price range.  We have eaten here twice now and highly recommend it.  If you get there near 4:30pm when they open, you can get right in.  Check out the full size Clint Eastwood in the women's bathroom.

AvzUJfBq-lYOxoPhlsaOUg.text: Fun place! The house red is good (and unlimited with dinner) and the portions are gigantic. More than enough food for one person, but keep in mind that if you split a dish, you will be charged for the dish plus an additional $13 to cover the additional salad/bread/wine. The garlic bread is delish! I got the chicken parmigiana, which was great, but would be interested to try the chicken rio next time. Good for large groups, but make a reservation. Bring cash or be prepared to Venmo your pals, as they only accept one card per table. The accordion player played "Deep in the Heart of Texas" for us Dallas folks, much to our drunken delight.

9v6REpZ6c4ERUCRrVOxdYQ.text: What a unique experience. I felt like I was in an Italian home eating with the family. Dinner salad is fresh with a delicious lite Italian dressing. The veal piccata was tender and the sauce was very good. The special was shrimp Diablo and the shrimp were huge and cooked to perfection. All meals come with bread and cappuccino for dessert. All the house wine you can drink was lovely. I would highly recommend Batistas for a delicious unpretentious  dinner while visiting Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Collection of miniatures in the reception area.

0_GwIh90hZmw_Gbv3h6pBw.text: How this place has such good reviews is insane to me.  The worst tasting food I have ever had.  The "cappuccino" was barely warm hot cocoa.  The wine was disgusting.  The food was obviously sitting out back waiting to be reheated.

BlxejjubsvJ-LQWvjo2A3A.text: I've read a few reviews that had me worried. They said the place had been slipping was not as good as it used to be. I'm happy to report that we went last night and everything was amazing as always.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5-qHz4spQAv4T9QXfEZSJg.text: Absolutely love the ambience, and the esteemed garlic bread was definitely living up to its reputation.   Quick service, delicious pasta dish bay I had (clams with white sauce) and the complimentary wine was not only a plus, but a delicious, quality one!   Strongly(!) recommend when looking for an Italian spot in Vegas!

EvCXSTIH4O77S-gcUf3RrQ.text: Taking an alternate route from the strip, we came upon this place. They weren't open yet, but the kind hostess gave me a menu to check out. Whoa! For $25-$40 you get a salad, amazing garlic bread, your entree, a cappuccino (best I've ever had) and if you're a wine drinker, free wine. Gordy greeted our table with an accordion and a smile to light up any room! The staff were all friendly and prompt. He atmosphere is fantastic. I guess that's why they've been around for over 45 years! Our server was on year 31 when I asked. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H7N9tGpZuTojdFmmu6gisg.text: Very good, price was a bit high but worth it!!! Only complaint I would say is when we walked in they told us 15 min to get tables and sit in the bar, later when we were seated there were many empty tables, I believe they just winged bar sales

9n3LFv3JxCrJGHRVpuw1zw.text: I was Excited to try this place and it didn't disappoint! Lot of locals, a lot of character, home style traditional Italian comfort food, leave your Gucci and Michael Kors at home instead bring your favorite easy jeans and a loose fitting shirt because you won't want to stop eating, between the delicious garlic bread, complimentary red, white or both house wine, and large entree plates plus complimentary cappuccino or dessert if you left any room! They also have an old man walking around playing Italian accordion music. When in Vegas don't miss this place ! Did I mention the garlic bread ? Mamma mia molto bene! Grazie mille Battista's!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ciao bellissima
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good for families or large parties
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battista&#39;s menu

-Ju70IDZGH8Kn1hir5huYw.text: I don't even know what to say about this place... I'm so glad we found it the first time we went to Vegas.  Every time we are in Vegas we go here.  I love the Chicken Parmesan.  The portions are huge and everything tastes so good.  Ambiance is nice, they get busy so be prepared to wait on a weekend but well worth the wait! They have earned their 5 stars

JmNv3V2vkHyQ1l2lXusjcA.text: Literally a HOLE IN THE WALL via a barrel.  Free wine with order of food.  Large portions of Italian food and memorabilia on the wall.  Healthy pours of alcohol for those who aren't ordering food, but just there for the drinks.

CERNB0RrUh-EZ3arxesHow.text: This place is the bomb!  I also got bonus points in a scavenger hunt for writing this amazing review!

i-Rlpxg_wqT7HRyu-QFohQ.text: I came here for my 21st bday last year and it was so good! It's literally a hole in the wall place on the back side of all the hotels on the strip. Batista's is next to two liquor stores but this place is a hidden gem.  The portions are pretty big so we all shared but the wind, garlic bread and pasta / eggplant and everything else made the perfect dinner! I plan on coming back real soon. 5 starts for batista's :)

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

elpEf6IU6pha0wuH0jwf3Q.text: Reservation needed for seating unless you want to wait an hour or longer for table to open up ! The quality of food was pretty decent. Nothing too extravagant. But the amount of food and ambiance received for the price was pretty worth it. It's like $25-35 for an entree, soup or salad, garlic bread, and unlimited red or White House wine. They also leave a jug of water at table.

AAKKi3tpXeBGirqxol3iHA.text: Been wanting to eat here since I was a kid so when I saw they had a groupon I was like let's try it! Well I wish I hadn't lol it was pretty terrible!   Service, Garlic bread and salad all were great but our dinners not good. I had steak piziolla and the steak was way to thick and very rare! There sauce has no flavor just very bland. My boyfriend had spaghetti and meat sauce and he also said the sauce had no flavor. For the quality of food u get here it's way overpriced. Can now say I tried it and I am sure it was probably way better back in the day and just gone down hill now

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good in the pic but it was just terrible !!

oUzOdEXphuHQCybNld7A3A.text: Have not been here for years.  Brought some friends from out of town here and had a BLAST.  Food was better than I remembered it to be and the staff was awesome.  Yes the old accordion player is still there (please let that guy retire) and he does not like it when you don't acknowledge him :).

IxyHjW0Hs-P5S_8oKuOIqw.text: We were VERY disappointed.  The customer services to TOP NOTCH but the food was OK. I'm glad we experienced Battista's but we will not return.

29VRTBrE5cq-S-wL6IVLhg.text: I don't get all the bad reviews....I love this place. Any time I'm in Vegas, I have to stop here. Wine and garlic bread automatically come to the table and the garlic bread is amazing. Just realize you will taste like garlic for awhile. :) the minestrone is great and highly recommend the lasagna and chicken parm. Enjoy and drink lots of wine!!!!

G_dCppFnUA256KI7J0roBA.text: Ate there a couple of hours ago with 2 friends. Just vomited for the SECOND time. EVERYTHING was awful. We are all sick and only 1 of us managed to finish an entree. I've NEVER had worse food, of ANY kind, ANYWHERE. We didn't have high expectations, on account of the limitless, free wine, but the wine is cheap and awful. You couldn't drink enough to make up for the cost of the potentially lethal food. I guess their food is always terrible, because the waitstaff cleared our full plates, without question. I might have complained, if we hadn't all been so desperate to get out of there. P.S. Should you ever have the misfortune of being dragged there, don't bother staying for the "cappuccino". It is basically powdered hot chocolate made with water.

fTZ5KHmkeUarGoOn-E9rtg.text: This is always a favorite of mine when I go to Vegas.... I think primarily due to the atmosphere.  The food was above average but not stellar.  For the price you a large quantity of food and free house wine.  It's a price performer and worth the trip here.

TrOZ44t7xKKePCS6bKjZqg.text: A friend recommended this place to me and my sister and I *loved* it. Things you automatically get with any meal: wine, bread, salad, entree, cappuccino. We welcomed the bottomless house wine with open arms/mouths. My sister was right in stating, "The bread isn't even that great, but I can't stop eating it!" Ha! It was definitely more delicious when we scooped sauce up with it. :) My sister and I split the eggplant parm. It was pretty good. The reality is we spent the ENTIRE day walking. I mean seriously, we walked miles that day. So much sightseeing and getting from place to place. That's the best time to visit Battista's. The atmosphere is chill and you can eat and drink and talk. For some reason the waitresses rushed us when they still had about an hour before closing. But we took our time with dessert and drinking more wine. :) The cannoli was my favorite part!! We were told to make a reservation in advance, but a party of 3 came in without one and was seated within 5 minutes. I assume weekends are crazier than a weekday [when we went].

wRRD9j7dEIzPZBmzk2lO5Q.text: Prices are between $20-$40 with free garlic bread, soup and unlimited white/red wine.   The house wine was all but undrinkable and was compared a friend to cheap Chinese wine. And we hoped that at least the food would be authentic or good but it isn't even as good as olive garden.  Gave 2 stars for some sort of nostalgia that some will enjoy but I just found it hokey.

fL78grvguVvhiokRjYkYDQ.text: I remember coming here as a kid and loving the place, so I decided it would be a good candidate for a Valentine's dinner.   Walking up to the restaurant, it was good to see that they still have a doorman that welcomes you inside...a nice touch. Once inside, it was pleasant to see that it literally has not changed ONE bit since I last ate there however many years prior. It's still extremely dark and the walls are covered with a plethora of random memorabilia.   A polite older woman at the hostess station greeted us and we only had to wait five minutes or so before we were taken to our table. The waiter promptly came up to the table and took our drink order, and the drinks were out in a flash (along with the complimentary wine).   The next items that came out were a basket of garlic bread, an Italian Salad for myself and a minestrone soup for my date. We both LOVED the garlic bread...it was extremely soft and very tasty. The salad was pretty good and she loved the Minestrone.  As for our entrees, she ordered the Lasagna, and I had a New York Steak with a side of Ziti and Marinara sauce. She thoroughly enjoyed her dish, and I thought mine was decent. The steak was a little on the bland side, and the sauce that accompanied the pasta wasn't too great.  The desserts we had were excellent though. First, we had the cappuccino that comes as a part of the meal...and in addition, we had the cannolis. They were quite delicious, though not the best we've ever had.  This is a great place for a romantic evening, and it's not too terribly priced. You can expect to spend around $25-30 a person, but you have to figure in the unlimited wine as well as the salad/soup, garlic bread and cappuccino.

BuJqfOArj2YmvSjkvsCyfA.text: Not recommended. Noodles under cooked and stuck together. For $27 per plate your better off going to Olive Garden and Olive Garden will taste better and cheaper.   Kids said food tasted like store bought frozen food, not authentic. Not enough of the free wine is worth the experience.

gtzWOOgJSPzG67cfl-gS-g.text: If you're looking for something tastey on the strip but not at outrageous strip prices, stop in at Battista's Hole in the Wall.  Red/white house wine is included, the menu is simple and even picky eaters can find something to eat.

QnOrMCi6C6R-SwEx-0KO_g.text: Lovely old fashioned Italian food, I recommend the lasagna and veal parm. Like a review said before if you're a high maintenance diner don't bother. If you like good food and generous portions with decent (free) wine then this is the place to go.

0ER754loAOG3388oqXW_zg.text: We've been coming here for years.  The last time in 2009.  So here we are, January 28, 2013 and decided to try our old haunt.  It hasn't changed a bit.  Busy as ever and the accordion player is still there - though his sets are much shorter!  The food is so-so but there is lots of it.  My husband had spaghetti and meatballs and I had the lasagna.  Huge portions for two people but we managed.  The free wine isn't as good as I remembered - but I had a less discriminating palette back then.  Who's to complain?  It comes with the meal!

ZdT2jCNTf4pL4V2Nh0w4Aw.text: Have been coming to this hidden Italian gem of Vegas since I was 15 years old.  Every trip to Vegas includes a dinner at Batista's.  Always enjoy introducing new people to this old school landmark.  Delicious food, good service, quaint entertainment being serenaded table side by accordion.  But this establishment gets 5 stars for ambience, can't be beat.  Closest thing to being at my Grandmas table I can still get.  Manjia!

gEUIEHXcaCiPj89GrDO_2Q.text: Food was terrible. Clams had enough sand to build a sandcastle.  Sauce was tasteless.  Ordered veal parm, got chicken.  Only good things was the salad and the cappuccino.  Don't waste your $

tbzqeJJa5trlB2wsjaWCFQ.text: This place is amazing. Old fashioned Las Vegas experience. On the house wine (all you can drink), which I definitely took advantage of. ;)

oCFM9oXQomBpxjQwU-uNOQ.text: I'd always heard about this place when I lived out here, but never got around to eating here until now.   While back in town, a group of five colleagues went here for a weeknight meal before heading out to a show. Food was solid and classic. Loved the garlic bread. My lasagna was good and I enjoyed the white wine (though I've read others may not care for it here in the Yelp reviews...) With two carafes on the table, you've got your choice.    The decor was a hoot. I wouldn't be surprised to hear that Buca di Beppo design was inspired from this place.   Not the best Italian food I've every had, but a fun experience. And it ain't a chain. Bonus points for that!

34TdsLhEpQKGPtp6pGsnMQ.text: Went because we had eaten there on our first trip to Vegas many years ago.   Apparently we had forgotten how bad it was; or the quality of food has declined.  Either way, don't waste your money.  The food has zero flavor and is likely pulled from the freezer.  My companion isn't a foodie like I am, however, he even admitted the food was terrible.  The free wine is just a step above vinegar.  We were quickly reminded of the musicians who won't leave you alone; pestering us to perform table side and then stare at you waiting for a tip.  We didn't ask for you to perform, we shouldn't need to tip you.  Total tourist trap.

YZVmviE77AbHnd6lASRg6w.text: I had a blast here, and sort of wish that the accordion guy was my grandpa, but that may have been the all you can drink wine talking.   This is definitely an "experience" type of restaurant... don't come here if you are a huge foodie looking for authentic Italian food. The inside of this place is totally kitsch and slightly cheesy, but I loved it. There is a fixed menu, everyone picks their entree and that includes salad and bread and among other things.... all the wine you can drink. The red wine was great! Not the best wine I've ever had, it tasted like sort of a cheap chianti. My salad was very tasty, and the cheese ravioli I had were good, but I liked my companion's dishes better. They treated our birthday guest to a great little song and dessert, and we had a blast laughing and talking with the tables around us. Like I said, it's more about the atmosphere than the food, so take that for what it's worth!

v46dWZX8r-hHoNhvZBhQew.text: We really enjoyed eating here.  I has the minestrone and linguine with chopped clams and my wife had the lasagna. Both were very good. The house red and white wines are complimentary with the meals. The service was good and they gave us a piece of teramasui since it was our wedding night. It was a good experience and I would totally eat there again.

QQGpbnKHdamMyTtNbHNoeg.text: Battista's will always have a special place in my heart. My boyfriend proposed to me here. The food is great (the garlic bread is the best hands down) I love the atmosphere, and the service is all done with a smile. The menu hangs on the wall at each booth, free wine, and hearty portions of food. You will not leave hungry.   The parking is a mess and the strip mall is very questionable, but they have a posted guard which made me feel safe going to and from our car.   LOVE THIS PLACE!! Just try it!!

c4L5hb9vm-AYBOWerhEw_A.text: I enjoyed every second of my meal here and can't comprehend why anyone would write a bad review. If you want to dress up and spend $200 on a meal, go to Sinatra.   If you want free wine, fun decor, an accordion player that plays at your table and food like your Italian grandmother used to make, then come here.  I got the Chicken Cacciatore and it was better than some other fancy places I've been to. I can't say I love the Marinara, which came with my boyfriends Veal Parmesan (it's on the sweet side), but it wasn't bad.  You start off with a basket of hot buttery garlic bread, followed up with a big bowl of Italian salad with their excellent house Italian dressing (or Minestrone soup if you want it) and then you get your meal.   I did think the plates were a little small... I would have loved more pasta to use with that delicious Cacciatore sauce.  Your meal is followed up with a hot chocolate-esque flavored Cappucino. By this point you would have realized you're not getting Starbucks here.  Gordy the accordion player comes to every table and asks you where you're from. Then he'll hit a few keys and attempt a song related to your state. Ask him to play more and he will, just don't forget to tip!   I only had the red wine, but for free wine, it's not half bad!  This place really reminded me of my Italian grandmother and the food she used to cook up every Sunday. I'd take that over a $200 meal at some posh Italian joint anyday. Our flight got canceled and we already plan to go back before we leave.

dOR4asGZHwmEEG13mRyFCg.text: How do you not love Battista's? With its old-school Vegas charm, all you can drink wine, and awesome service, it's definitely as good as it gets. Each dinner comes with salad or soup, garlic bread, a carafe of wine, and cappuccino. Ever time I'm in Vegas, I make sure to eat here. Great Italian food, great atmosphere, and my Dad's picture on the wall (ok, I might be a little biased. ;-))  I wish it was open for lunch - the hours are short comparatively speaking (it *is* Vegas), so plan your dinner time accordingly and don't miss out on a great meal.

_9mIFar5kAPV9q8MAJxwHg.text: Ambiance is fantastic! Very romantic if you enjoy that sorta thang. Sauce reminded me of Ragu, but not too terrible. I'd rather purchase a good wine separately, but I suppose I can handle the complimentary bottomless bottle of house red or white that they offer you, though it tastes a bit watered down. The cappuccino was probably that to a kid, but to an adult it was nothing more than hot chocolate. Again though, it was "free" with my meal.  Meal prices ranged from $23 to $40. Sure, I'll go back again, but mainly for the romance.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu.

1qnx0WYYYlU6Vo_XgskuNA.text: Service 100% great so this review is in regards to the food specifically.  Got the eggplant Parmesan and I wasn't impressed! Eggplant was extremely chewy and undercooked and it was covered it at least a pound of marinara sauce. You can't charge $26 for something that isn't perfection in Vegas! I've been to plenty of restaurants and paid $30 for one piece is salmon and it was the best salmon I've ever had in my life!! This place needs to be more about quality instead of quantity.  I've been to many Italians restaurants in different areas of the US and this was by far the worst!   Hate to say it but I would have enjoyed the food better at carraba's compared to this place.  *note to the owner/cook- make sure the food is cooked before you serve it.

AtGPGn8Lp2BqIZHMv6sFPw.text: In many of my reviews I say I am always looking for a great "hole in the wall" place... well, this is the first time I have actually found one with that in the name! I was not disappointed to say the least, upon entering two things hit me; the amazing aroma that made my stomach say "oh yeah" and the cool atmosphere with all of the "stuff" everywhere.  I grabbed a drink at the bar while waiting for the rest of my dinner party and kept looking for someone from the old "rat pack" to sit next to me... The energy inside this place was upbeat and energetic, the evening was starting well.  When the rest of my dinner attendees arrived we were seated and great service followed the entire night.  The food was good and if you are hungry this is the place to go as the portions were a very good size. The table receives house wine at no charge along with bread, the menu is on the wall and it's seems to be a pretty good value for the service, atmosphere and quality of food.  They finish your meal off by bringing you a coffee on the house as well. I had a great time and would recommend if you are in Vegas to definitely swing by for a meal.

LwMmZDylk1mqf1HTIeCvpA.text: Fun place for dinner. Food quality is really good.  Eggplant parmigiana cooked perfectly and tasted great.  Had several pastas and sauces and everyone enjoyed.  The single price for dinner and unlimited wine works great here.  Very casual, loud but fun and friendly.

yOSfCIN7AAMMJSS1bVJdkA.text: Our 4th time visiting and enjoying a meal. It has a misty old timers vibe in the place. We had the lasagna and spaghetti which are average but you are there more for the vibe and complimentary table wine (all you can drink). It's a fun old LV gem. Check it out.  Also, there is a fun older gentlemen who walks around with an accordion and plays Italian tunes, the guy is hilarious. May help knowing he's there every time I go.

FmLb2S9IgOMc-sHlNpL9Kw.text: Horrible server. Chicken parm was just ok but their sauce is horrible. Wine ok. Linguine n white clam sauce had no flavor. Only gave it 2 stars because I liked the salad. Won't be back.

5ehscor9rRr5EmFBMW-OdA.text: This is old time Vegas. Italian foods done the American way. I heard great things from this place but had no real expectations as to what experience I would get.  The business  is clean from what I could tell with the dimmed lights. The menus are on the wall, all Food was well cooked. Also unlimited red or white wine... So don't worry about going thirsty!!!  Overall Service: 4-5 Food: 4-5 Drink: 5-5 Price: $$$ Come back: oh yes

Sw1PQV8pJ-Bso5yeK6aZTQ.text: Fantastic prices for being on the strip. Has been around for a LONG TIME. Food is pretty good I would go again. Service isn't their best attribute but over all good and again a great price. House wine sucks but hey its included with your meal so you Dont have to feel guilty not drinking it. Skip the cappuccino but say yes to the salad they offer and chicken parm! Yum!

5EXMFrejys6Um_VpuKwsvg.text: I was a bit nervous before visiting Battista's because it seems like people either really love it, or really really hate it.  We ate dinner here on New Years Eve, and one of the main reasons for doing so was its proximity to where we were staying at the Flamingo. It is an easy 10 minute walk from the back of the Flamingo over to Battista's.  All of the staff were friendly and the unlimited wine is certainly nice. I had my own carafe of red wine and my wife had her own of white. It is not great wine, but it is unlimited.  The food is pretty good, but the prices are a bit high, even with the unlimited wine. The other thing stuck in my mind from our visit was the proximity of the tables to each other. We could hear the entire conversation of the couple at the table across from us.

uU2811ztBvvtP1bGSYnHqQ.text: This place is absolutely fabulous! Old school Italian eatery with excellent old school ambiance. The food and service are equally impressive. The food portions are very generous so be prepared to leave with leftovers. I have already been there three times in the past month and look forward to going there again soon.

QQ96t95X8eFq8VpxdEebgQ.text: This place is a bit overrated. The garlic bread is delicious but basic dishes, like the chicken parmigiana, isn't spectacular like I hoped it would be. For the price you pay, I would expect the food to be flavorful.   Overall, if you're looking for nice atmosphere in Vegas with good sized portion dishes and "free" wine with your meal, this place is for you.

PzKF29IpOMiFcRbzh3OI7g.text: This restaurant is a Vegas Icon, love this place, the ambiance is great, food is great, service is great

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary House Wine Red and White
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna with Meat Sauce

eFRcBK4csJuwmK1KsU8toA.text: The boyfriend and I vacationed in Vegas and this place was a must, since it was a usual spot he and his family would dine at while visiting. I couldn't have been more impressed with this place. It took me less than a minute to make reservations online, which came handy later because of their long wait for others once we got there. The atmosphere is great, with a really cool and cute interior. The food here is absolutely delicious, from their salads and garlic bread (best ever), to their entrees, and to their wine and homemade cappuccinos! I will definitely be coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty sure this tasty homemade cappuccino made it into my dreams that night.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the wine!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good ol&#39; Spaghetti and meatballs. Super filling and delicious!

rhu5XaWSrGViKu7Z5WYWgA.text: This is a regular place that I have to eat at every time my husband and I visit Vegas! You have to make reservations or it is very hard to get a table these days.You can easily make the reservation online.  I cannot tell you the amount of times that I have been here but every single time it has been amazing. The food is always great. The staff is friendly. And who can't love the old guy playing the accordion & making up silly songs about your home town? I was pleased to get another picture with him a couple months ago when we visited Vegas.   This place is a Hole in the Wall & you need to try it!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. :)

WH8kS7DDGQdBKNgaeNASOg.text: Pretty damn good. Has a local feel, relatively unknown to the masses who dine on the strip.  I doubt the menu has changed in 30 years; think Italian grandma in the kitchen type of place.  Not fancy, decorated with photos of celebrities from the 60's & 70's.    Great garlic bread, a side of pasta with every dish and endless wine-how do you go wrong?  Dinner is probably $40 a head but worth every cent.  Try the veal parm, ask that it be pounded thin and then thank me later.

4KxjDLiZcIz-KJ-OP-ZKiA.text: No idea how this place is getting good ratings. This was by far the worst meal we had during our trip. Every course was terrible. Wine was like vinegar, salad was soaked in dressing, pasta and sausage were tasteless, clam sauce tasted mildly rancid, and coffee tasted like Swiss Miss. Service was slow and mostly unavailable. Decor was neat, and garlic bread was ok.

sfuiz2QOiegpyk-Jfay8Zw.text: PLEASE READ, DO NOT EAT HERE!!!!!  Just for the record, I have been working in the restaurant industry for several years from Michelin rated to casual. Therefore, I know good food, and bad food, when I see it.  Battista's Hole in the Wall is the absolute worst restaurant I have ever been to. Listed below are all the reasons why:  1. The Hostesses. All the hostesses were cold and unfriendly. Did not smile or welcome us. When asked to be seated they told us we had to have our whole party there (understandable for large parties) but we were a party of 4, 2 of us were there. When asked to see a menu, they handed us a paper menu with ZERO descriptions and when asked about the descriptions, they informed us that our server would inform us.  1. The Server. When seated the was extremely clueless. He asked us several times if we had any questions, yet when we asked him questions he did not know. We asked him to explain the menu, and he pointed to the menu on the wall and told us to look at it. When asked what beers there were he told us all kinds, then only mentioned 2. He was very un attentive and took forever to do anything.   3. According player. As you "enjoy complimentary" soup/salad and bread, Gollum from The Lord of the Rings comes to your table and tells you (not asks) to play your party a song. Then, he awkwardly stands there until you reluctantly reach into your pocket/purse to give him a tip.   4. The Food. The food was awful. The dishes are pre-made ($25+) meals which are extremely unappetizing. Literally, they tasted like TV dinners. We had Chicken Alfredo, Chicken Parmesan, and Beef Ravioli. Everyone hated they're dishes.  5. Cover Charge. Considering I hated my meal, I returned it to the server assuming he would take it off the check. He did not. Only after requesting it's removal, the check is returned with a "cover charge." He did not tell us what this was and when asked, he informed us that "when someone doesn't order a dish a cover charge is done to cover the "included" soup/salad/bread. In my case since I sent my dish back, they decided to charge me $12 for their awful starters.    From start to finish I had the absolute worst experience I have ever had at a restaurant and left hungry. Please do not waste your time/money on this place. I would give it no stars if I could. At this rate, Battista's will surely go out of business.

fQvEnLERQ01JoqcXQp9JQA.text: Skip it. Food is overpriced for what you're getting, which is poor quality food. And the "house wine" is quite possibly the worst wine I've ever had.  Servers were friendly though

bhFNXNn_MCzjJmRXsFr9OQ.text: I should have listened to the yelp reviews that didn't like the place. The salad was fine, but it's served in a plastic bowl.  Kind of odd.  Dinner was on a normal plate.  I had eggplant, mistake.  The sauce is off--just doesn't taste right.  Tried the side of pasta they brought--same bad sauce,   Service wasn't very attentive.  Felt like they were assembly line employees.  Serve, clear, check leave.  Could be I lived in Italy and ate authentic Italian.  That said, I do love Rosals in Chicago.  Won't be going back.

saq2BpSEe7ESY881h7_mEw.text: Great little off the skirts restaurant.  The lights were dim, which made it very romantic. I absolutely adored the whimsical decorations throughout. My husband had the Cioppino. He said it was really good, however he felt the price was a little high for the portions, but it is Vegas so that's expected. I think everything sorta balanced itself out price wise. I mean you do get complimentary wine and amazing garlic bread. I got spaghetti and meat balls, I like to keep things simple. For me the sauce lacked flavor, but it wasn't terrible. Overall I was pretty happy with the place. There was an adorable older gentleman playing the accordion and singing songs,  that was pretty cute.  We stayed at the Flamingo. So it was an easy walk for us, since it was located right behind the Flamingo. We made a reservation online for an 8:30 spot but they were able to move us to an earlier time, since we only had 2 in our party, so that was really nice of them.

6aKfKNLnew9xk3E1acUHCg.text: It doesn't get any better than this!!! An iconic Italian ristorante across the street from Bally's. Step back into the 1950's, but don't think you can just mosey on over when the mood strikes!! If this is a couples dinner, call the night prior! If this is a special dinner, I would call for a reservation a day or two before you want to go.

n-jMIGm3WwLsp6XLBDhtCg.text: Been going to this restaurant for years. It is a staple of Las Vegas. Been here since the 1970s. The accordion player has to be 90-plus years old. We always enjoy this old school type restaurant that offers some pretty darn good Italian food. People on here that say it's frozen stuff from some Supermarket are just over zealous morons. Anybody who says this is not authentic Italian food is just comparing it some sort of chain restaurant that I don't enjoy. I had the cannelloni with meat and my wife had the veal marsala and the veal was very good. It also included garlic bread a soup or salad and cuppocino . It came with complimentary wine which was not a hundred dollar bottle of wine but it was still pretty darn good and very rare to have it included. That is why I like these old school restaurants the way it used to be. It is not all that expensive if you figure what you get for the price of their dinners. Anybody under 30 should probably forget about coming to this place they don't know too much. I am not an elite yelper so I don't meet the criteria for kissing butt. But I know good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary cuppocino
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UhxBglp9a_Y3BFxFV_Y6Bg.text: The food was not real Italian, the free wine is cheap and awful. I made a reservation with openable, which I have never missed one, and these people were so incompetent they marked it as I did not show up. If you want to spilt a meal they charge you $13 for soup/salad, garlic bread, side or poorly cooked pasta, and a sickening sweet cappuccino. I didn't even eat enough to charge me $10 plus I smelled the wine and almost threw up. So I didn't even drink it. They bring a large carafe of it and is nasty. The garlic bread, the cute little old man playing the accordion and singing to you, plus the tacky charm are the only things this place has going for them. I left with a bad stomach ache from an overpriced cheap meal. I have no problem laying down $300 plus at sage for a meal that is outstanding, but If you gave a refined pallet this is NOT the place for you

IDJK_i2OyNTvlvNJ-LLW4g.text: We returned to Battista's Hole in the Wall for the first time in many years. We went for dinner mid-week, but did make a reservation just in case it was busy. We arrived and were seated right away - still love the ambiance of this restsurant right off the strip. All meals include fantastic garlic bread, unlimited wine, appetizer (soup or salad), and cappucino at the end. We had lasagna (fantastic), veal parmigiana, and canneloni. Alot of food - you'll have leftovers to take home - we did ! The strolling accordion player didn't really play anything - he just walked around talking. Comparing this visit with our last one - I think the food has slipped a notch . . . hoping this was just an off night and it hasn't gone downhill ! Still a great spot for Italian food in an authentic location !

DyADuvB5zzlU6PlMD6K-PA.text: I cannot believe it has taken us so long to eat here! The shrimp with garlic and butter is beyond fantastic. The sausage cacciatore was incredible. It has been a long time since Italian food was executed perfectly without being pretentious. Everything, EVERYTHING was amazing! I cannot wait to return.

QpIJ7Ft5XDMX0A7Xzj7LhA.text: I don't understand why a place who serves FREE wine doesn't have 5 stars. The service is great and love the intimate atmosphere. Plus it opened in 1970! That's impressive. Love this place and the wine. Did I mention the free wine?

yKv_44evhfp7i5kMiL8EHw.text: Delicious food, charming Old Vegas decor, and a great value. Dinners come with soup or salad, bread, entree, a BOTTLE of wine, and a superb cappuccino. I was seranaded by a lovely older gentleman who played the accordian, and had a wonderful time.

xHx54wNUqhANGAhnm7I62Q.text: An interesting style restaurant for special occasions.  Environment: Just as the name suggests, the restaurant itself is a hole in the wall. Right off the strip near the LINQ, the restaurant could be easy to miss from the outside. The interior, however is fashioned to have several different sections of the restaurants, with the tables and booths being sectioned off into little nooks of the restaurant. Additionally, the designing of the restaurant is nice. There are plenty of wall decorations as well as mirrors, painting, figurines, etc. to give the restaurant a more casual, homey feel.  Food: The style of ordering is a little peculiar in that it is a cross between traditional ordering and buffet style. Complimentary bread, soup, salad, and wine is given with any one entree ordered, for one person, and for each other person, they either must also order an entree or pay a flat price of $13. Between four of us we were not sure which would be a better deal, order 4 entrees (which seemed like a little much) or just pay the $13. In the end, we just decided since we are already paying we might as well get another entree even if it means potentially just boxing it up and taking it home. Our speculations were correct and by the end of the meal we had plenty of leftovers. We tried the linguini and clams, the lasagna, the chicken parmigiana, and the spaghetti and meatballs. Everything was tasty although I would not say any one thing particularly stood out to me. The garlic bread was very good though.  Service: Our server was very accommodating in walking us through the process of ordering and suggesting courses of action for us to take since all of us had never been here before. Additionally, he was very good about refilling our water and especially with making sure that our carafes of wine were always full.  Overall, this is the type of restraint I could only see myself going for certain occasions, however it was a fun experience and I can see why this is a classic place to go on the Las Vegas Strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Complimentary carafes of wine

l5Y48Q-oR4AEiPsve_hbxw.text: Battistas was a lot log fun! All you can drink wine comes with every entree. Must I say more?   I went there with a large group of friends, however the staff were very attentive and got our food out to is quickly. This is a very interesting restaurant. The menu is on the wall and you get to select the entree you would like. Your entree will come with wine, salad and the entree you've chosen. I decided to go with the eggplant Parmesan.  I hate to say it was just okay, but it was. I was starving so I literally slammed it down. It was just sort of soggy unfortunately. It really wasn't anything special.   Everyone else seemed to really like their food though. I also think that the ambience and the fact that Battistas is off the strip is for sure a draw. It is also affordable and a nice change of pace of you are visiting the LV strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccino (was free and delicious!!!)
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Manicotti
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu on the wall

ACLo3vNCvTkwMMieZXQ6mQ.text: Contrary to popular belief, there are actually 8 deadly sins.  What is the 8th deadly sin, you may ask?  Coming to Vegas without popping into Hole in the Wall.  You go to Vegas without coming here and it might as well be a wash.  I don't care how much money you won or what show you went to.  You have to come here for dinner.  Hole in the Wall is a Vegas staple.  Been here for years.  How many?  Not sure, look it up.  Comfy intimate Italian restaurant close to everything, serving up pasta and meat classics.  The menu is on the wall, and there is nothing I could not recommend.  Anything will fill your belly up with love and comfort.  Although, the veal is phenomenal.  Poor little baby cow is a tasty little bugger.  All meals come with the famous unlimited white and red wine, bread, and soup or salad.  I switch it up between soup and salad.  I'm a gambler.  And when you are done gorging on your Italian feast, complimentary cappuccino.  SUPER sweet, piled high with fresh whipped cream to wash away the red sauce and pasta and cheese (so much cheese), and whatever else you may have stuffed in your  mouth.  And the cherry on top? GORDY the accordion player.  Sweet man who comes around to each table, asks you where you're from, and then plays a song for you while waiting for his tip.  He is adorable.  i want to put him in my pocket.  Remember: 8 deadly sins.  You gotta come here.

-NoZo_v81_azLllx69M9dQ.text: Love this place. This was my fourth visit. Is it 5 star food? No. but it is comfort food to the max in a relaxing atmosphere. Garlic bread, soup or salad, entree, unlimited wine & a nice cappuccino to end it all.  $25-35  The food coma cometh!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parmesan, creamed spinach, included side of pasta. All delicious!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad, garlic bread and free wine!

Et4deQOS4Gxow6VoyRwTYg.text: Don't let the prices turn you off.  As you finish off your cappuccino, you'll realize, it was all worth it.

3b258e_bQs4zHQnm6ZCkug.text: Gotta admit, my expectations for the food were really low walking in as a lot of reviews praised this place more for the experience/atmosphere and nostalgia rather than the food.  We were happy that we experienced the best of both tonight. My husband and I are both chefs in Vegas, not judgy up tight chefs, we're pretty easy to please. We got:   All you can drink red wine: 3/5  I'm pregnant so I didn't indulge in this part of the meal. I had a couple sips and it was pretty watered down like a boxed wine. But don't get me wrong. If there wasn't a baby in my belly I would have slammed it down. Why not   House salad- 4/5 I was expecting a run of the mill iceberg salad but was surprised when it came with a sexy mix of lettuces. Dressing is prefect, salad was crunchy and satisfying.   Garlic bread- 3.5/5 kind of tasted like processed garlic bread. It tastes like they took the garlic and herb seasoning packet you get in Pasta Roni and baked it on the bread with butter. The old college kid in me loves some Pasta Roni so I dug it. Was good to mop up extra dressing from my salad and sauce from my entree.   Chicken Parmesan- 4/5  10 oz breaded chicken breast topped w/ melted mozzarella, marinara (I think the marinara might just come from a can, but it was decent) and creamed spinach. They typically serve it with a side of penne marinara but I asked for fettuccine Alfredo ($2.50 up charge)  instead as I knew there would be plenty of marinara already on my plate. Here's a great tip, mix your creamed spinach in with the fettuccine Alfredo, sooooo good! The plate was solid, simple and to the point. Nothing out of the ordinary but it was satisfying for sure. Enough for two people.   Shrimp scampi- 4/5  Generous portion of shrimp and pasta, comes with mushrooms and lots of garlic, butter and fresh lemon which gave it a nice zip. I was surprised at how well seasoned and flavorful it was since other reviews  said it was bland. Would definitely order again.   After dinner "cappuccino"- 4/5 I'm pretty sure there's no coffee in here, but it was damn good! Tasted like Mexican hot chocolate w/ cinnamon. I love the old school mugs they serve it in too.   I'm so mad at myself that after living in Vegas for 12 years, this is the first time I've been to Battistas. Will definitely be back.

A9ZNOiOC80q5v-NASPf-uA.text: This is the most overrated restaurant on the strip.  The food is okay - nothing special.  The staff, particularly the hostess, are very rude and dismissive.  Good luck getting anyone's attention.  Worst $40 I spent all week.  Go somewhere else.

7qijvGjt7LQHtiwiRL1EDg.text: This restaurant is a must on your Vegas check list. It has been in business for a long time and still displays its authentic decor, menu and excellent service. Measles all come with the house red and white wine, salads and bread that will make your toes curl its so good. The entrees were amazing and dinner is topped off by a complimentary cappuccino. The food was delicious top to bottom.

HbQuShjDJYx7wwiKfDZyvQ.text: Battista's was recommended by a tour guide while on a recent trip to Las Vegas and it did not disappoint. In fact, I'd go so far as to say it was the best food of our trip.   Service was attentive, food was well prepared and you get free wine. What's not to love? Unfortunately we couldn't take our leftovers with us due to the lack or a fridge or microwave in our hotel but if we could have we would have. If you're in the area and looking for a memorable meal, give this place a try.

q5h8vH1VQV4kvvF-lhn3Bg.text: We were looking for a place to go for a large group of about 11-12 people, and something different. This is a cool little place with a really unique decor and vibe. We sat in a back room next to another large group, but it wasn't cramped.  The menu and ordering system is a little confusing. Supposedly it's family style, with large plates, but then we were told the plates would really only feed about 2 people so we should order one thing for every two people in the group. But there was something about a minimum order charge or split plate charge -- I can't remember but it wasn't explained to us very well.  Either way, the salads and soups were good (each person gets their choice of one or the other), and the food was good too. Nothing spectacular and nothing stood out enough for me to remember specifically, but it was good enough to please a crowd. Probably the best part was the "Cappucino," which was really more like a hot chocolate than anything else. If you're looking for a unique experience, this is a good, "different" place to go that's not typical Vegas.

qLk3zzzZeUU-NjvpHR4c5g.text: I would consider this place a classic Vegas must-do. It can get pretty crowded, so reservations are a good idea. The ambiance and decor are just totally awesome. The walls are packed with all kinds of pictures and autographs and other things to look at. It's got exactly the kind of character that I love. There's even an elderly man with a accordion thing that walks around and serenades the tables. (Tips are encouraged.) I just absolutely loved it.  The menu is posted up on the wall and is pretty straightforward. You get unlimited red or white wine. You get a house salad or minestrone soup. You get garlic bread. You choose your entree (there are about 5 different price levels ranging from $22 to $40), everything from spaghetti and meatballs to ribeye. If your entree doesn't already involve pasta, you get a side of penne with marinara sauce. You get a cappuccino. For the amount of food and drink involved and the quality, it's a pretty good deal for your money.  The wine was pretty good for being house wine. (We went with the red.) The salad was tasty - I liked the dressing. The minestrone soup was some of the best we've had. Our entrees were large and filling and yum. I opted for the steak caruso. It was a perfectly cooked steak on top of pasta with mushrooms and other veggies and just a little bit of a kick. The cappuccino was good. And we even got a free dessert, complete with a candle, since we mentioned it was our anniversary when we made our reservation. And that was tasty too. It wasn't the best pasta ever or anything, but it was good. And the ambiance made it awesome.  The service was great. Friendly and attentive. Never rushed. Checked on just the right amount. Good pace to all the food. All in all, we had a wonderful meal and experience here. I look forward to coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Itty bitty wine glasses for the unlimited wine.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menus are on the wall.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House salad

r0BVdQR7gMLAXvQIlboHmw.text: Just awful.  The complimentary wine tasted like spontaneously fermented dollar store grape juice. The pasta was no better than a gas station's microwavable offerings.  All for the low, low price of $30.00.

kzvs5njjDuM1rsdtxZY-UA.text: Omg!!! I love this place!!! I smelled it out from the corner store and went over to check it out. Unique on the wall menu (comes with free house wine and dessert drink!) Score!! Their Manicotti is delicious. Their food comes piping hot to the table and their portions are enough for dinner and lunch the next day. I come here every time I come over from California. Worth checking out!

l2sN36RKwqEfXpCMvwbhvg.text: Had the chicken parmigiana, it honestly did not taste bad but I'm not usually picky in the least. As soon as I got back to my hotel room I became violently ill. Spent the rest of my night providing offers to the porcelain god in the form of a technicolor yawn. My date was unable to take more than a few bites from her meal and I wish I would've trusted her intuition. Not to mention the wine was trash.  I may never be able to eat chicken parm again. Thanks Battista's!!

lxVS5VRM5S1_ahbJ5VohEg.text: This is the kind of place you take out-of-town friends who have overstayed their welcome and you just want them to go home already.   Upon entering Battista's, you'll be greeted with nearly no light. Which I discovered later was probably to make it harder to tell what exactly you're putting in your mouth. If you live for bad wine, you're in luck! With every entree, you get bottomless carafes of what I can only describe as, warm Kool-Aid made with vinegar instead of sugar, and it's served in tiny juice glasses! Yum!   The salad was pretty tasty, or maybe just seemed that way in comparison to the rest of the meal. Do you enjoy bread that's sat out on the counter for two weeks and then slathered with margarine and garlic powder? Hooray! Battista's has it!   For my main course, I had lasagna. Imagine tossing two cans of Beef-a-Roni into a dish, but instead of beef, it's mule, and melting some government cheese on it. If that's your taste, this is the meal for you!   After you've washed down your dog pound puppy chow with several cups of toilet wine, it's time for a refreshing cup of - what Battista's calls - cappuccino. Don't worry if you're Mormon, there is no caffeine in this, because it's dollar store hot chocolate!   During our dining experience, my friend excused herself twice to throw up.  When I got home, I also threw up, as did a third diner who was with us.   On a scale of 5, I give the food a 2 going down, and a 3 coming back up because it definitely tasted better on its way back out!   Barf Appetit!

ePR7bu7homs853d8UzRK1Q.text: Do yourself a favor and check it out. If you're not a fan of overrated BS, this place is your jam!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Killer vibe. I wish this place was in my city. I feel privileged to have found it.

QC_RxyhDn7vbvkdZy7x1jQ.text: Unfortunately when I visited over Valentine's Day I was sick. BUT THE FOOD WAS AH MAZ ING.   First off you get free wine! FREE WINE WITH DINNER! You can choose white or red. Or both! We opted for both but I thoroughly enjoyed the white way more! And the garlic bread was pretty good too! It beats Olive Gardens breadsticks on my view.  I had the chicken parm which comes with a side of spinach and penne with red sauce. But that 10oz chicken was the best I've found yet! It was so juicy and crispy! The sauce I couldn't really taste because of my taste buds being absent but it was amazing! I would recommend that to any!  When we received the cappuccinos after dinner i was thinking it was weird to have after having Italian. but it proved me wrong. It was more like a hot chocolate but it was perfectly sweet!

N_XzIogt8P-TFVEp0H_uTA.text: I'll be honest,after reading all the reviews we had really high expectations for this place....... well we left feeling disappointed. I had the chicken fettuccine and husband had the chicken Parmesan. My fettuccine was just ok but the chicken was horrible. The meal came with red/white wine,salad and garlic bread. The wine was just ok,the salad was very good and refreshing but the bread was very greasy and not very tasteful.  It was worth going to the place just for the atmosphere and seeing what all the rave was about but....... we never have to go again.  Oh,I almost forgot the best part though...... the cappuccino was very good!

CwWkezKIW9T36SlnjQfxTQ.text: Let's start with location and atmosphere first. Definitely an obscure location compared to all the other options in LV.  Just a short walk away from the giant ferris wheel behind the Linq.  (Uber cannot pickup here, just a precaution).  Atmosphere is quirky/funky/fun. Great display of memorabilia, photos, bottles and barrels.  Now the food... Soup or salad, both great choices, neither disappoint.  Red and white wine served with meal, along with generous portions of delicious garlic bread.  Menu has great choices for all foodies, including seafood, steak and pasta.  You can really tasted the homemade care put into the meals.  We samples many plates between eight dishes, all were good. Lasagna is very rich, easily shareable. As most other dishes are plentiful enough to share (although there is a minimum charge for sharing).  Cappuccino/espresso drink after dinner was delicious as well. Rich and creamy, hint of cinnamon.  Last, the service. Very attentive, friendly and courteous staff. From the wait staff to the servers, all great.  Bottom line, give it a try, but don't expect to compare to the 'major chains' that are popular. You wont be disappointed.

Gn0bxMuhvI8duhR6u0vr0A.text: Good Italian food that comes with 2 carafes of wine, soup/salad, AND cappuccino?!  Look no further!  We wanted some pasta and this was right next to our hotel so we decided to give it a try.  It's a hole in the wall, indeed, but it's obviously very popular and busy and has a great atmosphere.  There's an old guy going around playing accordion and singing, and it's quite neat.  I had the lasagna and it was meaty, cheesy, and just delicious.  The butter shrimp linguine was very yummy also.  The garlic bread is amazing, so is the salad, but the minestrone soup wasn't anything special.

X9VI_6LfkuGmdWtUgkjKWA.text: Food poisoning, emesis, diarrhea, chills, fever. This happened to me two nights ago. Rude and dismissive front end staff especially young women whom is standing at front and just stairs right through you. I had to go to urgent care for IV fluids. Food is terrible. Pasta is not even homemade. I'm from Spain, this is not fresh. this place was probably a happening place in the 60's. whomever owns it needs to be True and fix the front end and kitchen. Place is a dump. too many other excellent Italian restaurants down the street. Be Aware you will be at risk for food poisoning also.

LQ6eqjdAaim2eZC-lrGx0Q.text: We came here after I got a craving for some Italian food on the strip. After none of the other restaurants around sounded like the right fit, we decided to check out this little place a shirt walk off the strip. We are so glad we did.  Service here was great (had Frank as our waiter as well as Brandon), super friendly. Food wasn't the fastest to come out, but that's not surprising at a good Italian restaurant where you tend to linger over courses.  I ordered the chicken parmigiana with the fettuccine Alfredo on the side. So much food, and the alfredo sauce was the best I've had in a LONG time. Buttery and creamy, amazing flavor without being overly heavy.  And, almost most importantly, UNLIMITED WINE. You get a liter carafe at your table, either burgundy or Chablis. The burgundy was surprisingly buttery and smooth for a complimentary wine, and we made our way through two.  Needless to say, next time we're in Vegas we are coming back at LEAST once. If you're in the area and in the mood for some fantastic Italian food, this is the place to go!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chicken Parmegiana was tender and so flavorful. Loved the spinach side.
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A lot of the other photos of the salad really didn&#39;t do it justice, it was delicious
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh man, the fettuccine Alfredo was SO GOOD. Wishing I had more now.

PB-wXKXSaQrNVO_4C3QBLA.text: Love this place.  The ambiance and old pictures on the  walls everywhere create so much character.  It's a little load and the portions are enormous so you make the decision is that's a good or bad thing.  Unlimited Bread + Unlimited Red Wine + Unlimited White awhile with your massive 35$ plate makes this a restaurant only if you have a DD for the drive home.  #FoodComa!!!!

45lW8YabjbRN2EDg1KKVAQ.text: My go to place for italian here in town. Highly recommend putting in a reservation. Amazing staff, great atmosphere, and wonderful food.   Meals are ordered by meals and the complementary wine makes it great!!

pmLXX7QUrzEMott2274ZzA.text: I love this place, the food is good, huge portions, all inclusive, with salad or soup, dessert and wine, what more can you ask for?

B87SlH3F1NotLPFlx5VErg.text: The food was below par for the hype.  We ordered lasagna and the steak plate, we didn't finish any of our food, I can buy a frozen lasagna that taste better.  The garlic bread wasn't even good.  The only good thing if you like wine was it was unlimited they probably want you sloshed so you somewhat enjoy your food.  The portion size is huge if your starving this is the place for you.  The best part was the cappuccino was delicious.

z1RVjBBNmu3lTMYcEZzSTw.text: I don't know why I have not reviewed this place until now, but it's definitely one of my favorite restaurants to visit in town. Especially when you're entertaining friends in town on the strip. It's got that old school Vegas vibe, without the new school Vegas prices. Pretty solid food, lots of choices with your entree, and wine too?! Plus, service is quick. Actually had our wedding rehearsal dinner here back in 2013. They accommodated 40 of us effortlessly. Love this place! I recommend the chicken parmigiana. The creamed spinach that comes with it is my favorite part!

2hpMvMLYEtlqzYlDxWhB_A.text: We went here many years ago and I had great memories of the food and free wine. On a this Saturday night, it was too busy, with a line out the door. I know it's great to be busy, but we felt small and unimportant. In fact our best interaction was with our food runner, who truly made us feel welcomed. Great portions on the food, and of course, free wine, but the gravy was more brown than red, and not very flavorful. Lovely cup of cappucino to finish off the meal.

RtkwWg8-MYtwnbULq_uDEg.text: I like this place. It's expensive and the wine isn't too good, but it's all you can drink. I ordered the manicotti. It was good.  My wife ordered the spaghetti. We each got the salad and thought it was a bit dry, could have used more dressing. The entrees were large and good. The highlight was the cappuccino at the end. Very good!  We'll probably be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting for our table

KnjQg6-0696OLrH_Lp4-Jw.text: Really good Italian food off the strip! Kinda on the pricey side (dishes starts at $20+), but huge portion! Definitely share a meal or eat 1/2 now and save some other half for later... Fast service! Free red and white wine included in meal!  Drinks (cocktails) are also on the pricey side (watered down margarita costs $9) so I would recommend getting your drinks somewhere else...

_J4EUuVsvVpxrxgC7A6lRg.text: Fantastic food and good times sums up our experience at Hole in the Wall. I can see myself returning here when we come to Vegas in the future.  Prices are good for what you get so a thumbs up for value and the free wine is a win and nice bonus.  Kids options are good here and I was a fan of their main dishes, ordered spaghetti with Cacciatore sauce (a little spicy), wife got the pomodoro, kid got the spaghetti with meatballs. The add ons were wonderful. The garlic bread was great, the minestrone was solid, and salad was fantastic as well. Their salad dressing is tasty and we'll balanced.  The service was friendly and attentive.  The cappuccino was a nice touch and ending to a very delicious and wonderful experience overall.  Parking was easy enough, and their staff was great and kind. Right next to The High Roller which is also a highly recommended attraction in Vegas.  4.777 stars rounded down which can easily become a solid 5 with another visit.  Thanks guys!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti with Sausage Cacciatore sauce
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids menu
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

3G_3W7IU2f2CQkSBOyEN2A.text: This place is a kitschy fun, atmosphere. It gives you a clear sense it's been around a very long time. Lots of dated pics on the walls with the owner and celebrities like Wayne Newton, Michael Landon, etc. This isn't BAD but definitely different than standard Strip restaurants. Service was friendly. That was a plus. The food though...not the greatest. Decent but nothing worth writing home about. The wine included with your meal is not worth it. There was a burgundy and a Chablis option. I am not a wine snob but could not drink them. The 'free cappuccino' was not cappuccino at all - it was hot chocolate.

WOeJ5j8QevjI2oOKOqhNbw.text: I never thought I would say it.... but I would rather go to Olive Garden. Skimming through these reviews, I can't believe people come here more than once. It seems like the type of place you get dragged to on your family reunion. A place your Great Aunt Sally from the middle of nowhere Wisconsin heard about from her hairdresser 7 years ago. Cool atmosphere, cool location, awful food.  On a Friday night the restaurant was booked. Make a reservation! As soon as you sit, they'll bring out the unlimited wine and garlic bread. The menu is on the wall, divided up by prices. Meat dishes come with a side of pasta. Everyone gets wine, everyone gets garlic bread, everyone gets a cappuccino with whipped cream.  We had a party of 8 and ordered different things. Sadly, there was not a single dish I would recommend. It was so bad, none of us took back our leftovers. (Portion sizes really weren't that big)  Sure you get unlimited wine, but the price was not worth it. For what you pay, you can get a much better meal elsewhere on the strip.  Parking is easy, you can park right outside the restaurant. T

TSuxtJ-0tbZrI2GVuRbE0g.text: All the years I've been going to LasVegas and I've never been. Shame on me. I can't wait to go back!!  Tried to get reservations for later on a Saturday but they were booked solid.. so... 5:00pm it was!!  Made sure we didn't eat anything that day so we would be starved by 5!! Found this gem in an very unassuming parking lot!! ( right by The Linq) Entered into a very dark and lively foyer! Little mini bottles of liquor behind glass. All kinds of things hanging from the ceiling. Seated in a wonderful booth. Quickly our server Giorgio arrived with 2 carafes of  wine. ( one white one red) Red Please.  Our choice of salad or soup. We chose salads. Fresh greens and tomato onion salami cheese with oil/vinegar.  Husband ordered Cannelloni with a side of sausage. I ordered Cheese ravioli with side of meatballs. Everything delightful!!  We did a good job on both!  Able to relax a bit and finish our carafe of wine.  Out came out cappuccinos with whipped cream!  No way we could have ever done dessert.  Not sure if they have any!  The little man was playing the accordion but he never made it to our room.  Can't wait to return!!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

g_9PcNM7c3G8xS0lLMmXFg.text: It was pretty gross. I read a yelp review that said "if they offer free wine you know they are trying to cover something up" 3/4 of our group -despised our meal.   1st meal- got the special -ravioli Florentine and it was like a stick of butter was drizzled on it. Inedible.  2nd meal- spaghetti with meat sauce. Should have just had a lean cuisine in the hotel room. There was no sauce... it was spaghetti topped with dry ground beef.  3rd meal- chicken parm. Looked like slop and tasted like it too. Ick 4th meal- lasagna. Only edible meal at the table. And it wasn't even good. Just edible.  The only good thing they had was the garlic bread and it tasted like the stuff you put in the oven at home.   Even their water tasted grimey.   Do yourself a favor and skip this. There is no charm and the food wasnt good. It is literally just a hole in the wall.

Dc8MmVMEcFGI_XhHrfspRA.text: This place is a MUST in Vegas. It's such a short walk from the Flamingo where we are staying and it's such a traditional GEM! Although they may refer to it as a "hole in the wall" it is THE hole of Las Vegas. Papa took great care of us and shared a bit of history. I had the fettuccini mussels, my husband had lasagna, my 87yr old grandmother enjoyed the spaghetti and meat sauce and our uncle had the chicken parmigiana! Everyone loved their food!
