And of course... garlic toast, Italian salads and classic minestrone soup.  My mussels were impressively delicious. Large and meaty with the perfect tenderness. The sauce was fresh and PERFECT with a tiny kick of spice! This will be the spot we continue to come back to as a tradition! Also... you get a carafe of both a red and white wine. I would guess the white to be similar to a Pinot Grigio/Chardonnay blend and the red is similar to a merlot'ish blend. They are table wine yes and not a high class bottle as they are unlimited and included in your meal so don't complain just drink! (There is a full bar if you want something more your taste)  This place is a MUST. Truly a Las Vegas stamp!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zoVKW9-n-HHDwtK-FDmCAw.text: This place is more about its ambiance than the quality of food. We made a reservation and were promptly seated. The restaurant is loud.  The meals include soup or salad, entree, garlic bread, and cappuccino.  Entrees range $23-35. They start you with a soup or salad. The salad is made with romaine and fresh ingredients. They serve it with a creamy Italian dressing. The soup is pasta fagoili and is fresh.  They bring you warm toasted Italian bread with garlic butter on it.   I had the lasagna. It is a large portion. It did not taste fresh. I did not like the sauce flavor. The mozzarella cheese on top looked like melted plastic.   Other people at the table ordered chicken Parmesan and were not impressed by it.   The cappuccino tasted more like hot chocolate with cinnamon. It was topped with whipped cream. I liked it.   Each table has privacy. Overall, it is a fun ambiance but not the highest quality food. It's a good place to try at least once. It is next to Bally's and by the high roller ferris wheel.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8xPK-Id3RjAAvDA-I1Y3lA.text: Just discovered this place by accident. First of all MAKE A RESERVATION. Had no clue we needed one and had to wait about 45 minutes for a table.  A bummer watching everyone walk in and be seated immediately. That was our fault not theirs. For Vegas the prices are amazing and the food was good. Everything fresh, hot with a nice seasoning. Is this the best Italian ever - no. But we had great service, they have a nice atmosphere and we just had an enjoyable evening. That said, we have added this to one of our go to places when we visit Vegas now. Definitely worth a look and a try for everyone.

Z0xP7HcxtTaFSo7BQPLONQ.text: Hadn't been in several years and wasn't sure if the quality of food and drink were still the same but they didn't disappoint. I had a salad with a tangy Italian dressing which was good; and it had just about every leafy green thing in it; the garlic bread was some of the best that I've had (they bring plenty of it) and both house table wines (red & white) were good. As an entree I had a Ribeye and the texture could've been better but the flavor was good without steak sauce. I was very happy with the service Danielle was a pleasure and very attentive. All in all a wonderful birthday dinner.

WaloSspn6JTSvFBgXjn-1w.text: Very delicious!. I heard this is where the mobsters would eat since it has no windows. It is a very nice place, dim lights and decorated. The food is about 30 dollars but you get garlic bread, a big bottle of wine, soup or salad, and cappuccino with your dish.

dUQdsOuw2JaRddr8gyAirw.text: Great fun. Basic, crowded, menus painted on the wall and I wouldn't be surprised if the food was made in the morning and then heated for serving. Flavor is great. Meals come with soup or salad, garlic bread, and cappuccino at the end. "Unlimited house wine" has a very low alcohol content which may or may not be a good thing. The good news: no hangover.  Remarkably easy to find and a leisurely five-minute walk from the Strip, adjacent to Bally's side door and right behind the Cromwell.

LU_eHm8GYuopYb_UN9u26g.text: I came here for my birthday August 14 last year and we had a blast! Our server was wonderful and the food was fantastic so I waited a whole year to come back here for my birthday again and this time, the food was still fantastic but our server ruined the whole experience. I don't know her name but she was probably 70 years old, super tall, skinny hair I think like brown and gray with a little pigtail in the back/ we came at 9 o'clock in the 14th and I think it must've been past her bedtime she would barely listen to our orders and then run away / when asked how a dish tasted her reply was - it's great / deadpan didn't every look at us when speaking - she didn't give a crap what we ordered - I think she was annoyed because we had a Groupon or something who knows she was a aloof, short and rude to us in general didn't give us any options brought us my birthday dessert didnt ask us if we wanted anything else and that she never asked us if everything was OK or you wanted anything else - she seemed angry to be there and treated us like cattle she needs to be at a fast food place cooking burgers in the back without any human interaction she never cracked a smile zero welcoming qualities / IF I ever go here again I will make sure I ask for anyone but her - otherwise the food was great but the service stunk

ZooJvlVITUbIa8NWBMt-ww.text: When in Vegas...This is one of this restaurants that is iconic to Vegas so of course we had to try it. We made reservations which are totally recommended and were promptly seated when we arrived. This place has that totally old Vegas feel to it.  The menu is on the wall..literally. Our server arrived quickly and took our food order. No one asked is about drink. I'm guessing it's because the house red and white wine is complementary.  The food came out quickly and it was good! I had the veal Parmesan yummy! The portions were large so come hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i14Innn-U5MgVdgIBQHBAQ.text: Love this Hole in the Wall! Anytime we're in Vegas we make it a point to stop by. No crazy menu with too many options to decide from. Just look at a wall and you'll find their menu's posted with the same classic dinners served since 1970. You get free red and white wine with your dinner, also soup/salad, bread and cappuccino. Did I mention the FREE Red and White Wine? Lol. Everything on the menu is delicious. I definitely recommend this place if you're ever in the area.

TvlBaVS23abSJU3WeBfM9g.text: Las Vegas Landmark --  we enjoy taking out of town visitors to Battista's hole in wall for very good Italian food.   The lasagna is always the best.  The salads are very good.   I often get the Chicken Parmigiana.     I would recommend calling ahead for reservations, especially for parties of more than 4.  Leftovers are usually enough for lunch the next day.  It is a little pricey, but not bad considering the location is adjacent to the Strip.

LpbgdZAa9Kqh1V0bpxgiGg.text: Terrible experience. Sat 20 minutes at the bar waiting for a table. Tried to get the waitress's attention multiple times but I forgot I wore my invisibility cloak apparently because she didn't even look my way. We sat in our booth for another 20 minutes without a waiter even coming by. Then, as a favor to us, another waiter decides to come by and hand us salads (that we didn't order) to tide us over. It was fairly obvious that the salads were made quite a long time ago.  Fast-forward to ordering our dinners (no, really, because we sat there for another 15 minutes after our salad bowls were cleared), I ordered the cheese ravioli. Surprise, surprise, waited again for the most mediocre cheese ravioli and flavorless marinara sauce I've ever had. No one in my 5 person group bothered to finish their meal because it just wasn't worth it.  They don't do split checks, so be warned. But the free house wine was delicious, so there's that.

ApPqJT6PGJZgve40V7MTqw.text: This Italian "hole in the wall" has a cool waiting area, if there is a wait.  Great food, limited selection and medium price cost.  I thoroughly enjoyed the atmosphere and the house wine that comes with your meal.

usLDtLKrdbA0cv6js4bRWw.text: This is as close to can't miss as I know in Vegas. I usually sit at the bar where there is a limited menu but that's fine with me.    Tonight I got the lasagna and garlic bread for $15.95.  It was fantastic with a capital "F".  Quick service sitting at the bar, I was in and out fast and had a great meal (more than I could eat) at a very reasonable price.    Love Battista's - I'll be back again. And again, and again.....

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K-3qVoGyd7PTV2NU8SzVQQ.text: I was in Vegas for my birthday and heard from a fellow tourist that this was a local place you have to try... it was a must go to in Vegas... the food and entertainment were so good.

tJ774J7O9tvNoCKlrUChcw.text: A Vegas staple!!    Great food , fair price , and a charming environment.    We called ahead for a reservation for a Monday night.  Weekends are very busy.

pcNmCmpEgQkvTc8GS7mF4w.text: Service was less than satisfactory.  Drinks were nothing to write home about. Decided to not wait an hour and a half to be seated as it didn't seem worth it after the service

z92YWFtCrbWrXsXqqTZZ1Q.text: Dinner was excellent. We had the cioppino and linguine with clams and white sauce. Both tasted very good. We started with salads, had divine garlic bread and a very tasty wine. The dinner ended with the most delicious cappuccino. Also, the decor was dark and very cool to look at.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Battista Style Cioppino and Linguini Chopped Clams
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall of tiny liquor bottles

0ERVimSJWcFav6hJX57pYA.text: I think this place was pretty good. I had the eggplant Parmesan and my friend had the veal. Both were quite tasty and the garlic bread and unlimited house red wine were great, as was the cappuccino. Service was also really great. My only complaint is the pasta side (in my case, ziti with red sauce) was nearly inedible and my dish was a bit salty. There was plenty of food without the pasta anyhow, but I would think an Italian restaurant would have pasta and red sauce figured out. I would go here again.

B83ZF4QXkhL6fbXXCJW5wQ.text: Visited here this past weekend and all based on location.  We had a show near Bally's and was looking for something a little different.  It was so great!!  It was really a fun experience with the ambiance and the food.    We had 5 woman and couldn't decide how to order.  The bus boy who helped us seemed confused that we were asking.  Maybe people could figure it out, ha ha, but we couldn't.  In the end we ordered 2 chicken Parmesan's and 2 side order of meatballs.  We all got the salad, bread, wine, and the cappuccino at the end.  Plus the chicken parm came with a huge bowl of pasta.  It was a lot of food and perfect for us.  The chicken parm came with a side of creamed spinach as well.  We had a little left over, but not much.  The garlic bread was to die for!  And the antipasta salad in the beginning was great.  We did not try any desserts.  Being a foodie, of sorts, I wasn't sure what to expect but it was a fabulous restaurant.  The wine on the table was a nice touch.  We could just fill up our glasses when we wanted to.  I would certainly go back here again.  Also, mad props to the strolling entertainment.  That little man is amazing!!

YmJSdNXJv-BHoQWLmC2_-w.text: Rolled in here on the strong recommendation of a work friend.  Despite the outward appearance this place is a Las Vegas favorite of ours now.  Every trip to Vegas will see us here at least once.  The menu is simple and expansive. The service is great. The prices are reasonable. Most significantly the food is simply delicious.  Treat yourself to a visit to Battista's Hole in The Wall. You will be happy you did.

o8qB1eZLjphIXXD1h_LV-g.text: Just got back from a blast at the Hole in the Wall! Came here on a recommendation from a friend of a friend. Had reservations for 4, arrived early and sat immediately. I wish I had time to actually look around. Decor is like Buca di Beppo on steroids! But also, authentic! Service, as has previously been reported accurately, was robotic, but friendly. As a group of 4, we took the "all you can drink" part seriously, but only managed two large carafes.  When they hand you a thimble for a glass, you get amped...but the reality is, we likely shared 3L among the 4 of us in less than an hour. Regardless, most of what others say is accurate.  Except my salad was amazing, with lettuce, tomatoes, ham (antipasti) and olives with a house dressing. Full disclosure, it was as big as I usually make for a lunch at home! Bread, check!! Omg.  I mentioned when I ordered my meatballs that I didn't really want pasta so they doubled the meatballs, which was great until I realized I couldn't eat that much! What a waste.  I did not care for the cappuccino at the end of the meal. While heavily whipped creamed, I am a black coffee drinker and this smacked of sugar. So bad. I couldn't stomach it. So, the food here was great, the service decent, but what really ,made it for us was the couple who was sat next to us and allowed us to be our rowdy, 2-carafe authentic selves. This couple from Mississsippi had just the right amount of "bless your heart" to keep us laughing and fully reveling in the family atmosphere. That's the luck of the draw, so get a reservation and hope you get a great table mate!

kNjBjmtx0r5-MsDFZAsv6g.text: Slipping...  Things continue to slip here & that makes me very sad. We've been here on a handful of occasions and really enjoyed it but the last few times haven't been up to par.   Let's begin with the good stuff. Wine, wine & even more wine! This is how the conversation goes with the waiter ~  Waiter: White or red? Me: Both please Waiter: (laughs) So you've been here before...  You get wine with your meal & I'm happy to say that I've never once left here not tipsy :)   Does the food taste better when you're tipsy? Sure it does...  We always order the same two meals; cheese ravioli with a marinara sauce and Chicken Rio (chicken breast smothered in a creamy white sauce over noodles and veggies on the side). Both are usually good but on this last trip both were barely warm and our chicken dish had hardly any sauce on it. Each meal comes with a soup or salad and we get one of each. My man gets the minestrone which was sent back this time because it was lukewarm & poorly seasoned and I get the salad which is really consistently great. This time I noticed they added croutons which is unnecessary and they were so hard that one of them left a little cut in my mouth :(  Please get rid of these hard croutons....  The garlic bread is fantastic here and always comes out straight out of the oven and you also get sweet cappuccinos with whipped cream for dessert. I love the sweet ending! Let me also mention the old school ambiance that looks like a hoarders dream. I dig it and it's fun and on the dark side which is always extra romantic.   Service has always been great and not sure what's going on in the kitchen but we hope they get it together. We might give it another chance but no more after the next try if things don't improve.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cappuccinos ~ perfect little dessert
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Rio &amp; Ravioli
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine wine wine!

F3nGGdlM9ymCU9QDUCL0Pg.text: The best Italian food !! Service was fast and not rushed. Pricing was right on. Will go back everytime iam in Vegas

B2WLU5Aj-b_ahznaXGAtPA.text: Great food, fun atmosphere for an awesome price.  It's great for a birthday, anniversary or date night.   And to top it off they have the cutest accordion player.

qOXqFRri9IY8Dg2laJ3bLA.text: First time at Battista's, loved this place! Great old school Italian restaurant. Definitely will be coming back.

p7VSpDHP470yh1cuxG0N0A.text: We went here on one of our date nights. It's been on our list of Classic Vegas restaurant to try,list. The value of the food is great. But the quality is lacking. There are better Italian restaurants in town. Go to one of those places if you want excellent Italian food. This place is just kitschy. The accordion player on the other hand is fantastic.

Jk0rWXg6Yd_dvCtcHVEDIw.text: Every time I come to Vegas this is my first stop! The food is amazing and so is the atmosphere. The prices are so reasonable they start at about $22 but everyone gets a craft of red/white wine, garlic bread, soup/salad, and the main course! For that price you really can't go wrong especially it being so close to the strip. This will forever be my favorite place

zuSQX0fjVFHzWxIFrFyqrQ.text: Great choice for dinner with old Vegas charm! We loved it. The wine, food and cappucino were great!

S83vugmk3zEUxARuD_LQ-Q.text: 3 stars for the food, rounded up to 4 stars for great service!   First of all, the concept of this old school Italian restaurant is different. There is a minimum $13 fee per person, but each entree is around $23-$41. This means that you can either choose to have a ton of food, or to pay the $13 fee which includes salad or soup, wine, garlic bread, and a cappuccino.   For the 4 of us, we decided to just get 4 entrees so that we had extra to bring home. If you are just visiting and don't want leftovers, then I'd suggest just paying the $13 per person. I'd say that 3 entrees for 4 people would've been a good amount to order for us, since the soup/salad and garlic bread were pretty good and filling.  We really enjoyed the chicken parmesan and the lasagna. The spaghetti and 2 meatballs was pretty standard. We also got the linguini with chopped clams in white sauce and it was not very good.  I'd definitely come back for the ambiance, unlimited carafes of wine, garlic bread, and to try other pasta dishes. The service was great and they were very attentive in refilling our wine and bread. I was sad that the accordion player didn't come to our table, but maybe next time!

TDiDcIArKllTBIZTYH-6nw.text: Wow! What a delicious restaurant , they give you red and white wine and delicious garlic bread to start . All of our meals tasted amazing and our server was a very kind lady. I also loved the cappuccinos at the end of our dinner! Glad our friend told us to eat here, we will certainly be back. Best Italian dinner I've had !

aBvHeQfROBZyNXdsUwL4Jw.text: Service and the atmosphere are great but the food lid a little sub-par.  There is a roaming accordion player that is adorable and charming. The menu has a wide variety. My husband I chose classics: manicotti and cheese ravioli- $25.95 each. They tasted frozen and processed- not authentic.   Each meal comes with a house salad, red and/or white House wine, garlic bread and a cappuccino.  The salad was so-so. It has a slice (like you would get at the deli counter) of salami in it with a hunk of processed mozzarella cheese and is slightly overdressed.   The wine was for sure cheap, but I wasn't expecting anything fancy considering it was included. The meal, depending on what you picked, doesn't take too long to get there but again, isn't anything to write home about.  It seemed like previously frozen, processed pasta- not homemade- with processed cheeses and canned sauce. I've had better at chains. The garlic bread wasn't fresh- seemed like it had been sitting a while and was hard. I tasted the cappuccino and it was ok but had a strong nutty flavor, almost like pecan.   Again, the 2 stars are for the ambiance and the accordion player than came by our table to entertain.   It's Vegas- there are so many places with much better food for the same price.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Accordion player that visits each table

moAW46_2-QAJnTOAYA3oKg.text: Just like the name says, it is a hole in the wall where you can expect good food and large portions. Bread, house red and white wine, and dessert cappuccino come with meals.

B2NbEF52Q-okdHbtd-aq-Q.text: This is the BEST cappuccino I've ever had. Everything was absolutely delicious!! I had ravioli and he haD lasagna. We shared the soup and salad and both were amazing, ( I loved the salami and cheese in the salad!) wine was house so it was alright but was definitely good enough to not pay extra for! The garlic bread was soaked in garlic-absolutely amaZing! We heard about this place from a local and thankful we did! Soup,salad,  BOTTLE of wine, garlic bread, two entrees and two cappuccinos... $66..nothing better than that.. we are stuffed and have a whole meal basically to take back with us!!  P.s. There is a little man with an accordion and he's the cutest thing ever, such a nice fun little touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AOSk04Zq3mr2f0KRyo6URg.text: Yeesh... not so impressed. If you're grandma was a hoarder and an average cook, thus would be like going to her place for dinner... and being made to drink grandpa's homemade wine!  Not horrific, but average food, average service, dusty old room.

ZbXd5ErFF1PowV_74RbFSg.text: This is a nice "old vegas" place. Food is only okay but you get a long of food for the price.

LC2qJMNktCEuiOlf0djzEQ.text: WOW!! Finally made it here ! Great setting, nothing too upscale, however, just the place you always wanted to be at!! Great service, great food, tasty and the right portion size. Minestrone soup was tasty and seasoned perfectly, veal picante excellent, tiramisu hit the spot with the cappuccino! Our server Eric was attentive and explained the meals and answered our questions.  Will be back !! Maybe as the accordion player !!

rZ3YvM0snXOT7i81iHs3Kw.text: old-school italian spot, just off the strip. love it! i always get the lasagna cuz its bomb! every meal comes with a good salad, bomb garlic bread, tasty cappuccino and bottomless wine!!!!  tip for people gettin your drink on ... ask for to-go cups for your water, pour in your leftover wine!! ... your welcome.

Fu5bQdv66TwrGR8WSsdrUQ.text: If you want to eat expensive but mediocre Italian food in Vegas, this is the place!  Good:  - the garlic bread - the waiter (Doug) was polite and nice  - unlimited red and white wine   Bad: - the salad was terrible, way too much lime juice was added to it. It was inedible.  - the vegetable minestrone soup is made from beef broth. The server didn't mention it until we specifically asked. Why call it vegetable soup if it isn't vegetarian??  - the capacino served at the end is diabetic inducing. It has way too much sugar. How about not adding sugar and giving it on the side?  Ugly: - the clam pasta had 5 clams each the size of a dime. The pasta sauce (olive oil and garlic) had very little flavour and taste.  - the vegetarian Pasta (Tomato based sauce) was bland and flavorless. I've had store bought pasta sauce that tasted better.  -the lighting in the restaurant is horrid. It's a mix of dark yellow and orange. At first we didn't mind it, but as we spent more time in the restaurant, we started getting headaches. And we couldn't enjoy whatever little taste the food had.  - With all the problems above, the food is very expensive and you are left with a big hole in your wallet.   My experience at this restaurant has been a life changing one. I have decided that hence forth I shall never ever set foot inside a restaurant that has rating of less than 4 stars.   Tl;dr: stay away from this place!

QXnKKIZem96a3PJfGJWaqw.text: This is a hidden gem.  Right behind the Flamingo.  An old Italian amazing trip through time that you won't find anywhere else.  Make a reservation or be prepared to wait.  Try their homemade Sangria!  All the free table wine with dinner you can drink.  The salad is amazing.  Their linguini with clams is one of my favorites.  I don't know how they make the cappuccino but I always want more.  And best of all it all comes with your meal!!   When in Vegas or if your local and have never been you shouldn't miss it or your missing out.  Be prepared to take home leftovers!   They are awesome the next day!

OsuX0v3j1ilwJT9QkmiqYg.text: Everyone seems to love Batista's, and there must be a reason. But I sure didn't see many reasons to like it last night. It was my first visit---I went with out-of-town relatives who absolutely love the place.   The pluses first: The atmosphere is great, it's vintage Vegas and there are photos galore of everyone who is or was anyone. I love the carafes of house red and white wine they give you, and constantly refill. It's house wine, yes, but I really liked the white chablis. They also give you big baskets of garlic bread, and the Italian salad was quite good.  Now the minuses: My biggest problem with Batista's last night was the wait staff's attitude and the feeling I got of being rushed. Everything they did and said---and how they said it---screamed "We want to move you out of here as fast as we can." No smiles from the waiters, nothing friendly about them, just all business get-you-out-of-here attitudes. Our waiter brought an armload of salads to the table (yes, stacked on his arm), and said "Anyone here who doesn't want a salad?" We all did, and he dealt them out around the table, just like a 21 dealer. He took our orders and soon our food arrived.  I had steak pizzaiola. My plate was 3/4 steak covered in sauce, and 1/4 creamed spinach. It was mass of liquid. Frankly, it looked unappetizing, but the steak was very good. I didn't eat the spinach, though, I couldn't get past how it looked. They never brought my side order of pasta (the menu says you get soup or salad, garlic bread, a side of pasta, and cappuccino). I didn't realize they'd forgotten it until I was done eating because I felt so rushed. They dropped capuccinos on the table and the rush feeling really started. That's when I realized there's no dessert menu! I guess they don't want guests lingering over dessert. Since the family in our group hadn't seen each other in a couple of years, we were all talking over our coffee, but they kept trying to get us out of there! So we finally obliged them.  My dinner was $29.95, and I've certainly had far better for that price or less. Although the food was good, the presentation (at least of my dish) was just awful, and forgetting the pasta side just shouldn't have happened. And the truth is they weren't really all that busy. There was no line out the door, and I'm not sure anyone had to wait for a table if they didn't have a reservation. Normally I would have had a better steak, like a ribeye or a NY strip, but those were $39.95 on their menu, and I don't pay that much for a steak that's just a steak (it's not like the menu said it's kobe or even angus). I can't speak at all for the past dishes since I didn't have any, but those who had pasta in my party liked it.   Overall, I was pretty disappointed. To me, it seems like so many people come to Batista's (perhaps just so they can say they've been there) that Batista's no longer cares about the customer as much as they used to. Or, for all I've written, it might have just been a bad night. Whatever the case, it was a disappointing enough experience that I won't be going back, and I won't be taking guests there. Hope you all have better luck than I did.

nw-doZGe5V-LiZUSEkZ0tg.text: Wonderful atmosphere, great owners and amazing Italian food. You order a full course dinner: wine, soup or salad, main course, most delicious French bread and the best coffee at one price!! All around great meal at great prices! Definitely will do again!

ARk3-rYcda176AO5cDTNjA.text: I just moved to Vegas & stumbled upon Battista's Hole In The Wall, which has truly become my #1 favorite Italian Restaurant in all of Vegas!!!  I absolutely love their food........you cannot go wrong, no matter what you order.    The employees are really friendly and helpful. Carey, who was the server helping me the first time I dined there, made my dining experience really great and she is a great part of the reason I go back.

bHIAXVJXcMgcmRjgWDySdg.text: Awesome good.  Great ambience.  Old school Vegas.  All inclusive menu - wine, salad, meal, cappuccino.  5 stars!!!!!

FwPmRnBbCq2uKSAgqiIFcg.text: 3.5 Really good choice when you have a large group of people, fun and efficient restaurant for groups.  Gives you a kitschy feel for old Vegas, and thats a nice warm fuzzy feeling for sure.  The pastel blue toilets, the bartenders that have been there for 35 years, the junk filled walls, its all nice.  It feels distinctly Vegas.  Ehhh the food- good value, complete meal with wine, salad, entree and coffee- neat package.  Im just not one for uber cheesy suacey carby Italian.  Not my thing dont enjoy it.

-_GoqUCpH53K8QbCBZej7w.text: Seemed like one of those places out of the "old" Vegas. Dimly lit, classy staff, good food.   I had the chicken parm, and between it, the soup, and (amazing) garlic bread, there was easily enough to feed two people (I'm a big guy, and couldn't eat half of it). Everything was delicious. My wife enjoyed the lasagne.   Your wine is included in the meal, as is your cappuccino at the end (although that tasted more like hot chocolate than cappuccino).  My wife and I ate for less than $60. Given the price, quantity, and quantity of food, it felt like an amazing deal.  I'll be back again.

zMsqB6xY8RhFHJDezxwLDA.text: I love this place the service is great and the food is amazing and you cant beat unlimited house wine with your meal. I have almost tried everything on the menu now and so far have not found something i didnt like.

MwVWECDRcdAYXUADfJCQEw.text: This place used to be is all I can say. It is no more. Poor service and worse food. Sad but True. The food at least used to be ok. We won't be going back and it saddens me.

UmconG7TCA_OsLuNTgVQUw.text: I've lived in Las Vegas since 1990. This was my first time going to this restaurant tonight.  The place was nice on the inside but the quality of the food for the price was terrible. You only got one choice of soup which came to me luke warm. Then the main course steak pasta meal was very bland. Steak wasn't seasoned and the meal itself tasted like nothing. Then they give you a cappochino that has no espresso or coffee content.  To rub it in my face in the end it came to over $70. Olive garden isn't authentic Italian but if you want better quality food I suggest going there or any other Italian place. I wasn't the only one that complained that night. A couple across from us asked to speak to the chef about the food. Don't understand how they lasted for so long but they have definitely lost there way since it first opened. You know the celebrities wouldn't eat this garbage.

iWWR_IpfzCrECAaZd0IrBQ.text: This place was a lot better years ago but still it wasn't the worst place I have ever been to.  Pros -All you can drink red or white house wine  -Meal comes with your choice of soup or salad -All you can eat delicious garlic bread -Service this visit was the best ever received and I have been here numerous times -Salad was light & flavorful just the right amount of dressing  Cons -Quality & taste has gone down the last few years the meals we ordered were bland -Portions are small for the price  -Price has gone up just like everything else but $24.95 for lasagna and $21.95 for spaghetti is a bit much  -Wait time is terrible even if you do make a reservation before hand. -Cappuccino is more like hot chocolate but if you like that then that would be a pro

mujrFrVvWyE04t2H9FcK4w.text: A hidden gem! Skip the buffets and go here:) the food is great and the atmosphere is even better! Large servings too!

pM9OydixNNhv2H5ZOiCVnA.text: I really wanted to like this place. I have heard about this place for many years and thought it must be great since it's been in business for decades. The decor was interesting with tons of old photos covering the walls but in the end it seemed to be a tourist trap with bad service, bad food, and somewhat high price point with meals starting at 22.95-40.95. Meals include choice of salad or soup, garlic bread, free wine, and cup of cappuccino. The soup and garlic bread were good. The free wine wasn't great, but drinkable. The pasta taste like it came out of a box and the sauce taste like it was poured out of a can.

xcPfHG9GNZVW8v33AwQoFA.text: Best Italian in Vegas!!! Plus free wine!!!! There's always a line at this place so MAKE A RESERVATION!!!!

ys2aYi-9fhpVINoIOKrNIg.text: Sorry,I don't know how any of you can even put "good" and "food" in the same sentence,when referring to this place. I mean,no offense,but I've had better hospital food than what you'd get at this restaurant! The meals,wine and desert are pre-plated. Yes you get the 'house' wine,but it tastes like piss. Not to mention,the service is inexcusable...takes forever to order and forever to get your bill. I only came once a few years ago and walked out,after taking one bite of the food. For $40 (for 2),I could've had a better meal at Paradise Cantina (which is my favorite hole in the wall)down the street.  Would never, ever,recommend this place.    But,that's just me. I like food to taste good :)

eDNMKMgVuWoyzHs2wRrdWQ.text: Ok, runs like a machine. Everything is timed and you are in and out. Limited basic Italian menu. No personal service.   I had the lasagna. Pretty bland. Needed spices.

cUX4ol1hgUETwpe2CaYgpw.text: This is the best old school atmosphere in town! Such a great place to take friends! Great food! Chicken parm. Can't go wrong!

AL9kaucQKZxQMyUT61n0MA.text: Good, solid Italian food is what brings me back to Battista's when I'm in Vegas. The menu is posted on the wall and all meals include wine (your choice of red or white), salad and their amazing garlic bread. I recommend the egglpant parm which is baked with the right amounts of sauce and cheese. While the wine is nothing to write home about, its good enough and goes well with anything on the menu. If you're heading out for a night of drinking on the strip, Battista's is a good first stop for a hearty meal.

1AQrAxlJfZnu3PBrrtsuOA.text: I've been here a half dozen times over the past decade. I don't know if it's my nostalgia, but I seem to remember this place having standard Italian fare. Now it is just plain bad. The red sauce they use on everything is uninspired, the pasta is cold by the time it gets to you, and the quality of meats is low. I am not a wine snob, but it is not even at 3 Buck Chuck level. I don't see myself returning again.

zvzCQRDUQN-zj_xKUccD8Q.text: Great food, good value, can't beat it atmosphere! Go!!

x4sJw1TpClt22qrsqdgphQ.text: I thought the prices (22 - 39) we're high for simple Italian. The celebrators photos that cover the walls are so old I do not recognize the people and I am safely in senior citizen territory. It is near the strip and my date was impressed, so it so it ain't all bad.

bNmum6Wd2zukV8kqipDFkg.text: Just marginal - did not care for the tomato sauce, it had a strange metallic taste.  Rest of the food was pretty good (soup, salad, fried zucchini, cappuccino, and garlic bread). My daughter got shrimp in garlic butter sauce and it was quite good.

_p3PSZxLACpZLkWfuyRN_g.text: I had expected more from this place. Food was decent but not the best,I had the chicken Parmesan. We enjoyed the salad and bread. Our families had hyped up the place too much and my expectations were not meet but the cappuccinos were amazing. Service was fair.

XUVhd4RrSZEboSqeUstMvg.text: Food is bland and severely lacks in taste and seasoning. Sure the never ending wine is great but the food tastes like it is straight off the airplane. The decor is nice but that's all that is worth writing about at this joint.

tWvKVGl49aSFYl5L1GglhA.text: This is an old time Vegas haunt. The food is great and the decorations are awesome. While I love the food my favorite part is the accordion player who has been there for 22 years. It's convenient to the strip so make the trip!

vPWcBlvXrMURZiCS7dRpGg.text: Visited on 7/11/2011 for my friend Tim Young's 37th birthday.  This place rocks, (Thank you Phil Browning!)  PROS:   OVERALL FEEL.. This place is THE authentic Italian joint! Everything from the Over sized (bullet proof?) door, to the personally signed photo of Elvis Presley (The King) and all other photos, this place overwhelmingly reminded me of an Italian restaurant out of the movie CASINO.  (WITH ALL DUE RESPECT  :)   ) I think this place is where Bucca di Beppo got its inspiration with with real food that doesn't come from a bag...  THE BREAD: FUGHETABBOUT IT.....  Just remember, ask for the oil & vinegar. Delish!  THE WINE: ALL YOU CAN DRINK HOUSE WINE. Enough said.  THE FOOD: I had the spaghetti w/ Sausage Cacciatore.  Really, really good!  THE SERVICE: Our waiter patiently explained all the ins and outs of each dish giving a well scripted definition of the dish which set the expectation of the guest.   CONS: Be prepared to pay around $30 per person, but hell it's Vegas and every trip should have at least one solid meal.  OVERALL:  Great conversation, Great food, Great environment.  And as always friends and neighbors, when it comes to Food, Drink or Overall Value........Always trust a FAT MAN! :).  Pat Walters Anaheim, CA

z2IxZwhm8OcpUI9HUXpUuw.text: First time in Vegas and after 4 days of all-you-can-eat and fine dining my husband and I went to Battista's.  There was a huge line and after speaking with the hostess she made us a reservation an hour and a half away.  We were lucky enough that our hotel was right by the restaurant.  Sure, as the reviews say the entree prices may seem high but when you think you don't need to order anything else I found it was cheaper than going to other restaurants.  I ordered the Chicken Marsala, my husband the Veal Marsala.  It was absolutely wonderful.  I thought the pasta that came with it did no wonders for it but after the garlic bread, soup and wine who could eat all that anyway?   I would go again if I ever visit Vegas again.  The waitress was friendly, the feel of the restaurant was good and we had a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and Veal Marsala, garlic bread and side of meatballs and linguini with clam sauce.

jjAA4v67uFQ2Td49ozTrEw.text: 1. Overall, a mediocre mix of food and generic experience. It is truly, by all definitions - a tourist trap. One sign of this is that it is only open after 5 pm daily. Literally, a bus or two will come through every evening as far as I can tell. (I am a 36 year resident of Las Vegas.)  2. First, the food. Olive Garden is at least two levels better in quality. My wife and I believe the sauce is simply canned, nothing more or less. The lasagna, again, normal. Any degree of spice or uniquity is simply altogether missing. Strangely enough, the garlic bread was good and so was the expresso - small victories for a higher, mid-level priced dinner.  3. I think the 'never-ending' free wine basically makes many customers happy in lieu of good food. It's normal.  4. The wait was was long - 30 minutes, because of the tour bus. The bar drink we had while waiting was experience.  5. With all due respect, the accordion player with the disability, was playing off of peoples emotions. He would play a few seconds literally, say the same thing to most of the tables in the room - most of it was geared towards how beautiful the female was, everyone would give him money,and then 30 minutes later, the same routine, and same peddling for money. It's not right. We felt pressured to do as the other tables did and give him a few bucks each time.  6. Of all the Italian places to eat in Las Vegas, I would never suggest this place to eat. Fast-food or sit-down are all superior to this.   7. As I read in another review, it is True that the decor is somewhat interesting with vintage Las Vegas pictures. But does this overcome the shortcomings? No. I am torn between 1 and 2 stars.

wzNcKOqX0UWiYQe3S-OhxA.text: this hole in the wall is a little loud for my taste.  food is on the higher price for Italian... nothing special.  ordered the eggplant parm and it was soggy.  I think people only come here for the all you can drink house wine.

MFjkLVINZcu_cThwF_WmQQ.text: This place is great.  The food is very good not great but the atmosphere makes up for it.  Simple italian menu written on the wall or you can read it on a menu.  You have two choices of all you can drink wine, red or white.   I make a point to come here every time I am in Vegas.  I often bring groups of customers here for some thing a little different.  Don't forget to tip the squeeze box player.

K6H_Y2hnitvXPOVvITJrPg.text: The free wine with dinner and cappuccino was the first hook that got us in the door. The food was well portioned for the price and pretty good overall. We have always had a good experience unless there is a huge convention near by and wait times get to over an hour. Overall a reliable local joint with decent service and a nice selection of entrees.

KGMFglJa0BltwpHDRQE78A.text: A restaurant is foremost a place to eat, and kitschy  decor aside, this place is by far the worst Italian food I've ever eaten. The gimmick of "free" (poor tasting) wine is not worth it. No one, especially tourists, should ever eat here. I had the chicken parm, which was a large, flavorless chunk of chicken. Their sauce is the blandest red sauce ever. It came with some kind of revolting spinach goo.  The salad is served in plastic bowls. The garlic bread has some kind of grainy butter paste spread on it. Every dinner is served with plastic covers on scary metal hospital carts. The after dinner cappuccino tasted like burnt caramel.  After they had taken our plates, we asked for more wine and were told the "free" wine only comes with dinner, so don't make that mistake. Better yet, DO NOT EAT HERE EVER.

dhkeOo6SWUymDjbIZFa5Cg.text: The name says it all:  "Battista's Hole in the Wall."  It overcompensates for its really mediocre food by all the other kitsch items they have and the all the wine you can drink feature, for those that are interested in that.  I think the service was "middle of the road,"  as well.  I have had better Italian food at the chains out there (Carraba's, Macaroni Grill, Olive Garden).  They do serve you a filling meal but it's just not that great.  I guess people go try it because of its novelty value and its long history, being adjacent to the Strip.  Sorry, but that's not enough for a return visit.  I thought I might be in the minority - but there are a host of other 1, 2 and 3 star reviews for this place.

BchnI365VBhrrgrLWGGbFA.text: Seriously impressed!    We had a small group of 15 for our wedding and they totally rocket it!   We had some food allergies that were completely accommodated and literally had all we could drink wine!   Wow, amazing service by Frank and 2 others.   And the accordion player......he played for us a wedding song, so sweet!   They brought us wedding cake and couldn't have been more helpful and on top of it.  All courses were amazing.   I would definitely go back frequently if I lived in Vegas......and we will for sure go back when we visit for our anniversary.   Thank you so much to all the staff and for your excellent, friendly service.

lCBdd1OpY9erhMUNYCwZ-w.text: The ambiance was True Italian, but I'm not sure the little man playing his instrument for money was. The cioppino was not what I recalled. Probably won't go back. I was planning this visit for 7 months. Disappointed.

K2vmHMC_hQEe0fsx8JlByw.text: This place is amazing!  Great food. The Italian salad is the best I've ever had.  You get unlimited wine too! After dinner you get a great cappuccino and a yummy dessert of your choice :). Well worth the wait!

pNKpac-DxwDMqFbnsCZfhQ.text: Recommended by a cocktail waitress at The Palms. It's exactly what we where looking for. It was homey and casual. The portions are huge, the garlic bread delicious. Your meal comes with the house red or white wine as well as a cappuccino to end your meal.

VtSyzEHHV2vyKb4hqm4oPw.text: My second time to Vegas, and my second trip to Battista's. After my first trip, 4 years ago, I came back to Cincinnati wanting to find a place just like this. A hole in the wall Italian place with homemade food and all you can drink house wine. While I still haven't found this at home, I went back to Vegas last week with my husband to celebrate our anniversary and we made sure to have dinner here. The food wasn't as good as I remembered, but it was better than some places I've been to around home, so I give it a plus. The salad was soggy and the eggplant had been microwaved but the noodles and sauce were good, and the coffee was delicious. Every time I come back to Vegas, I'll be sure to stop in because the value of what you get vs the price is outstanding!

cVj4ZhYuJsgQSN6x-I4KlQ.text: Every time I go to Vegas, I look forward to eating at Battista's.  Every dish I've sampled here has been delicious.  It's all simple, good Italian cooking.  Meals range from like $18-30 depending on what you get, and that includes soup or salad, bread, wine, and a cappuccino for dessert.  Definitely a great deal, especially in this town.  Eat 'til you explode and drink yourself stupid on house wine...the Strip and all the tourists cramming it up get way more entertaining that way.  The decorations are kitschy, but that's part of the charm.  The tables are a little crammed together in some areas; this is more a homey, friendly atmosphere than a quiet, romantic restaurant.  Be sure to keep a few small bills handy to tip Gordy, the restaurant's accordionist.  He's an absolute trip.  Reservations are definitely recommended if your party is larger than two people and/or you don't like to wait over an hour for a table.

XLwUhVFwCJJhPQSAj5NKLw.text: The "cappuccino" is powdered hot chocolate. The wine is pretty bad, but the best thing about the place. The garlic bread is also pretty bad but better than the entrees. Way too much cheese. It's very difficult to mess up pasta I would imagine but this place accomplished it. All of us who went threw up. My friend took two bites of her meal and threw up. I threw up as soon as I got home, either from the nasty food or the bad wine. Hard to tell. My other friend who came with us also threw up as soon as we got home. The good or decent reviews are very confusing since this is definitely the worst Italian food I've ever had, and I'm not picky. Also the portion sizes aren't that big for most meals but the food was so bad it did not matter. The only thing they didn't screw up was the salad, and I have to give them credit there because I think salad is easier to screw up than pasta. Also being drunk off the wine didn't make the nasty food taste any better, which is saying something since McDonald's is delicious when you're drunk. The service was excellent though, but also because there was barely anyone in there on a Friday evening.. if you decide to go, good luck!

UjP1IJHxI_um4xtdsk-yhw.text: This place is great!!! Every time we come to Vegas this is a must go to restaurant for my husband and I. The price is great for all the food that you get, plus the wine is included and unlimited!

-aCfdc4giTD9t9m7_ifh5w.text: We have been coming to Battista's during every trip to Vegas since we accidentally stumbled upon this place. We took a chance our first trip and waited the 20 minutes to be sat and we are so glad we did. We always make a reservation now but this place is worth waiting if you need to. We LOVE the older gentleman that comes around to play music and every single bite is delicious!! The atmosphere is authentic and their walls are covered in things to look at!   The ladies who run the front could be a little more pleasant to those who come in with no reservation (or just in general, since they also couldn't seem to be bothered to answer where the restroom was) however, even their attitudes doesn't make this place worth any less than 5 stars.   A hole in the wall but a treasure!!

LJSMHbIh3mLVJ059JOQ29g.text: The house wine was terrible. The garlic bread felt like it was dusty. The chicken Parmigiana was somewhere under the sauce.

qYZO6OmkivoJ8zgjROStfQ.text: Nice and dark, old school, with the smell of garlic bread,  and a mishmash kitschy decor of a Chotchkie's apron with flair,  the place is oddly perfect for a romantic date night,  a family dinner that pleases everyone,  or a raucous party (the endless wine helps).   The portions are huge and yummy.   My lasagna was so cheesy it was like queso fundino with sauce.   My wife's cannelloni was a bucket of fresh ricotta wrapped in a pasta blanket.   My sister's sausage (wasn't that a CBS show?) was yum.   We ate for a long time and it looked like we never started.   Make sure your room has a fridge.   And we ended up with uneaten garlic bread.   Who doesn't finish off a basket of garlic bread?   I mean, besides the Lost Boys.   Oh, and personally I'm glad the endless wine isn't super awesome wine.  I don't like wine, but this stuff was slightly watery and slightly flat  so I was able to throw it down.  Hey, here comes Gordy, the accordion player!   He's like a mariachi band only it's one guy, I understand the words,  and I don't shrink in my seat when he comes by.   Keep a fiver in your pocket to give him -  the guy will need a second hip soon.  The service is great, too.  I didn't like much my minestrone soup.   It had, like, every vegetable in it.   I could point out so many it was like a Richard Scarry book.   So I asked if I could get the salad (mmm with a slice of salami) instead.   "No problem!"    Can we get more garlic bread?   "Sure, please make room for a shoebox size basket of garlic bread".   Hey, since this wine is endless, can I leave my car here?   "Please do.  Would you like us to fill it with garlic bread?"  Oooh, and that hot chocolatey cappuccino at the end w/ whipped cream! Nothing's better on a stomach full of 2 pounds of cheese  and a gallon of wine than some hot liquid chocolate coffee. Keep your leftovers so you have something to eat while you're in the bathroom :)

ZBrlzdZxPhvlpcTM7-ek5w.text: AHHHHHHmazing. Have visited here twice (each time I've been to Vegas) never has disappointed. We all got different meals, lasagna, veal parm and ziti with meat sauce. We all left with happy tummy's. Especially the free wine and cappuccino at the end of the meal

gcvXZ7Rh_bCxcxBQm8p75g.text: Great old school italian food.  The food is three stars the experience makes it four stars.  The service is very good and the servings of food are on the larger side.  My wife loves thier cappuccino that is served at the end of the meal.  The recipe for the cappuccino is on the Battista's business cards when you first walk into the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old Jimmy is still hustling the tables for tips...

phv5gDrdv2vJbmxFCl_lFw.text: Best kept secret in Vegas. Traditional Italian food that will leave you satisfied and full. I had the house Lasagna that was to kill for. And everyone in our group loved their meals.  Free house red or white wines. Free Cappuccino to finish off dinner. Laid back atmosphere casual dress.

rN60Rv9TRQKEp32Lyu58lQ.text: Battista's Hole in the Wall first caught my attention when I heard it served unlimited house wines... Free wine? Count me in!  As a fan of Italian food and wine, I wanted to see if it was any good here. I went with a group of 6 or so on a Friday night and there was a wait of 45 minutes. Once seated, we were offered house white and red wine. Average wine of course, nothing special. Since it was busy, it took a while for our food to come out but we didn't mind as we had wine to preoccupy us.  The ambiance is warm and cozy, the place pretty dimly lit (view pictures to see).  I got the lasagna and it wasn't anything to rave about. I didn't finish it nor take the leftovers home. The free wine is great, but the food is important too. I would most likely check out other Italian restaurants before returning here.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Who doesn&#39;t love free wine?

jPfoDnxsfrXLBNMyLbmyzQ.text: We was told that this was a must-go to place to eat. So, we decided to go. Upon walking in there was a huge collection of stuff in curio cabinets...had a little wait for a table. It was pretty busy. The funny thing was the menus were on the wall. We was entertained by an older fellow with an accordian.  The meals for a party of 5 came with soup, salad and unlimited white and red wine. I am NOT a wine drinker, did not know this upon ordering. The meal was just ok. The soup was a minestrone and the salad had salami in it..was real good. The main meal, spaghetti was Nothing spectacular. Rather pricey. Paid for wine.(see photos)

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sign on the wall
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White wine and red wine
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad..yummy

6fK42rlN96KzMVh9dbu83g.text: This is my favorite Italian place for many reasons.  They have a older Italian guy walking around playing the accordion and the food was amazing. I was full and still had leftovers! We got salads and soups right off the bat and their garlic bread is superb. At the end we got delicious cappuccinos with a great after taste. Love it and would come back again.

4ztLhijRVUPFTesLfnqIOQ.text: You know something about this place were good.  Like the garlic bread salad soup, and especially the red house wine.  However the red sauce on the pasta was thick as tomato paste and so acid .  What's more, it was ladled heavily!  Mos of the pasa was awful.  Never again.t

HVs2zp8_nHhkDqDKA1dj5g.text: They have time-honored italian entrees in a very cozy atmosphere. The portions are enormous and the prices are reasonable by Vegas standards. Each meal includes wine, garlic bread, salad, the entree, a side of pasta and a cappuccino. So it's a full-service joint.  The servers are usually on the ball and the hosts handle reservations well. Their 90-year-old accordion player is a rare treat but sometimes he lingers too long for tips, which can confuse first-time diners who don't know they're supposed to fund him.  Most importantly, you'll never go home hungry. Opt for this place over the usual chains and you'll be glad you did.

2RcNOLqdHBIY7d1boP_C2w.text: Pros: free parking lot - can park one hour before reservation time, must leave immediately after meal.  No problem making reservations the same day (weekday).   Service was overall decent- waiter was experienced n good.    Decor cute - some photos reprinted n placed in dif areas.   Cons: Dimly lit (could use more light to read menus), cramped (can hear neighboring conversations - one step and you'd be at someone else's table), food so-so tho I did like the pasta side dish with sauce.   Felt like a tourist experience.   If not a wine drinker can sub soft drink or iced tea - lemonade not included.   Sort of a conveyor belt system - efficiency to get customers in, seat, feed, get them out, next.

zv8qJPeJDfrXeF0iKh-9Yg.text: This little hole in the wall restaurant is a hidden gem. Soup or salad, entree, desert and and wine all for $$25. The best part of the meal was the cappuccino. OH MY GOODNESS. Who knew this  drink could be so divine.

yNcWgku4V65uHDSHVxgDBg.text: I found this restaurant thanks to Yelp. After being I the strip for 3 days I was ready to get away from it. This hidden gem is located behind the hotels next to a liquor store/bar. We stayed at the Flamingo and we were able to walk to the restaurant. We made same day reservations and arrived a bit before our time. We were able to enjoy a drink in the bar area.  The restaurant is dark, decorated with old photos on the walls, the menus are posted on the walls. The restaurant is divided into rooms. We got a nice little cozy table in a corner. We were brought over water, the server asked what kind of wine we wanted, red or white, we went with both. After he took our order warm, delicious, garlic bread was brought to us. OMG I could have skipped dinner and just eaten the bread. YUM! Our meals came with a soup or salad and we both went with the house salad. It was very good.  I went with the chicken Alfredo and it was on point. My bf had a steak caruso dish and he was impressed with it. It had tender pieces of steak with sauteed veggies. We both enjoyed our meals and I can honestly say that it was the best meal I had in Vegas. At the end of our meal we got complimentary cappuccinos that were to die for. The cozy atmosphere, great home cooked pasta, great service, dining in an establishment that has been there for 40 yrs, I was in heaven.  We also got serenaded by a cute little old man playing the accordion.  I highly recommend you try this hole in the wall place while in Vegas, you will not be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Accordion serenades
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menus on the wall
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Capuccino

jwNdCBnBCZK2Lgzo5OXLjw.text: Food honestly was mediocre.  I didn't enjoy my meat ravioli. It lacked taste. My bf didn't like his cannoli. The house wine says it's complementary but it honestly wasn't great and probably included in the price of your meal. I would have rather gone to Oliver Garden (which is saying a lot ).

v_sHi8HMJNR95K13HGhMBA.text: Been here before.  It is a hidden gem-great place to escape to with the family for an "ok" pasta meal and recharge. Staff is always hit or miss especially the hostess stand that snarls at you.  Kinda too bad. May not go back if that attitude continues. My teenage kids even noticed the sad attitude from the hostess stand and mentioned it to me.

kpWN33zKouT9A--Y7y3Ogg.text: My favorite restaurant in all the US. This is how Italian food needs to be served, and taste. I go out of my way just to have an excuse to come here

STvDGBJaQ30-2A1Jn8JK5g.text: Make reservations ahead of time!! We called prior and were seated immediately because of it. It does get very crowded at all hours of the day. We came for dinner last night around 7:00pm because who doesn't love Italian food right? It was very very busy though.   I ordered the lasagne which was just mediocre. Portion was huge I probably only ate a quarter of it. My hubby got chicken Alfredo which was DELICIOUS!!!!! Definitely recommend that. My mom got linguine with clams and garlic. And her husband got the NY steak. The noodles were okay but my mom really didn't enjoy the fact they didn't have any freshly grated Parmesan cheese or freshly grated cracked pepper. And the steak was supposed to be well done but came out medium and almost raw.  Also they never took our drink order I had to personally ask for iced tea and waters even though the table next to us was asked immediately after being seated what they want to drink.  Garlic bread is very good!!! My daughter ate about 7 pieces instead of touching any pasta. The salad had waaaay too much vinegar my tongue felt very tangy after each bite. The minestrone was great though!!!   For desserts we ordered a spumoni and tiramisu for the birthday boys! The spumoni was delicious. The tiramisu however, not so much. It was made with layered yellow cake instead of sponge fingers and I hated it!!!! Didn't taste anything at all like tiramisu and I know my tiramisu. Not even a strong coffee taste at all.  The one thing I did really enjoy was the bottomless white wine as well as the cappuccino that comes with dinner!!! The cappuccino was soooooo good I drank two. And probably 3 or 4 glasses of the white wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spumoni ice cream
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY steak

Lc34fYUYuA0lNYyo1C3LBQ.text: The place to go if you want to sacrifice portion size for unlimited wine. I'm not a wine drinker and usually take my friends from out of town here who are. Food is pretty good too but not worth the price if the wine was not included. Interior of the place is very old world looking which I like a lot. Great place to take a group of your wine drinking friends. I gave it three stars because I'd rather have the food. For the food I give it four stars.

qpLrwn1CNr8SQncGskb9gw.text: Great service. We were almost immediately seated even without a reservation before hand. Food was out relatively quick and it was all fresh. This is definitely a full course big meal! Comes with a choice of soup or salad for starters. Garlic bread was on point and kept us wanting more. Main courses were were just average. Ended the meal with the house Cappuccino which was amazing! Not your regular Cappuccino but more of a desert coffee which was lovely.

0-RnjcxqkZQcWUY20TzDiQ.text: My friend and I came here for dinner the first night we were in Vegas. AMAZING!! I loved this place so much.   The pasta noodles tasted so fresh and the sauces were awesome. I got the cheese manicotti. Definitely recommend. It comes with a meat sauce, Alfredo sauce, and a creamed spinach sauce in the order of the Italian flag. So cool! And the unlimited house wine with the meal was of course the best bonus! Garlic bread was amazing as well. The only thing was that the salad was a bit sad looking. Mostly lettuce with a slice of salami in it. Still good though.  The decor was super cute too. Lots of nick knacks and things to look at. It gets busy here so come expecting to wait for a table. We had to wait about an hour and that was around 8:30. Overall I would definitely come back here next time I'm in Vegas again!

zmGiXwJuc86UVHHWtwbu5w.text: Love it. Been coming to the Hole in the Wall for years!. The free flowing house wine is great!  This great local spot is so comfortable in its skin, no pretense, no bravado .... Just a great atmosphere, solid service and good comfortable food.   Expect a wait most nites, but grab a seat in the bar and get some wine and great starters.   Oh..... Come hungry!

daydifWi1mj6pYeJemcGKg.text: The hubby took me to this place as a surprise, I had never heard anything about this place and as we pulled in the parking lot I was confused. This place is for sure a hole in the wall (in a great way). It's not in your face fancy but the food and the service is that of a five start restaurant! As soon as we walked in the door it smelled amazing! The menu is reasonably sized. And every meal comes with bread sticks, salad or soup, all you can drink wine, and a cappuccino at the end! Talk about an amazing deal!!! The white wine was to die for, not cheap tasting and not overly sweet, it was just right! And our server jessica was perfect! I didn't get our bussers name but he was equally as amazing. The service was so quick and attentive!! I orders the cannelloni and omg! So authentic and so amazing! We will be coming back for date nights for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

7Cwe9O8sUP4MX4kkTOEWAg.text: We finally made it! My husband has been going on about their speghetti for as long as I have known him!!! It was definitely worth the wait! I had the shrimp scampi in butter and garlic sauce and he had the prime rib. An absolutely amazing experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Minestrone to die for!!!
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After Dinner Treat
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi

NneiZIb9IcwGSwH2_sD97Q.text: I went here for a birthday dinner. The waiter was very helpful and prompt to bring us our endless wine. We quickly ordered and were given our delicious garlic bread and salads (can also get soup). The atmosphere was great but a little too dark making it hard to read the menu and really take in the surroundings. Our food came very quickly and wasn't bad. I expected the food to be a little more than it was but it was tasty. I would have to say that the best part of the meal was the homemade cappuccino you get at the end of the meal. If I could drink that daily I would! Heaven in a cup!

0LfTYKiuvPUYNxOlClPzpw.text: It's like going way back in time. I felt at home because it reminded me of Italian restaurants growing up in the 70s back in NY. To be very honest the food was just okay but definitely nothing exciting. It's the atmosphere that truly makes it. The sad part is that the original owner has retired and Its now owned by a large corporation.

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9ZYL0WwILC6P7Fgrp2Zkhw.text: Nice place, good food, not great but good. My boyfriend had the fettuccine Alfredo with grilled chicken which he ate the whole thing! I had the ziti with meatballs and it was good. I love the garlic bread! The wine was fine and the soup/salad were just fillers. For Vegas the price was fine but I wouldn't pay that much at home.

bFwwX0tNQlmY-SzvGlRrCg.text: I love where this restaurant is located.  Just off the strip.  This is my second trip to this restaurant and I remember it being a lot better... I came in around 8pm on Sunday and not was pretty busy,  not too crazy.  We waited about 5 minutes and then we were seated which was excellent.  The front host staff is great and welcoming.   The experience and service was fine my 3 stars are for the food. Bland with a capital B. And the table wine is terrible,  not even drinkable really.  I ordered the chicken parm and my husband ordered the chicken fettuccine the sauce om my children parm really didn't have any flavor... then they brought a side of noodles with the same sauce, I think i used a table spoon of salt before it tasted decent. It comes with garlic bread, Amazing.  And some bland soup.   My husband's fettuccine was watery and the chicken had this weird burnt taste. They have a coffee that comes out at the end which was good.  I probably will not be returning for a third time... unless someone else was paying and I could just eat garlic bread... not worth the $90 bucks I dropped.

jXBbM0VdclqoQQujwN6SAg.text: if you want cafeteria Italian food, this is the spot for you! Truth be told, you can go eat at a fine dining Italian restaurant for the same price.  EVERYTHING has a taste of something that came right out of a microwave and was made in bulk.  For anyone who actually thinks this is good Italian food, I hope you are not a chef or do catering.

9GHvkZT7hoAi6OjIfqFi0Q.text: Omg! This restaurant is amazing! It is a little on the pricey side but it is totally worth every penny! Plus you can never go wrong with all you can drink red and white wine. I tried the shrimp Alfredo, lasagna, spaghetti, as well as their salad with salami. It was soo delicious. If you are in Vegas you must try this!

-fKjqvDVF6rG1SpBVJmS7w.text: I love the little man with the accordion, but that's about it. Service is slow, although we were seated quickly, as they try to serve a few tables at once, like an assembly line. The sauce tasted raw, although the pasta was al dente. You can do better than this, guys. This place has definitely seen it's heyday. Anyone that knows what Italian food is supposed to taste like will not like this place. We didn't even finish our food, which is unusual for us.

py3JnDTpm313C0B8jJ0cKg.text: This place has a really good atmosphere once you walk in. You get the small of garlic bread right away which is delicious. The wait is usually a bit longer about an hour on Friday night. The menu is all on the wall so no need to deal with menus. They have a bar area that you can wait at and they serve appetizers there as well. Once we got seated you get a choice or salad or minestrone and they bring you garlic bread. Also there is unlimited wine that they give you with any entree! The food is good but not like amazing. Solid place worth the visit.

CsKY62DGzO89jSrgdn9t_A.text: This is the same place that the rat pack used to go to and it is the same today. Great basic Italian food and free wine worth your meal! This place is tough to beat for a great value and a fun meal I  Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Battista's Hole In the Wall - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This place is a fantastic hope in the wall!

s1YIC66zEKXJMN0xMTCDwQ.text: This is my favorite Italian restaurant. The marinara sauce is so good it's better than most we had in Italy.  Very good food, nice staff, and excellent service.  My only complaint is they won't share their marinara sauce recipe

cuKHVs8X89MVr0jM4dSNtA.text: Enjoyed dinner at this out of the way place.  Make reservations because it fills up fast.  Come hungry and try the Chicken Rio. Yum.

CPlqvYFFL2z5GyS_S09KDg.text: Not as groovy as expected, either food-wise or ambiance-wise.  Got there around 915pm with our group of 5.  Seated immediately and were greeted by our service staff.  Wine (red or white) is AWFUL like horrible cheap in a box but worse stuff.  Still, due to someone daring someone else to drink we killed 2 carafes of white and 1/2 of red.  Blech....still tasted bad and it didn't get any better!  Ambiance was OK, not super 'old school Vegas' as others would recommend; however, the wait staff was pleasant and not in a hurry to shuffle us out the door at 10pm when they closed.  The first course included soup or salad, and we mostly got the salad - mixed greens from the bag at the grocery store, complete with bottled dressing and crappy bread.  Food included spag with meat sauce (extra sauce requested and it came on the side, a-plenty), Aurora sauce (not the best, not the worse), Filet of something that basically was Fajitas minus the Tortillas and the fish stew, which had two small halves of tough, chewy crab, shrimp that was equally unappetizing and overcooked, perhaps purchased in bulk at Sam's Club,    Seriously, the ONE saving grace was the cappuccino - homemade and amazingly wonderful - honestly, the best ever.  So, if you're looking to spend a few $$ for a great after dinner drink come here.  Otherwise, skip it.  Wish someone would have warned us more sternly!  I've attached pics so you can see the seriously average food.

CVqzNHEw3xwFvdzdiJuTww.text: Dinner at Battista's is an experience! Go with a group who is ready to eat, drink and be merry.  It's the perfect spot for that.  Their dinners come complete with warm, crusty Italian bread, soup or salad, ALL YOU CAN DRINK WINE and a cappuccino after your meal.  The prices range around $20 - $40 each depending on what you order but hey if you are out to celebrate it's on point.  We went on a Thursday night about 5pm, it was packed already.  It's close to the Strip so expect a little bit of a wait but they seated us faster than they estimated.  Go with the waiter's recommendation.  If you can't decide, ask his opinion for sure. He recommended the LASAGNA to us and oh my, thank you! It's the classic lasagna you imagine when you hear the word.   My sis got the CHICKEN PARM - it was good and came with a side of creamed spinach.  I was happier with my choice :)

0HZAbgCf5bMtLoxaVeklXA.text: Not bad for the price. Neat place. Cheap wine. Ok food. Love the accordion player. Probably the best part of the meal. It is not fine dining but a fun atmosphere.

auC_3RaV-WY46Npm4jVwrw.text: I will always have good memories of this place.  I really think you should try to venture a little bit off the strip and come here.  You will not regret it.  Good food, great house wines, and perfect for large groups on a budget.

yB9g0pYSm6N1uw36iYWUcA.text: So thankful that I was finally introduced to this place after so many years. If I was a local I would eat here every night! Delicious! Very reasonably prices, especially for being so close to the strip. Ordered the lasagna for I think it was $23. The lasagna was great, but so was the salad, garlic bread, cappuccino, unlimited wine and our special complimentary desserts!! Love this place beyond belief! We got to sit at the same table that our waiter, Vito, used to serve Frank Sinatra and Elvis Presley. I will be headed back to Vegas in a week and we've already warned our 5 Battistas-virgins that we will be taking them there!

-HNlAdzayAA91SLCJcqWtg.text: Terrible. Save your money, this is not Italian food. Maybe back in the day it was good, don't know who owns this restaurant and really don't care. The bread was soggy, the chicken was swimming in the sauce, way too much cheese, the small side order of pasta was the only thing cooked correctly (al dente),the coffee (brown water) was awful(plus you do not serve Capuccino with cold whip cream on top or with dinner (the server just plop the cup in front of us and never took the dirty dishes. Had to clean our own table and put our dirty dishes on the next table. Poor service, it is a tourist trap. I am a local and try the out of the way restaurant to take out of town guests. Will never come back. Had heard so much about this rest. we had to try it and see if we will bring out of town guests here, NOPE! Obviously they do not care, the gimmick with the wine, is just that, if you really are into wine, save yourself money and go somewhere else and have a decent meal. LV has tons of great restaurants that really cook great Italian food and are priced correctly.

sw33-nYQ2zHxx4w6SacQ0w.text: I didn't know what to expect when I discovered this off-the-beaten path restaurant, but I was so pleasantly surprised. I'll be back on my next visit.

sN9p8IcF4hPzwGWAlIpGdA.text: Awesome in every way!!! Great authentic Italian food. Great service. And awesome atmosphere. 5 stars all the way!!!

Sm-GwwnS6ueB5Pn1m5FXjA.text: I really enjoyed the salmon it was cooked perfectly,my friends had chicken Alfredo and a steak and cleaned their plates.

y962qPemTzclRkX_k6XlCw.text: Food isn't over spectacular but it was good enough to get the job done; fill me up. I've had better italian elsewhere but I don't expect much from Vegas restaurants. Then again, this is an old school joint so maybe it should be better. With that said I would come again for the comfort.

s_H3wjTetNWko_0t3YjOpA.text: Gimmicky and a bit Trashy. Bland food, and even worse wine... They only ask you if you want Red or White. That should be indication enough- Simple menu options, and a really sweet "Cappuccino" to end the meal... I went once, and that was more than enough.  The old school Italian ambiance is what makes it worthy of that extra star...

L9z8qX_Or3DP2CtSHJFdGQ.text: The prices are a little high, I think because they include the wine and dessert automatically. I didn't understand wine was included. My group and I were not interested in having the wine, so I feel like we paid for something we didn't want. The service was decent. There was a man playing the accordion and he came to our table - he was super sweet and definitely added to the ambiance. The restaurant was very dark.

vUXY0Yx6qvxt-sTR0bo8tw.text: I have been to this place 4 times and I keep coming back, I love it. They start you off with a carafe of red and white wine and you can either choose one or drink them both, the salad is more than average with a house italian dressing along with some breadsticks. I choose lasagna this past time, which was excellent and a big portion, and my favorite part of the meal is the cappuccino at the end, you are SO full of food, but you must drink this, it is not your average drink, so good. While eating there is the cutest nicest older man strolling around and greeting you and playing his accordion for a tip (remember to tip him when he is done!) Old pictures on the wall to enjoy and cushion seats to sit on in your booth. The bathroom is interesting too, in the lady's room there is a picture on the wall that will make you laugh.  This place is a MUST GO when in Vegas.

vDdzxZF_x8rPmRMbo3qyBg.text: This place isn't the best food. But its a fun environment and a good place to drink bottomless cheap wine with friends. Including tip it is around 30 dollars a person. Easy walk from the Paris or planet Hollywood.

cCESULoobx0qAWGMnN7qwQ.text: Went here with my group of girlfriends during my bachelorette weekend. I was surprised that it costs so much just to split a plate. But, as a group of girls on a budget, this place was a pretty good find we split 2 plates between the 5 of us and had enough to eat. The food was pretty good - okay, the bread wasn't great and the included salad sits on a rolling cart until you order, but the pasta was decent. The free wine is a nice addition and the free espresso at the end - is really hot chocolate.   Overall, yes it's touristy and a bit hokey, but compared with all the other rip offs in Las Vegas it's a good meal and a good price.

7KPkytE20gyFgZBXtMa2fA.text: Seriously, I'm not sure how anyone could give this restaurant anything higher then 2 stars. If they did, they should get out more often. Here's the thing, if this place was in a little town in the middle of nowhere, I'd say okay but it's just off the strip in Vegas. The culinary capital of the world people. There are at least 100 superb restaurants within a mile radius, so WHY would you ever go here??? lol but people do and my guess is, they're tourists and they don't know any better. I can pretty much guarantee if you are a local you would never ever choose to go here!  The place was packed! We had to wait over an hour, which didn't bother me because there was plenty of seating. The atmosphere is kinda cool but there are plenty of restaurants with that type of atmosphere/decor. The service was not very good. My friends raviolis came out ice cold. I had the chicken parmigiana, it was okay, kinda bland - nothing special. The "free wine" (I use the term free very loosely since I paid $28 for a piece of chicken - I'm sure the price of that nasty free wine was compensated for with the overpriced piece of chicken) was disgusting....the red smelled and tasted like red wine vinegar and the white wine was warm - yes white wine warm!? There was spinach that accompanied my chicken that as soon as I took a bite I wanted to spit out....but of course didn't. It was the most disgusting thing I've ever tasted. I sat and tried to figure out this distinct (overwhelming) flavor in the spinach and when the server came over I asked her if anise was in the spinach. She looked at me in surprise and said you're the only person that has ever guessed what's in that. She said people either love it or they tell her to get it off their plate. I'm guessing the former group is a small group, so I'm wondering why they serve it? Oh gawd it was gross. Black licorice flavored mushy over cooked spinach.....not my idea of good food.
